description:
Had a good friends 30th birthday party here few years back. What a memorable and beautiful experience it was. Her husband had reserved the entire restaurant out for about 80 people and she had no idea! It was a complete surprise. He has communicated with the restaurant about food options, number of people, and even having kids attend the venue and they were super accommodating. The space is large and you have a wonderful ambiance of just romance and time to yourself and loved ones. I love the dim light and "be amazing" sign- it's a little touch of classiness. 

Overall, I'd definitely be back here next time with just my group of friends or even my bf.
author: S S.

description:
I was really torn on this place...because while I had a great time and do plan on coming back again, I was really disappointed with the customer service.

First, to clarify - this is not in relation to the restaurant itself (which I've heard has great food). This is strictly in regards to the bar area / outdoor area and the bartenders. 

I did my birthday here a few weeks back and brought over 50 guests. In addition to experiencing it myself, I had several friends tell me that the bartenders were rude and snotty. Disappointing to get that NYC Meatpacking / LA pretentious vibe in a city that is typically void of any of that BS.

Summer Sunday parties were still dope though. 'Til next summer, I suppose.
author: Alex L.

description:
5 of us dined here. Really better to go to for drinks and appetizers than a sit-down dinner.  Started with Spanish Tots (turned out to be tater tots with salsa--very disappointing) and Smoked Cornbread (small pieces of fried cornbread with a delicious honey sauce but couldn't taste anything but honey and corn). The drinks were great. We had the Santeria (deep robust spice) and the Wrong Way (excellent). The baby kale salad was good, as was the market fish: salmon. 

We sat at a table on the right as you walk in. There are love seats for chairs and they are low, reclined and hard--super uncomfortable. The music was so loud I couldn't hear the person directly across the table. The waiter said it was impossible for them to turn it down. The atmosphere was dark and loud, and just not conducive to an enjoyable dinner.
author: Maria B.

description: There weren't 36 of em, but this place still brings da ruckus. I just should've protected my neck better from all the spilt Jameson tho. Shoutup to the clan in da front anyone who danced along w me to Mad Cobra(!) the dj snuck up in the mix. Can it be all so simple as 2 bars, plenty of couches, & an outdoor pool plaza? Crunk Revelers Everywhere Around Me. All I know is shame on a nuh if you weren't at the party Saturday(?) night. Or whatever night it was it was lit.
author: Dan B.

description:
3.75/5
Been here twice, once for brunch and once for dinner and both experiences were fantastic. You wouldn't expect such a nice spot in this area but it's like a little oasis in here. Atmosphere is great during the day and at night. Service is always very friendly. Not too far of a walk from the BART (which is good cause parking isn't fun).

During our first visit we got 2 cocktails and a freshly squeezed grapefruit juice. Food during brunch was more on the average side. We got a burger, an egg scramble, and a pork belly dish. They were all (3.25-3.5 stars) with the pork belly dish being the most flavorful. It was a sizeable and rich piece but not quite enough for the price. For once the cocktails were better than the food.

During my second visit we got the following:
1) Pork Belly w/ Ravioli (small plate): My favorite plate of the night. Pork belly had a great fat to lean meat ratio. The lean meat was pretty tender and there was a ton of flavor from the delicious earthy and slightly sweet mushroom sauce. The ravioli was so light but so good. I want a whole bowl of them (4.75/5)

2) Confit Octopus: So tender with mild flavors all working very well together then the chorizo and olives packing little punches while the butter beans helped mellow it back out. (4.5/5)

3) Vegan dish of the day (Risotto): Friend's dish. It was underwhelming. Like a soupy rice congee where the kernels didn't disintegrate and with corn. Flavors were very bland (2/5)

4) Market Fish: I believe it was king salmon. Friend's dish and it was quite small for the price but she said it tasted really good.

5) Pork Chop: Friend's dish. Slightly larger portion than a lot of the other items. Looked very juicy and she enjoyed it.

Overall, my experiences here have been great. In general I do find the portions a bit small for the price. I wouldn't say brunch is worth it but the flavors from the dinner dishes are (with the exception of the vegan risotto). Would happily come again if my bank account isn't hurting too much.
author: Vivian C.

description: Catch a vibe poolside ya know! This bar is connected to the legendary Phoenix Hotel so it has all types of characters in and out. A bit pricey drinks but you're in San Fran! Awesome laidback atmosphere and very nice decor inside.
author: Zach H.

description:
Ambiance: casual

Chambers is located near the Phoenix hotel. They were hosting a pool part with was $20-40 door fee. They have super bnice and friendly bartenders. 

We had a party of 12 and was nicely seated. We ordere the eggs Benedict which was delicious. But needed more sauce. It also comes with a vinigier. 

The French toast was on the sweeter side. But very fluffy and filling. Will definitely go back to try the wagyu beef burger.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
We ditched our original reservations somewhere else because we were so blown away by the customer service here. We were staying the night at the Phoenix and wanted to have a cocktail before heading out. I wish I got the name of the bartender in the back because she was amazing. Long brown hair, beautiful but just so kind! Her cocktails were spot on and she was so attentive to us and everyone at the bar. Because of her we decided to cancel our reservation some where else and to stay for dinner in the main dining room. I believe our server for dinner was Christina. Again, amazing! So hopeful with the menu, so sweet. She was just fun to talk to and gave us great recommendations! 
She even brought us out a delicious creme brûlée. We were so stunned with her generosity and kindness. It actually happened to be my husband's birthday too but we didn't even say anything so it was such a treat to have that as a surprise. Coming in from Oakland for a night of fun in the city I truly think we were meant to be there that night. It was hands down the best experience we have had in either city. The food was delicious but to us customer service is everything and yay to Chambers for having such awesome people represent them! I would recommend this place to anyone and we can't wait to go back!
author: Roxana L.

description:
Trendy, and hip.  Love the vibe.  Met my daughter for dinner last night and immediately knew I had selected the perfect place for her!

We were quickly seated, albeit at a table where I could have used at booster seat.  Too low for someone 5'4".  

The menu has a variety of small plates and dinners selections.  She was hungry so the apps flew at us quick.  Starts with an artisan cheese and fruit plate, scarce but delicious, Brussels spouts, totally yummy, and ceviche, smoky flavored and delicious also.

We then moved to sharing the pork chop. It was coated with most most flavorful crumbs and seemed to be quickly deep fried.  It was accompanied by asparagus and a rich BBQ sauce and slaw.

Excellent meal.  After dinner we toured the patio connected to the hotel.  Totally cool for the younger set.  We made our way into the amazing bar where the was a tech meet up going on.  Really fun people watching.

My daughter is going back for sure.  I liked it but it was a little loud for my tastes.
author: Susan C.

description:
Chambers is so unassuming on the outside but is a nice, hidden gem on the inside. If you're not familiar with Chambers (like me) you'll come to realize that Chambers restaurant shares a space with an old school motel. Chambers still manages to maintain it's classy restaurant/bar on one side, but allows goers to sit outside in the shared space they have with the motel. At first it was kinda weird seeing a pool in the middle of the place, but it has a nice retro vibe that seems to be a popular spot for weekend brunch (I came on a Thursday night). 

They have a solid happy hour menu that consists of a cheese plate, patatas bravas, cheeseburger/fries, brussel sprouts, etc. I opted for the cheeseburger w/fries ($12) and it was solid and I would get it again. 

+ The burger was a good size and came with a side of super crispy fries. For $12 in SF I thought it was a great deal because I was full after eating it. 
+ Patatas Bravas were OK. Not the best I've had but it's a huge bowl that you can share with your table. 
+ Cheese plate was meh. I don't think I would get it again because the size didn't seem worth the price, but it you want something light to pair with your drinks it is a good option to get. 

I really liked the atmosphere outside but the service was a little slow. If you're sitting outside you need to come inside to order your food and they give you a number so they can bring it out to you. When we came for happy hour it took about 10-15 mins standing at the bar to get their attention when it wasn't that packed yet. That was probably the only thing because they were quick to bring it outside. 

Overall, I'm really curious to see this place on the weekend because from previous reviews it seems like this is the place to be! I did enjoy my first time here and I think it's an awesome spot to come with friends and get some discounted bites.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
It's been a long time since I have partied in SF or a bar here at that! I think this place is pretty cool! Came here for my cousins bday. Very spacious and great for big groups. Why I liked it was there is a hotel next to it called Phoenix or Chambers is located within Phoenix hotel? If you plan to drink a little too much, I would suggest to stay here. ;-)

Pretty decent hotel inside for what they offered. Just don't go outside! Haha They have a pool and lounging chairs next Chambers. The neighborhood of this place is very questionable though!! We didn't park in one of the parking garages but on the street probably two blocks away. The two blocks that we passed were filled with homeless people!! Hella ghetto! One of the guys even pee'd in the middle of the street and in front of me?! Totally gross! So watch out!

The one bartender was hustling but friendly, on point and our drinks never empty! They need more staff though. There is a lot of lounging chairs inside. There is a small dance floor or space to dance anywhere. In the front area of Chambers, it's an actual restaurant. Do not ask me about that since I haven't had it but the drinks. 

We would come back here again if I was to host a gathering. I would definitely need one of the rooms to stay next door though! Hahaha  [20/100]
author: Edna G.

description:
Chambers is a really fun, unique spot in San Francisco. I came here on a Saturday for a friends birthday brunch. We did bottomless mimosas and family style food. They let her select the food ahead of time and had a good variety of options. You're able to choose three mains and three sides. We ordered:

Mains:
-albacore tuna poke bowl
-soft scrambled eggs (comes with avocado, potatoes, side salad)
-pork belly (comes with soft boiled eggs, potatoes)

Sides:
-crispy bacon
-crispy Yukon gold potatoes
-biscuits and gravy 

My favorite dishes were the pork belly and poke bowl. The biscuits and gravy were also a great deal as a "side" because the portions were huge! Everyone at the table had plenty of food and were sufficiently stuffed by the end. 

We also got to sit outside by the pool which was great because it was such a nice, sunny day. 

Only downside is price. When it was all said and done our tab was definitely higher than I expected, and a more than some other comparable brunch spots. However, I'd still do brunch again here. I'd like to try the non-family style options as well.
author: Jessie K.

description:
Came here for brunch on a Saturday. Surprisingly there wasn't a wait. I'd say it was kind of empty. Idk why. The interior was super cute (I love all the records displayed) and the food is decently priced.

I ordered the huevos rancheros without the huevos and the meal was still amazing. The waiter was also kind enough to put the cream and cheese on the side for me.

I like how they offered a French press for our coffee order. Makes the brunch experience that much better.
author: Stacey D.

description:
What a lovely place to come up on for our anniversary dinner!

Don't be sketched out by the outside as the interior will amaze you with the little details of movies, to the lighting to the sofas. The amazing sign in the back bar area makes for a fun picture with friends or in my case with your man. We had reservations which we ran a little late to so we hung out at the bar and waited for an extra 15 minutes which wasn't bad at all. So if you plan to come, make reservations and come on time cause it was pretty packed throughout the whole time. 

Drinks: 5/5 was in love with the wine bottle we got, they go in rotation but we also had some cocktails (summer time and break it down) both were delicious! 

Food 4.5/5 a little limited in terms of wanting your own plate because the food is so hearty so I would recommend having a bunch of appetizers are sharing those instead. In love with the bone marrow, it was juicy and creamy and just lovely. The patatas bravas were okay so if you can skip out on those.  The pork belly and octopus were both exceptionally well made and contained a lot of flavor. The winner thought was the tri-tip....wooooohhoooo yes x 100000 would just come back for that again

Service: we had a great server and I'm a little bummed I forget her name but she was super attentive and got us our order all in time and had a great convo and recommendations for us. The bar as well was quick to get us our drinks 

Overall this is would be a fun date night spot or even a place to take your clients for meeting dinners. I'd come back to stay at The Phoenix and for some more tri-tip
author: Ankita C.

description:
Such a disappointing brunch experience. The food and drinks are great but the service needs to be improved. 
Came here after an event at noon and we were told the table would be ready in 5-10 minutes. We were waiting for over 45 minutes and asked the hostess three times about the status of the table, she apparently forgot about it and her demeanor wasn't friendly at all.

When we were finally seated, our food order took an additional 30 minutes... The waiter was nowhere to be found and we had to ask repeatedly about the status of our food, which was already ready in the kitchen..... and cold when we received.

Might come back one day for dinner but definitely not on a weekend.
author: Elena C.

description:
We were on our way to a highly rated yelp brunch spot when we stumbled onto Chambers. There was a group in front of us that went in here. The doors were heavy and it was mysteriously dark in there although we couldn't see inside. So. What did we do? Follow them in of course! 
Inside was this dark lit eccentric space with vinyls lining all their shelves and walls, top to bottom. The playlist was a mix of throwback r&b to funk-hip sounds of today. The seating was a mix of couches with low tables seating, and plenty of communal seating. We sat at the bar while a table became available for us and I thoroughly enjoyed a spicy jalapeño muddled bloody margarita with homemade tomato base. I mean - hello!

We were finally seated and salivated looking at the menu. 

Huevos Rancheros - oh food Jesus. It was amazingly flavored with sunny side eggs, black beans, avocado, hard shell tostada, queso fresco, green and red salsa. This dish did not come with meat so I added a side of pork belly to it for $6. 
My wife ordered the pork belly dish that came with potatoes and some amazing salsa that blew our socks off. 

Needless to say, we never made it to our original destination after having several mimosas, several bloody mary's & damn good music. 
The vibe in this place was so dope and funky. It was exactly what I didn't think San Fransisco could deliver. 

2 things: They add an additional $1.50 per person on your tab to ensure health and safety for their staff. 
And lastly, this spot is in a semi seedy area of the city where lots of unfortunately drug addicts hang out. Fortunately they were all respectful and even walking through that adventure, we never felt in danger and we had no issues getting an uber. 

Live life out the box and go here!
author: Gina M.

description:
Went on a Friday night. It was elegant and the service was great! We ordered most of the appetizers, they were all delicious besides the bone marrow, I remember it being very salty. The sizzling Kobe beef came in a very small amount and was medium rare just how I like but the pork belly! It had a crisp when you bite it and it melts right in your mouth. The drinks were strong and the setting was intimate, definitely a cute place for a first date.

Came in to celebrate my birthday and they gave our table a complimentary dessert at the end of the night. Thank you Chambers!
author: Yenni H.

description:
Was here the night before my 30th birthday and It was a blast. Honestly hasn't changed since I was last here ~5 years ago. Super low key but chill vibes, cool bartenders, and not crazy busy which was nice. Slightly older crowd (late 20s/30s) which was exactly the evening we were looking for that night. Solid music. Come through 

Pros:
Bartenders
Drinks
Ambiance
Music

Cons:
Wish It was more packed if I was looking to get rowdy
author: Vyshak C.

description:
Classy place with a chill vibe to get some cocktails with friends! Not exactly a place to get turnt or show off your best dance moves, but a nice place to grab an after dinner cocktail on a lowkey night. The bartenders were great and very attentive as I'd asked them early on to pour us glasses of champagne at midnight for my friend's birthday. 

Definitely check this place out - at the very least for the dope Insta #beamazing
author: Chandani D.

description: AMAZING---  Right up till we got the bill.  The management of chambers ruined my perfectly good meal.  This would have been a 5 star review.  Great food, fabulous service, reasonable prices...   WAIT I have to take out reasonable prices. WHY BECAUSE YOU CHARGED ME FOR REFILLS ON ICE TEA!!!  That is absurd $4 per refill!  If you fix this policy I will return but until then NO WAY!
author: Kevin C.

description:
Disclaimer: A little scary walking to this place from the Civic Center Bart station to be honest. But then again, I'm kinda sheltered, weak in the knees and have a sensitive sense of smell. 
The space is amazing and super hip with hundreds of old records lining the bookshelves. I felt too square to be in a place this cool. 
What drew us here was all the awesome pics of that pork belly! I had to order something else so that we could try two entrees and eyed the Japanese Wagyu Burger for brunch. 

Verdict: we were slightly disappointed in the execution of the coveted pork belly! The meat portion wasn't as tender and the skin was not crispy, but chewy instead. One of the two soft boiled eggs was perfectly cooked, but the potatoes were done well.  The portion of pork belly has decreased since the first pics were posted while the price has increased.   Hmmm.

The wagyu burger was really yummy and we were pleasantly surprised that our second choice turned out to be the winner. Deliciously moist patty with a crispy coating on the outside was soo good. Crisp, thin fries completed the meal of course. 

The food was good, but I don't think I'll return unless I Uber here. Not worth the walk for me and the small slab of pork belly was disappointing.
author: Pam N.

description: Ohhh their pork belly is amaaazing - definitely try that! :) The bar has a nice hotel pool in the back so if you are lucky to get an outside seat, do it! I've been wanting to try their brunch, I've heard its great but so far I have only been there for dinner and overall had a good experience. Service could be a bit better and a bit faster.. I remember the first time I was there our food took a very long time to be ready.
author: Daffny V.

description: Came for a dinner on a Thursday night. The place was huuuge and had plenty of seating. The main attraction was of course the "Be Amazing" sign. Super cool. My friends and I ordered many dishes to share. We chose the fried brussel sprouts, little gem salad, sizzling kobe trip-tip, pork belly ravioli, and the wagyu coquette burger. Everything was superb. The service was also good. The servers were super nice and attentive. Only negative I have to say about this place is the neighborhood. Not dying to come back because of the area.
author: Annie H.

description:
This was my second visit to Chambers- I reluctantly came back although I wasn't that impressed the first time since my colleague made reservations here, and I remain not that impressed by their food and service. Ambiance is nice since it's on the swanky side, but the food won't blow you away. This time around, I tried:

-Red Quinoa Salad (Prosciutto, Arugula, Stone Fruit, Shaved Rhubarb, Sunflower Seeds, Angostura Bitters Vinaigrette, $13, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chambers-san-francisco-3?select=OIwB0xiTLcrmw9u0U7l9MA#OIwB0xiTLcrmw9u0U7l9MA): Ok, but I didn't think the ingredients worked that well together. The quinoa was also cooked very al dente, and on the crunchy side. I prefer my quinoa fluffier, and wouldn't order this dish again.
-Chambers Burger (Smoked Onion Marmalade, Butter Lettuce, Cheese, Challah Bun, Served w/Kennebec Fries, $15 + Pork Belly $3, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/chambers-san-francisco-3?select=OIwB0xiTLcrmw9u0U7l9MA#a7oHYWEuZUTqhh0ybFXRCQ): An ok burger, but nothing special, not even with the addition of the pork belly. At least the fries were nice and crispy.

Service was good, but there are too many other nice restaurants in SF, and I doubt I'll be back here again. Parking is hit or miss depending on when you come, but there is street parking available around here.
author: Amy D.

description:
Wah! I really wanted to give this place a higher rating but the food and drinks were very mediocre. I met with a few gfs here for brunch and this is what we ordered to share:
 
 
Torta Cubana: 2/5, $14 - This did not taste nor look like a cubana sandwich. The beige color pulled pork made the sanwhich looks like it was stuff with can tuna. It was totally not pleasing to the eyes and the flavors were bland.  
Souffle Pancak: 2/5, $12 - This was the main reason why I wanted to try this place. They really shouldn't call it soufflé, custard pancake would be more appropriate.It was totally dense! But the apple chutney with fresh fruits and green tea ice cream paired well with the custard pancake.
Japanese Wagyu Croquette Burger: 3/5, $15 - Tasty but the burger was too dry. The fries that came with this dish were good.
Pork Belly: 5/5, $15 - This the only dish that didn't suck from the brunch menu. This dish was absolutely declisious and highly recommended. The pork belly  had this amazing glazed and the potatoes were crack! The eggs were perfectly soft boiled. And there was this amazing sauce that we dipped everything in it. GET THIS DISH!  
 
I don't remember what drinks we got but it wasn't memorable either. Our server was a rockstar! She had a great attitude and was funny! She was even nice enough to cut everything up since we told her we were sharing. I don't think I'll be returning for brunch any time.
author: Judy V.

description:
I had to copy this from a previous yelp comment because it fits this place perfectly:
"This place is a truly one of those, WHOA, where the hell did this place come from.  A true rose between the concrete." You would not expect what the inside of this place is like by looking on the outside. Loved the ambiance, the decor, the service and the food!

Not only were we immediately greeted and seated but we got there right as the kitchen was closing and they kept it open for us to order a couple different dishes. Stephanie was our bartender and she was fabulous! She had all the great recommendations and was super down to earth! The only thing I wasn't a fan of that I ordered on my own was the corn chowder. The broccoli (idk what they season these with but o.m.g!) the steak and the ravioli.. awesome! We also thought it was super neat that the steak comes on a hot rock for you to cook your steak to your liking, had never seen anything like it before. (it's the little things and creativity). Little pricey but expected.
author: Mayci R.

description:
I've been here several times

DINNER
- Great place to sit down and dine in a nicer setting.  Great ambiance, great service and very good food.  Flavors are on point.  Brought a girlfriend here for her birthday and we had a great time.  Nice selection of well priced wines by the bottle.

DANCING
- Music starts after 10:30 and the restaurant area closes so the bar area and can become a dance floor
- Its hit or miss.  I've been here when it's been PACKED and a few times when it's been totally empty.  I don't know what drives this
- Good music (top 40) when it's playing
author: Christine L.

description:
I love the ambiance here. Dim lighting, great service, fancy furniture and vinyl records on the wall- this place feels like a hidden gem. 

I ordered the Japanese Style Croquette Burger. This was amazing. The brioche was toasted perfectly and there was just a dash of mayonnaise enough for taste. The Croquette itself was all meat and grilled to a medium rare. It was so tender. The house vinaigrette was a little too oily for my taste BUT the burger blew me away. 

My boyfriend ordered the Pork Belly. Although only a cube of Pork Belly came with the dish, everything on the plate was amazing. I have no idea what was on those Yukon potatoes but boy, were they out of this world!! I am coming back next time and ordering them just as a side of they're made the same way. The two soft boiled eggs were done perfectly- best I've ever had. 

Overall, I would love to return here. I want to try their drinks next time as well as get more of those potatoes.
author: Amber T.

description: This place was so much fun and the food was yummy too! Ordered 5 different dishes and 4/5 were phenomenal. The bartender was such a sweetheart!
author: Ani D.

description: Great place, awesome food, portions not as big as they look. But i still come back cause its dope. A bit pricey for the amount of food.
author: Joseph K.

description:
Tucked away the TL, Chambers is a not-so-hidden SF gem. I thought I had been here before but I quickly realized I had confused it with another place. It was a rare nice day in SF and I wanted to have drinks and dinner outdoor by the pool.

We shared a couple of appetizers - pork belly, asparagus salad, and the market fish. They were all ok (3-4 stars). The halibut was slightly overseasoned and definitely overcooked. The pork belly was good but I personally make a great pork belly dish so I'm a tough judge on that one.

The drinks we got were quite good. After some discussions with the server, I got the Even Flow (Rum, tequila, pineapple, lime, toasted rice gum, coconut milk, served tall on the rocks), which I liked very much.

Chambers is a cute date spot (if you're not afraid of the sketchy location). Brunch sounds solid; I may have to come back to check it out again.
author: Yi Z.

description:
Looking for a fancier spot to have a drink with friends and have a great insta photo. Go here.

Friendly bartenders, sweet grooves, and yummy bites. 
Good for groups and couples.
author: Theresa D.

description:
Worst old fashioned in the city....they use Evan Williams. Lights are cool though....
...
...
...
..
author: Roro O.

description:
This review is for the bar only.  I thought the bartenders were very nice, attentive, and made great drinks!  I had a old fashioned and it was very good.  I usually don't order old fashioned because some bartenders make it too sugary.  This one seemed on the smaller side, but it was tasty and hit the spot.  Sometime size doesn't matter. =P  

I thought the drink prices were reasonable for San Francisco.  

I think the only downside was that the bar chairs are so big and heavy that they get in the way when you're trying to order a drink.  

I drove and I was able to find parking about a block and a half away.  This place is in the Tenderloin but I grew up partying in the city so it was like a walk in a park for me. lol
author: Lan T.

description:
Located on the Phoenix Hotel property, Chambers is a real hidden gem in Tenderloin. So hidden that finding it is a little confusing - the entrance is on Eddy St through the brown double doors. Chambers has a GORGEOUS inside... the ambiance is so chic and modern with walls divided by shelves of records. There's even that "BE AMAZING" sign at the bar which seems iconic to this place. This is a nice place in Tenderloin for a romantic and intimate date.

Too bad they sat us OUTSIDE despite having reservations. I was pretty peeved when I found out later that they had 2 reservation systems, and for that particular night there were a lot of conflicts in the system for bookings. I really would have loved to sit inside and enjoy the decor... but had to settle for a heated outdoor patio next to the pool. Don't get me wrong - the pool at Phoenix Hotel is gorgeous, but our view wasn't so great since they had put down wall drapes in the patio wall. So we could see the pool through a plastic screen. On the bright side, it was quieter so I could hear my partner better, but it also made for a kind of eeriness.

Aside from that slight oversight, the food is geared towards Asian fusion and is pretty damn good. We had a Gilt City voucher for a $150 dining credit (paid $80), so we ordered a bunch of small plates to try a variety. Our server was nice enough to space them out like courses, thus we had the following:

- Sizzling Kobe Tri-Tip ($16): THIS WAS DELICIOUS... ~6 slices of kobe beef still cooking on a sizzling stone. I like my meat medium rare, so it was nice to control that. Because the beef is already sliced, you can taste the delicious meat juices at full capacity without cutting into it. Honestly the yuzu-soy sauce did nothing for this meat - it was delicious on its own. So delicious that we ordered it twice since the portion is pretty tiny.

- Pancetta Wrapped Dates ($9): I had high hopes for this, but at the end of the day it was lackluster. It wasn't bad... but it tasted so generic. I would've been fine with just bacon wrapped dates from Starbuck's late night menu. I would pass as you're paying $3 per skewer.

- Oyster Bao Bun ($12): These were surprisingly good! Oysters crispy and bao was fluffy/tasty on its own. The remoulade sauce and tabasco gave it a nice Creole kick. It was an interesting combination of Creole + Asian flavors. Too bad the portion was quite small (3 per serving), but we ordered 2 of these anyways. 

- Potato Gnocchi ($14): Sauce and mushrooms were on-point. The gnocchi itself is kind of soggy - still tasty, but I expect a bit of bite and chewiness in my gnocchi.

- Crispy Pork Belly ($15): Honestly this was disappointing - not only is it expensive for the portion, it's not very crispy and the texture of the soft fat is kind of unappealing. Flavor wise it was kind of all over the place with the fig chutney and bacon sherry sauce - it just didn't go well together.

- Fried Brussel Sprouts ($8): 2nd best thing we had that night... the portion surprised us because it was so big compared to the rest of the dishes! The brussel sprouts are flash fried so they get that really nice char flavor. Tossed with the Gochujang sauce, you get a nice Korean spice that goes well with the savory Parmesan cheese. This was well worth the price.

- Alive ($12): Cucumber, mint, agave, and vodka - what's not to like? It was a refreshing drink that paired well with all the savory items I had. I prefer my drinks on the sweeter side, but this had a good balance of being strong and sweet.

They also have non-alcoholic cocktails for designated drivers... unfortunately I couldn't remember the names of them, but my companion had a carrot juice + yuzu cocktail that they seemed to enjoy, It certainly looked like a cocktail - way to make those designated drivers not feel left out.

Overall... good food and great ambiance (assuming you sit outside in the winter and not in the covered patio). It's kind of an oasis in gritty neighborhood of Tenderloin (BTW, just take an Uber here as the area was super sketch at night). Portions are small and pricey, but if you come here with a discounted voucher or only want drinks with a few bites (Kobe Tri-Tip and brussel sprouts), then it's well worth it IMO.
author: Alyanna C.

description:
I've always enjoyed Chambers for the occasional cocktail or brunch, but last weekend Chambers exceeded my expectations. 

I planned a 20-person brunch for my birthday and hosted it at Chambers. The Chambers staff members -- especially Isabel and Clarissa -- were extremely helpful leading up to the event. They even calmed my craziness as the stress hit :) 

On the day of the event, my large party and I enjoyed an attentive staff, delicious food, and a wonderful atmosphere. Considering how tasty everything was, the price was quite reasonable. When we asked a staff member to take a photo, she even suggested the perfect spot on the patio. 

I highly, highly recommend planning large events at Chambers. You will have a great experience. If you plan an event on a sunny day, then see if you can snag a spot on the patio!
author: Giana C.

description:
My friend who I was staying with lives in the area so thanks to Yelp, I found this place so we could brunch before heading out for a day of me being an SFO tourist.

We were seated instantly and at 11am it wasn't busy yet. I had a French press coffee and the granola with yogurt. My friend had OJ and made her own plate of challah toast with eggs. Everything was fresh and good, and the service was great too. Solid local brunch spot.
author: Jackie S.

description:
This review is for reserving a table at the lounge. 

I had an amazing birthday party at Chambers because of my fantastic friends, not because of the venue. I made arrangements with Malik, the now previous event manager, who was absolutely fantastic! He answered all my emails promptly, and sent me all the menus and price lists. His replacement Isabel was fine, but I think things got lost in translation during the transition process. 

To reserve a semi-exclusive area at the Chambers Lounge, you have to put a minimum of $300 (pre-tax with additional tip) on one credit card, which they keep on file to reserve your spot. This is the card used for all transactions. 

FOOD - 1-Star 
Isabel was awesome enough to tell me that I could avoid a cake cutting fee if I brought cupcakes, which I did. But I also requested a comp'd dessert that they could bring out with a candle, which NEVER ARRIVED! My good friend had to request a candle to put on one of the cupcakes I brought myself. I also ordered chips and dip as a basic snack to have around in case my guest got hungry, which they were super timid to eat because they were located on a table that was really far from where we were sitting. Essentially I purchased a family-sized bag of Lays potato chips and a gigantic bowl of dip for $40!! I was told this was truffle dip, but it tasted like ranch. Do not waste your money on this. You will feel like an idiot. 

SERVICE - 1-Star for the Server / 4-Stars for the Bartenders
When I arrived at the venue, the server was there to greet me. She was very friendly and lovely enough to help me setup the cupcakes and show me the menu. Unfortunately, my guest trickled in for about an hour/hour and a half after I arrived, and she was missing for the majority of the night. Many of my guest didn't know we had a server, which I was upset to hear from them. Not one, not two, but several people told me the next day. I was not about to play babysitter at my own party for a server getting a guaranteed 20% tip. I distinctly told her that she was free to charge my card whenever friends ordered drinks. I was distraught to hear that she didn't take a single order. Since most of my friends ordered from the terrific bartenders, I emailed the manager to complain. I even asked her if the gratuity I paid could go to the bartenders. She gave me an excuse saying that I needed to be present for all transactions since it was my card. Why on Earth is it necessary to approve each of my 20 guests transactions when I pre-approved this on the phone and then in person? She completely avoided the topic of the bartenders, which tells me that they didn't get a dime. I even asked her to look at my tab to see how many drinks were placed by the server versus the bartenders, and she never got back to me. 

Table - 3-Stars
Since there are only 3 semi-exclusive areas and I was the last to reserve, I probably got the worst of the bunch. I got 3 small tables near the restaurant, away from the main lounge space. This was farthest from the music, which might have been a blessing in disguise to facilitate more conversations. We were given another table that was placed against the wall, probably 8 feet from our table to hold food and balloons. Pros included privacy during the beginning of the night and being closer in access to the beautiful courtyard. However, as the lounge filled up, way too many people were passing our area and trying to snatch food from our table.

Overall, I would not recommend reserving a table at Chambers. Nobody should have to deal with terrible service like this. I've been to the lounge many many times before, so I had high expectations. Frankly, now when I think of Chambers, I am appalled.
author: Joanna S.

description: Garden grove + chambers mimosas by joe (bartender) were delicious and he was great to chat with. Strongly recommend
author: Jessica H.

description:
I love their interior décor, as it has a retro vibe that brings you back to the time when records were popular. 

The egg in a hole was delicious, although a very simple dish. We asked for medium poached eggs, and the yolk was just the right amount of runniness. The toast was toasted perfectly!

The soufflé pancake was also tasty as well, but I had to adjust my taste since it was thicker/heavier than previous pancakes I've had. I loved how the maple ice cream, berry sauce, and berries complemented the pancake. 

The service is super nice, and our waitress even switched out our plates and silverware in between our courses! 

This restaurant can be a little hard to find, but it's not called a hidden gem for nothing!
author: Tiffany H.

description: The review is for the bar only. This venue surprised me by how expansive and cute it was. Great spot for a date or catching up with friends. The lounge area had a great vibe and a dj, but the music wasn't too loud so we could still enjoy a conversation. I wouldn't suggest hanging outside the venue due to the area, but definitely a cute meet spot. Drinks were pretty standard, nothing especially wowed me and limited cocktail choices, but for the ambience alone I'll be back.
author: Chelsea T.

description:
Really cute restaurant/bar that has this retro, hip, colorful motel incorporated into its theme. I thought it was absolutely awesome. I was completely in love with its ambience. Extremely trendy. 

My husband and I and our couple friend decided we'd grab drinks here and also a snack. We ordered the appetizers; grilled octopus, pork belly ravioli, the steak cooked on the stone and the chef's selection of cheese for the cheese plate for the night. My cheese plate was mediocre and everything else was pretty good but it was little in quantity. The cocktails were good. No complaints there.
author: elizabeth t.

description:
Came in for brunch with a couple friends. I love that you can make reservations on OpenTable! We need more brunch spots that take reservations so you don't have to wait hours in line.

Chambers isn't in the best spot in the TL; I parked my car on the same block and there were a couple sketchy people chilling in the area. Luckily my car was fine when I finished with brunch.

Even though we had a reservation, we still ended up waiting for maybe 10-15 minutes at the front before our table was ready. I believe they have an outside patio area as well, but we were seated inside. It was much louder inside than I expected, which made it harder for us to carry out conversations across the table.

I pretty came here for their souffle pancake ($12) which I had previously seen on someone's Instagram account. I was very intrigued by this dish since the pancake looked like a cake more than a pancake. Their menu says that it takes 35 minutes for the souffle pancake to come out, but for us it took closer to 45 minutes. Don't order it if you're running short on time.

After waiting for 45 minutes, I was super excited when the souffle pancake finally came out. First of all, it looks gorgeous with the apple chutney and scoop of maple ice cream on top and all the fruits that decorate it. I don't know how to describe the inside other than as very egg-y and custard-like, which was perfect for me but too much for my friend. It wasn't very sweet and relied on the various toppings for the sweetness, which I appreciate.

It doesn't look that big, but I was full halfway through and ended up sharing the rest with another friend. In retrospect, I should have just shared it with my friend who also ordered the souffle pancake, since she only finished half of hers.

I made the mistake of ordering a side of crispy hash browns and really regretted it when it came out. For $4 you get one flat piece of hash brown. Just one piece! I've never even seen hash browns served in this shape before...It doesn't make sense that their souffle pancake is $12 but one piece of hash brown is a third of that price.

All in all, though, I really enjoyed this whole experience and thought the souffle pancake was a great addition to the SF brunch scene!
author: Dianna H.

description: Excellent brunch spot. Poke bowl is unbelievably good. Soufflé pancake is worth the wait. Can't believe this place isn't more busy.
author: Mike T.

description:
Happy Easter! I'm going to fall in the footsteps of my Lord, Jesus Christ, and forgive the people who attempted to dampen my Easter Sunday celebration with my friends. That being said, I will not patronize the establishment call Chambers at the Phoenix Hotel ever again. 

After spending over $250 on drinks, this manager, a black man with a bald head, had the audacity to make fun of me while talking to my friends, as he instructed me to "wrap it up." 

If I spent $12 on drinks, that would be or thing.  However, I spent $250 at Chambers on Easter Sunday. 

Nonetheless, I will do what he couldn't do for anyone else. I will be gracious and chalk this awful experience up to him being unhappy with his own life.

That being said, I will not go to Chambers ever again. But more importantly, never let anyone get you down, make you feel bad, or dampen the celebration of your religion. 

Chambers, I give you a 1.0. To everyone else, I say, "Happy Easter!"
author: Fanya Y.

description: I don't know what all the hype is all about here , food was not good, the atmosphere was awesome and great staff all around , but if you are hungry for good food , this is NOT the place !
author: Angela P.

description:
Cool ambience. I like how vinyl lines the walls, and there is a ton of cool art everywhere. Came here for brunch. I was really jealous of the other table that ordered the souffle pancake to share. We should have done that! It looked really good. I split an order of French Toast and Soft Scrambled Eggs. Both were good. I wish they had a few more brunch dishes.

This restaurant does the lame "Do you want still water or sparkling water?" then charges you for "still" water because you didn't explicitly ask for "tap". A bit disingenuous. It was a bit annoying that they didn't seat us just because one person from our reservation had yet to arrive. We had  4 out of 5 people there already and there were plenty of open tables.
author: Samara J.

description:
why did i get charged four bucks for SODA WATER ON TAP ? why are there white women in black face on this wall? 

okay food and no complaints on service or ambiance. hella questionable tho.
author: Yves D.

description: So many of my favorite spots happen to be in the Tenderloin, so if you can get over the neighborhood, Chambers is great. I can imagine things could get nuts on a weekend, but we were here on a Tuesday night and it was still nearly full. Staff was great, everyone was very helpful and able to answer our questions and make recommendations. I know some folks have complained that the plates are small, which is true, but this is a bar with a small kitchen, after all, and not what I would consider a restaurant. So not really a dinner spot, but food was good, confit octopus was a winner, and the drinks are very well made and delivered quickly.
author: Josh M.

description:
Great atmosphere and service. Came for dinner and the food was extremely underwhelming. Portion size was extremely small for the price. We ordered the Pork Ravioli, Bone Marrow, Octopus and Brussel Sprouts. Brussels were great and would highly recommend. However, everything else we ordered was extremely rich and heavy and felt overlooked and soft. 

Would definitely recommend heading over for drinks, however the dinner most definitely was not worth the price tag.
author: Josie M.

description: Dined here the other night for a friends birthday and large party of 11. I'll say the night didn't start ideal. We waited around back bar for awhile for a drink and ultimately didn't get to order because they said we couldn't be seated until all party was present. Then we sat down and didn't receive anyone at our table to take drinks orders or greet us for probably over 10 minutes. Once the waitress did come over she was super friendly but seemed rushed and just think she had too many tables. Some people did tapas and others ordered mains. I order the fish for the night which was cod on bed of veggies, bacon bits and gnocchi. The fish was tasty, veggies were cooked perfect, sizable portion and plated so nicely. As for the gnocchi, I think i came across 3. Overall nice atmosphere inside but average meal and service so probably won't be back.
author: Aryn C.

description:
My verdict is still out on Chambers.

First, this place really is ultra-hip! The throw back of the hotel, the LP's (I'm dating myself) on the wall, the groovy (I'm dating myself again) selection of booze is just, well, groovy!

The food selection is fun but they must have had an off night when I went. The dessert tasted like it had been in the refrigerator for some time, and not freshly made. The rest went down well but I did have a sense that they were between chefs. I could be wrong...maybe it's me.

Until I return I'll stay at three stars.
author: Ron C.

description:
So I got invited to a birthday brunch here. I was running kind of late so my friend sent a picture of the menu to me. I thought to myself, "there's like barely any options." But I guess there's no need for a huge brunch menu when the food is good enough. Plus they are dog friendly!

FIRST IMPRESSION: 4 Stars 

It was hard trying to figure out where the main door entrance was. I also wasn't thrilled that the location is in the tenderloin. Kinda scary to me. When I found the entrance,  the inside of the restaurant looked pretty nice and clean. The host greeted us and lead us to the outside dining area. First thing I notice is a pool and a motel behind it. I was confused. We were seated at our table and that's when our journey begins.

SERVICE: 4 Stars 

We were late so everyone was eating already and we were waiting for our food. But the server made sure to check up on us and tell us that our food was coming. I was happy she was reassuring. She gave our little Pomsky puppy some water. Very sweet of her. The people who serve here are really friendly. Especially when you have a cute pup! 

FOOD: 4 Stars 

So I've been here twice before. The first time I got eggs Benedict. It wasn't that great.. Honestly I've had way better. The flavor was just not there for me. But the pork belly with potatoes were soooooo gooooddd. Ever since I've tried the pork belly, I refuse to get anything else. It is my favorite! The soft boiled eggs compliment the pork belly and the potatoes so well. I don't know how they do it. I also had the fresh fruit. Now, normally when restaurants say fresh fruit they lie. I know what fresh fruit tastes like. I'm a fruit addict. Now when Chambers says fresh fruit, you better bet your sweet bottom you're gonna get fresh fruit! I was so surprised to see that the fruit was fresh. It looked and tasted like it was freshly picked and cut just for me lol. I was so happy. 

OVERALL EXPERIENCE AND REVIEW: 4 Stars 

I come here for brunch only. And since I've tasted the pork belly plate, I refuse to eat anything else lol it's just that good. Also, get the fruit if you're a fruit lover. You won't regret it. I also got apple juice from here. It comes in a cute little glass bottle. Loved it. I love bringing my puppy here. It's a great dog friendly spot. I wasn't a big fan of the hotel guests swimming at the pool and staring at us. It feels weird. So that's why I refuse the 5 Stars. Also, some of the workers look like they just got out of bed and not very presentable. Either than that I love this place. Food is great. People are great. My favorite brunch place so far in San Francisco!
author: Tiger Y.

description:
Once you're able to find your way inside, this is a surprisingly large and well-decorated venue that feels like a chic, loungey, modern-day speakeasy. It is also linked to the Phoenix Hotel next door by way of an outdoor pool, so I'm not sure if poolside dining and drinking is still an option these days. 

During the day, the vibe is that of a fairly casual, loungey bar and restaurant. The service here is friendly and helpful, and while some of their food offerings might look slightly pricey, they're mostly good bets, especially the lamb burger. The cocktail program is also on point. 

I've heard that the vibe changes markedly on weekend nights and that it can get quite packed. Nevertheless, if you can snag a seat or a table during a less crowded period, this is a good venue as part of a date night.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Nice bar and bartenders.

Good food.

Abysmal service. Possibly the worst restaurant service experience I've had since perhaps a random Cheesecake Factory when I was 13 years old.

Friend had her cocktail spilled on her wallet/purse as drink was being placed down. Had to ask for an extra napkin.

Waitress highly recommended the fish (without us asking for recommendations), which was cool. Then said, I think that'll really round out your meal, I'm gonna go ahead and add that on for you.
Wait, hold up, let me ask the table of people with me if we want that?!?!? I mean, luckily it sounded good and we did, even if only slightly, and when the fish came out it was a good option, but that was a really really strange way of recommending and then adding it on for us without consent.

I got half my glass of red wine spilled across my lap. Waitstaff first set the rest of the table and had another person clean up the floor. Apologized. Meanwhile I was trying to soak up the red wine from my dress.

I was offered a new napkin since mine was soaked, then had to ask for it again because it was never brought. I had to also ask for a new glass of wine, of which I was brought a half/quarter pour, which I guess is fair because that's how much was left before it was spilled onto my lap. But you'd think it wouldn't be too difficult to pour a full new glass after that incident.

Asked about dry cleaning charge, was told would ask manager, but never followed up on it and never got offered again. By that point I just wanted to GTFO and didn't bother asking again or want further exchanges, however faux-nice it was.

Everything in setting the table was a little slow, bringing the food and setting things down a little slow and uncoordinated (plus two of our own drinks, spilled on us during service pretty spectacularly), pretty sure server was stoned out of her mind.

Anyway, nice bar. I'd considered having a private birthday party here. I might still consider the bar. The food is pretty good, but you can get good food so many places in sf. I'd avoid this. I felt like I was secondhand stoned from being around our server.
author: Victoria C.

description: Amazing food! Amazing drinks! Had my window smashed in when I got back to my car and my date offered to cover the fee for the damage, so be warned about the neighborhood -- but Chambers itself is a beautiful date night spot for cocktails and truly quality food. And it's Insta-friendly, with that big sign and all. What more could you want?
author: Dulma T.

description: Good drinks and ambiance. Loving the vinyls and swanky feel. Tasty small plates compliment well with my cocktail:)
author: Emily M.

description:
This place has a very interesting, fantastic menu. The food is so different and the flavors and unique. I like that about this place. The service was awesome, too! I got the cous cous with vegetables and asked for it to be "vegan". It was just a bit too plain for me. I asked for extra sauce, but it was nothing special to rave about. My sister loved her beet salad, though. And my friend said the salmon she got was the best fish she has ever had. 

Really cute atmosphere and good drinks.
author: Chelsea M.

description:
Made a reservation and there were pretty accommodating although my party was a little late. They say us near the pool, which was super refreshing!! And loved that they allowed dogs so our friend brought their puppy and there were lots of others around.

Took awhile to order food and get it, but they were attentive in water levels and seeing if we needed anything else.

My pork belly, poached eggs, and potatoes were to die for!! I would order them again in a heart beat :))

Friend loved her Cubano sandwich and drinks were not bad. Their soufflé with ice cream was a good dessert but the ice cream was actually the better part of the dish. It was a lot more like bread pudding than soufflé but maybe their similar.

My friends and I agreed that to go back again to the other dishes !! 

Also did street parking for $3.25 an hour for 2 hours and that was sufficient.
author: Anh C.

description:
Great place for brunch! Apparently not many people know cause it was super uncrowded. And they take reservations, so if you had a big party, that could totally be a thing. 

Yes. Outdoor seating. It's actually at the Phoenix hotel, and they have seating out by their pool - which I thought was neat. Inside had a very hipster/retro feel with records and couches and lounginess. 

Coffee was the most disappointing part. They only do French press and a small ($6 - kinda pricey) is supposed to do 3 cups (small cups, like 6 oz), but ours only poured 2. We complained and they brought us another right away at no charge, but still. Also, I just really feel like bottomless coffee should be a part of brunch. It tasted ok, but not amazing. 

Got the chambers mimosa which was quite nice - plenty of champagne as it should be. No bottomless, but really, that's ok. Full bar, so you should be able to find something for you. 

The food was awesome. All four of us were really happy. I got the Eggs Royale, and the hollandaise was really good. I am a major hollandaise snob and it takes a lot to impress me and this did. Really perfect balance of lemon and spice. Spot on consistency. The smoked trout was super tasty too. The eggs were also super good. The only thing I wasn't wild about was that it was all on top of hash browns. It just didn't quite compliment. Would have been better on sourdough toast. 

My husband enjoyed the Poke bowl. He said it tasted like poke. :)

Friend got the Pork Belly and very much enjoyed it. The potatoes that came with that were super flavorful - definitely winners. 

Cousin got the Burger which was quite good too. The shiitake mushroom relish on it was super well done and really brought the whole thing together. Meat was well cooked. 

Good portions. We were full, but didn't need to take anything home. 

Not cheap, but doable for a weekend.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I love how they decoration and how private environment. Have a brunch without waiting huge line at weekend is the best part!!! Chambers is connected with phoenix hotel, they share the backyard, when I set outside of chambers, enjoy the sun and also can see the swimming pool.
The food is good as well, I order pork belly, but everything is way to salty except two boiled eggs....
author: Faye L.

description: This was a great discovery! Good food, nice surroundings, pleasant service. Menu was simple but food was well prepared. Slightly funky decor.
author: Ernest H.

description:
Decided to come here for brunch, made reservations online. Great ambiance and decor, wasn't too pleased with the restrooms though. It smelled pretty funky in both of the restrooms. 

Onto the food- we ordered the following:
1 - strawberry parfait, a little confusing instead of yogurt it was ice cream and sorbet - never had this type before and my friend was surprised as well
1- burger, their fries and burger was delicious
1- slow scramble, delicious - ask for their hot sauce 
1- soufflé pancake, very yummy 
1 - egg in a hole, friend said he enjoyed this 
Service was great, will be back to try dinner at some point.
author: Tahima B.

description:
Dinner review. 

Crispy pork belly (black lentil, fig chutney, bacon-sherry) - 3/5
Pretzel (bacon sauce) - 2/5
Crab arancini (yuzu aioli, wagon wheel cheese) - 3/5
Duck breast, Crispy confit leg (duck jus) - 3/5
Burger (shiitake relish, bacon, avocado) - 4/5

Overall, "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description: Came here for my birthday brunch. Grabbed a cozy booth on the inside even though there was poolside seating which was nice by the way. Great food, albeit a little pricey for the quantities. But this is the city so what else can one expect!? All in all a nice place to sit down for some brunch.
author: Annie T.

description:
One of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco. 

This underrated spot in the heart of the TL is easy to get into, relaxed, friendly, and delicious. The ambiance is trendy, so dressing up for brunch is perfectly fine, as is wearing some workout leggings and a sweater. The food has been amazing every single time. We love the souffle pancake and the pork belly. The pork belly plate is soooo good- everything is caramelized, but  it's not too sweet. The pork is crispy (I don't even like pork, but this, I love). The souffle pancake is huge! The prices are very reasonable for delicious, san francisco brunch. I would come back every weekend if I could.
author: Hannah S.

description:
A great place for groups and happy hour/dinner with friends, co-workers, and dates! It's not clearly advertised so I never knew this place existed after passing by it numerous times. Thanks to Yelp, I found a new cool spot for happy hour!

Happy hour starts at 5:00, but dinner seating doesn't start until 6:00pm. I met up with my co-worker on a Friday, we sat at the bar and had 2 cocktails before we got seats for dinner. Happy hour cocktails are $5 vs $12 off the regular menu. Drinks were delicious. Try the "Sticky Fingers" its refreshing!

Rock Cod $28 - Nori crusted masa, summer squash, abalone mushroom, corn, fava beans, serrano scallion oil. It's a little on the pricier side for a small portion, but it was delicous and beautifully presented! I really enjoyed the fresh and flakey cod plus I'm a big fan of mushrooms. The summer squash was shaved into a long thin strip and rolled into a rose. Beautiful plating.

Hanger Steak $30 - Isreali Couscous, asparagus, baby carrot, onion soubise, dukkha spice, hazelnut, cilantro. My co-worker ordered this and I snuck a bite. The meat was cooked to perfection and the cous cous was well flavored.

It's spacious, with interior decor decorated like a library and  vinyl records. We had a great happy hour and dinner! The bartender was friendly and inviting, waiter was very nice, we had a great time! Will definitely be back.
author: Janny S.

description: Great little hidden spot. Funky vibe with great food. We ordered the ceviche, tri tip, short ribs, and burger. Everything was cooked well and the service was pleasant. Ceviche isn't your typical ceviche. It looked more like sashimi slices, but still tasty. The meat was seasoned perfectly and wasn't over cooked. Drool worthy. The portions are small though, so don't come starving.
author: Sophia N.

description: Here for a late dinner on Friday night. Fun crowd but super noisy. Had the halibut. Realty good and a decent portion.. Didn't need the apps. Service is super slow tho. Come before you are hungry.
author: Troy W.

description: Very nice interior design with a little but speakeasy style! Good place for drinks as for food..Personally, could be better...i mean..waiting time is too long we already had two drinks and still waiting for our food which we ordered with the drinks.. then somehow my short rib main dish was cold..like cold. Not sure why. But all in all the appetizers are good which I recommend ! The kobo! and will def come back for the drinks and maybe go for appetizers only next time.
author: Roxy T.

description: Love the place it has great ambience and the food was really good too the bone marrow was very delicious and the kobe beef was exceptional
author: Arvin N.

description: Not in a nice area of the city but sure is beautiful inside & out at the patio. Delicious food. Great service by our waitress but not by the lady seating us. Very pricey.
author: Jessica B.

description:
If you're wondering where do people take picture with the sign "BE AMAZING", it is here at Chambers.

Sunday brunch with some of my favorites. Love. Love. Love.

We ordered:

- Soufflé Pancake = apple chutney, pomegranate gelée, and maple ice cream. It was basically like a dessert. 

- House smoked pork belly

- Hangover Hash = felt like a dinner meal then breakfast meal. 

- Pork Belly = Two soft boiled eggs, caramelized onion, Yukon potato, lollipop kale, gochujang, black garlic, and cilantro.

- Side of chicken maple sausage

We had plenty of crafty cocktails which I can't remember the name, but they were all excellent and strong. The decoration at Chambers was very modern and chic. Love the interior and the outdoor poolside seating. 

Great food. Great service. Great ambiance. 

I hope you give this trendy brunch place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: Visiting from Salt Lake for my birthday. Food was delicious and service was great. I will definitely come back when I'm town again. Thank you!!
author: Claire C.

description:
The decor at Chambers is very interesting, I quite enjoy the records library aesthetic. I came here for a drink and just some light bites before going to a museum event. The drink menu was interesting and I got the Why Go, which had bourbon, vermouth, yuzu carrot juice, lime juice, agave and egg whites. For me, the carrot and citrus flavors definitely came out and it was an interesting mix with bourbon.

I tried a bit of my friend's patata bravas, and they tasted pretty good although it didn't blow me away. I ordered the fried oyster bao, as I was quite excited with the idea. The bao's texture was more dense than usual, and it tasted fine but also was not amazing. I didn't try much else, but if I was in the area for a good cocktail, I'd try Chambers again.
author: James K.

description: Been here for three separate occasions: once for drinks, once for brunch, and once for dinner. Don't let the exterior or the choice location (heart of the loins) dissuade you. This place is pretty good and deserves your attention. The drinks are strong and delicious (favorite is Alive) and the food is good in general. Just don't get the pork belly - one person in our group ordered it pork belly and it was overcooked to the point that it was difficult to cut. On the plus side - the kitchen took it back and scratched it from the bill.
author: Gary Y.

description:
We approached as the bouncer said last call in 5 minutes, walked in and ordered a round of beers. As soon as we got them they turned the lights on, shut off the music and said, we'll give you a minute while they kicked everyone else out. We left our beers half drunk.

What a disappointment. How sad to see SF taking the same path as Manhattan bars. Seems like the city's soul is being sucked out of it. 

If you're looking for anything authentic, avoid Chambers. If you could careless, you'll probably love it. Just ignore the homeless outside, and take some selfies under the lightbulb-lit bar.
author: Zach K.

description:
We just had our wedding ceremony and cocktail party at Chambers and the Phoenix Hotel. It was amazing!

First let me say that Chambers is a great place for food and cocktails any night of the week. The atmosphere, lighting, music and rocker chic vibe make this a great place to hang and fabulous for hosting an event!

An excellent space if you are looking for something a little different and beyond the normal wedding venue. It's glam, mid century modern deco style lets you have some fun with the space. There is a great selection of vinyl records (literally THOUSANDS!) throughout that add another level of cool.

We decided to rent out the back lounge and patio area for our reception/cocktail party after our ceremony in the Phoenix courtyard. What a great experience! Chrissie Dieu, the Director of Events, was exceptional throughout the entire process and over a year of planning. She was able to take every detail we gave her from chair requests to lighting needs to menu planning and make them a reality. There was a great event menu to choose from for our vegetarian only tastes and all our guests raved about the food and cocktails.

In addition to Chrissie, Chambers and the Phoenix are chock full of quality people. A special shout out goes to Patrick, Host Extraordinaire, who we met on a visit for dinner a couple weeks before the big day. Patrick was fantastic that evening, making us feel welcome and like we were regulars in the house, and on the day of the wedding, he constantly was looking out for our health and happiness, doing everything he could to make sure that we had food and -the tougher challenge- time to eat!

Even the servers and bartenders got rave reviews from our guests! As a former bartender, my newly betrothed was very impressed with the preparation and consistency of our signature drink for the evening, the Toasted Almond. And we have been hearing raves about the bartenders, the food, and the drinks all night long...and even now, weeks later!

We wanted something different and with a rock n roll vibe - Chambers was it. Perfect and truly unique!
author: Alissa C.

description: Pleasant experience with some good dishes. The rib was really good, also the pumpkin cheesecake. I couldn't see any photos of the desserts so we took some to add here. After asking for a recommendation from our waitress we got a bottle of the Grenache Blanc. It was alright, my friend liked it but it was too sour for me.
author: Ecegül B.

description: A hidden gem in the Tenderloin. Our bartender, Troy, was a great conversationalist and mixologist. I asked him what his favorite drink was and he was basically like "I gotchu" and proceeded to make an amazing Paper Plane drink. I'll be going back soon!
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Very cool spot. Don't get alarmed by its location in the old looking motel-style accommodations.  Inside is a very trendy restaurant and bar, with lots of space and well decorated. 

Drinks are creative, and the food was delicious. I picked this place for the dinner, and while at first I was uncertain then I stopped worrying and enjoyed my dinner and sexy date. 

After we had finished, we decided to come back again and rent a room and enjoy their beautiful pool.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Came for brunch. Service was incredibly slow and inattentive. We had already parked and it was raining outside otherwise we wouldn't have waited for over 10 minutes for the hostess to acknowledge us. 

Food was meh - the burger was not flavorful. The bloody mary was also lacking. The place has a great ambiance and I have had better drinks at the bar.
author: Laura D.

description: I came here with friends early on a Saturday evening . It's a lovely bar with a great atmosphere - dimly lit, dark wood, and old records. The cocktails are great but on the pricier side. I also got a wagyu croquette burger, which was the perfect size and not too greasy. Perfectly satisfying with the drinks.  Service was very attentive, and our waitress was great about drink recommendations. I would definitely come back for a quiet and classy night with good food and drinks!
author: Hali M.

description:
The atmosphere is pleasant with records lining the shelved walls. The cocktails are all named after Sublime songs and the music that was playing was really good because a lot of the songs had that smooth, slightly punky Sublime vibe. 
We ordered the beet salad, pork belly ravioli, sizzling Kobe tri-tip, the waygu crochette burger, and a few cocktails. 
The beet salad had loads of beets with tiny surprises of goat cheese, pears and spiced walnuts. The pork belly ravioli should be a meal in a larger super delicious portion. The Kobe tri-tip as served on a black hot stone that had a great presentation. By the time we received the waygu crochette burger, we were both pretty stuffed. But there is always room for dessert. We ordered the creme brulee which was topped with berries and a flower. 
We will eat here again. Preferably when I'm not pregnant and can actually drink the cocktails than smell them from my dinner partner.
author: Rosie M.

description:
Food wasn't bad. Small plates, good for sharing, but nothing mind blowing. Brussels sprouts were covered in a cheesy powder or something, a little kitschy but tasty. Pork belly was rich, as to be expected, but had an even consistency without any crisp. Octopus was diced up as small as a bowl of peas, which is great if you have a spoon.

Staff was pleasant but extremely slow, and they looked constrained. I had to flag down the waitress for second orders, the check, and make eye contact for the check to be cleared.

Ambiance is nice and relaxed. This place probably functions better for drinks than for dinner.
author: Christophe C.

description: Wasn't impressed on a Saturday night.  Pretty empty, no cover charge was good, but no people.  Also not in the best areas of town.
author: Ben C.

description: Great vibes, great food, great service, always. The pork belly and soufflé pancakes in particular are to die for
author: Claire C.

description:
My friend Shannon and I stumbled upon Chambers when we were going to go to Brenda's for brunch, but the line was CRAZY cause it was a Sunday for a 3 day weekend. But we were so happy with everything we got at Chambers! My friend got the French toast and she loved it!

I got the pork belly with potatoes and two soft boiled eggs. My eggs were PERFECT, the entire yolk was completely runny, just the way I like it. I'm also not usually a fan of breakfast potatoes unless it's deep fried hash browns, but these potatoes are crispy and so flavorful! I think I also loved it because it's an Asian fusion so it's all the flavors I'm accustomed and am attracted to! The pork belly was good and crispy on each side, lots of fat of course. Most pork belly are pretty fatty. All in all it was so good!

We also got mimosas with orange and pineapple juice, always a good addition to the brunch experience.

The service was awesome, we were checked on multiple times and I felt like the servers made us fee really welcomed and comfortable!

Would love to come back again to see the bar lit up!
author: Dorothy T.

description:
This place is a truly one of those, WHOA, where the hell did this place come from.  A true rose between the concrete. 

Ambiance: super hipster.  Plus: all the records they have as decor are actual playable records.  Very chic and retro. Minus: It's situated in the Tenderloin.

Drinks: Full bar.  We ordered a 2011 bottle of French wine but instead, we got a 2014 and paid the same price. Whatever, the wine tasted good.

Food: The food is super good, we had the Foie Gras Rav, the Pork Belly.  The food here is actually good, if we weren't in a rush I would've ordered everything because everything looked good.  Our server forgot one of our orders so we cancelled it because it took too long

Bathroom: I judge a restaurant a lot by it's bathroom.  If you can keep your bathroom super clean you can keep your kitchen clean.  The bathroom was ok.  Not super dirty not super clean either.
author: Paula G.

description: Cute place and atmosphere, but terrible service. Took forever to order, didn't ask how we wanted our burger cooked, didn't check in with us to make sure all was ok, and forgot our drinks.....
author: Elissa W.

description:
||REVIEW #600|| I feel like an idle millenial who wastes too much time writing reviews... but SF is too cool not to explore!

Chambers is essentially a chamber of secrets. Besides the somewhat hidden location inside Phoenix Hotel, the amazing (and very reasonably priced) brunch mostly remains a secret: fancy-pants brunch in a quiet and peaceful atmosphere, plus there is no wait--a great find in a city where a $20 brunch with a 45 minute wait is considered a normal weekend routine.

[THE CHAMBER OF SECRETS BY DAY]

The menu is fairly extensive and features creative variations on brunch food in which they take everything a step further. There are no pancakes, French toast, or scrambled eggs; only souffle pancakes, spiced French toast, and soft scrambled eggs. Some items add a fusiony spin, incorporating diverse flavors such as Spanish (tortilla omelette), Filipino (loco moco), Korean (gochujang), even San Franciscan (red quinoa).

The PORK BELLY ($13, two soft boiled eggs, caramelized onion, Yukon potatoes, lollipop kale, gochujang, black garlic, cilantro) made a hearty brunch with the huge block of pork belly. The lollipop kale adds a nice flair. It's melt-in-your-mouth crispy and reminds me of the crispy fried vegetable in Chinese dishes. (Also, it makes you feel healthy because it's kale). 

The SPICED FRENCH TOAST ($12, strawberry mandarin compote, vanilla whipped cream, bourbon syrup).... so many delicious things put together! The description speaks for itself: it tastes as amazing as it sounds.

I had planned to get Saigon Sandos across the street in case we were still hungry afterwards, but we were quite satisfied.

[THE SLIGHTLY-LESS-SECRETIVE CHAMBERS BY NIGHT]

The ambiance at night is vintage romantic: bookshelves of vinyl records lining the walls, shadowy lighting in warm gold and amber tones, climaxing at the famous "BE AMAZING" sign spelled out in light bulbs in the backdrop of the bar. 

The cocktails are good. Not too strong, but nice to sip on and ponder about how to be amazing while relaxing on one of their classy couches and staring at the flickering flame of a candle. One of my favorite cocktail convos:

Me: The pattern on the lights looks like mold when your cell cultures get contaminated
The boo: ...those are supposed to be stars... lol way to ruin this romantic ambiance

Be amazing.
author: Edna C.

description: Chambers is a beautifully enticing spot in an unassuming area. I've had many great nights here, filled with great conversation and exemplary customer service! Jessie is my favorite employee here! She is extremely attentive and constantly goes above and beyond what is expected of her to make your experience a memorable one. Highly recommend stopping by for delightful drinks and great bites!!
author: B V.

description:
BEST BRUNCH PLACE EVER!

My wife and I visited SF over a weekend. We did our homework and selected a few restaurants we wanted to visit. Chambers was one in our list, so we booked for Saturday brunch well in advance.

Our first impression of the place was not good. We walked over from our hotel and had to cross through very sketchy areas to find it. When we finally did, we were confused because Chambers is adjacent to a 1950s motor lodge that reminded me of hippie videos I had seen in history class. We weren't sure where the restaurant was, but we soon found there's a separate door to the hotel to enter the restaurant.

Once inside, Chambers is GORGEOUS!! It's an oasis in the middle of a depressed area of SF. Decoration is a little hipster, with walls covered by vinyl records, modern lighting, and a very cool vibe! Staff is very friendly and will not hesitate to share their advice on what to order. We absolutely followed their recommendations and boy were we in for a treat!

There are no word to describe how ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS our brunch was. Pictures (although great) still are not enough to show how perfect everything was. Eggs poached to perfection, pork belly at its best, soufflé pancakes like you've never tried before... absolutely great!

For anyone searching for an amazing brunch in SF, look no further: Chambers IS THE PACE!
author: Diego C.

description: Great ambiance and service. Not extremely vegetarian friendly but there was a great chefs choice option for vegans/vegetarians. Cocktails choices are inventive and wine list has a great selection. I tried the pineapple whiskey charcoal drink which was crazy sounding but delicious! 100%  recommend dessert!!
author: Nicole C.

description:
After a long night of going out in the city, Chambers Brunch was the perfect cure to my very very very very BAD hangover. For a table of 6, my group ordered the champagne bottle service ($40) and it was good for 2 glasses per person. They also offer bottomless, but 2 was good enough for our hung over asses. For being semi-busy, the service was very good and the vibe of the restaurant is super chic and cool. They have a contemporary look with all the records, curtains, and dim lighting. Top that off with their soothing music, this place is purrrfeectt for those trying to recover from the night before. 

For food, I love the variety of their menu - from savory to sweet, they offer a lot of choices! My group of 6 tried everyone's dishes and I highly suggest the pork belly or hung over hash as these were the more filling dishes compared to the others. If you want a lighter dish, the red quinoa salad is pretty tasty, but wish they had more prosciuto. The Spanish Omelette, souffle pancake, and burger were okay. The souffle pancake tasted like flour and wasn't anything special, while the Spanish Omelette was good, but everything else with it was random. And the burger is a burger.... Nothing special haha

I am so glad my group randomly stumbled upon this place and I would definitely come here again especially when I am hungover!!
author: Eric Joseph D.
