description: This is a great place inside although outside is a getto area, youll be surprised that such a cool place exists in that neighborhood, its great for birthday parties too
author: Jay G.

description:
My hubby and I went here for my brother-in-law's 30th birthday on a Saturday night. My sister made a reservation for about eight of us and we were promptly seated upon arrival. 

The exterior of the restaurant looked like a giant black, windowless box. Thankfully there was a sign next to the restaurant that read "Chambers" because we would have definitely missed the place without it. The interior, however, was much more decorative, with beautiful tables and chairs, low warm lighting, and a cozy atmosphere. 

We had a couple of people waiting on us and the service was alright, nothing special. There wasn't anything that particularly stood out. 

Because we had such a large party, we ordered double of the following appetizers: foie gras, kobe beef, pork belly, and house fries. The kobe beef was served on a heated stone that seared the raw meat whilst on the table so that was pretty cool. The pork belly was very tender and tasted great. The foie gras was served with unagi, an interesting flavor that strangely worked well. As for the fries, they came out as giant rectangular cubes that had actual pieces of potato in them.  But we weren't too big of a fan of them since they were more on the bland side. 

Because we were pretty full already, my hubby and I decided to split the Chamber burger with extra avocado. The bun was thinner than we expected, but instead of being crispy, it just tasted like flat bread. The patty was cooked and flavored well though. The side of fries was typical, but we did like the fresh herbs in it. 

Then finally for dessert, we ordered the coffee cake. While I understand that typical coffee cake has a crumbly surface, the entire piece of cake was barely holding it together, eliciting a rough texture. It did, however, come with a side of ice cream and honey lavender meringue which softened the cake up just a tad. But the combination of the cake, meringue, and ice cream quickly transformed the dessert to a sickly sweet dish. 

So for the kind of food we got and for the amount, we have to say that Chambers is a little too pricey. We weren't too fond of the food and didn't like how there weren't that many options either. Most of our party just ordered the burger because there wasn't much else to choose from. While the place looks nice, we probably won't be back to a place where the food is mediocre.
author: Quyen L.

description:
Definition of a hidden gem and not judging a book by its cover. Amazing place with fantastic food and atmosphere

Food: 4.5, Service: 5, Atmosphere: 5
Cost to worth it rating: 3 (small plates which is majority of menu $10-16, entrees ~$28)
Return worthiness: yes!
Eve award: biggest surprise find

Highlights:
- Staff: loves everyone who interacted with us. Friendly and relaxed and down to earth yet professional. They looked like they enjoy working there and seemed genuinely pleased that we were having such a great experience there. They encourage coming back after a show for a drink and a review ;-)
- Atmosphere: looks sketchy from the outside being in the tenderloin as part of a motel and having a nondescript big brown door. We almost turned around to leave instead of entering but instead were happily surprised at what we found. A beautiful room with bookshelves packed with vinyl records and modern low lighting. Classy bar up front, covered patio on the side, and apparently a cool back room we didn't get to visit this time.
- Menu: small plates to go with drinks type menu mostly which was exactly what we wanted pre-theatre show. The plating was artistic and beautiful as well. 
- Brussel sprouts: loved this version with Korean Gochujang sauce, pine nuts, and Parmesan cheese. We couldn't stop scooping them up. Not fried chips so not greasy and gives Marlowe a run for its money. 5 stars
- Sliced steak: came on an upside down skillet that acts as a small platform sizzling the sliced beef. Delicate flavor and nice touch with a thin yuzu soy sauce on the side for some tang. 4.5 stars
- Hamburger: juicy meaty goodness. We went for the avocado and bacon additions. Couldn't complain. Great fries too. 4.5 stars 
- Tartare: a twist of being covered in a coconut milk based sauce instead of mayo was brilliant. Came with little dollops of avocado puree and tall skinny tortilla chips. 4.5 stars
- Pork belly: tender with a fig chutney to cut the fat with sweetness. 4 stars 
- Octopus: flavorful with addition of chorizo and butter beans. 4 stars 
- Dates: standard stuffed with goat cheese for a naturally sweet and tart treat. 3.5 stars 

Lowlights:
- We had a show to catch and couldn't stay longer to try more food, dessert, or cocktails. 

Loved the personality of this place and I'll be back--maybe for brunch. I've already been back with another friend for a pre-Hamilton show meal.
author: Eve K.

description:
From the outside looking in, you don't see the impressive and chicness inside of Chambers!  Once you enter, it was like a whole other vibe going on.  I was surprised and digging it.  There's an outside, contemporary lounge area that is integrated with a motel and communal poolside.  It's very different on how they combined the two aspects together and it's quite leisurely to sit back outside with a drink on hand.  They have fabulous specialty cocktails as well as bottomless mimosas for 12 bucks with a brunch entrée.

I got their Campari drink and it was refreshing while lounging and our party was waiting to be seated.  It took awhile to be seated on a Friday night.  This place gets discreetly packed.  There's a lounge area on the inside and they have these light bulbs lit up to BE AMAZING.  (Key reminder to do so in life.  Thanks, Chambers.)

Their brunch food as well as their dinner entrees, are wonderful to the palate.  It suits the speakeasy atmosphere and the whole jazz to this happening place.  I love their pork belly with eggs for the morning with mimosas.  Do order their Hangover Hash if you need a recovery from the night before!  It has these unique gelatin, surface-covered, dressing that pops onto the salad with it that I found interesting.  For dinner, their quinoa salad has texture and was healthy with fiber.  I really like their Grit Fries as a bite-sized dish.  Their Pork Belly was smokin' delicious.  Signature burger had a savory taste packed in it.  Hangar steak was cooked perfectly and garnished nicely.  Well, as far as the eye can see!

You can stay in Chambers for hours.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I went to chambers last Saturday with a big group of restaurant servers and sat on the patio. Had a good time, everything was great. We went to pay the bill- we paid with cash and partial credit cards. Later, we realized our cards were overcharged $100 and we called them on it and they denied receiving $100 cash. So it seems our server, tall, dirty blonde, big boobs-pocketed the $100 and had a good night. We Won't be going back.
author: Tatum M.

description:
I came to Chambers to celebrate getting sworn into the bar because it was just a few steps away from the federal building.

On a slow Thursday evening,the service was very attentive and prompt. 

I tried the vodka drink - that's literally the name. It was nice & simple and gave a pleasant light buzz without tasting strong of alcohol. However, I was expecting to taste the basil and it was more of a garnish. 

As for small plates, I enjoyed everything. The smoked grits which come in rectangular deep fried blocks stood out to me most for their unique flavor and great texture. The pork sliders ( actually little pork stuffed dough balls sprinkled with sesame) were delicate and delicious small bites. The pork belly was a bit bland to me, the four tiny pieces came out on a very cool looking platter with coals smoking underneath and the spicy pickled vegetables on the side were tasty. The chicken pate with croutons was also just good. I also sampled the polenta with greens and I did not like the texture or flavor, as there was a hint of bitterness. 

Overall, I really enjoyed the cozy atmosphere. The prices are a bit high but you get good food and good service. I will definitely be back next time I am in the neighborhood.
author: Nina M.

description: The experience was great. The ambience was super cool. The staff was polite and fun. The food was a bit underseasoned, but overall it was tasty and visually appealing.
author: Veronika O.

description:
I value Yelp and this platform to warn people. Chambers has the worst service I have ever had in San Francisco. I came with a 10 person reservation with a pre fixed menu. We all ordered bottomless mimosas, which took 45 minutes to arrive (note: they have a 2 hour time limit). We were forced to get our own carafes of water, and I had to walk inside to ask if we had a  (she was never present and made us wonder whether or not we had a designated server). The food was excellent, but came 30 minutes before the drinks. Not to mention the fact that the server, with BLUE hair was EXTREMELY rude to me and my group of friends. It's unfortunate that I was forced to
Tip the mandatory  20% because we had over 6 people. There is nothing worse than having your friends look at you when you plan a brunch and not get the service you're expecting to pay for (do we get refills? 

I have come to expect a certain amount of service at well known establishments. Chambers did not live up to this expectation. Between the constant need to ask for service, and the rude responses from employees, my day was ruined.
author: L.k. K.

description: Love, love, love the decor and ambiance. Our drinks (alive and drunk in love) were delicious! The bartender was rude and seemed like he didn't want to be there. The service was horrible! My first time walking through the tenderloin and that, alone, may deter me from returning
author: Mercedes H.

description: Great place to lift the spirits and enjoy some quality time. Prices are more than reasonable and correspond to the quality. Waiters are great,polite and full if energy even late at night.
author: Maria C.

description: We went there on Saturday night. It was packed. Loved the decor and ambiance. Music was good. I didn't like the security guy. He was rude and jerk.
author: Zuleyha S.

description:
Stopped in here for a pre-dinner drink.

Gorgeous space, friendly, knowledgeable bartenders and fantastic drinks.

Loved that it wasn't loud, and was able to chat with a visiting friend.

I would absolutely return, glad my husband found it !
author: Amanda G.

description:
Would've given this spot 5 stars, if the service had been better and our waiter wasn't a weirdo.

Spiced French toast. Treat yourself. Two words: bourbon syrup. Your soul shall celebrate. Epic, just epic!

Our waiter said he'd be back to take our order a couple of times. Place wasn't packed. He finally took our order. When we wanted our check, he just kept sauntering by. Without even acknowledging us. We finally asked the manager.

My husband asked if the biscuits and gravy were veggie after I got a little curious and wanted to try a bite of his dish. He clearly stated to the waiter that I'm veggie. "It's sausage gravy, but you can just scrape it off." WTF. What a mongrel suggestion.

So, ignore the weirdo waiter if you get him. Feast on the French toast. So worth it!
author: Gabriela W.

description:
A friend was having a get together for her birthday at the Phoenix hotel, so naturally, we stopped by Chambers for drinks. It was a Friday some time last month.

We started at the bar early, around 6:30pm, so it wasn't too busy. The bartender was awesome. We basically told him what we liked and he crafted specialty cocktails for us. And of course we did a birthday shot. Jameson was the shot of choice. It was a fun, chill atmosphere since there was only one other party sitting at the bar.

We came back around 11pm for drinks and the place was packed. We managed to find a small table and had a couple of drinks. I ordered a pisco sour, but I think they made me a midori sour instead. I was done drinking anyways, so I gave it to a friend. She liked it. Atmosphere was definitely different as the bar had more of a bustling lounge vibe.

I'd love to come back for a meal. There may be a brunch or dinner in my future.
author: Elena N.

description: Great spot for evening to late night dinner in a mix of small plates that are actually pretty large. Ok wine list. Our server was honest and guided us well. Fish and salads were among best choices. Beet salad and grilled Brussels sprouts both really good. French press coffee great. Fun bars to start or finish the night with at either ends of a very comfortable dining spot. You need to be ok with the neighborhood enough to get in and out the door. It's sketchy but quintessential for that section of the city. I'll go back.
author: Martin S.

description:
We were refugees from Black Cat they had us waiting on the street after promising to let us in because we came early. Chilly from standing in the brisk wind for too long we said forget it and walked to Chambers located in the Phoenix Motel. There the staff is welcoming and good and hardworking and friendly.

We got there for happy hour and ordered $5 Malbec at the bar then got a good booth overlooking the pool and enjoyed our cheeseburgers more wine but you can't get the happy hour wine price in the booth deduct one star.  The food was real good and I'll be coming back to try different items.

Chambers is warm and dim easy to relax good for work mates dates and since it's a rock star motel you never know what hipster star is walking around.
author: SF T.

description: I like the vibe of this place and the indoor and out door pool side areas make chambers a nice option in the filth of the city. Drinks and service were up to par.
author: Noni Y.

description: Great service, cool interior, comfortable booths, mediocre food. Came for the pancake "soufflé" and some pork belly. The pancake soufflé unfortunately did not satisfy my soufflé cravings of the week since it had a denser-than-pancake interior. It was basically just an extremely thick pancake. If I wanted the equivalent of an extremely thick pancake, I could have gone somewhere closer to my house and just gotten a stack of pancakes. So, I think the labeling should be changed to "thick pancake" instead of soufflé. Anyway, the "pork belly" was OK, but it was really just thick bacon. If I had known it was just bacon, I would not have ordered it.
author: J L.

description:
A good spot for drinks or brunch/dinner. 

I've been here for drinks a few times, in the area by the back, which one can reserve for large groups/private parties. The cocktails are pretty good and priced at what one would expect in SF.

For brunch, I got the soufflé pancake one time and thought it was really good. It takes a while to come out, but I thought it was worth the wait. It's delicious, but very heavy, so come hungry!

I also got the yogurt parfait another time which was light and had the right ratio of yogurt to granola to fruits.

This place is really spacious, and has a retro vibe. It's located in the Phoenix hotel, and they do have outdoor seating as well (and a pool where they throw pool parties in the summer I've been told)
author: Tanay J.

description:
Hard to see from the street, but once you come in, WOW! This place was so fun. The vibes were chill and the service was amazing! 

We enjoyed drinks and food. Our favorites:

Drinks: Loving Cup - looks can be deceiving! It's small and pretty, but strong and delicious! My favorite :)

Food: Pork Belly, Tri-tip, Bau Bun, Chicken Wings, Chicken Patae, and Tuna Tartar... Favorite: Pork Belly, Tri Tip, yum!

Oh and the service... Outstanding! We loved Miranda, thank you Chambers for making my fiancés birthday that much more special.
author: Justin B.

description: This place is a hidden gem, in the middle of city. The outside is so boring and sketchy, but once you walk in it's a transformation. There are bookcases everywhere full of records , and pretty decor . Colorful posters and a light sign at the bar , make this restaurant have a fun and pleasant ambience . Their summer time drink is super tasty . The service was a bit slow when we went . We had an 8:30pm reservation and did not get sat until around 9:30 pm. The patatas bravas  and brussel sprouts aré delicious. Stay away from the vegetarian dish , that recipe was not tasty at all. Everyone enjoyed the rest of the food. The restaurant was super packed after 11pm , you can barely walk around the aisles .
author: Sofia G.

description: Chamber's wasn't has fun and great as it used to be. WARNING: They do not do bottomless mimosas anymore and you would have to buy "bottle service" which is 40/per bottle. The food is still good but the atmosphere is a little different and it's in the TL. Not sure if this would be my go-to spot anymore but don't get me wrong the food is still pretty good.
author: Jenn L.

description: Bloody Mary Review - Choose from the Green Chile Bloody Mary with house hot sauce and green chile infused vodka or the House Bloody made with house sambal and your choice of vodka, tequila, gin or beer. Both provide big tomato flavor with a hint of black pepper and horseradish for a well-rounded voluminous heat. But for something more unique, get yourself the Green Chile Bloody. Why go? Green chile infused vodka. | Price: $12
author: Shelley B.

description:
Chambers, there's one sign on the corner but I still found it very difficult to find.  After walking inside multiple doors, I finally found the entrance to the restaurant.

I arrived promptly at 8:00pm and sat and waited...15 minutes roll by and he didn't show up. F*ck. When he said lets get drinks and asked me to choose a place, I'm going to choose a place to eat and not to drink.  Is it sad that I was more excited for the food than him?  Anyway, showing up late is no Bueno in my book but I didn't want that to ruin my night so I decided to stay.  5 minutes later, I was about to order then he shows up.  Double F*ck.  Alright, save the excuses, let's get a drink and eat.

-Pork Belly- presentation, amazing. Pork belly, melt in your mouth yumminess with equal parts fat and pork
-Grit Fries- Anything "fries" is good.  I find it odd that there was only 3 pieces; make it four and call in even
-Tri Tip- the meat was laid on a hot stone cooked to your liking.  One bite and I ALMOST had a foodgasm, almost
-Lamb Dates- HIS choice not mine!  I already knew I didn't like dates and the lamb was a bit gamey 

Overall, the food and service was great.
author: Linda N.

description: It's a pretty cool lounge and it's perfect to go for an after party. It's not too crowded and that's a good thing. The music is pretty good too.
author: Ash M.

description:
I was really disappointed with the food and drinks. 

I started off with the kumquat cocktail which was not well mixed and very bitter although described as sweet by the bartender. 

For apps- we got the dates which were really great. 

I got the pigs in a blanket (bar bite) for dinner and it was disgusting.  There was a hair in my food and it was cold. Lucky me didn't find the hair until I had eaten two pieces. I complained to the waiter and nothing was done. We were charged for everything despite my complaint. We weren't even acknowledged for the hair that I pointed out. 

See the picture. Wish I had better things to say.
author: Jena M.

description: Be amazing. That's how you'll feel after a visit at Chambers. Everyone I've met at this establishment is just that--amazing. First and foremost, I met the man behind the talent Mister Gedeon. He's so attentive and charming that you'll find yourself staying all night. Then there's Gabriel who I find enchanting when I watch him do his magic--finesse. From day parties, dinners or private events Chambers offers a pool, cabanas, mixologist at their finest and staff (special shout out to Christian and Malik--fab duo) that are attentive while being completely poised even in busy times. This place should not be passed up--never judge a book by its cover. A treasure in the middle of tender nob.
author: Trish Z.

description:
Bottomless mimosas have been cancelled! It's now either $9 for a regular or $40 for bottle service. Oh well. 

Otherwise food is still good - very rich, a bit on the heavy side. The eggs royale had an almost syrupy like texture to them. The pork belly as stated in other reviews was great, very unique signature taste. 

All in all, okay brunch spot, but with bottomless now gone, probably won't be returning anytime soon.
author: Aileen L.

description:
My favorite place in SF! 
I haven't had the dinner here but the brunch is definitely the best in the city. Everything on that menu is super good but I'd especially recommend the Wagyu Burger or the Pork Belly entree.

Additionally, the lounge area is a great place to spend a Friday or Saturday night if you want somewhere to get your groove on or enjoy an amazing cocktail (The Alive is my favorite).

Lastly I just want to give a shout out to the staff for always being so awesome. It's always very busy here but everyone is always friendly and efficient. Special shout out to Stephanie, Maria, Willy and Kourtney for always being extra amazing!
author: Gilbert M.

description:
A small group (4 people) came here on the Wednesday, the day before thanksgiving. The city is usually dead the week of thanksgiving as most people are out of town, and this bar was no exception. More than 50% of the tables were empty and even though we asked to sit at one of the tables, the male server said it was reserved and that we couldn't sit there. We were confused since there were so many open seats but said uh okay, kind of walked around to figure out alternative seats and then just kinda stood around the bar. Eventually one of the women who worked there asked if we wanted a seat and told us we could sit at the very table that we originally asked to sit at in the beginning. We stayed for about 1.5 hours and the whole time barely anyone else came into the bar. 

So this place put a really bad taste in my mouth all because of the male server who was serving the main area on the Wednesday before thanksgiving. I plan to never come back here or recommend this place (even though I did before) because of this experience. It's infuriating to be told that you can't sit somewhere at a place you're paying for the food/drinks even though no one is sitting there and the place is dead
author: Ketzi C.

description:
The night started off with happy hour and dinner at Chambers. We took advantage of happy hour and ordered: Chicken Liver Pate, Smoked Grit Fries, and 2 orders of the Unagi Bao Bun. These were all delicious. My favorite was the Unagi Bao Bun. 

I ordered the Chambers burger ($16) which came with a side of fries. You have the option of adding bacon and/or avocado for an additional cost. The burger patty was tender and juicy. I'm not a huge fan of arugula, which is what is served in the burger, but I still think the burger is a solid entree choice. 

Our waitress was incredibly sweet and attentive (especially during HH). I had pulled her to the side earlier that evening and told her that we were celebrating a birthday. After our meal, she served a beautiful chocolate mousse dessert with some spicy Japanese topping and strawberries on the side. The dessert was rich and delicious. Perfect for any chocolate lover. 

I recommend making a reservation, as Chambers does get busy as the night progresses.
author: Katie C.

description: Chambers was a nice dining experience prior to our night out watching the Lion King.  It was just a 5 minute walk to the Orpheum.  Easy to make reservations on-line through YELP!  I really liked the atmosphere, chic surrounded by the history of vinyl.  Our waitress was patient while we asked a hundred questions about the menu.  Finally I decided to start out with the pretzel and dine on the brussel sprout salad.  The pretzel was about 1/3 the thickness of a regular pretzel, but the starter is served with two.  It was accompanied with ketchup, mustard, and bacon sauce.  I wasn't really fond of the bacon sauce.  The brussel sprout salad was good, but it really didn't pop out as fantastic, I probably wouldn't order it again.  I did get to try a bit of the tri-tip, it was AMAZING! - a must order!  Prices were as to be expected for this type of restaurant.  We parked at the Civic Center garage and then went to the Orpheum, it is very close and a good before the show dining experience!
author: Andrea B.

description:
I'm giving them 4 1/2 stars. What an awesome hidden gem, and of all places in the tenderloin. We were walking aimlessly for a good brunch spot and we fell upon this cute hotel. 
You would never believe what it looks like on the inside, from the outside. Complete rock n roll 60s or 70s retro. It was so cool with walls full of old record albums. 
I must say their menu was unique and I want to add that it was eccentric, in a good way.  The way they plated the food, to the different colors and it tasted great! The only downfall was, my food was pretty cold. I had eaten half way before my friend complained about it, but I was too embarrassed to send it back. They apologized and offered to bring a fresh one ( which I politely declined), so instead, they offered any dessert, on the house AND did not charge for the delicious coffee we ordered. If your a coffee drinker like me, BONUS points for the coffee, it was thick, dark and rich. (Tip: if you drink Pete's, try their coffee). 

A+ experience, food and coffee was delish, ambiance was super cool, minus 1/2 star for my food being cold, but they definitely made up for it.  We really enjoyed our brunch, I'm spreading the word. Oh and did I mention this place turns into a cool bar and lounge at night, oh and did I mention there is a parking lot!  Yup, you heard me right! 
There's also a swimming pool and cabana in the back, but I think that's off limits and only for hotel guests. 
Any who, I'll be back with friends!
author: Anie L.

description:
This is a 3 & 1/2 star rating. We came here and had a reservation. We were told our table wasn't ready, so we went to have drinks in the back. 50 minutes later we were finally seated! Even though we had a reservation. We were not impressed. 

We were offered free champagne so that was nice. Nothing stands out to me more than the Pork Belly off the Small Plate menu. The presentation of this dish was very unique. (note my picture) Make sure you take a bite of the meat with the pickled vegetables on the side. Such a great combination of flavors. 

The decor is really cool inside. Old vinyl & fun settees make the dining experience one of a kind. If it hadn't been for the terrible service in the front of house, I would have gone 5 stars for sure.
author: LeeAnn C.

description: I've been here before and it's pretty alright. Food is okay service is fine...regardless of all that though they sold a reservation booking to not just me but at least one other couple on 4th of July and they weren't open at all. I hate to give you this shitty review but it's just not that hard to change these settings. As a result I wasted $20+ in fare to get to and from the beautiful tenderloin for my reservation.
author: Thomas S.

description: I love coming here.  Yeah, it's in the TL, but it's all good. Still worth it.  I love how on the other side of the room there's a ton of vinyl records for decor.  That was tight.  Have not tried their food, but that's on my list.  Cocktails are well priced.  Crowds a little touristy, but won't stop me from coming back.
author: KB B.

description:
My family and I went to Chambers before seeing a show at the Orpheum. We were impressed by the thematic decor and the quality of food, but disappointed by the noise of the happy hour. The bar for happy hour is right next to most of the tables they were utilizing to seat those who had come for dinner. In contrast, the back bar with the beautiful "Be Amazing" sign was empty except for a few employees or hotel guests. I didn't understand why everyone was crammed into the front, underutilizing the space the restaurant had. Spending the first part of dinner shouting over people seeing how many Oceans they could guzzle down before seven was unpleasant. It was also strange to me that while we sat 25 feet from the bar, we couldn't order happy hour drinks. Would they have preferred we bought simple bar dishes instead of an entire meal to qualify for a dollar or two off a cocktail? It seems like a poor strategy, but that's just my opinion. 
The decor of the restaurant is trendy and interesting. It's amusing to see how many records you can recognize on the shelves and snapping a shot in front of the "Be Amazing" sign is a must do for an trendy visitor to Chambers. The food was amazing and reasonably priced for a night out in the city. We ordered the Dungeness Crab Cakes, Fried Brussel Sprouts, Beet Salad, Chambers Burger, and the Apple Tart. The Dungeness Crab Cake was our personal favorite of all the dishes we got. The sauce that complimented it was the perfect balance of flavors to match the fresh crab! The Beet Salad had a beautiful presentation and good flavors as well. Desert was presented beautifully with the rose shaped Apple Tart! Overall, I would return with younger friends, but I wouldn't bring my family back when drink specials were going on.
author: Delia C.

description: What a fun spot to stumble upon on after a concert at bill graham! Honestly, came in here looking to grub a little past midnight and my friend and I were very pleased. Great music and atmosphere and there was food! The food wasn't exactly what we were looking for on a Friday night, we got the Tator tots and pork belly, we wanted a little more simplicity, but they were good! Anyways, I loved that the front had a little dance floor and the back had seating. Will definitely be back!
author: Jenny E.

description: I love everything about the service, cocktails, and food. I had an amazing time - sat at the bar for HOURS with Stephanie and Troy, who killed it, and NEVER stopped filling our waters, and chatting with us! It's so refreshing to go into a place and be entertained by the bartenders. I wish more bars in SF would take cues from this place. Every cocktail we had was awesome, and we never had to wait if we needed something even though they were pretty busy on a Saturday night. My friend who was visiting from out of town said it was one of the best nights out he has had in awhile. The burgers were great, as were the potatoes and best Brussel sprouts EVER! I think we were there from about 6 pm and I didn't leave until around 1 am! Thank you for being awesome!
author: Lauren V.

description:
1. Very cool bar! Chambers itself is cool and swanky and the Phoenix hotel/outdoor seating area has like a cool vintage rock and roll vibe (lol I feel cheesy saying that, but apparently a lot of rock stars stay(ed?) there!). Also, obviously a fab photo op. ~*bE aMaZiNg*~

2. The food is actually really good! We had a few other things, but my top two were definitely the crispy pork belly and the sizzling kobe tri-tip - highly recommend both. I enjoyed the kobe tri-tip so much they handed us a dessert menu and I asked for another one of those instead lol
author: Terra C.

description:
What a cute and funky restaurant! 

Came here for brunch on a Sunday with a group of friends. There were 8 of us, but the restaurant doesn't take reservations for groups larger than 5. However, we requested that our groups be seated next to each other, so it all worked out! 

I had the pork belly dish. SO DELICIOUS. They served a good amount of pork belly with 2 soft boiled eggs and crispy potatoes. It didn't feel heavy at all and had the perfect amount of sauce on the plate. My friends had the tofu hash, burger, and french toast. Everything was really great and we all left with happy bellies. :)
author: Gina P.

description: Meh overpriced and music was lackluster. Best thing that came out of this place was the Be Amazing instagram picture.
author: Melissa A.

description:
One of two foodie adventures I actually had on this last visit of SF. And it was pretty eye opening. 

This place reminds me of the restaurants in Silverlake, Los Angeles. Trendy/hipsterish vibe in a somewhat sketchy looking neighborhood. Prices are definitely spendy for what you get. But the food and concept is brilliant. 

My favorite dish was the one I had ordered, the soft scrambled eggs with peas and szechuan style chili oil. What I was expecting was a ginormous scramble egg(it was $12), and a bit of greens on the side. But this dis had a very small portion of eggs, maybe 3 eggs? But felt more like 2. A bit disappointed on the egg front. But it was soft, still a bit running, exactly what I wanted that morning. But what I loved about this dish was the peas, mushroom, and other greens. It was perfectly seasoned, fresh, sweet, and just overall surprisingly delicious. The Szechuan style chili was unnecessary, but I think they had a theme going on, soooo sure why not. If you used the chili oil/sauce, it's not bad either. Try it out for yourself. It's very szechuan.

Among all the other dishes my party ordered were the Hangover hash(love the name), and the pork belly entree. 
++The hangover hash had the most amazing presentation, and the most disappointing small piece of pastrami ever. But it was so tender, so fatty and rich, and SO GOOD. I just want a plate full of that please. 
+The pork belly entree had very nice presentation as well. This had a Korean theme going on. Since it's served with gochujang, it's automatically Korean. And we did have a Korean at our table, he dared to say it was the best thing he's ever eaten. Not sure if he is exaggerating, but I thought it was not bad. 

Those were among the most memorable dishes I tried. Not sure if I would order the souffle pancake Marcus ordered, thought it was kinda pricey and I would much rather just have a souffle or just pancake. But that's just me.

Oh yeah, $14 bottomless mimosas! Our server was very good about topping us off. That's always awesome. I had quite a good experience here. Definitely recommend if you want a nice relaxing brunch next to the pool.
author: Jackson Y.

description:
I came here 8.2.14 for Saturday brunch and I was pleasantly surprised.  The food was wonderful and the service was great.


FOOD:
Souffle pancake - i saw a picture of this on yelp and it was covered with strawberries.  I ordered this and it came with an apple topping so i'm assuming it just comes with whatever is convenient or in season.  I had never heard of a souffle pancake before.  This dish takes about 20 mins to make but it was really good.  Think of a pancake with a consistency that is somewhere in between a souffle and a regular pancake.  Awesome.

Biscuits and gravy - i tried some of the gravy that came with this.  Outstanding.  There are bits of pork belly in it.  Yes, i put some on my souffle pancake.

Pork belly and pastrami - both really good.  Tender and tasty.  


DRINK: AYCD mimosas (Sat brunch only w/ purchase of entree).  Decent mimosas here.  Go for it!
author: Marcus L.

description: Pretty cool spot, kinda stuck up service though. Will go back for ambiance though. Drinks were decent
author: Shannon D.

description:
The dinning room where ate was really tight, like eating on a bus. But Martha, our server, made us feel at home.

The food is very good. 

The hood is scary.
author: Willi P.

description:
After looking at the menu online I arrived with medium expectations, and they were met.

The restaurant ambience is the highlight. Decor was funky, servers were wearing furs with bowling shoes, it was pretty cool.

The food for the most part was decent, maybe average, maybe bad. The tri tip though unique, was a tiny portion and lacked seasoning. And it's served wth soy sauce which adds nothing. Oh, and it's $16. Another sad dish is the $30 hanger steak. Tiny portion served over what looked snd tasted like canned beans. Hanger steak and tri tip are medium quality cuts and they shouldn't be charging top tier prices for tiny baby portions.

What was good was the polenta. Velvety in texture and the broccoli raab it was served with offered a burst of salt which was pleasing. The black cod was also good.. But again a tiny portion.

All in all the meal was okay. The service was somewhat inattentive. The prices... Astronomical. $191. If it were around $130 I'd be happier with my experience. But at this price point, chambers is just another over priced over hyped sub par eatery.
author: Peter T.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch with Joyce M. and Kathleen C. after the Nike Women's SF Half Marathon. Therefore, they can both attest to the plethora of food I ordered! 

Bummed that we came close to closing so they were out of most things people raved about but our server made it work! I had the: 

*Farmer's market vegetables + a side of 2 poached eggs + a side of the house-smoked pork belly: The market vegetables were delicious as they were really fresh and the chimichurri was really tasty. The most disappointing was the house-smoked pork belly...i wish it was more crispy because the fat just made it really rubbery. 

*Side of Marble Potato Home Fries: Skip it. Really oily. 

*Soufflé Pancake (Apple Chutney, Maple Ice Cream & Pomegranate Gelee): THIS is what I came for and I was SO glad they still had this. It's like french toast & pancakes had a baby. I liked the tartness of the pomegranate balanced with the sugary goodness of the Maple Ice Cream.

Overall, tasty but main takeaway: come early for brunch!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Trendy bar! Definitely a nice place to take a date, as they have unique drinks, vintage decor, and a dimly lit atmosphere at night.  Warning though, it's in the Tenderloin so the area is a bit sketch.  But this will give you an excuse to hold your girl/man tight ;) 

Orders:
Smoking pork belly - 4/5 - $14
Tater tots - 3/5 - $9 
Jidori egg - 1/5 - not good and it was $15! 
"Vodka Drink" - 4/5 - $12 sweet with a strong lime/elderflower/basil after taste

OVERALL: So it may be a little on the pricey side, especially seeing their big bites about $30-40, but just come here for the drinks anyway.  If only the area wasn't so sketch and prices a little more reasonable, I'd see myself coming back here more.
author: Raquel Y.

description:
Came here on a Friday night for later apps and drinks like 9:30ish and dug the food! Definitely a step up from brunch.

The dates were savory and delicious - recommend! Has prochuitto in it. The broccolini side was tasty nothing show stopping but cooked well. The polenta bite was great - loved all the flavors. All dishes were randomly veg - although I'm not! 

There were some obnoxious drunk ppl aggressively ordering fireball shots - almost comical bc it was just so early! But who can blame them for starting a few hours early?! We got over it...!
author: Priya S.

description:
Whoa, so spotty on the outside, but a pleasant and cool surprise on the inside! This was a great find for brunch when we couldn't get into the Creole place (you know which one). We were seated right away as there was no wait shortly after Chambers opened. There is definitely a pretentious hipster vibe going on, but the food is amazing so I can't hate too much. 

To start, the 4 of us split an order of biscuits and gravy--I typically hate this dish and the appearance of it would make me cringe, but Chambers made an amazing rendition.  They added Japanese togarashi spice to their enormous, homemade, fluffy biscuits as well as to the meaty and creamy gravy. Why this is considered a SIDE item confuses me, as I would definitely eat this with some fruit and their French pressed coffee for a satisfying mid morning meal.

I was in the mood for a bit of a breakfast hodgepodge so I ordered a plate of fresh fruit, a side of challah bread with homemade guava compote served in a cute little mason jar (which they put in my to go box afterward), and chicken maple sausage. I ordered way too much food -- I could have shared those things amongst 3 people and we all would have been plenty full as each side was HUGE. As for my friends, they ordered the pork belly, the hangover hash, and eggs in a hole. Each plate was, again, ginormous as well as beautifully presented. It was definitely fancy restaurant quality ...never had such a fancy brunch before. I would absolutely want to return, especially for more biscuits, on my next trip to SF!
author: Ann W.

description: We came here for brunch and we were amazed by the interior decor of the restaurant. There were shelves upon shelves of vinyls, trendy/eccentric furniture and fixtures...you'll have to see for yourself. We ordered the Eggs Royale, Souffle Pancake, and the Hangover Hash. The Souffle Pancake was the star of the show. It was SO light, fluffy, and delicious without being overly sweet. I have never seen anything like it. Service was great, food was delicious, the restaurant looked incredible...what more could you want?
author: Helen P.

description: Bad service. The hostess insisted she could only gave us a table for two after we said we were 4 but only 2 would order food and the other 2 would just order drinks. She literally said the other 2 could go to the bar and she could only sit us 2 down at a table. We thought she was running out of bigger tables. So we decided to leave. Hearing me suggesting to leave, she suddenly said she could give us a table of 4. WTF. Also the place feels and looks ghetto. Weird vibe. We eventually didn't feel comfortable and left.
author: ZY Q.

description:
This review is only for the drinks!

My friend suggested we get some drinks while waiting for brunch at Brenda's since there were at least 10 parties signed on the list ahead of us. This bar was conveniently within walking distance around the corner from Brenda's! We didn't want to spoil our appetite so we decided we would just order drinks. The host asked if we had a reservation when we walked in. It didn't look too busy, but you may want to make one if you plan to eat there. We told the host we were just there for drinks. He told us we could order at the bar and then take it out to the cabanas by the pool. WHAT?! I thought I heard wrong too, but no, they really have a POOL in the back!! The inside of Chambers is pretty big and has very cute, hip décor. 

I wanted to get bottomless mimosas for $14, but you had to order an entrée to get the $14 deal. I ordered the Chambers Mimosa instead which was a mix of citrus, cucumber, and chartreuse - YUM!! I also had the Skeleton Key (bourbon, elderflower liquor, lemon, ginger syrup, and peychaud's bitters) - also YUM!! Both cocktails were tasty and a unique mix! The bartenders were friendly and attentive, but the service for the food seemed slow. My friend ordered a side of sausage (3 links) that seemed to take 20-30 minutes to arrive. Maybe it was longer or shorter, but I forgot how to tell time after drinking cocktails on an empty stomach.
author: Jennifer S.

description: The drink on the right created by the amazing bar tender Joel. We named it the "Whiskey Chair". If you like whiskey drinks like the "Old Fashion, Mint Julep, Manhattan... This one tops them!
author: Alex R.

description:
Hands down most underrated bar/restaurant in SF! 

I feel like I've stepped into a fantastic, retrom Mad Men era when I step into the restaurant. The indoor area has very swanky decor and records lining the walls. The bar area is open and great for big groups. My personal favorite spot is the pool, which is so funky! There are a few heated spots outdoors, or grab a lounge chair by the pool.

I love coming here for happy hour, where you can get a $5 glass of wine. Also the Loving Cup cocktail (with green tea infused vodka) is amazing.

Most importantly, everyone is so friendly!! Everyone from the guy at the front desk to the bartenders are just delightful to be around!
author: Sally F.

description:
My girlfriend and I stopped by here for a nice dinner while in the city. The staff was attentive and we were seated quickly with our open table reservation. 

Drinks were well made and average price. We had a booth and started out with the Tri Tip Kobe, which was some of the best meat that either of us had ever had. 

Dinner was served on time and with a fantastic presentation. Would highly recommend the short rib. 

Overall a very nice spot to stop in, whether it be for locals or tourists.
author: Landry L.

description:
My daughter and I ended up at this restaurant on a stormy night, the moment I entered the restaurant I noticed the great romantic ambiance, very suitable for couples. My daughter's boots were all wet from the rain and I asked the waitress if they could put the boots somewhere to dry out, they immediately offered to help. The food was very tasty, we had gnocchi and burgers, you must try their chocolate pate for desert - one of the best. 
Thanks to Patrick the manager for the wonderful service and help. Will definitely come back again!
author: Sarah K.

description:
I had my wedding reception here, and it was amazing . Chrissy is the event coordinator that put a  great party together for me and my husband . 
Chrissy went above and beyond making everything perfect . 
They started out our apps in the bar room , then to the balcony for the dinner and cake. Everything was so romantic and beautiful . The price was so cheap compared to what most people would spend on their receptions . 
The ambiance of chambers was a dream for my reception , and the food and service is amazing . 
I just wish I would have booked the place for longer . Everything turned out better than I ever imagined .
author: Isabella E.

description:
Fun place to come with your friends or a date.
Ordered a bunch of small plates and enjoyed people watching all the drunkies on a Saturday night.
The neighborhood is a bit sketch so hold your breath while walking there and make sure to not leave any valuables in your car. (I saw glass shattered on Van Ness where I parked)
I would come back to try the burger!
author: Angela D.

description:
I would give 6 stars if I could. Perfect meal- the food, the service, the decor. And that's not easy when one of us is a vegetarian and the other is a heavy on the meat carnivore.

As soon as we walked in and I saw all the 70s/80s album covers (will always love vinyl), I knew this was going to be a fun dining experience.  And the food was every bit as enjoyable and delicious as the ambience. The heirloom tomato salad- ohhh my picked at peak of ripeness tomatoes, sweet puddlw of burrata in the middle. Stonefruit salad- who knew a grilled pluot could be that damn good? My guy had the burger and was very satisfied. I tried the bun on the burger- just lightly toasted buttery yumminess.

When I gushed to the server about the food, he very kindly said thanks and that a new chef had just taken over. Cheers to hoping the new chef stays a very, very ling time. Will go back asap.
author: Diana B.

description:
Came for brunch and couldn't find the place for 5mins.... There is no sign above the door, just look for a giant key logo and big wooden doors, thats the entrance.

The interior is pretty unique from a seating arrangement to the decor they chose.  I was offered outdoor seating however how can you pass up a chance to seat on a couch for brunch?!

The food choices are fairly unique but they were a hit or miss for me, and they were not super generous on their portions, so you may want to order another plate or two for your table to share. 

There are two bars and one of them has a signature tag line of "be amazing", it's near the back of the store but it wasn't lit up when I went.  If you like photos or are Asian, you will undoubtedly want to take a photo of this...

Overall, this was a great and unique dining experience.  Would recommend for brunch and I want to come back for drinks at night.
author: Mike L.

description: The food is really good! The place is beatific! The service is great. But it is a bit expensive. I like going there. I would recommend.
author: Rafael M.

description: Service is awful, food is average. The bar took so long to serve us drinks I came to the conclusion that they must be distilling their own spirits on demand.
author: Paul S.

description: I celebrated my "1/2 way to 50" birthday here this past November and it was a success! I wanted a private space for my guests to celebrate yet not too secluded so I can get the feel of "nightlife." Chrissie who works on the events end at the Restaurant and Bar was so easy to work with and communicated back and forth effortlessly, something I really take into account when working with other event industry folks. I got to rent out the enclosed patio area by the pool with a food and bev minimum of $1000. Chrissie even let me split it two 2 checks to cover the $1000 which was awesome because I just had my birthday dinner there with my closest girlfriends and then the staff rearranged the area for the night portion for drinks when my other friends arrived at 9pm. I preordered platters of food and my friend bought a bottle and we covered the $1000 min easily. I got to bring in a photo booth and the servers kept my two tier specialty cake in the kitchen up until my guests arrived so it just wasn't sitting there out in the open. They even tried to help me salvage it after my friend drove over a pot hole or whatever and broke half of my huge cake topper -_- I only wished that the patio area had some sort of sanctions as the other end across the walkways from the entrance is where the public can sit and they kept coming into my section trying to use my photo booth but of course I 86 their asses before they even pressed the button to start the booth. However, after I discussed this with security they were keeping a watchful eye over these two tacky girls who tried to sneak in telling me a bartender said they could use it and then tried to call me a B**** when I walked away but not before my friend heard and was ready to throw down on her and I had to intervene and tell her she needs to leave with her friend before my friend pounds her to a pulp because I know her, and I know she could mess this girl up easily.  Anyways, security guards were nice the whole time, Chrissie was a breeze to work with, and the wait staff was all on top of it all night! Would definitely recommend this location for people thinking about holding an event.
author: Yvonne L.

description: Holy Shit.....awesome food, great service and you get to eat outside near the pool. The short ribs and octopus were amazing. Both were seasoned perfectly, and both were so tender. Wish I knew how he made the Tako, because mine never comes out that tender. The Brussels Sprouts were also one of the best I've ever eaten. We did get the Matcha Flan for desert........OMG took me back to my trips to Japan. Definitely going back again!!!
author: Troy H.

description:
This ranks at the top of my brunch selections, right next to Foreign Cinema in SF. This place reminds me of some of the LA establishment. One would have never guessed a poolside patio restaurant in the midst of tenderloin.

The food was exceptional for brunch, deviating from the traditional eggs benedict, huevos rancheros, and omelets which become too repetitive from one place to another in this city.

MUST-HAVES:
soufflé pancake with apple chutney, membrillo, maple ice cream

pork belly with two soft boiled eggs, caramelized onion, yukon potato, lolipop kale, gochujang, black garlic, cilantro

SOLID:
japanese omelet "tamago" with house-smoked chorizo, sweet potato, cana de oveja, scallions

I also have the spicy cucumber cocktail with hangar one chipotle, lime, agave, cucumber. Good refreshing cocktail with a nice kick to it.

----------------

I also came to this place for dinner in sept 2014 and both my boyfriend and I had a case of bad diarrhea after the meal. We ordered the burger (pretty good), the hot stone tri-tip (probably the best dish with tender meat but probably the culprit for diarrhea) and side of brussel sprout leaves leaves (solid). I would skip the dinner here and stick with brunch.
author: Rebecca C.

description: The bar itself is really cool, great space. However, I was there last night (NYE) and the bartenders were incredibly rude to my friend. We needed something with sugar for a diabetic friend, and asked for one of the oranges. Instead of just being told we couldn't have it, the bartender told my friend to "fuck off you piece of shit". After asking the other bartender for just a coke since we couldn't have the orange, said "seriously? you goddamn asshole". Definitely never coming back. I know it was NYE and things were hectic, people not tipping well, but that's unacceptable.
author: Matt G.

description: So they sell you tickets to a pool party for $35 a head, and then tell you that you can't use the pool.  Only hotel guests.  The advertising says Poolside Party - Phoenix Hotel - Pool.  There is nothing on the ticket, the event website, the place where you pay that says you can't use the pool at the pool party.  I want my money back!
author: Yelp S.

description:
Atmosphere is an oasis in the garbage hole that is the tenderloin. Large wooden doors are almost a wall separating the outside. 

I tried the pancake souffle for brunch and while it's unique and presented well, the middle was really undercooked and I didn't find it very appetizing. The chicken sausage were also just okay and not worth the price for the size. Also, the orange juice was $4 a glass, that was upsetting to find out. The regular lunch dinner menu is much better though, so I'll be back to try more things.
author: Adamme K.

description:
They do not have bottomless on Sundays but you can split a bottle of champagne and some juices for $40 with a friend or whoever else!

Went here to show my friend around the city. I just got some side plates and added them together (pork, potatoes, and challah). the compote is delicious! my friend for the eggs in a basket and she really enjoyed her meal as well.

Great food and ive been here on a night out and it's been fun as well. Good drinks and it is separated into a restaurant and also a bar area (at night).
author: Bori B.

description:
Surprise, surprise! That's what you'll find at Chambers. 

Located in the belly of the beast called Tenderloin. This unassuming lounge is not much to look at from the outside. But on the inside another story is unfolded. The amber lighting and the library decor is Mad Men'esque and just wonderfully inviting. There are two full bars on either ends of the restaurant. The two spaces are stylishly defined by their seating options. The front side has plenty of booths and a long, slender dining table with a real fireplace exclamation point. On the back end is an open space with large chaise lounge seating, great for groups. There's a third outdoor area that's adjoined to the Phoenix hotel pool with patio seating (~9 four-tops) and heat lamps. 

Chambers offered two menus on that serendipitous Thursday evening: regular and three-course ($40 + $25 optional wine pairing). We opted to order on our own. Everything on the menu sounded amazing and sure enough there were no disappointments once the food and drinks arrived. 

Ordered:
- Chicken liver pate
- Grits fries
- Tatar tots
- Pork belly
- Veggie entree to share
- Hanger steak
- Chambers burger w/ avocado and pork belly
- Rye drink (like an old fashion but slightly sweeter)
- Tequila drink 
- Classic drink (too sour for my taste)
- Coffee cake
- Apple *something*

Everything was fantastic! From the drinks to the apps to the entrees! My only advice would be to skip the pork belly add-on for the burger; it's not the same as the appetizer and not worth the +$3. But definitely get the appetizer pork belly! 

As the night fell it seemed Chambers just got busier and busier. When we left around 9:30pm they were just setting up a DJ in the back. Really seemed like this little gem is one of San Francisco's best kept secrets! ...maybe I shouldn't even be writing this review....
author: Stephen Y.

description:
We were pleasantly seated for our 6:30 reservation even though we were 15-20min late. Had to ask a passing waiter if we had been assigned a server about 20min after being seated. They were kind of rude in response. A nice waiter appears and I had explained we were late but we are a bit in a rush with a 8:30 commitment and from that point she was attentive and friendly. We ordered 4 small bites, tuna tartare, Kobe beef, pork belly and a Brussels sprout salad. It was all very tasty. Husband got a beer and I ordered a delicious tequila drink (salt from the earth) and devoured it all! 
Nice atmosphere, good music just a little disorganized with the service. Worth a try for sure!
author: sunny a.

description: I'm a fan of this place. It's perfect for both small groups as well as dates. Their late night snacks are also pretty good (chicken wings). I mostly like the open areas and the lighting.
author: Arjan N.

description:
My friends & I decided to host a bridal shower here for our friend that didn't want the typical tea party type shower.  Although, Chambers is located in the Tenderlion it truly is a hidden gem. I recommend valet parking at the Cova Hotel for $3/hr as it is only half a block away and better than worrying about metered parking. 

For our large brunch party they provided us with a family style menu for $25/per head. Everything we ordered was delicious!!!

Spiced French Toast
Pork Lion
Red Quinoa Salad
Coffee Cake
Chicken maple sausage
Fruit Cup

We were placed in an enclosed area of the patio with heating lamps provided.  The patio is located adjacent to the Phoenix hotel that has a cool retro style which was a great backdrop for photos.  

Overall, Chambers was was cool, hip & trendy! I personally would like to thank the staff for being accommodating to our party.  

Thanks Chrissie!
author: Liz S.

description:
Chambers is just that! It's like a hidden chamber in the middle of a mansion!  You would never know that a restaurant/bar was this amazing on the inside, by walking outside of it.  My girlfriend and I were trying to kill some time, so we decided to yelp some bar locations.  Long behold, on our way back from checking out a closed bar, we opened a door to a magnificent place. 

As soon as we stepped our feet inside, you see a wonderful array of records which immediately brought me back to my childhood because my father was a DJ.  Once you completely immerse yourself inside of Chambers you seem to forget where you actually are, and I love places like this that make you feel as if you're somewhere sacred.  The bar is conveniently located, and the kid that served us was extremely friendly.  From the contemporary seats to the massive collection of records, I wish that we could have stayed longer.  The visit here was definitely short lived, however I will definitely recommend Chambers to any friends/family visiting the San Fran area!  Good job!
author: Vaughn K.

description:
My favorite lounge in SF. Yes it's in the TL and super sketch but as long as you come straight there, you're all good. 

Place has plenty of seating and 2 bars. Not a place you'd expect but as soon as you get inside you'll understand why this spot is a must in the city. 

Drinks can be a hit or miss with the bartenders. Order shots to be on the safe side :)
author: Shellie H.

description:
Wasn't at all impressed with this place. Three of us made reservations and shared much of the appetizer menu. Drinks were tasty, average price. Service was decent but the server had a twinge of attitude. The ambiance was really cool and i"d probably come back again just for drinks.

The food, however, was lacking. And we tried different dishes. Nothing was great

Baby lettuce - Basically a very small side salad. It's over priced and doesn't actually look like a shareable plate like the menu suggests.

Chicken wings - 8 very, very, very tiny chicken wings. They barely had any meat on them and the watered down blue cheese sauce was pretty terrible.

Lamb pancetta dates - By far the best tasting dish. Really tasty but only 3 tiny dates in each serving, for the price of $12 or $13. Cmon. 

Buffala polenta - A very small scoop on a large shallow bowl. The presentation made it look more appetizing than it was. It was so bland. So so so bland. 

Fries - The largest portion of food we had. A generous portion of french fries served with ketchup. I think this was $6 and the only thing we agreed was worth the money.
author: Sarah S.

description: Food is good but the portion is small. Lamb loco moco was good but the rice can be more. The beef brisket was find but not juicy enough. Pork belly was fine but can be more juicy too. Soufflé pancake was good but the topping spice could be more flavor than just sweet. Operation could be better - server came to try to give us the wrong food and then he took it to another table while another table also said that's not their food. Love hat they have online reservation. Good was a bit long wait though. Location was bad. Quite scary near by in tenderloin. They had party and brunch at the same time so the brunch experience was quite distracted by he party. The floor was sticky.
author: Anya C.

description: The atmosphere: incredible. The food: the tri tip is to die for, I especially enjoyed how you can cook it at your table to your preference like a stir fri sizzling in front of you (super cool), Brussel sprouts were yummy and almost too flavorful (large portion), and the pork belly with ravioli was perfectly flavored and delicious. Sadly there was an event when my husband and I went for dinner and we couldn't explore the spot as much as we would have liked but we had a great experience and great fast service despite the business of hosting a wedding on site.
author: Lizzy S.

description:
Love this place and happy to have it in my nabe!

They always throw amazing pool parties and New Years Eve parties but what I love them for most is the weeknight drink and quick bite with friends. Lovely decor, good food, happy hour specials, and exceptional service...what more can you ask for? 

The burger is solid as are some of the other small bites. Decor (both inside and outside) feels like you're in a different City entirely. I've heard others rave about brunch so will check it out especially since they take reservations.
author: Semuteh F.

description: 2.5 stars. We came for the food and were generally under-impressed for the price.  We ordered a handful of appetizers and small plates to share. Particularly disappointing was the foie gras which was under-cooked and small for the price.  This was a shame, really.  They should not be serving this dish here.  Our other items we just OK and I feel that better tasting, more imaginative food can easily be found at this price point in this area.  The bar scene is cozy, vibrant and my cocktail was good.   So if you come here, come for the bar, skip the food.
author: Joe S.

description: This place is great. I'm lucky enough to live nearby. While everyone is in line for Brenda's, you can skip the line and come to Chambers. Great ambiance and great bartenders (Joe in particular). Great drinks, great conversations and delicious food. Hidden gem that delivers. Thanks Chambers!
author: Nicole C.

description:
This place doesn't have any distinctive signs that tell you this is the Chambers Eat + Drink, so it took Mike L. and I a couple minutes to find, but like he said in his review, look for the big brown wooden doors and the giant key.  When you walk in, you are surrounded by walls lined with vintage records and the place overall looks pretty gosh darn cool.  Dimly lit, spacious with booths everywhere!  Chambers has a very speak easy feel to it.

For brunch, we got the Japanese Omelet "Tamago" (house-smoked chorizo, sweet potato, cana de oveja, scallions) and Tofu Hash (brussel sprouts, oyster mushrooms, red onions, garlic confit, farro, almond).  Both of which were very flavorful and unique...different from any brunch foods I've ever had.  I'm not even sure how I would compare it to something else!  

The "Tamago" was a little sweet but complimented well with the salty chorizo and scallions!  The sweet potatoes were very thin and crisp, almost like fried wonton wraps... which gave a nice crunch to each bite!  I'm not really that big of a fan on cheese, so that big block of cana de oveja was a little overwhelming.  If you've never had cana de oveja, (with my very limited cheese knowledge) it's most comparable to Brie.

Tofu Hash in itself was just tasty overall.  A bit oily and the tofu was almost tasteless, but it helped balance a lot of the flavor that came from the other foods in the dish.  We also added two sunny side eggs to the dish which I thought was the perfect addition - so I recommend that you do add the eggs if you choose the Tofu Hash!

I had a good brunch here and would love to come back again!  For the dinner menu and for drinks!  Maybe even give their $12 bottomless mimosas (with order of a breakfast entree*) a chance too on a random Saturday.  c:  This is a gem in the Tenderloin!
author: Carena N.

description:
This place is WAY ahead of itself.  We specifically booked a reservation here for a bday brunch due to the fact they had bottomless mimosas on weekends.  The menu mentions that you need to purchase food in order to purchase bottomless mimosas.  No big deal.  When we finally received a chance to order drinks we were informed we all must order them, because we weren't trusted to not share them!  We had a pregnant woman, 2 DD's, and another that quite franky just simply wasn't drinking.  We were told the deal is so good that it wouldn't be much of a big deal to just add it to the bill for EVERYONE!  Seriously?!  We are all working professionals, lacking criminal records.  It was so tasteless.  I voted to leave.  I won't be going back.  

The service was also SLOW.  The food wasn't bad, but just overpriced.  GET OVER YOURSELF!  They also charge people who cancel reservations, which again is just too much for me.  Unethical BS, all while accusing you of being unethical.  Whatever you do, just don't expect prompt service..
author: Gary M.

description:
I made a reservation here for my birthday brunch about 2 weeks in advance, I was very excited as there were so many great yelp reviews! 

First of all, make sure you know they do not have bottomless mimosas on Saturday which I think is ridiculous but sure...understandable. 

Because I made a reservation, I had hoped we would be seated inside (it is December) but we were seated outside in the very corner! There are heaters but the feel was not what I was hoping for. 

The service was VERY slow, it took about an hour for the food to arrive. I was extremely disappointed with the food and so were my friends. They placed a lot if emphasis on the presentation rather than the actual taste. 

Once again, I do not recommend for brunch but I have been during the evening and the lounge is nice for drinks.
author: Natasha S.

description:
You could never accuse me of being hip. And yet here I was, with my fiance, enjoying a second birthday dinner. We made reservations for 7 p.m. on a Saturday night (can you tell that we're overly cautious out-of-towners?). We showed up a little after 6 p.m. because we happened to be ready early and left early. The restaurant was nearly empty. We are sooo not hip, you guys.

The hostess was super nice and we got a table right away. We were immediately in love with the feel of the restaurant - dark, cozy, romantic, yet super....wait for it...hip! And funky, and sexy. This is a great place to go for romance, or even not romance - there were lots of groups as well later on in the night. 

You're probably not here to read about how the place looks, though. Right? You wanna know if we liked the food and booze. 

Yes, yes, we did. We started off with an appetizer (dungeness crab arancini) which was ah-mazing. They only give you three, though, which is disappointing. To go with our appetizer and eventual entrees, the fiance had Lagunitas while I had the "Salt of the Earth" - tequila, agave, and a jalapeno (though I omitted the jalapenos due to allergies. Go ahead, laugh - it's such a weird allergy). His entree was the tri-tip with a side of fries. I only tried the fries, and was obsessed with the herbs. My entree was the short rib with sweet potatoes, kale, etc. I didn't love my entree as much. The best part of the meal, though, was the dessert. We got the strawberry parfait. GET IT. It's so fruity, creamy, and rich, topped of with a sprig of mint. Yum! 

The waitstaff were nice and prompt without being overbearing. 

Here's where hipness really eludes me, though. I had to use the restroom at the end of our time there. I went in and was shocked not only by its size - the size of our hall closet at home - but by the absence of a sink. A sink, you guys. They were nice enough to put a full-length mirror directly across from the toilet, though. Because we all want to watch ourselves do our business, right? Is it the new 'hip' thing to not have a sink in public restrooms? I guess I'm really ungodly boring and unhip, because I did my thing and left feeling really gross. Thankfully I carry hand sanitizer with me, but not everyone does. 

Takeaway: Come for the ambiance, food and drinks, but bring a good hand sanitizer. Or, just answer nature's call elsewhere.
author: Morgan R.

description:
Most of the great late night eating places are located in the TL so it wasn't surprising that after a Matisyahu concert this was one of the few places that were open.

Okay, let's just say that I absolutely love this venue. Super cute & I love it!
I would totally rent this place out for an engagement party or a rehearsal dinner. Love the atmosphere! They have a bar area towards the entrance & as you go through the bar area you get to the dining area which has seating outside by the pool since this place is connected to a motel/hotel. Just cannot say enough about how much I loved the ambiance.

I got their mojito, it was yummy. You cannot go wrong with a mojito!
This place isn't vegetarian friendly, I am just sayin'
The only thing I could order was the Smoked Grit Fries, it came with a "early girl tomato aioli, BBQ Spice" sauce.

I should've ordered two since one just wasn't enough to fill me up but it's okay. I'll for sure be back :)
author: Camille C.

description: We are from South Carolina visiting San Francisco for vacation. We are staying at the Phoenix built onto the restaurant. The guys at the front desk recommended the restaurant. We looked up reviews on Yelp and decided it'd be worth a try. The restaurant is cool and hip. Our waitress Rachael was courteous and helpful. We ordered from the "small bites" menu and were happy with our choices. My wife got the potato gnocchi and I ordered the crispy pork belly. We also got an order of fries to split. Everything tasted great but it was a little pricey for the amount of food received. To be fair we are from a state of large portions, and we expected to pay more for food here. Last night was our first night in the city so we are adjusting from coming off the road too.
author: Joshua P.

description:
This was my first time at chambers and I just say, I was impressed. 

Loved the ambience, the decor , the records and the food was amazing. 

I had the mushrooms for appetizer and the hanger steak for my main course; both of them were amazing. The mushrooms came with this lemony sauce that added so much flavor.

I loved everything about chambers. Such a cute place. Ladies if you're going to chambers, don't forget to dress to impress ;)
author: Reet R.

description:
Chambers was a delight, a really unique venue with some equally unique and inventive creations.  It's worth braving the 'Loin for a weekend brunch.

I had the Hangover Hash - Dry aged short rib pastrami, red bliss potato, cabbage, giardiniera, horseradish, rye toast, two eggs sunny side up.  It was the bomb dot com.   The pastrami was perfect, some of the best I've ever had outside of NYC and it just melted in my mouth.  The artful trimmings just rounded out the whole meal, I was really impressed.

My friend had the the Pork Belly, I tried a bite and was equally impressed.  He loved his meal as well.   We also shared the biscuits and gravy and it was decadent, great combo.

My wife had the Spiced French Toast, and it was a beautiful constructed dish.  She said it tasted as good as it looked, the bourbon syrup set it off.

Our waiter was a bit of a weirdo, only drawback of the experience.  My wife asked if the biscuits and gravy was vegetarian and he said it has sausage in it "but you can just scrape it off."  Wow.  Thanks, jackass, never thought of that!  All the vegetarians of the world now have a great alternative; just scape the meat off the dishes and you're all set! :)
author: Saminda W.

description:
As dodgy as the Tenderloin is, there's an occasional gem that offers good food and drinks. Just do your best to avoid the sketchy people, especially at night.

Part of the retro-styled Phoenix Hotel, Chambers is a restaurant-bar hybrid that offers excellent cocktails and a wide array of small to mid-sized bites. In addition to the inside lounge area, Chambers also has a nice outdoor heated patio area by the hotel's pool.

Cocktails are great, but not that strong. Their "vodka drink" (tito's vodka, leopold's blackberry, rosemary and honey syrup, lemon, rhubarb bitters) was quite tasty, refreshing, and sweet.

The chicken liver pate was very creamy and rich, and they paired nicely with the crispy, buttery crostini bread. The sizzling kobe tri-tip is a must-order! The juicy, tender tri-tip slices cook on a hot stone, so you can eat them immediately for a rare or a few minutes later after serving for a well done.

Chambers offers sit-down dining at the front of the restaurant, with menus catered to brunch, dinner, and small bites. If you can overlook the sketchy neighborhood, definitely give Chambers a try for drinks.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Don't be fooled by the pictures from Thrillist and Google.  The atmosphere is very mediocre, they ran out of rose at 7 pm, and there's only a small area where you can sit and enjoy your drink-most places are blocked off for hotel guests.

It's a quaint place in the heart of Tenderloin but don't waste your time.
author: Ying H.

description:
The atmosphere was really great. It was cozy--perfect for dates or a small party. My party and I ordered a few of the bar plates and a dessert. The smoked pork belly was excellent and the tri-tip was flavorful and delicious. The beet dish was a nice complement to the meat dishes. We ordered a chocolate ganache dessert, which left of all unimpressed. The balance of sweet with salty was a bit uneven and the smoked macadamia nuts were a little too smokey. Felt like I was eating ash. 

I might not come back specifically for the food, but the atmosphere was intimate and the drinks were well made.
author: Brittany M.

description: This place so weird in so many levels. I try not to compare new york standards but can't help it. This place doesn't have a character, could not decide what it wants to be, interior is inconsistent and not in an eclectic cool way, crowd is very mixed which reflects the decor and ambiance. Food is mediocre and service is extremely slow and not very friendly
author: Emine A.

description:
almost like a Secret bar!! when we arrived by cab i thought we arrived at the wrong place because all we saw was the janky phoenix inn but go through the large doors and low and behold a modern, homey, yet lively bar

bar at the front, some tables if you're ordering food, and another bar in the back with more loungey seating

nice atmosphere for friends or a date
author: Jenny S.

description:
I hadn't seen a dear college friend of mine, who moved nearby SF, for almost four years. So, this had better been an epic and memorable brunch for us.

I meticulously scoured through reviews through Yelp and made a reservation at Chambers.

If you don't mind walking through some pretty crappy (and at times frightening) areas of the Tenderloin District to get to Chambers, I'd say it's well-worth the trek.

Hipsters were everywhere, but a different permutation thereof. The staff were nice, patient, and enthusiastic about helping us. This proves my theory that NYC people are more prone to hating themselves.

I had the soft scrambled eggs with broccoli, cauliflower, romanesco, st. george cheese, szechuan chili oil. Its creative architecture didn't rob the dish of its comfort food intentions, because we all know how that happens. You try to build the Eiffel Tower out of mash potatoes and it ends up tasting like brains.
author: Kendra C.

description: Ambiance, food, drinks are good for a date night. We enjoyed a lot of things here. The only thing I would be careful for is the surrounding areas of this place. Our car parked right in front of it with a lot of street light, still got broken into and our laptop was stolen. Maybe not a good place to drive a German sports car.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Firstly, you have to try the grit fries.

Secondly, you have to try the grit fries.

Thirdly, you REALLY have to try the grit fries.

Those grit fries are amazing!  Crisp and delicious.  The drinks at this join are poured heavy.  The crowd is friendly.  And I like the dim lighting.

This is my new go to date spot.   It really is a great little place that I never would have found unless a friend had brought me here. 

Please, for god sakes, try those grit fries!
author: William P.

description:
You should definitely check out Chambers. It's yum yum in the tum tum and the decor is fantastic. I felt like I was transported back in time. No biggie, just gonna eat brunch poolside while I wait for Freddie Mercury to sidle up next to me for some chillin' time. I don't know what I'm talking about but my friend informed me that apparently the Phoenix Hotel is where all of the "cool" musicians stay when they have a show in SF, so it's kinda cool just to think that you might spot someone famous while eating at Chambers. I don't know if that's true, but I'm inclined to believe her; she knows all.

Anywho, on to the food. Our server offered to bring out some biscuits and gravy for the table as an appetizer and we, of course, agreed that was the best course of action for any blue-blooded American. Who says no to biscuits and gravy? Not a sane person, that's who. Well, as expected, it was delicious and I highly recommend it. As a group, my book club pals and I had: Egg in a Hole, Hangover Hash, Red Quinoa Salad, Eggs Royale, Pork Belly, and...something with duck? Anyway, everybody loved the food and it was absolutely beautifully presented. The only complaint from the table was that the coffee was on the expensive side. $6 for a pot, but it was french press, so take that how you will.

Finally, I must throw in my standard disclaimer that Chambers is located in the TL so tranny hookers, crack, feces on the sidewalk, yadda yadda yadda, you get the point.
author: Stephenie S.

description:
I came here for a 500 brunches event on a Sunday. 

This restaurant is located in the Tenderloin right next to the (or is it a part of?) the Phoenix hotel. Apparently it also converts into a night club with a swimming pool.
