This was my first time here and the interior of the place is actually very charming. I thought it had a very nice ambiance. 

One of the main attractions of this place is that they have bottomless mimosas for the weekend brunches ($14). The mimosas were delicious! I also ordered Tortilla Espanola and tried the french toast. The Tortilla was pretty decent but not the traditional fat pancake looking thing, it was presented in a modern reconstructed fashion, cut into smaller pieces and with a refreshing side salad. As for the french toast, I did not really care for it as much. 

I would say that this place is cool to visit once or twice but if you want really good brunch food I would still choose Kitchen Story over Chambers.
author: Katya O.

description: We went here for happy hour, and they had decent prices on appetizers, and great drinks. We all really liked the bacon wrapped dates. The best part is the courtyard of the adjoining hotel (Phoenix Hotel). It's definitely worth checking out.
author: Tucker J.

description:
I'm still just as impressed by Chambers Eat + Drink.

I've seen this venue accommodate a wealth of different events now. On each occasion Chambers - not only delivered, but shined. Gloriously unique and hip  - Chambers is a consistent brunch, dinner venue which captures this retro rock-n-roll city remarkably well.

From a well planned deliciously decadent Chambers catered afternoon wedding, to a casual good-bye drink and appetizer spread, to a foodie friendly birthday dinner with friends, to a rave worthy brunch which boasts a souffle pancake with maple syrup (have your knees buckled yet?) -  Chambers twinkles in the Tenderloin.

Whether basking in the midday sun by the Phoenix pool, while bohemian hotel guests casually peer over their ray-bans at the city scene, or warming by modern fire pits in the early evening dusk while Karl rolls on over San Francisco - if you wanna court cool - come to Chambers.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
So lets go to brunch they say. Its at a place called chambers... im like wutevs... lets roll... then we roll up on a total 60s style dive motel in the heart of San Fran... and its the same address... I am thinking wtf... diner grub? or what... 

So we stroll up to the front lobby and they have a sign that says go around the corner.  I am like WTH there aint no signs over there... but there is a non descript brown door on a brown building that is just about as flat and drab as anything you have ever seen... well lo and behold... you enter into a dungeon. The lighting is so low that I almost walked right into the hostess with the mostess podium as my eyes adjusted. Its almost like I need to be led into this place or given a flashlight outside to enter with... 

Is this brunch in the dark I am wondering? We are given the how dare you not have a reservation treatment and we may be able to accommodate you uncouth lowbrow guests outside on the veranda... so off we traipse to a semi open and decently lit location. YAY us!

So yeah I am not too pleased with this joint to start with and the condescending attitude or the feeling thereof was bad... I felt like telling them they can take their frisco 'tude and shove it. However once we sat down, we had a chill waitress who was pleasant and jovial. Disheartened that she was a vegan so its hard to get any kind of recommendations or taste info about many of the meals from her. Regardless we did and got our orders in. Half our party went in for the AYCD mimosas for $14 with purchase of an entrée. 

We got a ton of food in the end on our table. I definitely enjoyed mine. I got the biscuits and gravy with pork belly and made my own plane since the only other thing on the menu I could get was the burger and it didn't reach out and grab my interest as much. I am glad as hell that I did! Talk about super tasty vittles. The homemade country gravy was outstanding to say the least. The biscuits were a bit different than normal but definitely went well with the gravy. What made me happier is that my side of pork belly came sliced and on the plate with the biscuits n gravy so they were awash in the delectable deliciousness as well! I ordered more extra gravy because it was so good. 

My friends ordered most everything on the menu and most liked their grub at least decently... it seemed the least liked item was the potatoes though. They had a coating that wasn't as tasty overall... also if you order the pancake soufflé thing, be warned it takes 20 minutes to make it!!!

There is only metered street parking nearby so be forewarned if you are trying to come here at the wrong time. Overall though its worth a stop if just for the biscuits and gravy... OMG so good and yummy!
author: Schel H.

description: Had vegan plate my son had eggs royale. After he saw someone with the soufflé pancake he knew he would order that next time. Great brunch. Great restaurant loved the atmosphere! Will definitely go back for dinner.
author: Robin L.

description:
Love this place for brunch, ambiance and drinks. Had dinner for the first time and it was a let down. We ordered the tasting menu. Beet root salad was good, but both the hanger steak and cod lacked salt and taste. When we asked for salt, or server brought salt from the kitchen in a big container, which was really odd. 

So, no more dinners here! But def going back for drinks and brunch.
author: Aigerim D.

description:
Where do I start.

Chambers. So different. The place is basically not where you'd expect. As someone not from SF, I was surprised to the location, but once you walk in the building, it all disappears. Chambers has the best ambiance I think I've been surrounded by. Vintage records, dim orange lights, beautiful outdoor seating, great classic music. This places decor was second to none. 

Brunch. The food was very different than what I'm used to. Hangover Hash and pork belly with French toast and a French press. Now I want to say it was spectacular, but it wasn't. Was it good? Sure. Was it great? No. It felt like to much was going on with the Hangover Hash, and it all tried to work together but, sadly, didn't. The pork belly was tasty. The French toast was also dry. I'm okay with dry, but this was like not even a drop of wetness, and it wasn't sweet at all. 

The ambiance of Chambers is amazing, the food for brunch was somewhat of an experience, but not the main draw. Maybe dinner would be better?
author: David T.

description: Everything's awesome, service has really improved - love seeing familiar friendly faces every weekend with the best brunch in SF. Thank you Chambers!!
author: Sarah B.

description:
Extremely rude staff and ridiculous seating rules. If you can't deal with the amount of people at your place, just don't let them in. Don't start to be rude once everyone bought their $14 drinks.
Also, pictures are ridiculously staged, the outside area is nowhere near as nice as it looks in the photos.
author: Orsolya J.

description:
This review is for the drinks at chambers. 
I've been here a couple times in the past, but never stayed for very long to get a drink. This past weekend I celebrated here with a few friends and tried a variety of their drinks. I definitely came in with the expectation that this was just another regular bar. I was pleasantly surprised! First of all, I didn't know they had an additional back area with a second bar around the corner (This is great--it's less crowded and has plenty of open seating) 
The drinks are also quite good. I'm not sure if their menus are seasonal or if they change all the time, but I really liked the mezcal drink and the spicy drink. The rum drink is pretty good, but having stopped at smuggler's cove right before chambers -- well you just can't compare to smugglers. 
All in all, I'd say this is a great place to hang out and drink with friends!
author: Annie Z.

description: The words cool, hip and intimate immediately come to mind and aptly describe this gem of a spot which is a winner for a dinner date. I forgot the appetizer we had, but remember it was delicious. The crab cakes and spareribs were awesome, as was the strawberry rhubarb desert. All marvelous! Atmosphere, music, sound level, lighting, and kind of strange, but totally cozy, bench seating were all perfect. Hospitality staff were great. We both thought all aspects of the experience were excellent. Yes, woohoo!
author: Scott C.

description:
Background: my company had their holiday party here and I never reviewed it because I didnt feel like I had a normal experience to share. But I recently went again for dinner. 

Environment: really cool. Like super hip. It is in a shady part of the tenderloin but once you get inside it's very "cool". You can eat inside, in an enclosed outdoor space or even next to the pool. And the pool really makes you want to stay in their hotel. Or reserve a cabana for a party.

Food: There was something about the hamburger I didn't like. Maybe Worcester sauce. But this is definitely a preference thing.
They did make me a michelada and I have gone to so many places In the city that don't know how to make a michelada. So this was a HUGE +++

Service: great service. Friendly, helpful, and quick. 

I would come back here and definitely need to throw a cabana pool party.
author: Julianna I.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  Unfortunately, there are just too many things I cannot forgive.

The food is over thought, it feels pretentious.  There's 2 too many flavors in every dish.  It's like fine dining from 20+ years ago -- when over complicating things was still cool.

The portions are tiny.  I mean seriously, if you have any kind of appetite, you are better off eating somewhere else before you come here.  I had an app and a main, and I was still starving.

I do love the decor.  It's dark, leathery, with shelves stacked with old records.  Cool lighting and great entranceway.

It's also hugely expensive.  Two drinks, two apps, two mains, $150 for 2.  SF is an expensive, but come on!  You are in the TL! Get over yourselves!
author: Yan L.

description:
I've had a lot of memorable meals in San Francisco, sometimes due to the food and others due to the company. My meal at Chambers was memorable thanks to both. I joined a rowdy group of ladies here for a dinner that included wine, tater tots (with bacon dust!), grit "fries", and the sassiest (in a good way) server I've had in a long while. In fact, I wanted to be BFFs with our server because she was the awesomest. It all started with her calling me "boo" which is, strangely enough, a nickname I use for my 2 year old son. 

The interior is the coolest. If I had a lot of money, an interior decorator, and unlimited space I'd invite said decorator to Chambers and command "Make me a room like this, please!"

The cocktail list is creative, the food menu is small, but delicious with a Southern hint, and the service is extraordinary. Chambers is a little oasis in its corner of the Tenderloin and well worth the trip there. Without a doubt I'll be back!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
I was recently here on a date night with the mister and was surprised when I walked in. The last time I had been to this place it was something else with an Asian flair and overpriced wine list, but the sketch factor in the surrounding area hadn't changed much.

The ambiance is great, and allowed for some fantastic people watching! They have outdoor seating, but it seemed geared toward larger groups. They had a bar area in the back for non diners to hang out in, which works if you are waiting for your table.

Drinks were tasty and our server was pretty awesome--he kept us laughing and apologized when our drinks were slow in coming.

I had the pork belly and he had the burger, we split the tater tots and were very happy with our choices.
It got a little hectic as the crowds started to roll in, but its a nice oasis in a dreary neighborhood.
author: Kathy K.

description:
BE AMAZING!! First of all, the restaurant/bar/lounge is gorgeous. The shelves are lined with old records and there's a fireplace and the place is dripping with cool art/furniture. I would love to come back just for drinks and chill out with friends.

We came here for date night on Friday and the place was already packed. The attached hotel hosted an art exhibit and there was a Gatsby themed party going on simultaneously so the place was rocking. There was a large party seated right behind us and they were being super loud so it was a bit hard to have a intimate romantic dinner, but I was told that the place isn't normally this crazy. 

We shared three appetizers and the burger. I also tried two of their cocktails (hibiscus drink and the spicy cucumber). The spicy cucumber had a pretty strong kick, which I liked, but is a bit on the sweet side (to be fair, what is sweet to me is probably just right for most people). The hibiscus drink was just right, with the right amount of tartness.

We shared the chicken liver pate, smoked pork belly and sizzling kobe tri-tip. The live pate was divine! It didn't taste organ-y and had a wonderful port flavor. I couldn't taste the leeks, but I think the leeks were cooked down so much that it melted in with the pate. I can certainly detect a bit of sweetness in the pate that's most likely from the leeks.I would order that again. 

The smoked pork belly was disappointing. I expected it to be more buttery, but it seemed to be blanched and sliced up pork belly sitting on some wood chips. Granted, the presentation was great and the house made kimchi (more like pickled cabbage and less kimchi) gave the dish some kick, but it couldn't salvage the blandness of the pork.

The sizzling tri-tip was another winner, even though the serving size was tiny. The meat was so tender. There was a nice little slaw and dipping sauce that came with the dish, but I could just eat the meat plain because it was such a nice cut and so flavorful.I wish they would have an entree sized portion!

The burger was very good, too. The patty was juicy and the onion jam gave it even more flavor. The challah bun had nice texture and soaked up any extra juice from the meat. The fries were pretty average and there weren't much of it, but overall, it was a good dish.

I want to come back and try out their other cocktails. Hopefully it won't be so crowded next time and I can take a pic of the BE AMAZING sign.
author: Alice W.

description:
I always have really good brunches here. they make the best eggs in hole with salad and baccon. If you have never been, i reccoment eating outside , its super beautiful. the pool, the fish, the sun. great customer service never had any problems there:) 

Also wanted to add the place is urban esc and very homey and welcoming and i love the " Be Amazing" sign in the back bar room.
author: Sophia H.

description: Racist ass bartenders out here. I was waiting at the bar for 10 min, then a white guy comes up and he takes his order. Racism sucks!
author: Neil C.

description: Restaurant is located in the tenderloin district so outside restaurant is surrounded by homeless/drunk people. The restaurant itself is nice and classy on the inside. We were there for dinner so it was a nice and intimate feel. The food was good and the service was excellent. We ordered the patatas Bravas, fried Brussels sprouts, Kobe tri tip, pancetta wrapped dates, pork chop and the night's special - I forget the type of fish! Whatever it was, it was yummy!!! Everything we had there was great. The waiters were pleasant and helpful. The bar manager brought out my bubbly Rose'! Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely go there again especially on a date!
author: Jen S.

description:
I thought this spot was very cool.  While the outside is a disaster since the neighborhood is not fantastic, the interior of Chambers is great - nice, cool vibe with a great sexy atmosphere.  The menu looked good, although the items we ordered were not great - I had the burger, which was alright...the meat didn't have a lot of salt and the burger came off a bit flavorless...the challah bun was also a bit on the dry side and not the rich, eggy bread I was expecting.  I also tried some of the steak and that was good, but also a bit under-seasoned.

I would definitely come back here, but probably go for drinks as well as try some of the appetizers and small plates since those looked great.
author: Ken G.

description:
Ordered the prefix menu and food and ambiance was good, but pricey for the portion size and after the automatic gratuity and SF mandate charges are counted in. Probably better off hanging out at the bar side since the drinks are tasty and my friend who ordered a burger ($13) and other bar snacks seemed satisfied.

Got the chocolate ganache for dessert which wasn't that great, but the steak, though very small, was good.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Chambers is in such a weird spot that it's definitely a hard-to-find hipster bar. Once walking in, you're really transported to this outstanding mix of dive bar and class. The books and records on the wall are mesmerizing enough, but the cocktails are out of this world.

From the outside, you'll never find this place so make sure to look it up beforehand. Don't miss out on Chambers- especially if you're into pool parties- you'll love the parties at the adjacent hotel!
author: Kerry G.

description:
No food experienced here. Just drinks. Another bar with drinks, but this was a cool little experience. I stumbled here with a group somehow, but it seemed off the beaten path so I don't think I'll be back unless for an event.

Went outdoors mainly and they had a trippy cool hotel like area outside the bar and it was nice to have some space finally and enjoy my drink without rubbing elbows with strangers like you have to at every bar.

Solid drinks with cool ambiance. Not bad!
author: Joseph L.

description:
Really unhappy with the service we had last night (Wednesday). There was no host when we arrived. I had to ask the bartender to get someone. It took a long time between table service visits. They got our bill wrong and had to correct. Then we wanted to order a drink at the bar and no one came over. But a bartender asked us to move out of the way so he could get behind the bar. Then we decided to leave and now there is a guy at the host desk doing nothing, while we were waiting to order a drink. Seemed like many people "working" but doing nothing. 

Food was delicious! But yes the portions are small as people say. That didn't bother me because it was so good (Skirt Steak).
author: Orion P.

description:
This time around, I was lucky enough to have din din at Chambers with some lovely (and lively) lady friends. 

Between two bottles of wine, a cheeseburger, and several sides, our meal was nothing short of decadent. Especially for a Tuesday night! 

I must add that service was awesome! At one point our server called one of the gals in our party "Boo". As in "Would you like another drink, Boo?" Yeah, things were going so good between us that we were on a pet name basis.

Bummer that the bar was closed for a private party, but hey , if someone reserves it I guess it's their right to keep the riff raff out!

Still a great choice for out if towers and locals alike. Great ambiance, nice menu selections and personable service.
author: Abby S.

description: This place is legit hipster. My friend got the eggs royale which is two eggs over hash browns, salmon trout and hollandaise sauce. I got the souffle pancake and I preferred the eggs wayyyy more because the pancake was a tad too sweet for my liking. The eggs exploded over the hash but the best part was definitely the trout. It was divineeeee. We sat on the patio that overlooked the motel...haha very awkward setting but it was a cute brunch experience.
author: Amy H.

description: Wow... such a disappointment. Food was absolutely tasteless... It felt like NO effort was made into making their dishes, service was the bare minimum (does flagging down your waitress several times count?), and the drinks were gross (we got our food before our drinks). I gave 1 star for the cute ambiance but that's about it. I'm honestly surprised by the good reviews. Maybe it wasn't our night... Regardless, I won't be returning. Save your money!
author: Ava L.

description:
DO NOT RENT VIP space! 
Chambers bar looks very attracting from a far... it's not!
I paid $1000 to rent the VIP space for my wedding after hour party and the service was a disaster from the beginning to the end. I brought over 35 people... big mistake to chose Chambers. They were good at taking your money, that's it. They were not helpful at all. They never made me feel happy and far from being special the night of my wedding. 


-- I wanted to have the expenses on several cards, they never let me do it.
-- I had an appointment with Chrissie ahead of the D day. She wasn't here! really? (I should have take another place, it was a sign!)
the night of the party:
-- We had to wait in line to enter, really, VIP!??
--They told me that I was short by $400 on orders 15min before the closure.They brought 3 bottles of champagne $120, 5 min before they kicked us out, we paid it and we, of course, didn't have tie to drink them... really!? they could have tell me that a little early. Opening bottles and telling you 5 min later, 'we have to take them back, it's the law' A JOKE!!!!

RUN AWAY, Chambers looks cool and nice but they are jerks!
author: Titoconsume f.

description: I really love the interior and the setting in a legendary hotel frequented by the rich and famous and witness to countless wild parties. The turquoise and orange of the motel walls and the pool and stacks and stacks of old records on the walls. It's a bit of a time machine. Ziegler graffiti is also a reward. The staff is super friendly and accommodating not to say attractive too. So it is a place worth visiting even on its own, but I cannot say the same about the food, which was in many ways underwhelming at least what we chose for breakfast which was pork belly and soft scrambled eggs. Their French press is so strong it's undrinkable and the dishes had a weird greasy side to them and were seasoned with what seemed at first a pleasant tang of Szechwan hot pepper paste but in the end this taste was way overwhelming. I will stick to drinks next time.
author: Aga K.

description:
I had been waiting to dine at Chambers since my arrival on Sunday evening.  *cough---open for dinner on Sundays and Mondays--cough*  My stay at the Phoenix was coming to an end, so I made reservations (the book inside the hotel recommended it) for one.  The atmosphere is fabulous.  I simply loved the ambience; dark, chic, trendy, classy. The servers were friendly and helpful.

I ordered sparkling water (the drinks sounded great, but I'm a lightweight) and opted for the Tai Snapper.  OMG, who would have thought to put sushi rice with peppery snapper, buttery leeks, baby daikon, turnips, bokchoy and beurre blanc?  Each flavor, succinctly different, played well together.  I was amazed.

Next came coffee.  Cute presentation in its own little silver pot with enough for two cups.  
 
I asked the waiter which dessert he recommended.  I was torn between the Chocolate Panna Cotta and Carmelized Apple.  He said hands down, the Carmelized Apple.  I hesitated due to someone else's review, but decided to trust.  I was glad I did.  The dish came out, thinly sliced apples and crumble, hot out of the oven, next to homemade maple ice cream atop a sprinkling of pomegranate seeds and crunchy diced apples.  The plate was painted with a swipe of apple cider gelee.  The different textures and temperatures...the tastes, salty, sweet, tart...I died and went to apple heaven.  
 
I loved my meal and felt like I was a guest on Top Chef, tasting the chef's creations.  If we were on Top Chef, I would have voted for Chambers' chef to win.
author: Jo S.

description:
Delicious ! Must try their burger! Was juicy and cooked just right.

Beet salad had a perfect balance of tang with creamy goat cheese. 

Kobe steak that came in a sizzling hot rock had also great taste and great visual and presentation .

Fast service, great ambiance and lovely staff. Chic and happening. Must try
author: cristina s.

description:
We came here for my cousin's birthday. We paid for bottle service and food. At one point I went up to the bartender to buy more drinks. He said we couldn't have anything. We asked why he would cut us off when we just got there. Then some girls next to us at the bar started laughing at us. He smiles at them. It was clear then that he was just trying to get laid. Once we realized why he was acting like a complete douche, we left the bar and eventually so did the girls. He then told us he was kidding and asked if he could make us drinks. No asshole. You can't have anymore of our money. 

Two stars for feeling like I was back in high school. 

Food was meh. Fries were awesome.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Saturday/Sunday Brunch = Fantastic.
Minimal wait = Even Better!
Outdoor seating (if desired) next to The Phoenix Hotel pool = Awesome.
The number of cracks that are seen while sitting next to The Phoenix Hotel pool while trying to eat your delicious Saturday/Sunday brunch = Not so awesome, unless you like crack. Of the backside variety. Of the male persuasion.

Seriously though, I really hope nobody takes this review seriously and never wanders down to the heart of the Loin to have brunch here, because I would hate for this to become another "spot" where you have wait 1+ hours to dine on a hungover weekend morning.

Well... just enough of you guys to come to keep this place up and running and rocking out, but not too many to annoy the easily annoyed.
author: Victor C.

description:
I've had nothing but good meals, good drinks, and good times at Chambers. 

Brunch? It's fabulous, and the Vegas-inspired pool set-up (along with a couple of mimosas) makes hangovers melt away like butter.

Dinner? Chambers is a great spot for groups as there's plenty of seating and the space is dark enough, pretty enough for dates, too. 

But my preferred way to experience Chambers is on a weekend night out. The potential for beautiful people-watching is off-the-charts high but even better, the people who frequent Chambers just happen to be expert conversationalists. Without fail, my friends and I end up entangled in hilarious, engaging convos that sometimes have us glommed onto a new group of people for hours. The hot Jason Statham doppelgänger who hails from Dublin and rode in on his motorcycle? You'll find him here. The dude with Euro-length hair and enviable taste in music who works in aerospace engineering? Yep, he actually exists. What I'm trying to say is, cool people hang out at Chambers and now maybe, you will too.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
Love this place for drinks and now dinner too! The bacon dust tater tots are too good to share, in my opinion.The smoking pork belly is irresistible - primarily because a single order fills the whole room with the most delicious scent. The burger was also amazing.

The only thing I didn't love were the pigs in a blanket, but that's not at all to say they weren't good. 

I'll definitely be frequenting Chambers for more than just drinks... maybe brunch next time? We shall see...
author: Vanessa L.

description:
New favorite bar in the city? Possibly. 

I've heard and seen buzz about Chambers, but never would have expected it to be in the TL, let alone part of a motel. The interior is absolutely stunning. Like other reviewers have said, you will feel cool as FUCK walking up in here. There's really no other way to describe it; nice leather couches and comfy chairs, the lit up "BE AMAZING" sign behind the bar, a DJ, and list of carefully crafted specialty cocktails. 

The best part is the outside patio. When my friends and I went back there, my friend jokingly exclaimed, "VEGAS?!" It really is a poor man's version of vegas though. There's a pool (which looked clean), cabana, and lots of chairs and tables to lounge about. Make sure to get here early to enjoy the patio, though, it closes at midnight. 

Drink prices were average for the city, and the bartender was very efficient considering the large crowd she had to deal with.

Edit: 

Came back and had dinner with a friend. Best burger I've had! Get it with the pork belly, you will not be sorry.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is the definition of MEH. I have definitely experienced better food.

You definitely pay for the atmosphere and nothing more. First of all, it's in the most ghetto/ sketch area ever. And it is definitely over priced.

Their menu is pretty tiny and doesn't have much of a variety. I ordered their burger with pork belly, as suggested by the top reviews on yelp. But in my opinion, it was wayyy too salty and I couldn't really taste the pork belly either -- AND trust me, I love pork belly and know what it tastes like.

THE ONLY thing worth mentioning/raving about is the whole design of the place. It is really beautiful, I was stunned while walking in (because the outside is so ghetto... man... LOL) and they have that "BE AMAZING" sign which I think is breath taking.

SOOO, at the end of the day, the food here is whatever and the drinks are over priced. Unless you're ballin out hard, it really is whatever. And I wasn't that filled either. Haha. Will not come again not another day. hehe
author: Mel T.

description: Crab cakes, and tuna tartar...bland. The drinks...on point. Drink there. Eat elsewhere.
author: Judy R.

description:
Spacious outdoor seating in San Francisco with heat lamps, and a Southern Californian feel of a view (think [poolside at the Roosevelt Hotel)

Indoor ambiance is one of my favorites - classy with a retro twist, incredibly cozy, romantic lighting (the kind that makes everyone look dreamy).

Food didn't even need to be great to keep me coming back - but it was top notch as well. 
Everything I've had there was delicious and memorable. 
Kobe beef on a sizzling plate - perfectly cooked and melts in your mouth
Heirloom tomato salad - flavorful and refreshing
Burger - one of the best in the city (next to super duper, and better than Umami. yep that's right)
author: Nattie X.

description: I really really love the atmosphere here, but this is my 3rd time here for dinner in the past year and I always walk out a little disappointed. Yes, the pork belly and the tri-tip is what they are know for and my friends say it's amazing, but they need more menu options that don't include beef or pork. I'm not vegetarian; I eat seafood and chicken, but their entree menu is pretty limited. Last time I was there I had the chicken entree. It was good, but the squash was not fully cooked and  I was still hungry afterwards. For a $27 entree, I expect to be full after I eat it. This time I had the sea bass. The two small pieces of fish were tasty, but again, I was still hungry after I ate it ($27 entree). If I come here again, I'll have to eat somewhere else first and just come for drinks.
author: Elaine Tiffany P.

description:
Always delish! The decor is sexy and swanky... Great atmosphere and music from their vast selection of vinyl.

Much to recommend here... Excellent French press coffee, spicy green chile bloody mary, and the pork belly plate with poached eggs, crispy brussels, and caramelized onions is to die for!!
author: J S.

description:
3 1/2.... Worth a try but do not come on an empty stomach. LONG LONG LONG WAIT 
Appetizers took 25 minutes to come out... Then the main dishes took an additional 35 minutes .. Then it took us 15 minutes to get the check and another 15 to get the check back.. 
The pork belly playing is super cute .. Worth a try. Grit fries were ok could do without.. The best dish of the night was the chicken. Unfortunately the steak dish wasn't seasoned well at all and everything tastes a bit bland except for the natural vegetable taste.
author: Michelle W.

description: Toilet paper and wetness on floor. Water splatter around entire seat. No toilet seat covers in dispenser. No paper towels in automatic dispenser. Paper towels stacked near sink splattered with water. Dark.
author: Lavator E.

description: Very cool find close to the heart of San Fransisco. It was a great brunch place where we were able to sit longer than most restaurants would have permitted. (Outside table, group of 7) reasonable for the city and food was good
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
I have enjoyed Chambers for some time.  The staff is always great and the vibe is good.  Tonight, I had the usual experience.  Later in the evening after leaving Chambers, I realized that I had left my ring in the bathroom (took it off and placed it next to the sink to wash my hands).  I assume a patron found my ring and turned it in for lost and found.  When I returned to Chambers, the manager had it and returned it to me.

Thank you to the person who turned it in and than you to Chambers for returning it to me.  Great people and I am sincerely thankful.
author: Marsizzle M.

description: Food is decent but service is absolutely terrible.  The hostess told us that there would be a 30 minute wait when there were more than 9 tables open that I could see.  She seated everyone else who came in after us and then ignored us for 10 minutes before seating us at the table that she said was "reserved".
author: Matthew K.

description:
Came here for dinner when my cousin and her husband were about to head on their vacation.  They were catching an orchestra show that night so this was decently close.  We came here and it was a lot different inside than outside and in a good way.  We got a good amount of food and tried a lot.  Just the way I like it.   

Food:2.5/3

The food was really really good.  We got the crab cake, the mixed green salad, the pork belly, the steak and the pate.  All of it was really good.  Why not the full 3?  The steak wasn't consistent throughout.  Parts of it were over cooked and some parts were cooked just right.  

Value: .5/1
Although the food was delicious, the price was kinda steep.  For three people, it was about $120.  That is the above and one beer.  We had no leftovers which is why it gets the .5 instead of the 1.  I don't mind paying the extra money if I think it's enough, but damn, this was kinda expensive.

Atmosphere/service:  .5/1
Hipster is the first word that comes to mind with records on the book cases and a dimly lit front room.  It was nice.  The service was pretty nice, but the reason why it doesn't get the full 1 is because it took forever for the food to come out.  Didn't have too many people come by and check on us either.  

Recommend it?  Yeah.  I might even go there again.  We'll see
author: Best T.

description:
Yummmmm! Delicious. Beautiful culinary presentations! Service was good. You could smell the aromas of the dishes wafting out into the restaurant before they arrived at your table. Beautiful presentation. Excellent wine recommendations. 
The staff went above and beyond to help my fiancé in delivering "the package" at the perfect moment during our valentines dinner. 
Can't wait to come back again and stay right there at the Phoenix hotel again. 13% discount at the restaurant for hotel guests.
author: Tara W.

description:
6 stars for food, 3 stars for service.

Love love loved my meal. I got the eggs in a hole and the biscuits and gravy. I don't have a single bad thing to say about either one.  

Our service was unfortunately lacking- we came for bottomless mimosas and every single time our drinks were empty, our waiter just passed us, so we had to ask other servers for help. Maybe he was just bitter because he didn't get to go to OSL. 

Either way, that won't stop me from returning because everything else was wonderful.
author: Jordan S.

description:
The server, Natalie, was very rude. When we asked her to split the bill, she said "Are you serious??" And gave us a really rude tone. We wanted to split the bill for us to pay faster. She would often answer in a rude manner, making us feel like we're bothering her all the time. 

The food was okay. Nothing really special. They have a lot of hidden charges too. So be careful because you might be ordering a meal that has a $25 additional charge. 

The ambiance was okay tho. Very chill and cozy. Just not satisfied with service and food.
author: Maxine G.

description: Came here for Sunday brunch. The menu is delicious. The ambiance is chill. The neighborhood leaves a little to be desired, so this spot is a welcome relief from the outside.
author: A G.

description:
Recently came for my friend's birthday.

The service was a bit slow, but it's probably because the server had to walk half a mile to arrive at our table nuzzled in the very far end of the back table.

Chicken Liver Pâté (8) was perfect, but should come with more crostini
Chamber's Burger (15) was basic
Duck Breast (25) was flavorful, but pricey
Hashbrown is creative and delicious

Dessert was a giant miss. Oddly flavored gelato with strange aftertaste and texture.
The persimmon - tasted like a dried squished persimmon that had been left out
The sangria tasted like a strawberry gusher

Really hip restaurant with a so-cal style motel with pool attached in the back.
author: Chris L.

description: Rude as fuck... Bouncers kept checking and rechecking IDs and telling everyone to chill the fuck out. That's not how you treat your customers. Fuck you too.
author: John D.

description:
2 peeps, both opted for the tasting menu.  

Honestly-- we both were expecting much more from what we received.  It's not even portions it's more of taste that lacked.  

Maybe Chambers should stick to being a lounge?
author: Noey A.

description:
I would definitely recommend coming here.  The decor and ambiance is trendy and really awesome.  I love the interior design of the restaurant, and this part alone makes me want to come back here already.  

The staff is super friendly and our waitress was really nice.  There's definitely a positive vibe.  The drinks were really good!  Give the tater tots a try -- they were bomb.  I ordered the steak -- and I was pretty disappointed honestly, because the portion was REALLY small for a $30 plate.  

Despite my disappointment with my main entree, I would definitely go back -- and just order something else.  

Oh -- and go to the back of the restaurant, there is a lounge/bar with a really cool sign that says "BE AMAZING."
author: Michelle S.

description:
I really wanted to like this spot... Came for brunch and was just disappointed as soon as my food arrived. I ordered the Loco Moco - looked delicious - but the rice was undercooked (hard on the inside). I sent it back. Our server informed me that the kitchen was aware of the rice but that's just how they make it. 

I ordered a combo from the side dishes - scrambled eggs, house smoked pork belly, and biscuits and gravy. 
My partner was nearly 1/2 way through his meal before my replacement meal finally arrived 15 mins later!

Wait staff had good intentions. The kitchen I'm less confident in their ability to execute. Good luck to the big table of nurses sitting behind us. I hope your food arrives without issue.
author: Marcus P.

description:
Seems like I have my ups and downs with this place..... The employees make it so difficult to spend money here. 

I came here yesterday with Lou S., and a few others from my office, and we had the hardest time. We walked in, asked for a table for 5, and was told tables are for formal dining only. I said we wanted drinks and appitizers, so the guy responded by repeating that tables were for formal dining only. There were tons of open tables so I didnt understand why we couldnt sit at a table and order drinks and appitizers? 

I did study business in college, and it is my understanding that businesses need customers to make money. So why do Chambers employees make it so difficult to spend money here?

Just to let the Chambers management know, we left without spending a dime since we couldn't sit at one of the many empty tables. We walked down polk street and spent a good $200, if not more, on drinks and appitizers at other bars which made it very easy to spend our money. And these bars were more than happy to let us sit at a table.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Definitely a great date spot. They are open late, have a nice out back area to enjoy a cocktail, or sit by the pool, nice waterfall. Used to be a fire pit thingy.

Love the tri tip app. Comes out on a hot stone rare, sliced thinly so you can cook it to your liking. 

Service is always great here. Greeted with a smile even from the bar (strange) haha.
Keep it amazing chambers. 10/10
author: Nathan B.

description:
Totally worth exploring!

I am one of those people who has never...ever... looked to the Civic Center hood for a Saturday night itinerary. That is, until fate brought me to Chambers Eat + Drink (part of the Phoenix Hotel) for work-related cocktail party last weekend. I love when "work" and "cocktail" make their way into the same sentence.

The Tenderloin motel exterior is pure deception, because the guts of this place are gorgeous! Think prep-school gone swanky. Lots of plaid and leather, old records lining the shelves, and a dark den-like atmosphere that begs for a stiff drink. While I'm usually a wine gal, the cocktail list was too intriguing to pass up. The Cuzco - rum, ginger beer, cinnamon bitters and lime - was a spicy delight. The French 75 = liquid classiness. 

Bartender Annabelle was a dream! She handled our party of 50-ish like a sweet, smiling champ. Thanks to the fantastic staff, swanky digs, and crafty drinks, our group had no problem making themselves at home at Chambers. PLUS, on rare sunny days you can take your drink out to the poolside lounge area. You really gotta see this place...
author: Nique F.

description:
A pristine DIAMOND in the rough... 

Once you get over the lingering crackheads on the streets of the shady TL and step into Chambers Eat + Drink, you will feel like you've stepped into a different world. 

On Friday, 8.5.11, my friend and I came to Chamber's for dinner at 8 PM with reservations and were promptly seated in a booth.

F O O D / D R I N K S:
*PISCO PUNCH ($10) - 4 STARS
I'm not a cocktail person but my friend said the pisco punch was really good. So after downing my Hendrick's tonic, I decided to also order the Pisco Punch. It was refreshing, nicely tart and was a total creeper. 

*SMOKING SALMON w/ Salmon Caviar, Yuzu Sake Crème Fraiche & Chive Oil ($14) - 5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/O2y-CyIsJz8f_6f-MJuKIA?select=hQRFUWkOp4OXyvn3H1i6Ig
The smoke from the burning charcoal infused a prominent smokiness without overpowering the delicateness of the salmon which was silky smooth. The yuzu crème fraiche gave a layer of creaminess while the caviar a pop of saltiness. 

*PB & L.T. w/ Crispy Pork Belly, Butter Lettuce, Heirloom Tomato & Rice Paper ($10) - 3.5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/O2y-CyIsJz8f_6f-MJuKIA?select=E-vlPDIud25sSsQ88FF1AQ
A rendition of Vietnamese spring rolls, the rice paper was filled with slices of heirloom tomatoes and lettuce and topped with a slice of pork belly. The veggies were fresh and crisp, though the rich pork belly lacked a crispy crunch. 

*CHAMBER'S BURGER w/ Pork Belly, Heirloom Tomato, Smoked Red Onion, Carmody Cheese, Whole Grain Aioli & Thyme Kennebec Fries ($12 + $3 for the pork belly) - 4.5 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/O2y-CyIsJz8f_6f-MJuKIA?select=FOJZim5TPLPg9tRg0zdmRw
Between the soft toasted bun was a thick patty perfectly cooked to a medium and was succulently juicy. The carmody cheese added a creamy milkiness, the tomato and onions gave it freshness while the whole grain aioli gave the burger a nice creamy tang. The addition of the pork belly is an absolute MUST! Like thick bacon, the pork belly was nicely crisp and added a rich, porky smokiness to the burger. If you're a carniwhore like me, the Chamber's Burger will NOT disappoint!

*DARK CHOCOLATE GANACHE w/ Brioche, White Chocolate, Strawberry, Almond & Basil ($7) - 4 STARS
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/O2y-CyIsJz8f_6f-MJuKIA?select=sUePrrOkzmmrmudlIbH49Q
The richly divine chocolate ganache topped crunchy brioche slices which a nice contrast in textures especially when the ganache melted like a fine triple cream butter on your tongue. The white chocolate sauce gave an extra layer of decadence while the strawberry compote gave a nice sweet tartness to help balance the richness. 

S E R V I C E
Friendly but lacked attentiveness since Chambers was a full house on a Friday night. If it weren't for this snag in service, this would have been a 5 star review. Food came out in a timely matter which is always appreciated. 

A M B I A N C E / D E C O R
All I can say is, WHOA! The design team definitely did an AMAZING transformation to the former Bambuddha Lounge. Chamber's vintage glam decor is super swanky and a place you would imagine to be in Hollywood or NYC; NOT in crackhead central that's for sure. Shelves of old records lined the walls in the main dining room giving you that feeling like you're dining in someone's living room. The lounge area has plushy sofas and ottomans perfect for mingling and having a drink. There's also a poolside patio with several cabanas and a fire feature. 

A live DJ comes in at 10 PM and currently plays Soul/Loungey music. There are 2 bars and drinks didn't seem to be a problem to get though we only stayed till 10:20 PM. Chamber's attracts the Marina-type crowd and Hipsters in the masses if that's your thing. Chambers is definitely a place to check out and start your night off but not a place I can spend the whole night at (I like to dance).  

P A R K I N G
Street parking; beware of street cleaning signs. This area is pretty sketchy at night, so I highly suggest taking a cab here instead.  

At the back bar, lighted bulbs spell out "BE AMAZING". LOVE IT! Pay a visit to Chambers and be prepared to BE AMAZED, I know I was and it takes a lot to impress me. BELIEVE ME.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Probably one of the best experiences I've had in a long time!! I never would've expected such a jewel located in the Tenderloin. Maybe that's why it's sort of hidden! The entrance is a large wooden set of doors with no sign. If you don't walk around the corner you'd never see the sign that's says Chambers entrance around the corner.  We came for brunch on a Sunday so perhaps it's a little different coming here during the night, but the service was excellent and the food was delicious!  Our waitress was super friendly and after maybe 10-15 minutes of waiting for our order she must have noticed our hunger pains because she came by to apologize for the wait and then offered us a drink on the house! That's not something I experience much, especially in restaurants in the 'Loin.

I ordered 3 side orders - 2 eggs (over medium - cooked perfectly to my liking! not too runny), home fries (seasoned just right, not salty!) and pork belly (requested crispy style). It was the perfect portion to make one feel satisfied and not too disgustingly full.
author: Mercy D.

description:
Went here for brunch once, I probably wouldn't return for that purpose, but would try it for dinner or drinks. I really love the look of the place, and can see why people want to lounge here. I dined here with a part of 7 and the service was good. I did find it odd that at 2-3 of their brunch items were unavailable early on in the day, but who knows? 

I also don't love restaurants that don't allow for substitutions, because I remember not ordering my first choice because of one of the ingredients in the dishes. Any who, I had the burger and it was okay. The whole experience was just okay.
author: Candace R.

description:
Nice new hipsters joint in the Tenderloin. Young professional to late 30's crowd. The only downside is there's no dance space. And people are uptight; filled with pretentious Asian females who stands there and do not know the definition of fun. It'll be a great place to go with a large group of friends, not fun for singles who wants to meet people. 

Drink wise, stick to the outside bar. It's limited selection but faster service and reasonably priced $8+ up. The outside patio area closes at 12:30 AM, so make your way there before you get herded inside.
author: Phoebe T.

description:
I looked up restaurants around the Orpheum theater, and Chambers had great reviews. We needed to find a place within walking distance b/c we had a show at 8pm.

The restaurant is beautiful inside with the eclectic decorations and a sophisticates/ relaxed atmosphere. The food we had was tapas style, which was perfect for our occasion. The served as in the amount of time we had, and life with a comfortable amount of time to walk back. Totally recommend!
author: Christine H.

description:
The happy hour selection was pretty nice, had well drinks and cheap beer. The red wine was a bit bland though but it was only $5. 

The best part about this place is that during happy hour, it's relatively empty and there's a nice backyard that combines with the hotel next door with comfortable seating and a pool. It's very difficult to find a bar with outdoor seating that's not crowded in this part of town.
author: Gary W.

description:
Cool decor. Not in the greatest area. The bottomless mimosas are good. The menu was very varied and a bit different a to your standard brunch menu. The sauce that accompanied the pork belly was not at all to my taste and the pork itself was tasteless.
That said the other three guests that I was with enjoyed their meals. Everyone thought the portions were a little small.
author: Barry O.

description:
It's very rare that I get to start a review while I'm actually still here. But in the case of Chambers, it's really all I can do to pass the time. Life sucks when you're a designated driver and while the people that you are with, act crazy stupid drunk...I have to wait this out until they are ready to leave.

Earlier in the night, things were pretty chill here as it was mostly empty and the crowds haven't started piling in. This is around 7pm. Then as the night went on, the number of people increased and increased and increased...til the point where it was a challenge to even get to the bathroom!  The guy/girl ratio here as the night went in skewed very heavily to guys so ladies come on down and get your drinks bought for you!

In terms of service and music atmosphere, the bartenders were mostly friendly although smiles and banter were not always the case since they seemed busy most of the time.  The DJ came in after 9pm and what initially was a 90's R&B blend of music then morphed into Top 40 around 11pm or so.  I do remember hearing some cool 90's hits like 112's "Only You".  

Initially the seats inside were tagged as Reserved for a private party at 8:30pm but seems like they never showed up so they made the tables available to my group.  It was very gracious but was a bit irritated that we couldn't use those tables even before the reservation time.

All in all, it's a chill bar and restaurant before 10pm but a very loud clubby like place after that.  The drinks were the traditional over $10 price range except maybe for bottled beer.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Overview: Eh food and even ehhhh-er service. Not sure if the servers were having a bad day but they seemed irritated in answering basic questions about menu item.

Good: French toast dish was very good. The bourbon syrup was spot on.

Bad: Everything else. Eggs in the hole dish was cold and dry. Side of pork belly was cold and barely cooked. I understand that you don't want to ruin pork belly by over-cooking but how about exposing the food to an open flame. 

Best part of the experience was watching the guests checking in and out of the eclectic boutique hotel that the restaurant is adjacent to. 

Also located in one of the seedier neighborhoods of the city. Not much car parking but plenty of shopping cart parking out front.
author: Chris T.

description:
**NEW AND IMPROVED DECOR WITH A TOUCH OF HIPSTER**

Loved the friendliness of the front door staff.

Oohs and ahhs at the front bar.

I ordered several Blood and Sand cocktails from the back bar. It was a tad too sweet and it was not stiff. But flavors were good.

The decor was very nice; better than the previous lounge.

Classy, upscale feel. 

Dim lighting, dressy folks, and BE AMAZING bulbs. 

Drink menu was decent. Nothing fancy, but solid.

We stayed for an hour and it was the right amount of time.

RECOMMEND for a friendly pre-drink in the neighboring Tenderloin.
author: Betty N.

description: Tried the pork belly brunch - simply superlative. The tangy sauce was a perfect accompaniment to the overall dish.
author: Vivek R.

description:
Chambers should definitely be on your list of brunch experiences in the TL. 

My partner and I were in the neighborhood and decided to stop by Chambers for brunch. It was about 1030am, so we were expecting a long wait for a table amongst the saturday morning brunch crews. Fortunately, we beat the crowds. There were lots of tables open. The host was nice, we let him know we didn't have a reservation--but with a smile he said not a problem and he walked us to their patio seating. Before walking out the patio we were able to walk through the restaurant space. You're definitely transported in to a great vintage time period. You feel like you're in a record library, with sleek, masculine vintage furniture. Pretty awesome design choice. 

Outside, you get the enjoy the ambience of the Pheonix Hotel pool. Our server, Jahvanna was really nice. She took the time to discuss her favorite dishes on the brunch menu. She had a refreshing perspective--commenting on which dishes have the best to offer in colors, presentation, and portion size. I decided to go with the Egg Sandwich ($11), the BF decided to go with the Pork Belly ($13), and we shared the Togarashi Biscuits and Gravy ($6). 

Biscuits and Gravy:
The Togarashi Biscuits and Gravy came out first. We were a bit unsatisfied with this dish. The biscuits definitely were a bit too tough inside, though nice and crisp on the outside. It seemed like they may have been sitting around for a while. The gravy, a bit too salty, had a nice richness and thickness that I appreciate. Unfortunately, the gravy was just warm. This led it to be cold in a few minutes because we were seated outside. After a few bites and some conversation, cold biscuits and gravy just doesn't uphold a consistent enjoyable experience. 

Egg Sandwich: 
The egg sandwich was delicious. The eggs were moist and seasoned just right. The focaccia had a nice crunch that together with the cool crisp butter lettuce and warm, seasoned mushrooms created a really nice combination of textures that definitely livens up an average "egg sandwich." The seasonal greens had thinly peeled slices of cucumber that balanced the generous amount of salt. (They're salt happy in the kitchen).

Pork Belly:
The pork belly was fulfilling and had a nice balance of being crispy and juicy. The sauce alone had a richness that paired so well with each component of the dish--the pork belly itself, the potatoes, and the kale. We felt that eating each together with the sauce was a bit overwhelming, but overall this was our favorite dish. 

Overall, a nice brunch option and experience!
author: Ben C.

description:
Date & Time:  Tuesday May 16, 2011 @ 7:30pm Opening Night
Location:  Phoenix Hotel Former Bambuddha Lounge & BackFlip
Dining Companion:  The Husband
Scene:  Couples & Groups in MiniDresses w/ Over-the-Knee Boots
Vibe:  Sexy
Music:  Jet, Tool & Soundtrack from Kill Bill 
Decor:  Steve Tyler+Jimmy Hendrix Inspired Circa 70's Bar+Lounge+Resto.  Dead President's Art +Strategically Placed FirePlace.  Two Full Bars, Sleek Lounge w/ 70's Chaise Lounge, Fur-CowHide Banquettes+Communal in Main Dining Room & 60's Leather Chaises in 2nd Bar, Pool+Cabanas & OutDoor FirePlace Completes The Scene
Service:  Drop-Dead Gorgeous+Outgoing Natasha & RockStar Jaime
Imbibe:  Full Bar.  Pisco Sour & Strawberry Mojito
Devour:  Table-Side Smoked Salmon, Artichoke Hearts, PBLT(PorkBelly, Lettuce, Tomato Wraps), Burger+Fries & Carrot Cake
Total:  $73.91
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
I. Am. Blown. Away. In. Awe. 
This is SF's best kept downtown secret. If you see a run down hotel. Find a big black heavy door. And are then able to open it... You will also be blown away in awe.

A cross between a speakeasy and rockstar afterparty scene thrown in with a Miami scene, this bar is meant to impress. Especially during happy hour, this place is where you want to be. The service was impeccable, personable, and knowledgable.

I only wish there were beers on tap and more food options to keep me longer!!
author: Regina D.

description:
I came here in hopes of having a nice dinner but walked out of there dissatisfied with their tasting menu, the price and the whole experience. Between two people, it cost us $150 for appetite, entry and dessert! For the quality of food and the culinary school type presentation, I didn't think it was worth no where near $150. I've eaten at better fine dining places for less than that. 

The decor was cool. It was a hip, trendy place. It looks like a fun place to go have drinks and bday parties at but not for dining. We sat in the walkway which was an awkward place, so we were in the middle of the bar and restaurant. Our table was sticky. It was way too dark. I had to use my flash light from phone to read the menu.

Service was slow. 

If you're gonna charge like a fine dining restaurant then I expect the food to be on point.
author: Mai N.

description:
Cool ambiance inside, in stalk contrast to the 'Loin. Also has a nice covered and heated patio, where we sat poolside for brunch.

I really wanted to give this place a 5 for their pork belly, but that dish is *salty*. At first glance it looks beautiful - a golden block of pork belly and two soft boiled eggs nestled in a plate of fried lolipop kale and potatoes, along with other accouterments. My first bite was of kale, salty but tasty since fried or roasted kale is best on the salty side. Pork belly was nicely cooked, tender and flavorful. Additionally, the eggs tasted unsalted relative to everything else, so I thought the saltiness of the overall dish was purposefully done so that I could balance it with the potatoes and the kale. But in hindsight the more I ate, esp the parts covered in the orange-colored sauce, the more the nice flavors turned into salt, salt and more salt. Basically the last 5 bites or so of mine felt like I was eating salt, as I hoped in vain that I could rediscover the original flavors I tasted when I first bit into the kale. In the end I think that it was the sauce  (gochujang - wikipedia: a 'fermented Korean condiment made from red chili, glutinous rice, fermented soybeans and salt') that gave things a very salty flavor. My early bites only were lightly touched by this  sauce, but the last few bites were unavoidably drenched.  I downed 3 glasses of water faster than they could refill, and would have a 4th if they poured me one. Only was able to tell the waitress about it when I was basically done, who passed it along to the chef for future reference, I can only hope! If they can tone down the saltiness, this would be an awesome dish, but right now I have to warn people about this potential salt fest.

My gf's vegetable medley was also on the saltier side (although not as extreme as mine), so it may be affecting more dishes? I hope not, because I still would love to come back to try a bunch of other yummy sounding dishes (like their soft scramble or pancake souffle), not to mention their intriguing cocktails. Looking forward to giving these guys a higher rating the next time around...
author: Linus W.

description:
I've been to Chambers a few times now and always have a great time! The food is really good, it's a great, fun environment, the wait staff is always super friendly and the bar itself is fantastic! I've sat outside twice and inside twice. I prefer outside as it's a little more bright -- the inside is on the darker side to go with the lounge feel. They have heaters outside and a large canvas/plastic wall that helps keep you warm even when it's not super nice outside. 

The food is great, the tater tots are an absolute must! The menu changes periodically depending on what is in season but I've never been disappointed by a dish. The bartenders make fantastic cocktails and they have an extensive beer and wine menu so you're covered across the board. After we finished dinner the server let us go sit out by the pool while we finished our wine which was super nice. 

If you're looking for a fun brunch of dinner spot this is definitely a place to try!
author: Lizzy U.

description:
Terrible service. Totally overpriced. 

Took us almost an hour and a half after sitting down to get our food. 

Food was B-.
author: Audrey S.

description: Great service, fun atmosphere, and awesome food. Definitely would reccommend for date night, group events, or drinks with friends. :) Make sure to check out the back end of the restaurant for the infamous "Be Amazing" sign! Great for pictures.
author: Cassie M.

description:
This place is in a seedy area but in the inside is nice.  I want a Be Amazing sign in my living room now.

Becky was our server and she was great!  The bartenders were gracious too and they even have ice wine from Austria here.  I had a second dinner here on Saturday.  The Kobe tri-tip on the hot rock was so good (just don't overcook it).  It same with a cold cucumber salad with daikon and carrots.  The brussel sprouts with wonton chips were good too.   

The ambiance is casual but still yuppie and the decor is great.  

Would come back for dinner!  (Probably not the nightlife though since they would not let my friends in for 30 minutes and they had to wait until 12:15 to get in (not cool!). It was not even crowded)
author: Chris L.

description:
I'm sure other people have been in similar situations, but my friend and I ended up at Chambers for lunch after realizing the line at Brenda's was monstrously long. 

We opted to sit outside and were surprised by the brightly color retro motel and pool. 

My friend ordered the eggs royale and I ordered the pork belly. I know some reviews mentioned having it come in your own smoker, but I think that's strictly dinner? Either way, both entrees were delicious.

My friend enhaled her eggs royale, which featured sous vide eggs sprinkled with caviar. The pork belly was well seasoned and decadent and I would certainly come back to eat! 

Warning to those with large appetites - you'll have to order more than one plate. The portions are humble but is solid.
author: Daisy K.

description: $15 for a glass of wine in this "hipster" spot? No thanks, forget it. We'll go elsewhere.
author: Casey R.

description:
Trendy restaurant with a South Beach vibe. Came for brunch and had many innovative items. The best was the soufflé pancake (takes 20 min to prepare).

The restaurant is pricey, though. Mimosas were $11 each.

If you're looking for a trendy atmosphere and young crowd it's worth the price.
author: Benjamin Y.

description:
I think my good friend Elvis P. wrote a song one time about the area of SF that Chambers Eat+Drink is located and just got some basics mixed up, here let me show you:

As the sun shines
On a cold and gray SFO mornin
A poor out of town boy is creepin (out)
In the ghetto
And his friends cry
Cause if there's one thing that they don't need
Its another hungry mouth to feed
In the ghetto

Ya I had to trek across Eddy street to get here and let me tell you I felt like I was living a scene from the Walking Dead. Scared shitless as I dodged zombie like loud homeless... what's with the homeless in SF they're approximately 1000000 decibels louder than any other derelict person I've ever encountered?!?!?!?!

That all being said I would make that trek 1000 times knowing the gastro-treat that awaits me at Chambers!!! Kind of like a foodie Oasis in the midst of a homeless Sahara dessert. The diamond in the rough located in a neighbourhood ironically known as the Tenderloin. (Ain't nobody eating a tenderloin in this area)

Stopped in for Brunch with friends and had:
Eggs royale $14 - Two sous vide eggs, crispy hash browns, cold smoked salmon, mandarin hollandaise, caviar, chive, and dill all sitting on a bed of creme fresh

Side of Pork Bellies - fatty, delicious and oh so bad for you YET so damn good 

Bloody Mary - OK, I'm from Canada and we do Bloody Caesars, I can't deal with Bloody Mary's, not my bag baby.. seriously!

Aside from the Bloody Mary, everything else was fan-friggen tastic. Food aside, the decor of this place was awesome, I especially liked the oversized light signs and the HUGE collection of vinyl. Seriously, I think every wall of every booth was covered floor to ceiling with shelves filled with classic albums!

I might decide to drive here next time I'm in town - in fact I'll MOST DEFINITELY drive, no way I am doing that death march again!

Eat Crest Out!
author: Kris U.

description:
I am usually very skeptical of even hanging out in the TL at night, but let me tell you, Chambers is a #MUST 

Cute decor inside and out, you almost wonder why this is in the middle of the TL, but it surely makes you forget that walk at 2am later is one you might later regret...

With plenty of seating and a big bar area, this is a great place to grab dinner with a larger group or to just hang out on a Friday night. The drinks here are fabulous and the food takes fancy up a notch. We ordered the Fries to nibble on and was served a plate of cubed potatoes instead. Although it was delicious, I have never ordered something as simple as fries and got such an interesting rendition. Definitely will need to come back to explore the rest of their menu one day!

Overall, a great bar scene with a fun and young crowd. Will definitely come back again!
author: Luby H.

description: got the pork belly and coffee for brunch - absolutely delicious
author: Jess Y.

description:
Mmm! Mmm! Mmm! Pork belly in my belly! 

Per several recommendations my best friend decided to have her birthday dinner at Chambers Eat + Drink last Friday prior to the Macy's Glamorama Fashion show. This was the perfect place to start off our night.

This place is a hidden gem. From the outside this place looks sketchy... it is attached to the old Phoenix Hotel in the Tenderloin and the door is on the side of the building. When you walk in however, there is a dimmed, artsy, classy kind of ambiance. We arrived around 6:00pm during happy hour on Friday. There weren't too many tables occupied but the front bar was surrounded by young looking professionals. 

The menu is short, very short and prices are mediocre. Three of us ordered the Chambers Burger ($12) with pork belly (+$3). The only thing I've tried here is the Chambers Burger but I think it might be the best thing in the menu! All three of us agreed the burger was super juicy and very aromatic. It had a heavy smokey flavor and all the extra fresh condiments complimented the taste. Ohhh and the pork belly... it is a must have if you are ordering the Chambers burger. Without the pork belly... you'll feel cheated. The seasoned fries were a little too salty yet addicting. 

My best friend had the California Sea Bass ($23). She said it tasted really good to the point where she cleaned her plate- including the sauce. The Truffle and Wild Mushroom Dip was okay, it is served with chips. My friend who does not like mayonnaise was not a fan.

Mixed drinks seemed pretty strong and I guess we were there for the Happiest Hour of all because the two beers we ordered did not show up on the tab.

Service was really good. I mentioned to the waitress we only had about an hour and a half  for dinner since the show was at 8:00PM at the Orpheum (a few blocks away) and she got us out in good time. She also reminded us of drink specials and happy hour time, refilled our waters and checked on us frequently. 

Good food, drinks, style and class- this place has it all!
author: Cindy S.

description:
The food was good, but things were pretty overpriced, the service was a bit lackluster, not BAD, but considering the prices paid? Not quite so great.

The cocktails are all solidly good, fancy mixology. and on average $11. I ordered a bulliett neat and was charged $22 for it... Less than 3oz of bulliett straight should NOT cost $22. I do not understand how that's justifiable.
author: wolf n.

description: Awesome atmosphere- this restored 1970s Los Angeles style hotel is reminiscent of where Janis Joplin would hang out with metal bands.  Records on the wall, cool music oriented decor and nothing kitschy about it.  The food is a tad overpriced, with small portions and can also be oversalted at times, but still quite delicious and inspired.
author: M S.

description:
If I ever have the chance to try this place again, I may increase my starage. Overall, the experience was good. There were a few "wth" moments but nothing that couldn't be fixed.

The Ambiance: Don't get lost walking up and down the Eddy st in the heart of the Tenderloin district looking for this place being that it has ZERO signage outside. It is directly on the side of the Phoenix Hotel. Get a sign please. ANYWHO, The inside of the restaurant is dimly lit (very loungey), tables are a little close together. There is a restaurant section and then another portion dedicated for the actual lounge. There is outdoor seating (heated) and plenty of standing room within the hotel (motel) courtyard area.

-we sat outside in the covered area. heat lamps work but there are breaks in the covering so you will feel a breeze from time to time.

-The service: This is probably my main reason for the 3 star experience. Our waiter seemed a little more interested with his eye brows than providing excellent service for our table. Although he wasn't bad. He was far cry from great. He did not explain the menu and when we did have questions, his answers were a general and very flat  "no". Didn't offer any suggestions just said no. He did not check on us very often and when he did it was super brief and he would take off, leaving us trying to call for him to come back. 

-My BIGGEST gripe was with the bill. Our bill was almost $400. First he would not split it, ok fine. We gave him the bill back, itemized everything and wrote how much we wanted each card to be charged. When he brought it back, one of our guests looked at her card and realized she had been charged over $20 more than what she wrote down. Of course we went back through the bill to see what we may have forgotten and realized there were 2 items we forgot to include. Our bad. My issue is, why not tell us that the bill was short opposed to just charging the card for whatever amount? We clearly listed HOW MUCH that card was SUPPOSED to be charged. But it just went along with the lazy, laissez faire type service we had received all night. Victor was out server.

The food: I enjoyed the food. Small bites mean small bites. The Kobe steak is amazing! I had a small side salad with their champagne vinaigrette; very tasty.  I wish there were more alternatives to some of the dishes, for instance the salads. If you don't like what they have on the menu, so sad too bad lol. My side salad was just lettuce and dressing. lol

p.s. Take a cab or Uber. Parking SUCKS
author: Meghan M.

description:
I came here for drinks maybe twice and enjoyed the ambiance since they have a quirky but refined decor. It's a nice place to just sit, chill, and have a drink or two. 

When I ate here, the service was really slow because they were backed up that night. The waitresses apologized for the delays, so I couldn't really be mad at them. The food was decent, but I'd probably just come here for just drinks next time. Boyfriend and I shared a shrimp bisque, spaghetti squash, and Chambers burger with pork belly. Nothing was really outstanding to me, but they weren't terrible.
author: Kathy L.

description: This is one of those places that feels like a best-kept-secret. The neighborhood is a little sketchy, but inside it's the swankiest. I love their pancake souffle. I will say that it can get a little crowded so either go early or make a reservation.
author: Kyle F.

description:
Chambers makes you feel good. Inside and out. 

The vibe is on point. along with the food and drinks. The staff makes you feel like you are a rockstar, and well, you are! 

I had been looking for a wedding venue that wasn't your typical banquet hall or vineyard. TOTAL SCORE. I walked in and literally cried. Chambers is everything that an "alternative" bride could want. The ambience screams sexy fun! 

I was married here 1.5 years ago  and not to brag, but it was the best wedding ever. You wish you were there. In fact, people are asking if we can get married again. 
Chambers is connected to the infamous Phoenix Hotel, which makes partying there really convenient. 

Isabel and Chrissie were wonderful coordinators. They really understood what I wanted and were able to work with my budget. 

The food, drinks, ambience and staff were all top notch. 

Thanks again, Chambers!
author: Catherine C.

description:
I absolutely love Chambers - it's trendy, modern, has great hand crafted cocktails and is filled with fabulous waiters. 

So why the three star rating then? The food. 

Now don't get me wrong, I actually enjoyed a lot of the appetizers and entrees that we ordered and yes we ordered 6 appetizers, 2 entrees and 2 desserts for the two of us. That's actually precisely my problem with the place - it's perfect for a happy hour/ post-dinner drinks & apps type of spot, but not for a legitimate sit-down dinner. The portions are simply too small, even by fine dining standards.  

It's definitely fun to sample all the apps and perhaps an entree or two along with well crafted cocktails and a fabulous group of friends. But I need more from a traditional dinner. I want to be able to order 1 appetizer, 1 entree and 1 dessert and feel more than content. Chambers just doesn't cut it. 

Having said that, however, here's what I recommend - truffle dip, smoked grit fries and the pork belly. I enjoyed the appetizers much more than the entrees. So I'd recommend coming to Chambers for a light dinner filled with sampling all the appetizers and drinks or a post-dinner drinking venue, definitely not a traditional coursed dinner.
author: Priya S.

description:
Drinks are a bit pricy but good! Great date locale!
Brunch was good, a bit pricy for the quality. Incredibly creative but lacking in substance. I don't really feel my pastrami, eggs, hash, plate complimented each other well. Nevertheless, I'd recommend the spot to anyone. The decor and service alone deserve a repeat visit!
author: Brandon G.

description: I had one of the most amazing meals of my life here, The pork belly. Drinks are delicious but do take some time to get. The atmosphere is prime with the outside patio with a pool for the hotel next door. Don't be scared of the surrounding area because inside is totally worth it.
author: Amanda I.

description: Service was a little slow, but it was a Saturday afternoon so I won't hold it against them. Motel next door was doing a poolside yoga class, so that was neat to see. I had the egg in a hole and WOW was it rich. Love that it comes with a salad... something light and fluffy next to OMGGREASE. Very. Very. Good. My bf had the pancake soufflé and it tasted like the yummiest French toast you've ever had had a pancake baby smothered in apples and laid in some kind of berry glaze blanket. It was a masterpiece, but very hard to actually finish. This place is overall awesometown. Planning to head back soon, only for dinner/drinks.
author: Maggie D.

description: Food was pretty good! The fruits were fresh and the biscuits are to DIE FOR. Unfortunately the same can't be said for the brisket.  I didn't care for it too much. It was a bit tough and too sweet. I wish I had just ordered another Biscuit and Gravy. Mimosas were yummy--juice was good! The service was okay. We sat on the patio and it took about 10 minutes to get someone's attention so we could get water. But they were very friendly about it. They also continued to serve us mimosas after we paid which I loved!
author: Haana R.

description:
The food is just absolutely fantastic. We had the Kobe beef tri tip, which was like buttah- so smooth! The pork belly was delicious and dissolved like cotton candy and the burger was a perfect finish! 

The service though really sucked. I'm not even going to lie. They came over maybe 2x (order, check) to the table and we waited for a lifetime for the check. She even forgot our wine, but after that we were over it. Service gets a 0, but the food was a 4 for sure!
author: Carmen H.

description:
Street parking-- after a couple times circling the surrounding neighborhood, I snagged a spot directly in front of the restaurant. A friendly homeless man with a little white powdery stuff around his mouth suggested he would watch my car for me while I dined. I politely declined. 

Trust the menu-- small bites are not meals. Rather, small plates, tapa like, for sharing or a quick bite before the entree is served. 

Party of 6 for our birthday dinner. We were seated outside on a cool night with the fireplace blazing for our comfort. Cool place-- you eat and chat, drink and dine while imagining what the place looks like during the day. When you dine outside, your view is of the pool and the 70's style motel/hotel where guests filter in and out. 

I arrived late, so I ordered a small plate so I would get it about the same time my group had their entrees. I ordered the Smoking Pork Belly ($14), which came with tomato kimchee, pickled sweet peppers, aji amarillo chili, and scallions. Wow-- it was so good. Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned. The spiciness of the salad perfected the pork.

The brussels sprouts were also a delight. The combination of the chorizo and lemon gave the leaves a nice balance of spicy and sweet. 

From what I understand, the rest of the table wasn't terribly in love with the burger, and the tri tip was ok. 

Skip the dessert. I got the caramelized apple, a hodgepodge of ingredients thrown together in a confusing combination of tastes that didn't at all blend together well.

Instead, get Tequila Drink, made with Suerte reposado, agave nectar, lime, cucumber, raspberry, and mint. Homygawd. So good. I had three of them. Not kidding. We were there for awhile lol

What I loved about Chambers was the atmosphere. Once we were finished with dinner outside, they moved us indoors. The vibe was cool, sexy, and easy going. The decor really sets a chill vibe in there to dance, talk, eat, or take in more Tequila drinks. 

I'd come back for a chill night to talk to my girlfriends over small plates and drinks.
author: Ashley J.

description:
Don't let the sketchy hood deter you away!
Love the ambiance of this place with vinyl records, fireplace and 'Be Amazing' lights.

Went for happy hour on a Friday night (until 7pm), ordered light bites (food is not on happy hour), but the speciality drinks are all $8. GET THE WHISKEY SOUR! (might be a holiday/winter drink, but get it if you can!)
author: Christine C.

description:
we came in a large party...we did catering and I am not a big fan of their food..
we got salmon...iron steak...
for that kind of price it didnt deliver the same level of food to me
