however, the bar side is nice..the decor and atmosphere is quite model..yet one thing i cannot stand is how small their bathroom is..
will i be be back?sorry Chambers...
author: Jessie L.

description: The food is decent, which is the only reason why this place shouldn't be closed and incinerated.  The service here ranges from atrocious to criminal.  You will wait at least an hour for your drinks to arrive, and they are incapable of splitting checks, even when asked to do so in advance.  They also rub under toasted pieces of bread all over your back (that's really a third-date activity, right?). They do, however, offer special side dishes: a unique strand of hair in your food, which they shamelessly pluck from the plate in front of you.  SAD!
author: Jamie C.

description:
Okay, I'm not going to lie - the main reason I wanted to go here because I saw the cute "Be Amazing" pics of the bar and totally knew I would love this place! haha! 

We went for dinner on Saturday night - what an amazing place! To be honest, I was kinda scurd as we all know the Tenderloin isn't the safest of places, but oh well, you just have to walk a litttttle bit faster.  Once we walked in, I was pretty impressed - the place was SO COOL - decor was right up my alley! People were totally enjoying themselves - some there for drinks at the bar, others were enjoying din din.  They have 2 bars and the bartenders were super attentive and quick to take your order - which is always a plus.  And to top it off, the ambiance was seriously amazing! 

We had ressos for 9:30am, we arrived a tad early and the adorable host told us that he'd see if he could get us seated earlier.  We decided to head over to the bar and get some drinks while we waited.  As soon as we ordered, he showed up to let us know our table was ready.  We were seated in one of the booths and the backdrop was amazing!! 

Our waitress was really sweet and gave great suggestions. The only downfall was the service (of actually getting our food to the table) was soooooo SLOW.  Maybe the fact that I was starving made everything seem like it was in slow-mo! But, oh well, with a place as cute as this, I didn't mind too much...I did have my glass of wine, which made the wait bearable.  

We ended up starting off with the Smoked Grit Fries with Tomato Aioli which tasted like jumbo, fancy tots.  They were pretty freaking good.  We also had the Chamber's Burger and the Zabuton Steak - both were yummy and worth the wait! 

After dinner we lounged around by the bar and also outside by the fire and pool.  

Good times! Can't wait to come back! Definitely putting this on my list of fav lounges in SF!
author: Suki B.

description:
The food here was excellent. I think they finally figured it out! 

I had the Chambers Burger with pork belly added for breakfast. Very juicy and full of flavor. Get this, it's excellent. The fries tasted a little funny though. The oil was maybe old or used for something else. I'm not exactly sure but whatever the case the flavor was a little off so I couldn't eat them. It's too bad, I love fries. I'm sure you'll like them and I'll get them again and hope for better results.

The only negative had nothing to do with the food. The bar staff, waiter, and front greeter were unable to break a dollar bill so we could pay the meter. I find it strange that an entire restaurant was not able to come up with change for my dollar. We spent over a $100 in the end.

We will be back but next time we will take a Lyft or Urber. I guess more than anything I  should be asking myself why I was driving in the city in the first place.
author: Justin S.

description:
Had a great time here. Great atmosphere and interior design, friendly and attentive staff. Not too loud, not too quiet. Good selection of music playing.

Started with Grit Fries (rectangular bricks of fried grits with dipping sauce) from the Bar Bites menu. Delicious, and not too heavy. The Red Quinoa + Peaches + Prosciutto salad was also delicious, with subtle flavors and not too heavy or overbearing. It was rather filling, though.

The Kobe Tri Tip appetizer was delicious, served rare on a super-heated stone for you to heat to your preferred taste. Dipping sauce was good too. Next time I want to try the Pork Belly.

The hanger steak entree was superb. Tender meat, served pre-sliced, served on two mounds of beans and minimal veggies on opposite sides of the plate. Great presentation, amazing taste.

Had the seasonal sorbet for dessert. Small bowl of Coconut Mojito sorbet. Light, delicious, not overly sweet. 

I ate in the restaurant area, and the larger bar area was closed for a private event. The renovated low-budget-turned-chic-hipster-motel connected to it presented a nice view out the window, with its unique paint scheme, lights, and pool area. 

Overall had a great time here. Definitely recommended.
author: Brian D.

description: This restaurant is in a horrible neighborhood and can be deceiving from the outside but it is very nice inside and brunch is amazing on sundays!
author: Annie R.

description:
My roommates and I like to brunch at least once a month, and so we went to Chambers about a month ago.  Because of the lovely Tenderloin views, walking into the restaurant was like walking into a new, hip world.

I ordered the eggs royale which included smoked salmon, caviar, and an orange hollandaise sauce on top of has browns.  I liked everything individually, but eating the cold salmon with the warm eggs was off-putting.  And I had no desire for the caviar.. it strengthen the fishy taste of the salmon and not in a good way.

I wouldn't mind coming back, but I also don't have a desire to.
author: Vira P.

description:
I'm giving Chambers four stars, with a strong potential for five and here's why:    

It's located in the very unconventional and uber-cool Phoenix Hotel (where the lady and I found ourselves last Friday).   

The pork belly is served japanese style over hot cedar coals.   It's not served as a giant, oily half-burned slab as most places, but as small tidbits smoking tenderly over the little coals in the wooden box it's served in.   The best I've ever had.  really.

The duck breast was cooked perfectly, and served with immaculate perfection.

The chocolate tart with curry coconut ice cream was magical.  

Service was kind, lighthearted, prompt and professional. 

A soft minus star for ceviche which was rather plain, but good nonetheless.   I'm definitely holding a star in reserve for next time.
author: Max K.

description:
BE AMAZING

I don't think Chambers lived up their motto quite like I thought they would.  

Drinks were stiff and nothing impressed me.

We did come here a bit earlier than usual but maybe it was an off day?  I can see the venue being an edgy spot to hang out as other reviews mentioned but the back bar itself looked pretty small unless they move out tables from the dining area when a party occurs here!  I should give this place another shot when an event happens here, because I am sure they take full advantage of the pool area also!

(Definitely in a shady area though so be safe! It's the TL!)
author: Kathy D.

description:
Food was 4 stars, service left something to be desired.  

More specifically my gripe is with the Phoenix hotel staff.  We arrived 8 minutes early for our 5pm reservation. The restaurant wasn't open yet and the front desk clerk suggested we go down the street to another bar to wait until Chambers opened - when I responded that it was only a few minutes he said "you can do a shot then".  Hmmm, so then I asked if we could just wait by the pool area, to which he was all to happy to say "No, that is for hotel and restaurant guests only."  But we are restaurant guests? No he said, not until we check in for our 5pm reservation.  So we sat outside, on a bench, in the middle of the Tenderloin, to wait 5 minutes for the restaurant to open.  

Tater tots and Smoked grit fries are delish; ambiance and music are spot on - but I was just rubbed the wrong way by our first interaction to ever come back again.  Granted, dude isn't an employee of Chambers, but when your restaurant is in a motel, their staff is part of the service too.
author: Brittany D.

description:
Went here on Wednesday with two friends after work. We had heard the drinks and atmosphere were awesome and wanted to check it out. Outside of the restaurant is a pretty sketch neighborhood be warned but inside is very chic and sophisticated. My one friend got there a little bit before us and by the time we had gotten there we were ready for cocktails. I would say it took our server (Maria) ten minutes to greet us and ask for drinks. When I say greet us "Hi, did you want a cocktail?".... Didn't introduce her name (only know her name from the receipt)... Didn't ask how we were or if we had been there before... Totally rude. Mind you 2/3 of us were servers in our past so.... Yes we are going to judge. Drinks came out and were fabulous... Two of us had the vodka drink which was strong and refreshing! If you like basil get it! My other friend had a Malbec, which she enjoyed. After the drinks were dropped off we didn't see her again for another 20 minutes when she then took our order. We got the tri tip, polenta, tater tots, burger and quinoa salad. We all enjoyed everything... All delicious! The taller African American man who was the food runner was very kind and helpful! Shout out to him. We got another round of drinks and had also asked for ice for our water. She looked at us like we were completely putting her out.. Again rude. We wanted one more drink but had enough of our server so we asked for our check which she of course dropped off quick. My friends and I look young and I guess naive, but when it comes to service at a restaurant and tipping we are always overly generous. This server however did not deserve that. Perhaps she could start with a smile for one. We got up and went to the bar and got more drinks. Bartender was quick and efficient. We then took our drinks outside on the pool deck and enjoyed the scenery! The pool and surroundings are very retro chic! We also took a picture in front of the Be Amazing at the bar. I'm giving this place a 3/5 because drinks, food and atmosphere were great. Server sucked. 


Update: Soon after my original post I was contacted by the manager of Chambers, Isabel. She was a delight and offered my friends and I, a second visit to Chambers to redeem our original visit. This time our server was Barrett who was attentive, witty and provided great service. Our food runner was also a delight who had originally helped us with our first visit. Kudos to Chambers for their great customer service and acknowledging their guest experience!
author: Alyssa D.

description:
Let me walk you through the amazing chambers experience. 
First, you're greeted by this trendy host who gets you seated at the bar or a table ASAP (reservations usually recommended, duh) 

The bartenders and servers are so cool and unique, as well as knowledgeable and make great recommendations re: food and drink. They are super laid back- ask them anything... Except on a date. They are all super hot but are at work for Christ's sake! 

The amazing thing about the kitchen at chambers is they are always experimenting. This is adventurous fine dining but I've never had anything I didn't like. Meats: The Kobe beef was so flavorful, the BBQ at the table pork belly was adorable and a full sensory experience. Salads: the quinoa salad right now is delightful, recently they had a gem salad with salmon which blew me away. 

Tonight I had a delicious and spicy Bloody Mary, the carrot soup (which is un-fucking-believable) and the bacon wrapped medjool dates with some amazing complicated sauce. 

The thing about this review is I'm leaving all of the details out which go into the genius dishes at chambers. Don't even get me started on the ever changing homemade sorbets... I could go on forever. 

Impress a date or go for drinks and food with friends when you want to really enjoy eating and drinking. It will make you happy to be alive.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Review of bar only:

I've come here twice while waiting for brunch at Brenda's around the corner. Drinks are AWESOME. Great Bloody Mary, great Mimosas. The place is swanky. The bartenders are nice. The host will give you quarters for parking. Need to come back and actually eat brunch HERE!
author: Jenny J.

description:
Great decor. Great food. Great staff.
Grit fries, sizzling Kobe beef and the Brussels sprouts were only half of the dishes that were ordered but they were my favorite. Flavorful dishes and decent portions. 
The bar area was closed off for a private party but I would like to go back to have drinks and check out the lounge.
author: Minh T.

description: I came here few weeks ago for HH, had 1 drink and left. The bill was splie between my gf and I, when I saw my statement, they had charged me 30+, the total bill was around $20 and split between 2. when I called them, some rude guy who claimed to be the manager said he would look into it, of course, didnt hear back from him. Thank God my CC refunded me the difference they over charged me ($20)
author: Gizzy S.

description:
Not a whole lot of hospitality here.  Surly bartender serving small, overpriced drinks.  Bouncer and the rest of security were unfriendly, bordering on hostile.  Kind of like what you'd get at a nightclub with shadier crowd.  Why do these guys think that being polite is a sign of weakness? The women's bathroom was dirty, and that's especially annoying since there are no changing rooms to put on a swim suit.  So you'll have to change in the dirty bathroom.  Sound appealing?  

You'll also have to contend with the neighborhood.  It's rough.
author: Leigh F.

description:
I may have slightly crashed a wedding here... um... but anyways, cool spot and the amber lighting/wood finish especially in the back room make everything seem kind of sepia and glamorous. 

My drink was a mule type thing and was ok. Kinda strong tasting which isn't a bad thing but cuts down on the refreshing vibe I was going for.
author: Misha T.

description:
I had brunch here once (which was great but pricy) and I mostly go here for the nightlife.  

I would come here often if it wasn't terrifying to walk five feet from the cab to the front door.  Perhaps others are less sheltered than I am, but I worked at Turk and Taylor streets for more than a year so I'm pretty aware of how this area can be.  And well, at night, it's another story.  If you don't want to be hassled or harassed, make a straight beeline right to the door.  This isn't the kind of bar where you can hang out outside with your friends after a fun night.  Cab to Bar, no other stops.

Inside, it's awesome.  Drinks are good, the crowd is good...I like the age range too, definitely not too old or too young (at 27, this is great for me.)  I also love that people dress up and really seem to be putting their "all" into having a fun night.  Reminds me of the NYC clubs I used to go to when I lived there, except less...clubby.
author: Alexandra B.

description: Came here without reservations on a Thursday night. We were seated relatively quickly by a genuinely gracious hostess, which was very refreshing. Both the decor and atmosphere were lovely--walls are adorned with piles of old albums and a sculptured elaborate light fixtures hangs over the bar. The lighting is a little dim, but warm. Our server was friendly and attentive and the food was great! We had delicious well-prepared hamburgers and an order of Brussel sprouts that were every bit as tasty as our server said they were. The restaurant was completely full by 7:00 p.m. What stood out to me about the experience is that Chambers attracts a young crowd and we are old; I've grown used to being invisible in such establishments, but that was not the vibe here. We felt welcome.
author: Sarah W.

description: I loved my experience at Chambers. Thank you to yelper Edna C. for recommending it. The service was great, the food was absolutely delicious and well-executed, the pricing was fair and the ambiance was laid back. Everything was excellent! I would definitely come back! The staff was very kind despite the fact that we were late for our reservation and while the food took longer to come out, they made up for it. Sometimes things happen and I thought they handled it great. My husband had the pork belly and I had the french toast, both were tasty. In the end for me it's all about the food and I'm a fan!
author: Kay N.

description:
Be Amazing. And while you're at it, have some amazing cocktails at Chambers Eat + Drink.

This was the second year in a row where I came here for some holiday party and the service is always attentive and on-point. Among their signature cocktails, I like the "vodka drink" here which is essentially a basil gimlet I guess but they are tasty and deceivingly helpful for cocktail conversations. I also enjoyed the "bramble" - a Bombay Sapphire gin concoction with blackberries and mint. It is a refreshing cocktail that is well mixed and not too sweet at all. 

But the atmosphere is where Chambers excels. The poolside area is a nice place to chill if it's not too cold out. If it is, the "Be Amazing" room is a cosy space to have a drink at the bar or lounge on the sofas. After all, it's always a nice reminder to Be Amazing! Cheers to 2013.
author: Jon L.

description:
1 star for ambiance.
1 star for... moral support?

Came here on a Sunday late morning and was seated outside on the patio with no wait. The situation outside is quite interesting, with Chambers' outside patio nestled right next to the very Americana pool area of neighboring motel, it almost gave me the sense of eating in LA or in an old-time hollywood movie. Inside the music was comfortable with the right amount of jazz.

Service was polite, but not very attentive (we were given desserts without new sets of clean utensils). 

Food, oh the food gets one star at best.
I ordered the Eggs Royale (eggs sous vide with mandarin hollandaise on a bed of crispy hash browns and creme fraiche, with trout and caviar garnish). First things first, the hashbrowns were stale. One bite in and I was consumed by the taste of stale oil. The lil coated my tongue with a sticky film and left a terrible aftertaste. The two eggs sous vide proved to be runny, but I wasn't supplied with any form of carbs to soak up the delicious egg yolks. (Hashbrown to eggs ratio was intensely off-balanced). The trout and caviar were good. But rather standard and boring. All the components of this dish were either cold or lukewarm. Definitely a do-not-order.

Chambers really likes its Asian fusion. I could not get down the list without seeing some sort of asian ingredient randomly thrown into a traditionally Western dish, which is totally fine, given that it had to be done correctly. I only tried a bit of the pork belly, and that was well cooked, tender, though slightly on the sweeter side. Usually in Asian cooking we refrain from cooking the thick pork belly fats so long that it loses its texture, because it ends up with the texture of pudding and nobody wants fat pudding in their food.

The souffle pancake were horrendous. First of all, it was undercooked. Second, they added way too much egg. The centers were gooey, reminiscent of the insides of an omelette (which souffles definitely should NOT look like), and tasted like an overly watered down omelette (which souffles should NOT taste like either). The outer edges were neither soft nor crunchy. Caramel vanilla ice cream and sauteed apples on top were adequate, nothing too exciting. Raspberry bourbon sauce on the side lacked in depth.

Would not visit again. I rarely leave a meal feeling cheated, and I did today with Chambers.
author: Chia L.

description:
Entering this restaurant, you are transported to a different word and time. Between the mind blowing collection of full record albums and a unique decor, this place set itself apart from most others. Attached to a boutique cool retro motel is Chambers set inside a black brick building. The staff was very friendly and chatted with us about our hometown of San Diego. 

Ambiance: 5/5 - very unique and catches the eye
Staff - 5/5 - friendly and attentive
Menu - 4/5 - vegan and meat options, but it could have included more options for starters. 
Food - 4/5 - excellent unique flavors and presentations, I feel content, but not full after eating.
Cost - $$$ - a meal for 2 cost about $120

Overall - 4/5, but since I plan on heading back again, it gets bumped up to a 5/5

*Keep in mind that gratuity is sometime added in, even for a table of 2. We nearly double tipped beyond the included 20%.
author: Nick M.

description:
This place is actually really amazing. Try their liver pate if you want your brains blown. 

All of their cocktails were concocted with surgeon like precision and expertise - a flavor smorgasbord for your senses. 

Oh, and try the steak if you want to orgasm in public. Enjoy!
author: Shawn H.

description: Amazing brunch spot where the service is always friendly and fast. The Egg Royale is one of the best dishes on the menu!!! The French toast is also a delicious option but takes about 30 minutes to prepare. Overall great vibe and people.
author: Christi Y.

description:
I have never been here before, but then when I arrived, I realized that I had been in this area before. I had no idea that THIS was the Tenderloin ... one of the most raved about Viet sandwich places is just around the corner.

Anyway, having ... experienced this place during the day, it was no surprise that I found myself far more outmatched by the sheer amount of random people stopping me on the street at night and hearing the words "Drugs" over and over again when passing other peoples' conversations. I don't know how people dress and doll up to come here because I was feeling mucho overdressed.

However, once inside, it was a nice, warm atmosphere that greeted me at Chambers. The staff was friendly enough and we moved ourselves back to the lounge area because our dinner guests were still dining. The lounge has a nice sign that says "be amazing". There was an outdoor area with pool, etc. but for some reason it was closed later on at night when it became unbearably warm inside the lounge.

Overall, anytime after 12:00am this place is a cluster, you will wait at least 25+ minutes to try to get the attention of a bartender to get a drink because they're so busy and it's almost impossible to get through. But before that ... it was nice. Come early or prepare to be very, very aggressive!
author: Lorrie M.

description: You would never know from the outside what a gem this is! Great food, service and ambiance. Highly recommend!
author: Ed C.

description:
There's a reason why this place has become such a hotspot.

I came here for dinner and drinks with my friend Michael who was visiting from Germany, and was impressed overall. Yes, it's in the Tenderloin, but once you're inside, it's a whole other world. The decor was gorgeous, the lighting perfectly dim, and it has a great loungey feel. 

The signature cocktails were strong but still delicious. I definitely recommend the bramble and the something something coupe (can't remember the name, just look for coupe).

The food was amazing! We opted for small plates instead of getting the entrees, and I'm so glad we did! I would totally recommend everything I tried! Here we go:

Chicken liver pate - very light, creamy, served with a poached quail egg on top. Yummy. Michael's favorite.

Truffle dip - I love truffle anything, dips, potato chips. Add them all together = winner!

Grit fries - breaded and fried grits served with aioli...soooooo creamy and tasty!

Sizzling Kobe tri-tip - a small piece of Kobe beef sliced thin and served rare on a hot rock...with the option of letting it cook longer if you wanted. I took a piece and seared each side for like 2 seconds and it was absolutely perfect! The dipping sauce was also good but the Kobe was already so flavorful that I didn't really need it.

Fuyu persimmon - sliced persimmon served with burrata, drizzled with olive oil and sea salt...delicious! I wish I had known to put this together when I had fifty persimmons back in the fall...

As the sign in the lounge area says, BE AMAZING...and that's what Chambers did! Definitely coming back!
author: Tanya P.

description:
Chambers is in a strange rundown Florida-inspired hotel. There is no name on the door, just an intricate key on the side. When you open the wooden door, you enter a dimly lit, vinyl-filled haven. If I were judging Chambers solely on presentation, it gets 5 stars.

The restaurant didn't look busy from the outside, but there were no tables left at 7PM on a Friday, so my friend and I sat at the bar. As per usual, we asked for the sweetest/fruitiest cocktail and the bartender recommended Number 13, which was a fizzy and unmemorable drink. We ordered a few small bites to accompany our drinks. All the food is presented gorgeously and creatively, and I guess that's how they justify a price markup on otherwise mediocre food.

- Truffle Ricotta ($13): Don't miss the mushrooms hiding under the block of ricotta! 

- Smoking Pork Belly ($14): The 5 slices of pork belly came on a mini grill with a bed of smoldering wood chips; this presentation made me feel Very Important. I liked how the pork belly balanced with the pickled peppers/kimchee "salad."

- Tator Tots ($9): Have you seen rectangular tator tots stacked in a pyramid and sprinkled with bacon dust, to be dipped in a pork remoulade (to be mixed with some kind of powder cheese)? If you haven't, you should order this just so you can take photos and make all your Instagram followers jealous. This was my favorite part of the meal.

The actual flavors here are nothing extraordinary, but Chambers understands the importance of a first impression. I would very much enjoy seeing pictures of this place in a magazine and imagining the food rather than actually paying the steep prices to eat it.
author: Jessica F.

description:
Refreshing Mojitos in a Pilsner glass..
Served by tall, fresh, and delicious bartenders.

Plush tufted leather seating, 
Mood/accent lighting, 
Upscale Rock & Roll nostalgia 
Mellow, Low-key Lounge

Dressed up, or dressed down.
Alone or accompanied.
Yum.
author: Ty T.

description:
we were a party of 7 for brunch on January 18th. 
We did not have reservations but were literally there when they opened. They tried to put us outside and we declined (weird location with hotel pool).
So, they suggested to break our party into 2 tables. Okay fine.
But here is a deal.
they seated a party of 4 at a larger table that could have fit us all.
they also sat us at 2 tables nowhere near each other and put people that were just coming in with reservations at tables in between. it would have been no biggie to put us close together and other folks at other tables. 
not a good hostess
The inside of the restaurant is very cool, old records, very trendy. Very nice.
Music was playing, but it was christmas music. not kidding. mid January.
Food was pretty good. Not incredible, but solid.
author: Nataliya C.

description:
This place deserves zero stars.  They were arrogant assholes to say the least. We waited 45 minutes for a table and they gave it to someone who walked in because they were hotel guests who "deserved VIP treatment", as they said.  The couple seated admitted they were NOT hotel guests.  Instead of apologizing for their oversight, the manager and hostesses continued to tell us it was our fault and to wait another hour. Their customer service and mere people skills were horrendous.  It is people like this that taint this beautiful city. 
TLDR;
Please do not eat here or support this terrible management. 
I'm sure their food and decor is amazing but you are selling a piece of your soul to the devil by associating with these people.
author: Nayra G.

description:
This place is a bit of an odd duck. An upscale place serving brunch/dinner in a pretty downscale neighborhood. Although, there are a few other well known brunch places nearby, so maybe it's not that odd.

The decor is fascinating. Think rare books library + contemporary art museum + low rent motel. The back windows overlook the pool of the attached hotel, which it's hard for me to imagine anyone uses but it is an item of interest.

We went for brunch, which was pretty innovative and featured some more deconstructed items. The chef here definitely does not feel constrained by convention. I had the hangover hash, which comes with pastrami, potatoes, and eggs, and it was definitely both good and inventive. The pickled vegetables alongside were a little too vinegary for my taste but I see what they were going for. The Challah toast was pretty darn delicious, and came with some homemade pear compote which was fresh and excellent.

They do have bottomless mimosas on Saturday for brunch as well, if that's of interest to you.

Overall, an interesting place to check out but the neighborhood is a bit of a deterrent. I wouldn't rush to go at night, but during the day it was fine.
author: Brent W.

description:
Love that they have a vegan brunch option!  Brunch is hard for a veg gal!  Highly recommend the tofu hash. 

Good service, great vibe and bottomless mimosas on Saturday. Definitely something for everyone!
author: Kayla W.

description: Love this place. A few movies have been filmed at the bar. Food was very good however a bit pricey. Ambiance is great for a date or night out with friends. Nice place to get dressed up if you're feeling it or dress down if you want to chill. Dance floor/bar at the back area. Will I come back? Absolutely!
author: Miguel Y.

description:
Delicious. Ate outside for brunch on a Saturday. Wasn't terribly packed, really pleasant patio area.
Tried the French Toast and the Coffee Cake, both were top notch. Need to go back more often.
author: Cody H.

description:
5 stars for service alone. I took my "manfriend" here for his graduation dinner with a group of friends. My reservation was a little late, but whatever, it was Friday night after all, they were very busy and they have two bars that we hung out at while we waited. When we were seated, only about 10 minutes later, we were greeted by our server who was fabulous and he took our orders very quickly. Shortly after that, another couple of friends decided to join us last minute, oops! No biggie tho, the staff didn't sweat it and were all happy to accommodate us to a bigger table and we were set... Sweet! We got our small plates fast and they brought our food out at just the right time. Everything was very well presented, music was just right and the ambiance at this place is different, in a good way. 
I do have to minus one star for the dinner. It was alright, not worth the price IMO, and my table agreed that our tapas were so much better than our actual meals. Would I come back? Of course, maybe next time just for the yummy small plates, drinks or dessert.
author: Nora M.

description:
Except for the reclusive entrance, everything feels good.

The duck wings under small bites and duck breast on large bites tasted quite savory.
author: Wenxuan Y.

description:
We had our latest dinner club at Chambers which is an awesome place even if you just wanted to stop by for a drink.  They have a bar area in the front and a huge space in the back where there is a DJ.  We sat at a table in between the bars but right next to tons of vinyl records which were fun to look at.  Our service was excellent and our waitress Rebecca did an amazing job describing details of the menu.

We started with some drinks and I had the spicy cucumber which had the right amount of spice and was really tasty.  My wife had the earl grey coupe which was really good too.  For our meal, we shared the sizzling kobe tri-tip (a must have) and the yellowtail ceviche to start.  For our main meal my wife had the lamb shank and it was massive but had an awesome flavor.  I had the duck breast and cleaned my plate.

This place is great but expect it to be a bit pricey.  Also, try and see if you can get a seat away from the door as we had to ask to get it closed multiple times.  They were very polite about doing that but with so many people coming in and out it was hard to keep it closed the entire time.
author: Blake B.

description:
pretty solid spot! have been here for brunch with the ladies, and then drinks last night. super happening all around.  

the first time i came here, i decided to walk from soma, which was NOT a great idea because the walk is kinda super seedy and i wasnt sure if i'd actually make it to brunch.  but! the food is delicious! we were here maybe 6-8 months ago and we stillll talk about the french toast.  great service, too, and you can sit outside on the patio on a sunny day and just gossip for hours.  the pool and cabana area is also really cute!

later at night, it kinda turns into a restaurant club, if that makes sense.  i was dropped off, and there was a bouncer and people standing outside smoking.  TOTALLY different from the brunch scene.  then i went inside and the place was dark and there were people dancing to the music. and the crowd is pretty diverse.  

i'd definitely come here for often if i could walk...
author: Christina L.

description: Good food, nice atmosphere, there is a poppin bar in the back. Although, I would say this restaurant is a $$$, not a $$.
author: William S.

description: What a find!  We will definitely be back.  The food was creative and yummy, be sure to try the persimmon salad.  Very cool atmosphere and deco, checkout the fireplace...really unique.  I'm booking the fireplace table next time.  Service was fun, positive and genuine.  Thank you Chambers for such a nice night!
author: Debra E.

description:
Lovely decor.  Super swank.  Love the "Be Amazing" sign.

Quality of the food doesn't match the high prices.
I ordered the:
- truffle dip with waffle fries
- brussel leaves - soft and buttery (not crispy like i was hoping for, but delicious nonetheless)
- smoking pork belly - interesting kim chee side
- chamber's burger
- salade lyonnaise - bitter tasting, small, way too pricey

Drinks are lovely though - I greatly enjoyed Drink #12, the spicy cucumber.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Nice decir and ambiance and I really wanted to like their food,  nothing was outstanding. 

Service is ok. We asked for a dessert and a candle for a birthday celebration. The waiter brought out a gelato that was really inedible and said they were out of candles. Two minutes later we saw another waisted taking a dessert with a candle on it to another table. I probably would no be back to this place
author: Teresa B.

description:
Hidden from the ghetto of Little Saigon, Chambers Eat + Drink is a surprise for many first unsuspecting first comers to the wonders of trendy food and drinks in the heart of the Tenderloin. It is not a guaranteed known spot, even for some of the most seasoned visitors / locals in the hood. The most important thing is this place is worth a visit for all sorts of occasions.

Inside the place is dimly lit, intimate, and a perfect spot for a casual date. It's comfy, lounge worthy, and versatile enough to serve as a place to quench one's alcoholic thirst or satisfy some hunger pangs. It is far cry from anything else remotely close in the hood and like eyes that can finally see light, it does take a blink or two to adjust in here. Once acclimated, there is almost always a sexy vibe in here.

I've done more happy hours at CE+D and their signature ($10) cocktails are killer. The Pisco Punch seems to be pretty popular. I love Pisco as it is, but when combined with a little lime, lemon, and honey liquer, this drink becomes its own little glass of epic. Cinnamon bitters, ginger beer, lime and rum make up my other favorite, the Cusco, which is sweet and incredibly potent. Their drink menu is enough for all palates, but is most importantly well made.

The dinner options are pricey, but that's to be expected at a place like this. While I'm a fan of the bar bites (truffle dip and chicken liver pate anyone?), the rest of the menu is a collection of small plates and entrees. Out of the "big bites" I am a fan of the pancetta wrapped chicken roulade, which is succulent and savory and roughly $19 in change. If one decides its tapa time, shoot for the crab croquettes ($12) and smoking hamachi ($15). While many folks are intrigued with the foie gras torchon ($14) and and kobe beef tips ($14), I find them to be semi-pricey relative to portion size.

In the end, Chambers Eat + Drink is a really solid venue featuring a wide array of drinks and bites, and the perfect place for a group mingle session or a cuddle worthy date. And being situated in the Tenderloin gives it the kind of charm that many establishments in SF simply don't have.
author: Jando S.

description: Cool atmosphere, worst bloody-mary ever. When i asked for some hot sauce to give drink some life, the waitress said ok and brought me 6 slices of jalapeno.?! Friend ordered egg-in-the-hole, bread tasted fried with oil not butter. The menu is not for those with a hangover looking to find their fill, it's a try-hard menu where the breakfast items come with salad.
author: Colleen S.

description: Omg... Considering I've only been here once not too long ago, I already know this restaurant is one of my favorite restaurants to go to. I got a medium rare burger and added pork belly to it and an egg... It was amazing. And the servers are so nice. I was a bit skeptical considering where the restaurant is but it's definitely not what I expected.
author: Marvin A.

description:
Our server was fabulous. Sassy, super fun and perfect for a table of four ladies who wanted the full meal deal. Environment + great food + lots and lots of wine. My lady taxi driver on the way over let me know that this used to be "THE" Sunday spot in SF, celebs and locals minglin' like they just don't care. Now it's this dark, romantical joint with records jammed in the bookcases and funky art. 

The burger was pretty damn good but we also enjoyed the tator tots (bacon dust people!), smoked grit fries and the brussels sprouts. Get all of those sides. Just do it. They were fanschmastic. The gwen avocado was good too -- though less remarkable than I wanted. It's not a place I'll actively seek out in the wide world of SF food... just because I always want new outrageous experiences. But if someone invites me to go, well, I wont be mad either.
author: Kelly S.

description: Chambers has a very hip, but retro vibe. The decor is interesting and the staff was very friendly. I would not go back however, it was over crowded and so loud. You can't hear the person sitting next to you. Also, the drinks are subpar. We had the green tea vodka drink. It was so bad I couldn't even finish mine (I always finish my drinks!) We opted for moscow mules the second round and they redeemed the bar to an extra star.
author: Lauren A.

description:
I recently visited this establishment to celebrate with a group of 11 people. In order to book a table for our large group I was required to discuss the event with the event coordinator Chrissie.  We had finally agreed upon a time and date for the event. The day prior she texted to confirm for 9 people rather than 11 and then proceeded to tell me that to accommodate for 11, she would have to sit us at 3 separate tables and at 15 minute intervals to help offset the pressure placed on the kitchen. I felt that she acted in an unprofessional manner and we ended up suffering for her mistake. I wanted to cancel our reservation, but could not as we were 1 day from the event and it would be very difficult to find another restaurant to accommodate us. I do not feel that this place is good for large groups. 

When we arrived at the restaurant, I was prepared to be disappointed. However, we had an excellent waiter (Marcus) who was very kind and attentive. In addition, the food and drinks were very good. The pork belly and burger were great. 

Overall, I would rate our experience with 3 stars.
author: Radha C.

description:
So the old Buddah Bar has some new diggs/names/plates eh?  Chambers is delightful.  The decor is homey for a trendy hipster San Franciscan, with vinyl records lining it's walls and artwork of epic proportions adorning it's fireplace and hallways.  The "69" pool adds a touch of, dare I say class, to this already down and dirty location surrounded by the crack-addicts of the trendy-loin. DO NOT let that deter you.

Small plates are a good way to start your meal, but from what I've tasted I'd recommend skipping the small bites and head right to the big daddies of the night.  The waffle chip, truffle dip is a easy pass as the way to salty twice baked Ruffles adorn a plate of sour cream "truffle" dip served in a container making it hard to actually dip the chips. Eating the Crab Croquette was the saving grace as we watched the sizzling Kobe trip-tip smoke on top of a heated rock.  Nice touch, but I expected a masseuse to begin walking on my back while Enya played in the background.  Music was great though and eased you into the fun-times-with-friends mood.

Overall the space is great.  Just get inside otherwise you'll quickly second-guess your dining decision and safety.  Make sure to grab a drink as they were the highlights of the night and walk around the pool while feeling important at the fire-lit waterfall table.  You'll know what I mean when you see it.

3.5 stars.
author: Kevin J.

description: So far so good, trendy clean hella, cute drinks & goodpool but where's  the food spots? there's only Tai or bars well not to bad I want to try the soul food spot around the corner
author: Chareffa K.

description:
Situated in the Tenderloin, this place is really a hidden gem amidst a plethora of crackheads and junkies, as others have already mentioned.

The ambiance here is unique - vinyl records surrounding all the walls and very swanky & chic atmosphere. The cocktail here list is solid, and with everything priced at $10 (or $8 during happy hour until 7PM), prices are reasonable.

Small plates here are also delicious and affordable. Great for sharing. I was really pleasantly surprised with their chicken liver pate. Melt-in-your-mouth goodness topped with a warm quail egg on top and crostini..mmm!

Great for small group outings, dates, or grabbing drinks!
author: Veronica S.

description:
We had our company holiday party at Chambers. The staff was extremely easy to work with from start to finish. From the very beginning, they went out of their way to communicate each step of the process and even helped arrange our red carpet and valet service. 
The food was top notch! I loved every item with the exception of the mascarpone filled strawberry dessert. It's not that it wasn't good, it just isn't my kind of dessert. My heart belongs to all things chocolate. The bartenders were on point and the drink offerings made the night. Great venue, food, and amazing staff. I give Chambers a BIG thumbs up!
author: Jenn G.

description:
I took the hubby and my pop here for a Father's Day brunch. So glad I did because this place did NOT disappoint!

Ambience is trendy, although a bit on the dark side. I could see how this place would be fun at night! Crowd is definitely a younger crowd. I say this place is less suitable for families (ie: my screaming yet adorable bundle of 10 month joy).

Now on to the food: we ordered several different dishes, all were AMAZEBALLS!  The hubby got the Hangover Hash. It came beautifully presented and it must have been good because he devoured it in under 5 minutes. My dad ordered the Eggs Royale, which looked delish because I enjoy anything that comes with smoked fish. I ordered a bunch of stuff, being the undercover fatty that I am. For starters, I had a side of pork belly hash (please don't tell the other Jews), a side of marble potato home fries and Spiced French Toast. OH EMM GEE. The french toast was melt in your mouth good. Like the kind of good where you have to keep in your moans as to not scare the other patrons good. The pork belly was fresh and perfectly made. The potatoes were just aiight. We all also ordered fresh squeezed orange juice. I love a place that offers fresh squeezed juices. Juices from concentrate just don't cut it. Yes, I am a juice snob. 

Anyway, after licking my plate clean, I felt satisfied. When the bill came, I was pleasantly surprised that it was all reasonable priced. 

So moral of the story: if you want a cool spot for brunch that'll give you mouth-gasms... and a place that is easy to make reservations, Chambers is your go to spot. Just make sure not to drop your baby's pacifier on nasty, pee drenched Eddy Street :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
Man there are some UPTIGHT dudes at this bar who wouldn't give me their underwear. Clearly no one knows to help a girl out with her bachelorette party checklist.

Other than the "young professionals" that frequent Chambers, all was decent- good drinks, and nice outside area.
author: Tess M.

description:
From the looks on the outside you would think that you are about to enter a side door of a broken down motel in the tenderloin with 2 cars in the parking lot only to be wowed when you walk though the doors 

the restaurant was packed bar was crowded. 
interior of the place was great for our dinner date night, dark with lit candles on every table and walls full of records. definitely unique.

Service was a little slow but friendly.

started with chicken liver pate it was okay I believe they can do better.
tequila drink was awesome. 
rye drink not as awesome.

had the duck breast was PERFECTLY cooked juicy and pink. served with some greens and some kind of vegetable puree. very well balanced dish, I was extremely happy with it. 

my girlfriend had the burger with pork belly she said it was a bit salty and was average. 

for desert we had the caramelized apple it was excellent came out warm flaky not too sweet, Ice cream was delicious perfect mixture between flavor sweetness and milk/cream.

we both agreed we will be returning soon.
author: Zzzzzz Z.

description:
Hastings student review:

Students of UC Hastings --- please STOP going to Soluna for every happy hour and START coming to Chambers. Chambers has everything Soluna lacks--friendly bartenders, places to sit/stand, OUTDOOR space. Let's do ourselves a favor at stop buying overpriced drinks in cramped quarters, and buy equally overpriced drinks in a much better space. Only one block more to walk and so worth it.
author: Kate P.

description:
I love the ambience of this place! The interior is retro meets modern decor. Service was amazing. The waitress had a really friendly aura and was very helpful with recommendations. Even though it was extremely busy, she didn't seem to forget  us and came by occasionally to check up on our table. This place as 3 full bars (outside poolside, lounge area, and resturante area).

Food:
*Sizzling Kobe tri tip- The kobe trip tip came out on a sizzling stone! Its hands-on and you flip it around until you find it perfect. Very fun! Cool presentation!
*Smoking hamachi- Also hands-on. It came out on a small fire-wood chip box. It was a really nice display and the hamachi sashimi pieces were thick and buttery soft. Love love love!!
*Chamber burger- Burger was delish, but nothing spectacular. Maybe it was because i ordered it without the shaved avocados and/or crispy braised pork belly.

Once done with dinner, you can walk over to the lounge area to enjoy the loud music, people watch, and take in a glass or two of wines. I really enjoyed it here and would totally come back!

BE AMAZING!!!
author: Christine H.

description:
This place is a lil odd! 
In front is a Restaurant and in the back is a bar and lounge. They tried to make it pretty fancy upscale I guess?? FAIL

We ordered a bunch of appetizers and FAIL they had these French fries made out of grits, some odd dip with knock off ruffles potato chips, I forgot what else we got but I will say the hamburger was very good! 

We went up front to order the food and this blonde chick was very rude, the bartenders were very friendly but lacked some knowledge on how a few popular drinks are made... Who doesn't know what a Adios mother F is????
author: Kevin B.

description:
No dogs allowed... on the patio?! 
This is after we were directed to the outdoor section through the inside. Idiot manager.
author: Michaela O.

description:
Simply superb brunch today.  The staff were wonderful and very personable.  The food was as close to perfect as one could hope for.  Simple, yet elegant and fresh, well prepared and presented.  This is such a lovely hidden gem that I almost want to give one star to keep people from coming here.  But I can't do that.  Besides, from what I have heard it is already quite well-known.  I will most definitely be coming back here, much sooner than later.

It's kind of like finding a diamond in the muck.
author: Scott A.

description:
Chambers--Finally, a douchebag restaurant for the rest of us!™

Alternative title: We Bought a Restaurant Zoo

(No Yelp, I don't want to write a 5000 word essay discussing about how I and fellow Yelp Elite members Susie J. and Tommy D. were coming from a craaazy bike-based farmer's market near the Twitter office)
author: Sean K.

description:
Overall review: 4 Stars (Brunch only)

Ambiance: clean and peaceful. No drunk rowdy people ruining your dining experience 

Parking: street parking available and should be easy to find within walking distance.

Reservations: easy to make! 

Drinks: House Bloody Mary with vodka. Recommended 

Food:
- Eggs Royale: slightly salty for me, but a very good dish. highly recommend if you like that salty, crunchy yet chewy texture
- Pork Belly: salty yet delicious. I was addicted to the seasoning and I wiped my plate clean
- Souffle Pancake: i am not a sweets person but this was pleasantly delicious. the icecream on top of it really makes it
- Biscuits and Gravy (side): pretty standard. it comes with two biscuits and they're pretty big, so don't be fooled by it being a "side"
author: Bee H.

description:
I don't know what to do with this place...I really don't. 

My friend suggested we come here for a happy hour, which was fine by me. As stated in one of my lists...I'm a bit alcoholic. =)

I approached this place hesitantly. First, I parked my car around the corner and was a touch concerned. Not for someone breaking in, but just terrible drivers in general. Second, I saw on the website that it was part of the Phoenix Motel (hotel?) and I don't remember a bar here. Umm...no signage. Just walk to the giant wooden doors near the corner of Eddy and Larkin and pull. There's a giant key on the upper left hand side.

We got drinks, and they were hit/miss. The girl who manned the bar in the front made WEAK drinks. The girl in the back made STRONG drinks. I was confused. Not opposed to the girl in the back though...

There's an outdoor eating/drinking area where we spent most of our time. The outside was cool, a bunch of outside tables, a cabana, and a pool area. Very welcoming. The inside seemed a bit intimate, and I really don't want to drink in an intimate setting with hotel rooms within stumbling distance. Just sayin'

The food was meh. The wild mushroom/truffle chips were hard to eat. I kind of wish they chopped up the mushrooms and mixed it with the aioli, but there were just chunks. It made for tough eating. The chicken patte was pretty good, but a little too loose for me. I like it a bit firmer...
author: Lily W.

description: An absolutely lovely restaurant!  Delicious food and a fun, friendly staff.  We had a terrific birthday brunch there and will definitely be back!
author: Eric M.

description:
Don't judge a book by its cover. Before coming to Chambers, I knew it was situated in a hotel. My girlfriends and I had the most difficult time finding this place. I had my iPhone out, the little blue dot said we were here, but WHERE IS THE DOOR?! By looking at our confused faces, a man standing next to an unmarked door asked what we were looking for. We responded "uh... Chambers...?" Of course he responds with "well come right in." 

Once you enter, you are transported to another world. The swanky decor makes you feel so fancy, but not uncomfortable where you feel out of place. The drinks here are so well made you will need some strong willpower not to order their whole menu. The food here is also delicious. The portions are small and it didn't fill me up, but every bite you take is just as good as the first. Definitely a place to check out.
author: Cindy A.

description:
Food and drink are all ok. Happy hour is a decent value.

Cool atmosphere offsets the pretty slow service we experienced most recently here.

I also wish they would open up the outside area for diners. I'm not clear if it's actually off limits and really for hotel guests, but the two times I've been here seemed like there were events going on.
author: Sam R.

description:
"It feels like we're in a DiSaronno ad!" - David, homie for life

Indeedy, this places oozes in the cool kind of suite chic sort of style. But don't worry, if you're coming in with street clothes (like I did one time), you're still welcome in this trendy little spot. Careful when looking for this spot. The building isn't quite marked on the outside, but as long as you see the little pool/outdoor lounge area, you'll be good.

This place may initially look small inside, but just keep walking. You'll find yourself in the lounge area very soon. Plenty of seating in here as well. There's also a nice influx of people here, but it's never crowded. A very comfortable place indeed. You'll initially be struck by the lit up "BE AMAZING" letters right behind the bar. I gather that if you have enough cocktails, you shall indeed "be amazing" (or something else on the other end of the spectrum, but that's outside the scope of this positive review).

The drinks? Awesome! All of your standard cocktail joint drinks can be found here. From the most girly girl (I admit it, mojito's are one of my favs) to the gentlemen's drinks (rusty nail, anyone?), they got em here. They also have a good selection of house specialties, so be sure to give those a try. One of the bartenders made me a experimental drink with rum and cilantro. Twas off the hook, to be sure. No disappointment when it comes to libations here.

Next time I come, I gotta try the eats here as they sounds really good. All in all, I like this place a lot. If you ever wondered what it was like to be in a DiSaronno ad, all stylish where even the greatest of fails becomes the largest of victories, hit up Chambers!
author: Eric A.

description: I had my birthday dinner here, we were sat by a great host. He asked if we were there for any special occasion and I told him it was my Birthday. Excited for me he told me that it was his birthday and wished us a great meal. That didn't happen. After walking in and taking in the great atmosphere and host there was nothing else positive about my experience. Our server was late for her shift and awkward, as well as absent most of the time. We had to ask someone to find her when we ran out of drinks. The food although tasty, was overpriced for tiny portions. I ordered the steak and got two tiny pieces maybe equal to 4 oz. but I doubt it. For 30 dollars I expect a meal and I got a snack. My friend ordered Gnocchi and got about 6. They advertise the plates for sharing I would advise against it. I never heard mention of my birthday until leaving, when the host wished me a happy birthday again. He was the only redeeming quality of the service that night.
author: David A.

description: Place doesn't look like its pictures. Terrible service (mean bartenders and waiters with attitude). Place is connected to the Phoenix Hotel, but there's no indications what belongs to the hotel and to Chamber. We mistakingly sat three times in areas we thought were part of the restaurant, but were basically shouted at by the staff to move. If this is such an issue why aren't there signs or better verbal directions??? Will never come back to this place again, especially since it's in the heart of the Tenderloin and not near any other decent watering holes.
author: Anthony D.

description:
Almost everyone I talk to about Chambers says 'I wish I could live there.' I think what they mean is that they wish an interior designer would come to their home and re-make it to look like this stylish retro meets hipster bar, because I seriously doubt that anyone would actually want to live in this pretty skeevy neighborhood in the Tenderloin. In any case, once you walk in the doors you're in for a visual treat, with lots of glam 70s looking leather seating and light fixtures and quirky details hiding in every corner. On a warm night it's great to bring your drinks to the pool area of the Phoenix hotel, where you'll find more of the retro-chic aesthetic (if you've been to the Ace in Palm Springs you might know what I'm talking about). 

I was there for an event sponsored by a liquor company but on a normal night you can expect the bartenders to make your favorite trendy concoction or a classic drink if that's what you fancy. It's a great, unexpected place to find such a stylish lounge but if you're out there late you might want to consider taking a cab home!
author: Christina P.

description: Should be open right now-but the doors are locked. Terrible signage, couldn't figure out the front entrance. Giving 1 star because if I drive out of my way to visit your place-you better be open when you say your open. Crummy example for this hotel chain. Normally they are much better.
author: BK T.

description: Great food, horrible service. It's one of those situations when you have a group of 6 or more, your tip is expected. Our server was lazy and rude. We wasted 2 hours waiting around for her.
author: Nikki P.

description:
A friend reserved some tables for a bday party. We popped a ton of champagne bottles and ate a bunch of cupcakes. Turns out to be a pretty epic night.

The bar area is fairly small and getting a table just enhances the experience so much more. But walk down the ramp and there's a ton more space to hang out by the restaurant-y part. They even have an outdoor area with fire pits (huge plus!)

Since all we drank was champagne, I'll save my last start for the next time I come back and try out their supposed good cocktails.

In the meantime... BE AMAZING!
author: Katie D.

description:
It has literally only been 3-4 hours since I left this place and I'm writing this review, because it deserves THAT much attention ASAP. the food was DELICIOUS beyond words. I don't remember the last time I've been to a restaurant with perfectly cooked, seasoned, tasting foods. My friend and I went to this restaurant after looking at reviews and from the beginning our experience was nothing short of awesome. The atmosphere was fancy BUT not too fancy where everyone is pompous and douche-ey with attitude. Everything was clean and nicely decorated and best of all REAL VINYL RECORDS stacked on the walls all around the place. How awesome is that?!?!?! We didn't have a reservation (didn't know it's only reservation based), but were still seated within 20 minutes!

AS far as food goes, I didn't even mind the price because it was THAT GOOD. We ordered the grit fries, the bread and ricotta, the tri tip steak (all three of which are "small bites") and the duck main dish. FANTASTIC is the only way to describe it.

Everything was perfectly seasoned and cooked JUST THE WAY IT SHOULD BE. crispy on the outside but juicy and soft on the inside. Nothing was too overwhelming with flavor, but at the same time not bland either. We also had two glasses of wine each, which was also well paired with the foods we ate.

If you want to avoid the snooty attitudes and the overwhelming burden on your wallets, then this is a  MUST TRY FINE DINING place. Service is awesome and nice, ambience is great, nothing bad whatsoever.
author: Hannah K.

description:
If there's one person who can keep me indefinitely drunk for the remaining years of my life, it's probably James at Chambers.  I don't trust easily and last time I entrusted someone to surprise me with a mixed drink, it had been spiked with Fireball and that's seriously grounds for being defriended on Facebook.  So when I opted to have James create a drink based on a very ambiguous description of what I typically like, I had my doubts because I have absurdly high standards for cocktails.  The opposite happened and I honestly don't think I could have crafted a more perfect cocktail for myself. 

Upon first impression, it seemed like a high-profile bar and I noticed the brightly lit "Be Amazing" sign paired with the leather couches, so at first I was like, fuck me, the night's going to be long.  However, when we finally got to know our bartender a little bit, I discovered that he is a psychic, ingenious bastard.  I could sing gospel of his unnamed cocktails.  Whereas my partner likes his drinks to be on the side of tasting like pure tar extract and then put hot on a grill, I prefer my drinks to be not at all smoky, savory, or ashy.  Somehow, he was able to mix drinks that seemed to fit our personalities to a T.  

We didn't order any food so I can't speak for that but I would highly suggest coming here for a few drinks.  I was already a few drinks in before I had anything to drink at Chambers, so my only regret is that I didn't have the alcohol capacity to hold any more drinks.  Another downside was the music.  It sounded like the worst type of dubstep music you've ever heard but played backwards.  I wanted to throw all sharp objects I could find at the DJ.

I left feeling thoroughly impressed.  I'm disheartened that James does not live in Seattle.  Although I'm not horribly against blackmail and extortion to get my way.  His talents alone compensates for the shitty crowd this bar attracts.  They were either old business professionals, young entrepreneurs who are anything but alpha and are a misnomer with no home outside of getting shafted by their peers and knit-your-own-cat kits, and desperate party-goers.  Tread with caution.
author: Whitney B.

description: Whenever I find a friend who hasn't been to Chambers I have to take them. Great vintage set up but the service is always just , ok. I believe Patrick was our saving grace, along with the sweet host. Also, on the menu they have Schramsberg, Rosè for $15 a glass. Sure two of those, then we realize it was poured from a black-ish bottle, not the beautiful gold bottle. It ended up being Schramsbergs, lower tier, Mirabelle. I just felt it was a bit misleading and on the menu it should say, Mirabelle, especially for $15 a glass.
author: April H.

description:
Love the ambiance here. Very nicely decorated.

The service could have been a lot better!!

We were seated by the door with the wind blowing which was not comfortable. 
The food was so so.  Mimosas weren't as good and didn't seem to have much alcohol in them :)
Overall I would say night time is best for Chambers.
author: Kimia R.

description:
Chambers is the one and only awesome watering hole + eatery in the Tenderloin. As such, it is sometimes sketchy to get over here, but if you're brave enough it's worth it. 

The drinks are amazing, and my favorite part is that it is semi-connected to a motel with a pool...makes for a great outdoor poolside seating atmosphere! As for food, I just tried their brunch and it was awesome, definitely go for the Pork Belly. Dinner-wise I always lean towards the burger: the waiters will tell you it's one of the best burgers in the city (as well as the most affordable entree here :) At night this place is more of a club atmosphere with DJs and a dancing area, but from what I can tell it's never too crowded or claustrophobic and has a pretty classy vibe.

And if you're looking for just one piece of advice to takeaway, go for the Earl Grey/egg white cocktail whenever they have it: it's amazing.
author: Danielle B.

description: I was so disappointed in Chambers last night. I've gone many times for brunch and dinner in the past and have always liked them.  I love the ambiance and food is always different and exciting... but last night we went for a birthday dinner and decided to go with the 3-course pre fixe menu with the wine "pairings"....the reason for the two stars is we expected a wine/champagne pairing with each dish...instead they brought out a wine "tasting", literally about three conservative sips each glass, tops....this put a huge damper on the meal, as every restaurant I've ever been to in the past a pairing meant a full glass of whatever....it was kind of a joke that they did not clarify this to us....had we known we would have ordered from the regular drink and food menu....I tried to laugh it off but after a $300 bill it was disappointing, to say the least.
author: Brian S.

description:
Came here for a goodbye party for our friend Eric B.

The last time i was here, this place was called Bambuddah Lounge. This place is way different than I remember, but for the better!

Tater Tots - these are more like a cross between hash browns and tater tots in the sense that they are about finger length, perfectly browned with a nice texture that was crispy with nice coarse shavings mixed with some softer potato bits.  It comes with pork remoulade and bacon dust. I felt the bacon dust was more gimmicky than anything, since there was plenty of porky salty flavor. The remoulade by the way was freaking awesome; creamy, sweat salty smokey. We shoulda asked for more of this. Had this come with eggs, it would be a nice bacon eggs and hash reimagined.

Smoking Pork Belly - they treat the belly well. One of the things i noticed first about the taste was that it was very clean. It's kind of hard to describe the "clean" vs "dirty" tastes of pork belly, but i guess the best way to describe it is it wasn't ultra gamey. It had a nice crunch on the skin layer, and the fat wasn't overwhelming, while the meat was juicy and tender. The kimchee was different; not spicy at all, but more sweet and red peppery. A good classic acidic balance for the fattiness of the pork. 

Sizzling Kobe Tri Tip - a perfectly rare side dish that comes sizzling on the plate. Good quality grade and marbling, with just enough salt to accentuate the flavor. Ultra tenderness and the reduction was good if you wanted to have an earthier addition to the dish, which was a good change up. The pickled veggies were a good palate cleanser, especially since this dish is fatty but delicious. While this was kind of redundant of our other app, it still was good and worth getting, and you honestly can't go wrong with either

Smoked Grit Fries - Grits! Its not just for breakfast!  This reminded me of fried polenta. The grits were nice and firm, similar to polenta. The tomato aioli went really well with this and actually made me think of polenta, and provided a nice change of perspective as far as how other foods can be analogous when executed a certain way. The BBQ spice added a layer of sweet/smoky.

Truffle Ricotta - without the truffle this dish is just ok. I am naturally biased against ricotta. I am also not to much of a fan of focaccia outside of the olive oil/red wine vinegar, or toasted like a pizza variety. The focaccia was lightly warmed, and airy, and the ricotta also didn't have to much flavor. Add the truffle and wild mushrooms and you get something that was a nice and light dish. 

Chambers Burger with Pork Belly - this was a solid burger of high quality. They use a challah bun, which I think has become my favorite bun for burgers since its nice and eggy, and absorbs a lot of the juices. The meat is of great quality and they cooked it a perfect medium rare. The cheese was very melty, and the smokiness from the onion brought out a deeper flavor of the cheese and made it feel almost like a BBQ burger but not really. The pork belly is the same as whats in the appetizer, and I honestly could have gone without this.
author: Marc T.

description:
100% surprised at the ambience of this exquisite gem in the TL.
Used to be ???....but now New ownership and completely transformed into a swank New York-ish vibe.  Outdoor area with fire tables and a pool.  Kinda old school Las Vegas-Palm Springs-New York!!!
Great service and drinks....beautiful!
author: Scott T.

description:
Once you've set foot into this well decorated "chic" lit room, you may be a bit confused over where you arrived too. This place is the "biz-nees"
for a lack of better words.

Inside the heart of the "Hotel Phoenix" rest the vagabound-ish hotel lounge 
and restaurant you can recognize your somewhere special.

"Chambers" delivers yes, it does despite Curiosity, it delivers in a sexy way.
 If this place was to choose an identity by the styling of a movie persona,
or even a Director as a hang out, 

I would think this place tries to take a spin on the idea 
of "Los Angeles" if the place was directored and designed by "Wes Anderson"

(DIRECTOR of Rushmore and Fantastic Mr. Fox, Moonrise Kingdom etc)

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wes_Anderson

Think 1960s-1970s Las vegas, lady in the water-ish swagged out 
low-key style to the predictable, unpredictable fanfare,
complete company would include bearded men, 
clean cut James bond aficionado's 
and indie rockers who know bands you've never heard of.

The Appetizers: 

Spinach Salad - It's beautiful, delicious, and just right for a summer night.
Crab croquette  runs about $12 - roe aioli, friseé, baby fennel, meyer lemon, dill
                                                            
Drinks - What to Order:

They Had a drink called the "Bramble" - I honestly forget, what was it it.
It had a but of lime. Honestly I was hypnotized by the "Be Amazing" sign
dangling right about the bar.

And the "Primms" drink gin, lemon, mint, cucumber
it was refreshing, fans of the gin and tonic would love this.

I forget to tell you what you already know...
this place doubles as a spot for celebrates and unknown rockstars,
Funny, I've seen Keran Culkan, http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0001085/
and I didn't realize who he was until I was done, secretly making fun of how much he looked like the guy from "Scott pilgram" lol.

My only complaint was the dj there. who didn't take request. 
But i can't blame him. not everybody likes to here "PRINCE'S PURLE RAIN" smh!

Next time, I'll come for food, Dinner....Well scoping out the collection of records.
author: Michael R.

description:
Came for brunch with the BF's family on a Sunday. I've only come for drinks before so I was delighted to see how bright the restaurant was so early in the day. We were seated outside by the pool. The BF's parents thought it was funny to see people swimming by the pool with their dog and commented on the hip "kung-fu hip hop" music playing as being very artsy. 

The menu appeared simple at first glance, but upon reading the descriptions you could tell each entree was an adventure in itself. For instance my BF and his dad ordered the Eggs Royale which came with sous vide eggs, smoked trout and caviar! That doesn't even really begin to describe the dish, but really!? I give props to any place that will sous vide their eggs. I had the French Toast which came in the perfect portion and had the best bourbon glaze to pair with the fruit compote. SO GOOD!

Also, our waiter Marcus was incredible. He was very accommodating, especially through our many french press coffee refills and especially when we let him know the cream wasn't looking good. 

Definitely coming back for mo brunch. Glad I made a reservation through Yelp, we got there upon opening and could see the place immediately filling up.
author: Darline D.

description:
UGh, another one of those places that like to pretend that are super popular. We got here at 11pm, and were forced to wait in line until 11:30pm bc it was "so crowded" inside. The bouncer said it was "one out, one in". However, at 11:30pm, he just started letting everyone in...and lo and behold, it's FAR from crowded. There was plennnnty of room to stand and sit.

In the back is a restaurant where you can sit and order food.

No dance floor.
author: Margaret R.

description: I don't think I've ever experienced worse service at a restaurant. We went for bottomless and a poolside brunch but had to ask for a refill every time. If you want to drink 8 glasses of orange juice this is your spot but if you want to have a few glasses of mimosas with your friends AVOID! I didn't even eat half my food because the quinoa salad was so overdressed I should have asked for a spoon. NEVER going back. If you want to be ignored by the wait staff, eat mediocre food, and drink oj with a splash of champagne then this is perfect for you. Everyone else....you can do so much better.
author: Christa N.

description:
Chambers is hot hot hot!  Hot, literally, figuratively, & aesthetically!  This place is gorgeous, packed, and has a diverse and pretty people crowd.  Bf & my friends that have been here when it was Bambuddha said the place looks so much better & different now. My belated birthday celebration almost didn't happen here but so glad that it did!  It was a little frustrating after calling three times & talking to two or three different people to find out that after I made it explicit that my party of thirteen plus was just going to have drinks and not eat, so I was wondering if it would be possible to reserve a table solely for that.  The first person I talked to assured me it was.  But then as the day got closer I got two reservation confirmation calls stating dinner reservations, so I called back & the girl told me that she found out from a manager that table reservations were only for dinner.  I called back after a little bit & asked to speak to a manager, luckily Isabelle was a manager & she answered the phone.  She reassured me that everything will be alright & that I will have a table for the next night.  

When I walked in with a couple friends & my bf, the hostess got Isabelle right away after seeing my reservation & she showed me around asking me what table/area I'd prefer.  We decided on a big table by the walkway which across was the door to the pool outside.  While the back lounge area is absolutely *AMAZING* (if you've been here you get it), it was way too crowded & stuffy.  While we were waiting for the table to clear up she told us to go to the bar & got us 4 drinks on the house.  I enjoyed my Pisco Punch though I asked for it to be a little more on the sweeter than the sour side.  Just like Chambers, Pisco is so hot right now!  

One handful of friends that came in a little after us said that they tried to get in through the lounge exit but the bouncer said that they were at capacity & that some people were even trying to slip him some money.  Just go through the front restaurant entrance & you'll have no problem getting in.

As the night went on we kept seeing yummy food pass by us & luckily my friends that came later on indulged in some food, so I got to try some tasty truffle fries.  I did underestimate how many people would show up, so next time lounge couch for sure!  Did I go on an off night because, yes I know it's the TL, but I didn't really see any shady people on the streets!  Loved Chambers, will be back to eat & drink again.  This place is poppin but when I left around 1ish the lounge cleared out pretty drastically.
author: Cat C.

description:
Came here for a quick drink (or 3..) with some friends and was pleasantly surprised. Despite having to walk through a sea of crack heads which I have grown a custom to living in SF it was all in all a great night.

The bar was pretty full with lots of thirsty folks, but the bartenders got around to us pretty quickly. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Megan S.

description:
Parking is a b*tch! But when is parking in SF ever easy? I really wish they opened up the hotel parking lot to the restaurant patrons but I get it.

I've been here for brunch, dinner, and nighttime. Every single time, I've had a great time. Mimosas are delish and never stop coming. Drinks are easy to get. Oh, did I mention they have HH until 7?
author: Victoria Y.

description: This place is reallly trendy. We sat at a table with an entire shelf full of records behind us. It should probably say $$$ rather than $$. My friends and I got some great burgers.
author: Hannah R.

description: This is not a review of the food and drink which are fine although a little pricey. This is a review of their seating policy. We arrived at 5:00 PM with a hungry and thirsty party of 5 and were told we could not be seated at any of 100% empty tables unless we were "dining." Repeat: all of the tables were empty and there was no one else asking for one. There were only about 3-4 other patrons in the entire place and they were seated at the main bar which only has about a half-dozen seats total. We explained that we would be ordering several appetizers and bar snacks and that we would be out of there in about an hour but it was "no go" for Chambers. I just don't understand turning people away under those circumstances. We gladly took our business elsewhere where they were happy to seat us and serve us food and drink and take our money.
author: Lou S.

description:
Came here because I once again. overslept and missed getting to Brenda's Soul Food breakfast without having to wait two hours.

BUT!! I ended up coming here to this yummy place around the corner. Yay for food adventures!

The building itself looks a little sketchy and dark but we went inside and it has pretty cute decor and best of all. no wait! 

The menu and ambiance reminded me of the Table in willow glen. The menu looks like it changes pretty often as well based on whats in season, but thats just my guess.

I ordered the eggs benedict with smoked salmon and mimosaaaaaaaaa of course.
They also have grapefruit mimosa, strawberry and a bunch of other flavors but I say if it ain't broke don't fix it. classic mimosa is good enough for me. 

Okay again. I have this bad habit of freaking out with food comes out and I'm like wtf. I am definitely not going to be full. For the price I expect to be full. (It was about 13-14 for my eggs benedict) BUT those two little things filled me up real quick. I like heavy foods and I always forget that I don't need as much to be full.

Will definitely be back! But I still need to try out Brendas! ARGHHH!
author: Rachel C.

description: Loved it. Space is all warm and cozy. Food was excellent. Burger awesome. Drinks awesome. Out particular bar tender has a PhD in mezcal, so I was ordering some killer off menu mezcalisciousness.
author: Bib G.

description: Chambers is one of our all time favorites. Innovative and tasty, from cocktails, bar bites, small plates, all the way to big plates. We are always too full to try the dessert. The deco and ambiance are awesome! Lots of characters.
author: Julia H.

description:
Came here for a brunch on a Saturday at 12PM. I made a reservation because weekend brunches in SF always seem to involve hourlong waits. 

The interior is awesome. You know how all the girls on your news feed have Instagrammed that "Be Amazing" sign? Yep, that's this place. 

Began my brunch with a seasonal cherry mimosa. Stick with regular orange juice - for some reason, it tasted like straight champagne. There wasn't any cherry flavor.
