Also, you can't begin an order of bottomless mimosas at the bar and then move them over to your table. Wait until you're actually seated to get a round of bottomless mimosas going. 

I split the spiced french toast and eggs royale with my friend. Both were delicious! I've never had smoked trout before and was anticipating a very strong fishy flavor, but that wasn't the case at all. As for the french toast, it was sweet and filling without being overwhelming. What I really wanted was the souffle pancake, but I was so hungry that I didn't think I could wait that long for it to be prepared...
author: Anna N.

description:
Much like my affinity with any of the Ace Hotels littered throughout this great nation of ours (well, I suppose they're only in Portland, Palm Springs, and NY to my knowledge...), I'd happily pay a handsome booty to have the interior designers responsible for pimping out Chambers come to my apartment and outfit my pad in exactly the same fashion. Everything about this place just oozes cool. From the mismatched vintage furniture to the rows of old-school vinyl that dots its marrow, it's gotta be one of the hippest rooms in the entire city. 

This space used to be BackFlip and Bambuddha back in the day, and while I didn't spend too much time enjoying either of the previous iterations of this space, I can confidently say that Chambers Eat + Drink trumps the three in vibe, taste, and thirst. Vibe-wise, again, you're dining in one of the most modish rooms in the city, complete with attractive patrons and servers, and great music streaming throughout the concourse. On the food tip, I have yet to have anything short of exceptional. The seafood salad starter is a light and refreshing way to tip off the meal, the lobster ravioli is house made and perfect for satisfying your craving for carbs, and the seared tuna with asparagus, morels, and olive oil mashed potatoes is equally remarkable to boot. 

For those who view quantity as the signifier of a quality meal... you may be a bit disappointed, as most of the entrees are fairly small. However, I'm more of the mindset that I don't need a dump truck full of food have a good time, so the portions are perfectly suited to how I'm accustomed to dining. Just enough to leave fulfilled, with emphasis on great taste and imaginative fare. Could you really ask for anything better? 

The service tends to be somewhat slow at times, but it's never without a knowledgeable smile. The staff is great at answering questions about food/wine pairings, and they're quick to suggest house favorites on the mixed cocktail side of things as well. Most definitely worth bookmarking as a new hot date spot, or even just a swanky weekend hang for you and a group of friends.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
What a great find!

I would def give this place more than 5 stars.

Great great food! and great drinks. We went for brunch and got 2 diff types of mimosas, beer, the burger, hangover hash and pancake souffle.

AAAHHH can;t wait to come back!
author: P D.

description: The music is hypnotizing and the burger is delicious. Don't be afraid of the patê on the dessert menu. It's rich and a little more on the dark side of the spectrum but very tasty.
author: Audrey F.

description:
I left saying hmm that wasn't terrible. Then I walked back home through the tenderloin. So yes there were many things I shouldn't done that night but checking out Chambers wasn't one of them
.
Located in a hotel you would miss the bar and dancefloor part of this area if you weren't looking for it. Its also located in the middle of the tenderloin so you better be looking for it and not just wandering around this area. Anyone that lives down here you know your way around and you know the loin isn't that bad but all places can be bad when you are drunk and its 1am so watch your wallet and purse.

There was a line to get in but once it I was pleasantly surprised by the inside. There were a couple bars in the small establishment as well as a dj booth and some vip areas that were hosting various birthday parties and celebrations. I came with a large group of about ten people after spending some time dancing at Swig and wanting to keep the night going. 

The place is well let and the music was really good. It was a mix of top 40 dance and hip hop and techno. I danced with the various people I came with and most of the parties there danced in their own groups on the dancefloor which is positioned oddly in the middle of the place. So you literally walk into the dance floor when you enter the door. Get to dancing or gtfo out. I like that in my dance bars. The drinks were decent but nothing to write home about.

Put it this way. If I had to go out in the tenderloin for some reason and I couldn't make it to Polk, or union square or market or soma or mission or northbeach. Then I would totally check out chambers. If I had any other option I wouldn't. I hope that make sense. Silly drinks and dancing to be had. Location is try at your own risk.
author: Nick R.

description:
Not a regular in the neighborhood and took some convincing to get hubby out here...only because it was still early and the sun was still out.  

Got parking right outside and walked in through the backdoor.  Appear to a private event but it was only for half of the place.  We walked toward to the front and got the chaise seats across from the fireplace - quite comfy.

Our waiter, Pablo, was nice and helpful.  Cocktails were $10 each.  No drafts, all bottles so hubby opted on cocktails too.

Hubby started with #9  whiskey drink - old overholt rye, benedictine, araku, peychauds bitter.  It tasted mostly like whiskey - served martini style.  #2 bramble - tanqueray, lemon, sugar, leopolds blackberry, mint.  Hubby liked this better.

I started with #8 pisco punch - pisco, lemon, lime, american honey liquer, pineaple juice, galliano - it was ok.  #7 - cusco, aged brugal rum, lime, ginger beer, cinnamon bitters.  Tasted mostly ginger beer.

Shared some small plates:

smoking salmon - $14 - salmon caviar, yuzu sake crème fraiche, chive oil.  smoked salmon rolled above a mini grill w/ smoke for flavor only.  It was more fun to look than to eat.

sea salad - $13 - hirame sashimi, cucumber, seaweed, radicchio, daikon, popcorn shoots, smoky vin, puffed rice.  Not bad. 

sizzling kobe tri-tip - $14 - summer vegetable salad, mushroom brandy reduction.  SUPER yummy.  If you like your beef medium rare, remove the tri-tip for the hot stone right away...or you'll end up with medium or well steak.  Sauce is good but skip it and enjoy the essence of good beef.

Love the ambiance.  The fireplace was a nice touch.  Very cool and interesting light fixtures.  The albums decor is great - sure take you back seeing some of the covers.  Music is mostly classic rock but a Dionne Warwick tune was in the mix...

Good times - look forward to returning.
author: Gloria H.

description:
It's Saturday night.

No specialty cocktails after 11pm on weekends...wtf?!

Bar bites menu says 11pm-1am but when we tried to order at 12:30am, the bartender told us the kitchen was closed. 

Bathrooms were filthy and unkept.
author: Q C.

description:
As I stepped out of my Lyft (S/O to my driver Moe!) I felt a little scared because I had no idea where I was and the Phoenix hotel looked straight up like a scene from a crazy epic party movie turned scary movie. 

I had two options:

a. Moe - take me somewhere else

b. Let's do it.

The answer was quite simple, a great reviews requires risk. B was the only answer. 

Rewind: Don't get me wrong, The Phoenix hotel got their image on point and it was actually freakin awesome!

Post-dinner, I walked around the poolside area of the hotel. They have a cool Cabana nearby, which served as the perfect reenactment to an epic movie once again.

Anyway, back to Chambers.

Vinyl dressed walls, cool furniture, cool server, cool bar area with "Be Amazing" bedazzled behind the bar. 

+1 Attached to an awesomely unique hotel
+1 Decor - unique, rock n roll, a different, fun eating experience
+1 Food - also unique (see below for further deets)
+1 Awesome bar area and good drinks

Food:
Kobe Tri Tip: Comes out on a sizzling stone so you can cook to your preference
Tater tots: Not your typical tots and comes with an amazeball cheese, bacon and pork dipping sauce - need I say more?
Ceviche: I believe it was yellow tail, cucumber shavings, mango transported on plantain  chip vessels

Keep in mind the portions are small sharing portions

Happy Hour was from 4-7 I believe. 

Would definitely come back because of the ambiance/decor
author: Ashley C.

description:
Impressed with the modern and yet, retro interior, Chambers Eat + Drink, is surely a site for the eyes. The space is filled with comfortable lounge areas indoor as well as outdoor. Inside, Chambers, it has a 2 full bars and is also accompanied with a DJ on some nights. Outside, one can check out the glowing, blue pool which provides a great social scene.

The menu is not extensive however the dishes are aimed to please. I tried the smoking salmon- fresh and points for creative presentation. The garlic polenta fries were also definitely worth trying. Though, Chamber Eat + Drink offers more of an ambiance than a filling meal, its worth checking out! (#SFgem)
author: C M.

description: A little over priced and over classed up for what you get. The meal was tasty enough but not outstanding. Felt like it was lacking in portion size and full flavor.
author: Kylie T.

description:
I probably give out too many 5 stars but part of the 5th star here is a reward for successfully dodging the hyper-dermic needles, erratically driven shopping carts and the occasional mumbling junkie.  This place is in the 'LOIN and boy is it great. 

While I am not a huge C.S. Lewis fan, I imagine walking into the Chambers hotel "eat + drink" is akin to the first step out of the wardrobe and into Narnia.  Literally you are leaving the grungy, dirty, charming-in-it's-own-felonious-way Tenderloin and into an amazing world which could only be named SWANK.  Hundreds of vinyl records line book shelves, ridiculously cool lighting swoops over you like curious birds and the staff breathes an air of mellowness and confidence that can only come from the fact that they know they have figured out how to make a great restaurant.  One expects John Travolta to pop out, swipe two fingers across his eyes and bring you a cocktail or Quentin Tarantino to push the button on your e-cigarette.  This place is cool.

The cocktails are wonderful...just strong enough to know that you had one but not so overpowering that ordering another one doesn't require a second thought.  I had brunch and every bite I had was amazing.  Eggs were offered either Sous Vide or Softly Scrambled just to remind you that the chef is one step ahead of you here.  The Hangover Hash was ridiculous...a perfect pre-cursor to that second drink.

Oh..wait! Has it been 30 minutes??  Because guess what?? There is a pool outside dead center of a re-vamped No-tell Motel which fits perfectly.  This is a far cry from a fancy infinity pool with private cabanas one might see in Cabo or South Beach.  On the contrary, this pool probably once had 6 inches of dirty water in it with floating yellow duckies bobbing helplessly.  But it's been redone perfectly...a perfect Oasis on Eddy street where  you can relax and remember why you are in San Francisco...(I have no idea if you can swim by the way...never crossed my mind.)

In summary...GO!  I haven't been for dinner yet but it's at the top of my list and I bet it's even better....

C.R.
author: Chim R.

description:
I made reservations on a Wednesday night and expected the place to be pretty vacant, however, to my surprise, the place was actually quite packed.  

I went with a party of six and we were seated immediately.  Our table had candles and we were placed right next to a sea of records.  The interior and ambiance were awesome, and they had really good folk music softly playing in the background.

The food was actually really good - we literally ordered at least one of EVERYTHING on the menu, but the truffle ricotta really stood out for me.  Normally places just add synthetic truffle oil, but we had a generous amount of truffle shavings on the top and the flavors melded very well with our drinks.  Speaking of drinks, their drink menu was pretty darn sweet.  I recommend the spicy cucumber drink and the whiskey drink - the former was refreshing while the latter had a great whiskey burn. :)

Overall, 5-stars as the food was great, prices were reasonable, ambiance was nice and service was very attentive/friendly.
author: Kathy F.

description:
Dinner At chambers tonight for a friends birthday. 

Arrived at 7pm , ordered drinks and dinner 
Took like 1 hour to get out appetizer - they also forgot some of the drinks .... 30 minutes later comes dinner.... The another 30 minutes for dessert and the of course the bill. 

The service was incredibly slow. Service was mediocre.  The servers didnt come in to check in and ask how the food was and the food for some of the party was just "meh".

The pricing is a bit over priced for the actually quality and taste of the food. I ordered the 35 steak that came with the steak alone so I had to order sides. For the price I rather would have gone to a steak house to get the better quality and service. 

All three people that got duck said it tasted like a high end costco hot dog....meow??? 

Bread.... The server didnt  bread with 12 people at the table. Bread was requested... But they bring only a plate enough for half the table placing the bread at the end of one table... Wtf? Really???? So we asked again and they brought another plate of bread to the other side of the table.  For a table with 12 people the bread got devoured immediately. 

Overall, would I come here again? No thanks.  Food sucked and so did service. Long wait. 

Considering our bill was 640$$ I expect more from a place like chambers.

* the place inside is nice though... Nothing you'd expect from tenderloin *
author: Suzie B.

description:
Let's start with the pros. The ambiance is nice - big booths in the front, lots of unreserved seating in the back. A bar in the front and back. Outdoor area with fire pit and a couple cabanas. And they serve food until late. I think this is a good place to come if you want somewhere to eat and drink, but don't want to go to a sports bar or pub. It's a lounge that offers nicer food (not your typical bar food). DJ the night I was there was alright.

The one big con: They really hold up the line outside. We had a group that came at separate times. When we got there around 10p, there was already about 15-20 people waiting in line. Luckily we were able to join our friends toward the front, but we still had to wait at least 10 minutes. And when we got inside, it wasn't crowded. More friends got there later and ended up at the back of the line, and they waited for at least half an hour before they finally got in - and it still wasn't that crowded! So yeah... our group wasn't too happy about that.

I'll probably be back, but I'll definitely arrive before 10:30.
author: Andrea L.

description:
This is a great place to take some friends out or even a date. Its trendy but not too upscale. I took a girl here for dinner and we totally had sex after.

Food here was great, service was great as well, and their cocktail selection is excellent.  

I ordered the tri tip steak and it was cooked to perfection. 

Keep in mind the portions here are pretty small so you should definitely get an appetizer with your entree.
author: Kong P.

description: The food was fantastic!  But unfortunately the service was up to par with the food they serve.  Worst service ever!
author: Daniel M.

description:
The ambiance, AMbiance, AMBIANCE!!!! Super cute, classy, modern, classic place to definitely have a girls night out or a romantic dinner. Me and a girlfriend was greatest at the door by a bouncer who checks your id and opens the door to another world. A world where your eyes draw to the beautiful chandeliers and walls filled with old album covers. We waited for our table in the bar area, we went to check out the other side where the chambers sign is located but there was a private party, so we couldn't go through, that's ok though an addition to excuses for me to come again. They specialize in cocktails, however the bartender that made our drinks was not very warm or inviting, more like he didn't want to make our drinks or hated his job but I'll let that pass, as the rest of the night was great. Finally got seated, ordered another drink finished up our topic of gossip at that moment, then went over the menu. We ordered a lot of small bites, the waitress asked us if we wanted to order more as the regular menu was going to end and late night menu was going to start. We looked at the entree section and decided to just keep to small plates then asked to take a look at the late night menu to see if anything was not on there that we wanted to order from the reg menu while we still could but the late night menu still offered most of the small plates and sides. The waitress was attentive, very nice and informative of drinks and food. She came to check on us now and then and didn't rush our hour and a half of eating, drinking and catching up. I definitely am coming back with the bf so he can experience chambers.

As for the food:
Chicken liver pâté - The quail egg is to be mixed before smearing it on the crostini. Livery flavor but taste good that when the crostini were done I continued to eat it off the spoon.

Sizzling Kobe tri-tip - This was great, just make sure you dip it in the sauce and top it with the pickled veggies. What makes it great is not the food itself but the presentation, comes still cooking on a stone. If you like your meat more on the rare side make sure to eat it right when it gets to your table, or it cooks to medium.

Smoking pork belly - Just as the Kobe, presentation is what made this dish. Found myself making my bites with more kimchee to belly ratio, as the belly was a bit salty.

Creamy polenta - This dish was opposite of the Kobe and pork belly, no fancy presentation but delicious. The polenta itself was creamy and flavorful but adding a piece of the tempura'd maitake mushrooms to the bite brought it to a new level. My favorite dish of the night.

Smoked grit fries - Too gritty and flavorless even after dunking and drenching it into the sauce. This was the only dish that was not finished off. 

Out of the 5 dishes, will for sure order the pâté, Kobe and polenta again..
author: Candice B.

description: Hipster ambiance. Had a lot of fun and experimental dishes. Would come back here in the future with more friends.
author: Sophia N.

description: The shareable food here is amazing. We had the octopus, beet salad, butternut squash soup and pork belly. Excellently prepared and delicious.  Our waitress wasn't as versed with the cocktails and we had to send one back or this would have been five stars.
author: bil w.

description: Was supposed to go to another restaurant but decided to come here instead because of the brunch sign right outside. It is in the sketchy part of the hood but don't let that discourage you. Had the pork belly and it was good. Loved the decor as well. This place is also good to hangout at with friends if you want to grab a drink and just chill.
author: Eunice M.

description:
Tiny portions, mediocre service, cool ambience, and good food

I came here for a New Year's Eve dinner with the family. I was immediately impressed with the ambience. However, once I got the menu I became less impressed. The menu was limited but I was excited to try the Smoking Pork Belly and the Sizzling Kobe Tri-Tip. Once we got the food the portions were TINY. The food was good but overpriced. 

Service wasn't great either... I left hungry and unimpressed. Would not recommend
author: Danielle B.

description: Such an Oasis in the tenderloin. Great brunch option for large groups. We enjoyed the outdoor seating, food and service. Almost perfect.
author: Fay F.

description:
For the decor, the price is extremely reasonable. I love the atmosphere - slightly hipsterish with a cool retro swimming pool outside. Also the record-lined wall is a great way to pass time browsing through while waiting for food. 

We went for lunch so I had the Pork Belly which is amazing! Decadent, rich, and perfectly flavored. Whats even better is the yukon potato that came with the dish, drenched in this spicy sweet Korean sauce. I hate fusion normally but this won me over 100%. Oh did I mention it came with perfectly soft boiled egg that had easily separated yolk & white? Amazing..

We came here because we got too scared of the line next  door at Brenda's French Soul Food. I went back to Brenda's again couple days later and can honestly say that brunch here is as good, if not better, then Brenda's. Must try!
author: Ashley Z.

description:
This review is for dinner/cocktail hour:

I've been meaning to try out Chambers for a while now. I made reservations at 8pm and hopped on the bus down to meet my date. The neighborhood is so sketch, that I told him I'd wait for him inside. I sat at the bar and grabbed one of their (numbered) drinks and once my friend arrived was seated at a nice cozy booth. We decided to share 2 small plates and a 3rd large plate. I scrolled Yelp really quick to see what other reviewers had suggested in terms of food. We chose the smoking salmon which was amazingly awesome and presented quite nicely, the PB&LT aka Pork Belly/ Lettuce/Tomato. Both were really good. The 3rd dish was the fish which was prepared perfectly. For dessert I just had to have the carrot cake. I'm a huge carrot cake person. To my dismay, it came out like a deconstructed carrot cake, almost like a carrot cake brownie. Sigh. Not so great. 

I suggested coming here to try out their drinks, grab some bites and lounge around. Service was a little mixed. Our waitress was busy so didn't come by as often as we'd like and did disappear at times. Come in a group or with someone else. Don't stumble out of here by yourself. It's scary out there.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Vegas experience in SF. I used to go when it was Bambuddah lounge. I still don't get it : Do they ever use the pool? Is it a hotel? Staff isn't particularly nice and food seems expensive. It's totally pretty and trendy. And different for SF.
author: Andrew K.

description: Love this place. The atmosphere is amazing. You can easily talk while at the same time have a Friday night feeling. The food is excellent. My favorite probably the pork and chicken. The burata and tomatoes was only thing that was a little disappointing as I expected proper burata and it didn´t tast much. But all in all easily one of my favorite places in SF.
author: Hanna A.

description: Ok so the restaurant itself is so adorable - super retro hipster. Our waitress was fantastic - super sweet and helpful BUTTT the only thing that deters me from giving it four stars is that they were out of practically everything on the brunch menu, even though we got here around noon. And then we came to find out they only have bottomless mimosas on Sat, which is what we came for, but on a Sun! Thennn, the waitress listed off about 4 different mimosa flavors and every time we would pick a flavor - she would come back to tell us it was out until we finally settled for plain ol' orange. I ordered a pancake that just looked like a giant fluffy biscuit instead and I didn't enjoy it much but everyone else at my table seemed to thoroughly enjoy their meal. Ooh but their biscuits actually were great.
author: Tania S.

description:
I've been to Chambers twice. The first time was a magical experience that I wish I could live over and over again. The burger was too die for- the patty was thick and juicy and the fries were seasoned to perfection! It was easily my favorite burger in the city. and the ambiance is realllllllly cool, too. walls and shelves full of records. dark lighting. felt like a little gem tucked in the tenderloin.

the second time i went (this past weekend), it wasn't as good. The service was okay- the girl was really snotty and couldn't seem to smile if it saved her life. The burger seemed to changed- from the patty all the way to the bun. It lacked flavor. The patty was thinner and the bun felt like a straight up sara lee hamburger bun. It was still good...just not amazing like i remembered. I was underwhelmed.

The most disappointing thing though were the tater tots. When i order tots, i want classic small tots i can just throw in my mouth. These were more like potato bricks. Imagine a smaller thicker hashbrown. that's what these "tots" are. So if you're expecting tots when you order those......don't!

siiiiiiiigh. Whats a girl gotta do around here to get some tots?
author: Angeline V.

description: We had brunch here on a Sunday. The pool party was just gearing up. The restaurant has a young happy vibe, with a nice mix of gay/straight/fun people.  It feels more LA than San Francisco, but can be forgiven for that because the food was really good. My companion had the hash, which he ranked among his favorite breakfast items, ever.
author: Morris R.

description:
One of the coolest, hippest bar I've been to in a long time.  If I were a celeb I'd go here.  It's a little dark and has that swanky rock royalty vibe.  Surprisingly the bartenders where friendly, which is rare in California.

Nice music by house DJ.

Came here with my brother and we vowed to come back after we are famous!
author: William W.

description: I write this sitting on the toilet. I will be here for a while. Went to Chambers yesterday ad had the chicken entre. It came out looking pinkish but I assumed that a place as expensive as this would know how to cook chicken. I have not felt this bad in a while. The decor was amazing so I can not give one star but, given that I am taking the day off work to work through my diarrhea, two stars is all I can give.
author: Vadim O.

description:
I have been here several times, almost always in the weekdays and quite late. The staff is very friendly and relaxed but still professional, food and cocktail is great and the interiour is really well planned. I can recommend the olives for tapas.

The athmosphere is a little bit more mature than other places and the crowd aswell. This is a great place for your last destination if you are a bunch of friends that wants a place where you can actually talk with each other but still have something nice to eat and drink.
author: Pauline M.

description:
Love this place! The atmosphere and decor is fantastic. It's low light with warm colors and a loungy, sexy vibe. 

I've been here a few times - equally good for cocktails and munchies or a full dinner. Their food is a bit experimental. Some of the items incorporate molecular gastronomy (like bacon "dust"). I sometimes find places that do this OVER do it and the food is more like a science experiment than a meal. Not true here - they add the correct amount of flair to make things interesting but keep dishes delicious.

I'll be back - you should go too!
author: Amber C.

description:
This place deserves a 5 but I'm giving it a 3. The chambers is Awesome on Saturdays and Fridays, however, the entire establishment is dictated by how good the dj is. 

On 4/6 nights, the dj sucks. More "artist" than dj. Stop playing your artsy shit and play shit that makes people dance. 

That's all I have to say. The women  are hot, the drinks are good, and the venue is legit. They just need to stop playing these artist djs, play what the audience wants.
author: Kenny C.

description:
This is for dinner. 4 Stars. Brunch is better. 

Great service.

chicken liver pâté with buttered leeks, quail egg, crostini-not bad. a little gamey, but they give you alot and this was super filling

tator tots pork remoulade, bacon dust -this was more like big potato pillows and the sauce with it was sooooooooo good. you can really taste the bacon

smoking pork belly early girl tomato kimchee, pickled sweet peppers, calabrese chili, scallion-the longer it sits on the grill, the more flavorful it gets. Super tender.

sizzling kobe tri-tip Pickled vegetables, mushroom brandy reduction-cook your meat on the hot stone, but don't over cook it. this was spot on! 

tai snapper chorizo, mussels, pearl onion, nante carrot, fennel, saffron aioli, rye, fumet, dill-this is a new dish. the flavors are all great, but my fish was just a little bit over cook.

dry aged rib eye steak sauce bordelaise, roasted garlic beef tallow-very over whelming. way too much butter and it didnt' melt

Giving it 5 stars because I came here for brunch with my girls for xmas. Food was great, but service was lagging. Our waitress was too busy talking to other people. I think it was the manager who helped us take all our pictures and she insisted that we go to the other side where the BE AMAZMING is to take our group pics. When you come here at night on a weekend, it is so packed that it's hard to get a pic of that sign. For us to take a bunch of pics there was awesome!!!! Made our day! =)
author: Karen H.

description:
the atmosphere is incredibly fun, with a cool vibe and fabulous food from Chef Trevor Ogden. We went for brunch & had an incredible Pork Belly dish and a few other dishes that were all fabulous. The cocktails were beautiful crafted, and the knowledgeable staff easily accommodated my gluten allergy. 
We'll be back for sure.
author: K.C. C.

description:
4.5 because its in the TL. 

My my, TL, how you've grown since I moved. 

Nice ambiance. Nice drinks. Open till 2am and close to school? Excellent. 

I am excited to go back and eat. 

I am also excited to go back and once again pretend I'm in the 70s.
author: Emily D.

description:
(4.33) ~ Very Good overall Food & Service!;)  NOTES:  It's a casual & laid-back atmosphere.  Located in the Hotel.

MY MENU:
** Pork Belly Brunch Dish = (4.5) Very Good!
** water(tap) = (4) very good...must be filtered;)
** Orange Juice = (4) very good...freshly squeezed too;)
** Coffee(french press) = (4) very good
author: Craig D.

description: Brunch was surprisingly good!  The walk there was a bit dicey so I probably wouldn't do that again. The eggs royale was really good and I sampled the biscuits and gravy which were also good.  The biscuits were herbed inside and the sauce had a nice kick.  Very unexpected but good.
author: Debbie L.

description:
Review is for dinner only!

Beautifully decorated restaurant with vintage furniture, sexy lighting, and old records lining the walls. The 2 full bars and plush leather couches are enticing enough to make me want to come back at night when this place turns into a lounge. The outdoor patio and pool area is a major plus! 

Onto the food:

-Kobe tri-tip: there was literally 4 pieces along with some pickled veggies. For the price, not worth it for 2 bites
-Hamachi ceviche: we asked that they hold the spice on this dish but that might have ruined it for us. The hamachi was overly sour; it needed something else to balance it out. Our bad. 
-strip steak: Our server hyped it up so much but it ended up being pretty ordinary. Not enough sides or veggies to fill us up. 

For the price and portion sizes we were not impressed. We were still moderately hungry after our $75 meal here, which is unacceptable. 2 stars for the overpriced subpar food but a bonus star for decor and service in this otherwise sketchy neighborhood. 

I must add the restroom here was one of the worst. It was literally a creepy dark closet with a toilet in it (everything was painted black and the lighting was extremely dim in there! I wonder what they are trying to hide?!). Avoid this at all costs if possible!!!
author: Vivian D.

description:
Amazing experience!
We came here on a tuesday night, so it wasnt as busy. The food was great, nothing very special, but it's satisfying enough.
Th cocktails, however, were amazing. They couldnt make the gin drink #5 because they run out of something, so we tried the other drink with gin, #2 i think, and the Kentucky Nail. Both were delish!
Even I, who is not a whiskey drinker, liked the Kentucky Nail
Service was very nice and friendly
author: Alan T.

description:
The food is really good. We had two excellent burgers. We liked our server. 

It took almost an hour from order to getting the food. It was brutal actually, at the point where if it didn't come within minutes it was gonna be time to go. 

One order at the table was lamb. It was so-so. A lot of meat inedible due to the fat:meat ratio. 

Also, as hotel guests there actually is no 15% discount. And you can't charge it to your room cause "they haven't worked that out yet." FYI.
author: Delilah B.

description:
Chambers is one of those places that you can take your guests without any hesitation. I actually found out this place after they told me the wait is 2 hours in Brenda's for brunch at 11am. It's just a block away from Brenda's, we got seated right away and the food was pretty good. I absolutely loved the decorations and how cosy this place is. 

Everything in their menu has an esthetics aspect and they seem to be spending some time preparing your plate. I would prefer Chamber's over Brenda's but would love to keep this place for myself so that I don't need to plan my Sunday brunch plans a week ahead of time. 

I tried Eggs Royal but heard anything that has eggs in it, is pretty good here. 

Interior: 5*
Service: 5*
Food: 4*  
Price for Value: 5*
author: Gokhan T.

description:
I go to school near Chambers and apparently pass by this place all the time... but never realized it was there until I went for my fellow Yelper's birthday last night.  

- Bar: Very cute.  Love the "BE AMAZING" sign in lights.  Didn't really plan on getting drunk, so ordered a mojito.  SO good and kind of strong too (although I'm a lightweight, so take that with a grain of salt).

- Ambiance: Cute and trendy.  I was definitely underdressed.  Next time I will wear heels.  There is a cute lounge in the front, and a huge balcony in the back. 

- Food:  Didn't get to try it, but it looked and smelled good!
author: Christine A.

description:
The perfect place to be on a Friday night!! Went exploring in the city with a friend and we ended up bar hopping- and what do you know, we ended up in the Tenderloin. Since Chambers has been in my bookmarks for ages, there was no excuse.

The inside was amazing! I felt like it was a mix of swanky, chic, and old school. It was very unique! From oversized chairs to vinyl records lining the wall... there was a lot to take in! Didn't get to wander into the back, but it looked a lot more intimate. Very disappointed I didn't get to see the pool area!

The cocktails list was interesting. We tried the Bramble, Cusco, Spicy Cucumber, and the Hibiscus. All were well done. THUMBS UP to the spicy cucumber! Who would have ever thought of that mix? So good. Drinks were strong and we walked around the rest of the city a bit buzzed.

I enjoyed just lounging around in the chairs and couches, and the waitresses didn't seem to mind if groups sat in reserved areas if the party wasn't here yet.

This is the place to be!!
author: Sally C.

description:
We came here for saturday brunch and it was super easy to get a reservation the night before. I loved loved loved this place. As soon as I walked in I totally forgot I was right in the middle of the Tenderloin. The inside is cozy, and very hipster. I loved the inside with books, comfortable sitting and a nice view to the pool of the hotel next door.

First things first, they have bottomless mimosas during brunch. This is to me the best part of brunch. And it actually makes more sense at this locale; you can pay $11 for one mimosa or $14 for bottomless. We also had coffee, which came in a french press; and was seriously delicious. Enough for two to share.

As for the food, it was great and tasty! I had the tofu dish with a side of poached eggs. Portions were decent and everything was super tasty. My brunch buddy had the french toast and also a side of eggs. I tasted the french toasts and it was also delicious.

This is one of the places where you can have a very different and interesting brunch and the menu has items that you will not find in other restaurants. the menu is very creative and combines many different ingredients and flavors that you may not find on a typical brunch menu. 

As for the price, it is not cheap, I think thus far this has been the most expensive brunch I've had in SF but was totally worth every penny, the coffee was amazing, the mimosas were tasty and servers kept coming often to refill our glasses and the food was again delicious. I will certainly come here again, but if price is an issue for you I would say there are places that (for brunch) are more affordable.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: They don't make any egg substitutions?!?! Wtf it's a breakfast menu!!!! Just shows the level of the chef. I live for poached eggs and they don't do it. CRAZY def won't be back, I'll stick with my daily Brenda's around the corner! ALWAYS delicious and accommodating
author: Brandon B.

description:
Ahhhh....setting foot into Chambers is like entering an oasis, it's truly a diamond in the rough, located inside the Phoenix Hotel in the heart of the 'loin.  I'd been wanting to try Chambers for some time, and the opportunity arose when we came in for a team dinner.  We sat outside near the pool in a tented area which was lovely.  The tent kept the wind away and there were overheard heaters. 

We were served family style so I was lucky to try several menu items including: tater tots (YUM), polenta with fried mushrooms, ricotta spread, the duck, swordfish, quinoa salad, veggies, panna cotta and crumb cake.  Nothing blew me away but was tasty enough and well-presented. Food-wise, I'd come back for the cocktails and tater tots alone.

The service is what really shone. We had multiple staff working our 15-person table and they were on top of things from start to finish, always with a smile.  It is on my list to come back for brunch and enjoy more of the outdoor space and awesome service!
author: Brianna M.

description:
Well well well! After dining at Chambers, I now officially feel like a local - this is a true diamond in the rough. Not a lot of hype yet, but I can feel it brewing. Your friends haven't heard of it either,  so go now so you can claim to be one of the discoverers (like I'm about to do)!

I found it on Yelp when looking for a place to eat that was equidistant from my house in Hayes Valley and my friend's hotel downtime. There really isn't a whole lot in that space (it's essentially one giant stretch of quasi-ghetto), so that's really the only reason we picked it.

As you traipse through sketchville, you'll stumble upon "The Phoenix" hotel which looks like the kind of old school motel where a Jack Kerouac character would wake up post-acid trip. Chambers is not particularly well marked, and the large, heavy door doesn't convince you that you've found a safe haven. 

HOWEVER - it's awesome in there. I still don't really get how they did it, but it's like swanky vintage. Mismatched couch benches, and shelves full of old records, paired with fancy chandeliers.

And the food! This is serious food - we got the marble potatoes (with almonds, snap peas, etc), and then some kind of spring vegetable salad to start, followed by seared tuna. Dessert was a beet + goat cheesecake. Cooked and prepared to perfection, and so pretty I was inspired to start taking pictures to accompany my yelp reviews for the first time.

I got home and my roommate told me he went to a birthday party there the previous night when it was in bar-mode. Though I'm still not totally amped about the area/walking around there at night, the place is definitely a rising star. Go now!
author: Joanne S.

description: One of the best, and I'd say somewhat hidden, brunch spots in the city. Well worth the trek to the Tenderloin!
author: Erin W.

description:
Move over HoS, Local Edition, JC, Harlot, Press Club, and on and on, I think there's a new player in town! If only this place was closer to the Financial then it would be over!!

There is nothing that I don't like about this place. It speaks a lot of the place when you see a couple of Giants players just chillen and drinking and not being bombarded by people trying to take pictures with them. The music is good the people are good and the atmosphere is just right. The drinks are a little pricey but it's the city, com'on! The decor of the place is really chic, looks like the new owners spent a pretty penny spicing the place up and they did a good job. The only thing that I wish they did was allow the people who visit the bar to swim in the pool, but I guess that's just asking for a lawsuit haha. I highly recommend to come after work, on a Friday night out, to grab a bite, to celebrate your birthday, whatever just come and you won't be disappointed.
author: Javier G.

description:
"Be Amazing" is a great slogan for this bar! My friend and I had a great time here just reading the drink menu. We both had simple drinks (vodka and a mixer) but the atmosphere and ambiance made the visit memorable. The bar itself is well appointed and it would be a great place for a large party.

The decor is awesome too! It has a slightly library-esque feel to it but not in the stuffy way.
author: Katie D.

description: Chambers is a great bar for a more trendy, slightly dressy night out in the city. The bar / restaurant extends over a large space. I like that you can go from a posh, crowded bar abuzz with energy on one side to a more low-key, quieter bar area where the median age is slightly older on the other side. Variety is the spice of life :) I'm a fan of the outdoor / swimming pool area, which is shared space for the Phoenix Hotel. They have ample seating to sit down and chat with friends with a few drinks in hand in the evening. The drinks themselves aren't the best in the city, but they have a decent selection and they keep a full bar.
author: Michelle E.

description:
I came here on Sunday, June 30 for the Gay Pride parade party, and it was AWESOME! It felt like I was all of a sudden transported to La or something for a day - the weather was amazing, everyone was hanging/drinking by the pool, and people were in fantastic costumes! They had a bar set up outside and were also selling food. The set up was awesome and the party definitely had weather on its side because SF decided to cooperate and not be gloomy :)

The inside was not too crowded and was perfect - both the bars were open and it was fairly easy to get a drink. Bartenders are all really nice and fun and I've never had an issue here - I've been here multiple times in the past just for drinks for friends' birthdays. 

I've never eaten here so can't comment. But for any of you businesses/nonprofits that need a space to have a party, check out Chambers' pool area - it's rad! The only issue is, SF weather can be hit or miss. But it's spacious, big, awesome for dancing, and enough space to set up an outside bar and food area.
author: Priya G.

description:
I had absolutely no idea that this place was a nice lounge/restaurant.  I had been in the area meeting up friends for coffee/lunch, but never really paid attention to this place.  So, when my buddy said we were meeting up here, I really didn't know what to expect.  On this particular Saturday night (as I suspect most Saturday nights are here), the line is pretty big.  Maybe 30 people were standing in line waiting for this place.  Once inside, it was really packed (no surprise there), and this place would be that much better if there was a dance floor since the music was pretty good.

Overall, a good spot, and yes -- I guess you can check out the pool from the bar/restaurant, too.  Interesting times. :)
author: Mel G.

description:
OK...it was a LONG walk for me to even get to this place. After being exhausted from the walk, we were about a half an hour late for our reservations. Luckily they were able to seat us anyway. 

Right when we walked in, i swear I was in a time warp and went into the past. The decor is old fashioned, records on the wall, retro lighting...super cute. This restaurant is located/attached to the Phoenix hotel, which fed off a Palm Springs kind of vibe. They sat our group of 4 outside near the hotel's pool. This is where the ambiance was weird, because the hotel's style is very apartment-like. There were girls laying out, kids all around, and this woman was just breast feeding her child out in the open, no cover up. Literally..wtf? lol.

Ordered the Chamber's burger. That smoked onion marmalade is what made that burger. I enjoyed my brunch order very much. My friend's food also looked visually amazing. They have a great brunch menu.
author: Darlene B.

description:
Meh! I used to love this place both for drinks and dinner.
But now I think I'll skip dinner and just coming in for drinks.
The food was ok and took forever and the price is a bit on a high side for the quality they serve.
I came in in Saturday had the pork belly and duck breast and my bf had the burger. Just an okay not super excited to go back here for dinner, maybe just for drinks.
The drinks somehow were great so two stars for that.
author: Ty N.

description:
We ate out by the pool as it was a very nice evening, and we tasted a variety of items from the menu.   Some were disappointing (the salmon rillettes) some were tasty ( the chicken liver pate) but on the whole it was a so-so dinner for the four of us.
The service, however, was excellent and the cocktails were stiff, so that made it all worthwhile
author: Whitney D.

description:
Drinks didn't taste good. Food was good, but not spectacular-- certainly nothing to make the dishes worth the price. 
Happy hour prices make this place almost ok.
Bread service, which is only upon request, took forever. The accompanying pink peppercorn butter was the highlight of the night.
Service was patchy, though servers were all very nice and smiley.
Friend also had her entree (duck breast with couscous?) shovelled onto one side of the serving plate, leaving the other half empty and looking like it was missing something. Strange.
author: Karen C.

description:
Oh. My. God. This place was great! 

As a fellow vinyl enthusiast, I loved all the old LPs lining the walls! It has a trendy, classic ambiance with just a splash of hipster to make it legit SF. This is a great spot for groups, celebrations, and taking out-of-towners to. 

It had a sort of South Beach feel to it which, as a recent east coast transplant, made me feel right at home. The courtyard with pool in the center was so fun. I am now determined to have a SF stay-cation and book a room here for a weekend. 

Back to the Brunch - The Pork Belly was to die for, but I also enjoyed stealing a generous portion of my boyfriends Hangover Hash. I have a hunch this is a no wrong orders kinda place. 

Loved Chambers so much. I will def be back!
author: Ashley H.

description:
I really wanted to like this place but after a visit...it did not live up to it's hype.

First and foremost, shady area for sure and parking is tough. One of my girlfriends and I had our early Christmas dinner here along with reservations which was easy. But we had to wait at the bar while our table was setting up, we asked the female bartender for recommendation on the drinks (there goes the minus star). IMO, She did not want to help us with our order better yet provide recommendations. As a bartender, you would want to guide and provide recommendations for your customers to get drink orders and tip (am I right?), well, from my experience here, the female bartender was careless to take orders and definitely not inviting or vibrant as most bartenders should be.

 Anyways, after the rude awakening, we intended to go into the area with the marked "Be Amazing" sign, it was booked for a special occasion (understandable), we asked a wait staff to see if we're able to go in there afterwards, one wait staff just shrugged it off and was snotty (for no apparent reason) but luckily another staff member made sure to ask when the party was leaving so we can go in there (thx u). Overall, two horrible customer service BUT our waiter was super friendly and the hostess was friendly too.

Food wise
- Average
- overpriced
- Tiny portions
- Still hungry after dinner

We ordered the Brussels sprouts, burger with pork belly, chicken liver pate, tater tots with bacon. All were A-OK, but very tiny portions. I can go to Palominos and get better food at half the price. Two stars and don't bother checking out this place.

Will NOT come back. Save your money and time.
author: Julia K.

description:
Come here for the ridiculously cool ambiance; stay here for the delicious food and drinks. This restaurant/bar has an incredibly swanky, hipster vibe that reminds me much more of NY than SF with more manageable prices for the scene. It's a great place for dates, birthdays, and other celebrations, but call to confirm there isn't another event going on if you're expecting many guests to join you- the bar can get quite packed.

Get the Gravlax appetizer if you like raw salmon... our group absolutely cleaned that plate down to the last teeny sphere of caviar! Other highlights were the sizzling kobe tri-tip (we ordered a second round) and the spicy cucumber cocktail with stoli jalapeno, agave nectar, cucumber, and lime (also deserving of a second round).
author: Kelcey M.

description:
All I can say is wow - this place is a total SF gem. 

I came to Chambers for the first time on Saturday for Brunch. I have heard really great things from friends and knew I needed to check out the iconic Phoenix Hotel. With some friends visiting from out of town I knew this would be the perfect time to go. 

I made a reservation that morning and it was no issue sitting a table of 6 outside by the pool. The whole decor was amazing, I loved the the old bookshelf and the the various kinds of tables throughout the restaurant. But my favorite part was the outside patio, with the bright colored hotel room doors and outside furniture, the pool and the funky sculptures I knew this place was right up our alley (regardless of the fact it's located in the Tenderloin).

Since it was a beautiful Saturday in SF, we decided to do the bottomless mimosas. What a steal, especially since we love our morning cocktails. Our server was very attentive and made sure our glasses were never empty. 

And then there is the food... Let me say this again, WOW. My friend visiting and I shared the egg-in-a-hole (4 stars) and asked for the bacon crunchy, which is a must in my book. The brioche bread was amazing the side salad was extremely refreshing. We also shared the Pork Belly (which is the reason why I had to write-up a post 5+ stars). HOLY YUM!! This was probably the best brunch dish I have had in SF. The crispy kale, the spicy gochujang and garlic potatoes combined with the running soft boiled eggs was absolutely TO DIE FOR. I'm not the biggest Polk Belly fan but this was good! I also tried my friends Eggs Royale (4.5 stars) which was an awesome play of eggs Benedict and lox. 

I will 100% be back and will be telling all my friends about Chambers.
author: Talia R.

description:
Like Daisy K. we came here because Brendas was too packed.  Didn't know what to expect but I gotta say....our experience was awesome! We were surprised there was no wait during lunch time on a Saturday. 

The hostess was really sweet and sat us outside & told me the history of the spot and the vinyl records that lined the shelf.  Food was awesome.  I got the pork belly w/ pork candy.  I was hesitant to get the grits but our server (who was also friendly and attentive) explained that they were made into balls and deep fried.  They were almost like hush puppies!  

There was an event going on outside....a bingo thing for this burlesque show...that kinda threw things off but they made sure to turn the volume down so all was good. Even though I wasn't into the festivities I gotta give it up to them for being super enthusiastic.  

Great decor. Nice to sit by the pool.  OH and they hooked up a free pork belly skewer afterwards as well!  Would def come back for brunch/lunch - especially on a sunny day.
author: Brian L.

description:
Love it for Brunch!  Okay, last week I went here for brunch, and was transported to like, rock and roll Miami!  We sat outside, where the patio is shared with the Pheonix Hotel, and they have an outdoor pool!  in downtown San Francisco!!  There was an awesome group singing songs in French with an accordion and guitar shredder, not your grandma's cafe music!  
The mimosas were good, but the bloody Mary's were even better!  A stick of Jicama is what does the trick for me!  
Very exotic menu:  I don't even know how to describe it, its, EVERYTHING!!  
I had the soft scrambled eggs with st. georges cheese, a conservative choice amongst all the wild items, i know, but YUM.  my more adventurous friend got the Japanese omelette, with sweet potato, also total YUM.  we split an order of the french toast, which is really NO JOKE!  pear compote and bourbon sauce, I was in heaven!  See you next week!
author: trum d.

description: The food here is amazing. Fantastic flavors and incredible brunch. Bottomless mimosas are in point. Rachel and the crew took such great care of us for Saturday brunchy-brunch!
author: Jil S.

description:
My wife and I walked by and decided to see if we could get a slot for Sunday brunch. We were forth ate they were able to squeeze us in between 2 existing reservations.

The place has a cool, hipster, vintage music vibe. Much of the decor is shelves of old vinyl records. 

The menu is a very modern, eclectic take on some typical favorites. 

My Hangover Hash was very tasty with separate components of pastrami, hashbrowns, over hard egg, horseradish, and pickled vegetables. On the side  was a Russian dressing in a "bubble". It was a bit difficult to compose the perfect bite, but well worth it. 

My wife had the Eggs Royale.  Sous vide eggs, hash browns, trout, hollandaise, caviar, herbs, and creme fraiche. It came out a little cool and needed a little salt, but was good otherwise.
author: Dave R.

description:
One word...........AMAZING! 

This has to be my new favorite place, like FAVE FAVE FAVE! 

Good food, good drinks, and super duper awesome decor. I love the rock and roll theme, and I also enjoyed the music playing at the background. It's hard to find Chambers, but when you enter... it's like you're in a whole new world. 

I was hanging out at the lounge, and I had mostly small bites. Everything I tried was really good... from the smoked salmon, pblt, pork croquet, soup, marble potato, to beet salad. My favorite has to be the pork croquet. I also loved smoked salmon, cause it tastes so fresh! The presentation is beautiful. For me, presentation makes the dish worth so much more! 

Lastly, service is beyond five star. I mean.... there is no word to describe how amazing it is. Isabel is one of the most amazing person I've ever met. 

I, however, wish to see more things in the menu. Hopefully it's gonna get better every visit. Can't wait to come back!!
author: Marlis T.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night which was really slow but was still such a charming place ambiance. Boyfriend and I ordered the Kobe beef and liver plate. Both were okay. But we both thoroughly enjoyed our cocktails. I ordered the spicy cucumber which I loooved! This would be a good place to take a date or someone from out of town. Such a cute space.
author: Jamie L.

description:
This is for the brunch review only because frankly, the place looks pretty awesome for some night time drinks.  Brunch starts at 10am on Sat.  Not bad because it's not one of those SF brunch places where you wait a really long time or love brunch so much you wake up before 9 to not wait in line.  So Chambers definitely gets a plus for the ability to make reservations.  However with that being said, this place is kind of like Foreign Cinema in my opinion because the food is ...overrated and not so great.  

I gravitated toward the souffle pancake because you don't see that often.  It takes 15 minutes to prep so if you know you want it, you should order it ahead of time.  However, when it came out, it wasn't all that.  Think an extra fluffy pancake (1 inch thick) and double the cost of any other brunch place in SF.  It comes with a side of ice cream which I totally liked instead of the typical whipped cream.  Creative, but not worth the whatever $12 I paid.

Friends got the pork belly hash and some egg scramble.  While the presentation was beautiful, the food was sparse and the taste was mediocre.  I think they try too hard to make creative dishes and miss the flavor.  

I rather get a traditional brunch at all the other awesome SF brunch places like Mission Beach, Butler & Chef or Brenda's.  Heck even toast and coffee at the Mill would have been better at a fraction of the price.

Pros:
They service their coffee in a french press, which lasted about 6 cups.  Coffee was decent.  Place is pretty nicely decorated with shelves of records, with a mix of retro and modern furniture.
author: Tammie C.

description: I want to thank them for being so accommodating and friendly. I brought my mother and boyfriend the other day for dinner before we went to the ballet. We were running late and forgot to advise our friendly waitress that we had a show at 8. They sat us promptly, explained food to my party and helped us make our show on time. While I have a lot more experience with this kind of dining, my Mom and BF don't. They were very pleased and enjoyed trying new foods. I believe the name of our waitress was Rachael. Thank you for a very nice experience on my Mom's Pre-birthday and Pre-mother's Day dinner.
author: Lambert C.

description: This place is amazeballs. Don't judge a restaurant by its hood.  This place can beat any Michelin starred bs any time any day.  I'm impressed and will be back for more.
author: Koalie W.

description:
At this point I'm not sure why I went back after the first time I ate here (I've been here about four times, always the same experience). Some of the waiters are pretty rude and unresponsive to customers. It's almost like they talk down on people. 

The majority of the interactions I had with them left me feeling uncomfortable and like I chose the wrong place to eat at. 

I had their pork belly dish. It was okay. Nice ambiance.
author: Andrea M.

description:
If I'm going to the Tenderloin, I expect the restaurant to be amazing to make up for the sketchy area. My group of friends were unfortunately disappointed with our dinner this past weekend

The food was mediocre at best. The Burger was rather disappointing, especially after the hostess claimed to be a burger snob and insisted we try it. The appetizer steak was ordinary and too small of a portion for the price. The only dish I really enjoyed was the coffee cake.

This restaurant does have a cool ambiance going for it though (why it gets 3 stars instead of 2). The hip bar and lounge like tables reminded me a lot of L.A. nightlife. I think the mistake was coming here for dinner, seems to be better for drinks.
author: Ashwin S.

description:
Food tastes delicious!!
Had the bristle shiitake and it was soooooo yummy!!!!
The aahi Tuna was delicious as well 

Service a little slow but with a company it doesn't matter
author: Ella B.

description:
review for brunch only.

the location of this place is a bit sketchy but the inside of chambers was really nice. as many has probably mentioned before, i loved the BE AMAZING sign. our group was seated outside though where it looked like and felt like we were eating right next to a motel 6 type of place pool.

i tried the biscuits and gravy, the eggs royale dish, and the pork belly and eggs dish. i really liked the biscuits and gravy but the two main dishes were really disappointing. the eggs royale definitely looked way better than it tasted. the hash brown was soggy and even with the smoked salmon, the dish as a whole was really bland. the pork belly was mostly all fat and did not have much flavor as well.

not a place i'd come back to for brunch...
author: Katherine C.

description: My family and I have come here for brunch / lunch a couple of times before going to the SF Ballet.  We have grown to really love this place.  The atmosphere is hip but in a relaxed sort of way.  The food is delicious.  I highly recommend the pork belly!  The only downside is that there aren't a lot of vegetarian / vegan options on the menu.   Be forewarned that the souffle pancake takes about 20 minutes so budget extra time for that.
author: Irene A.

description:
Really, this place should be called Chamber -eat + drink. 

It still wins 4 stars in my book because of the fabulous, fabulous venue. I simply love bringing friends here because it's fun and stylish, and so are the other people who visit. NOT for the food. 

This is besides the incredible cocktail list and the quirky "Be Amazing" bar in the back. 

The food and the service - 1 star. Don't eat here - you'll waste calories, time, and money. It took us 45 minutes to get our appetizers on an early Saturday evening (pre-rush). Service was disinterested, didn't know the menu well. Food was subpar at best, the only thing it had going for it was plating and style - and given the unreasonable prices, that's exactly what you're paying for. 

If you MUST order something, the grit fries are the most interesting thing on the menu. 

Don't eat at Chambers eat + drink. And if you must, reverse the order so that the drinks make the food and hole in your wallet more bearable. 

Pro tip: this place is good for groups. Get the back seating area for drinks with friends, and they also have large tables for dinner.
author: Meghana D.

description:
Nice place. Had dinner here--we got a great table/seat and made a reso. Service was good and ambience is nice for a date. 

The Kobe tri-tip app was really good. But the halibut and quinoa salad were just OK. Overall I didn't feel the quality of food was high enough for what we paid, and that was the main thing we were there for. 

If it was just a restaurant I'd give it 3 stars. But as a whole it's a cool spot, and nice place to get a drink!
author: Karl P.

description: Sitting outdoors, this place is very peaceful and relaxing for the Tenderloin.  The interior courtyard is my new favorite part. Some of the portions are very small, but the quality is excellent and the drinks, strong and delicious.
author: Brian K.

description:
Review for brunch.

I enjoyed coming here for brunch but I did not enjoy the walk here from the car.  The neighborhood is super shady and even more so smelly.  Not really a great way to begin a meal...

But, upon entering I almost forgot the nastiness outside and started to regain my appetite.  I skipped breakfast so I was HUNGRY!  My bf and I both ordered the burger.  He has had it before and knew it would be good.  It wasn't so much a brunch item but my stomach was doing all the ordering.  (I considered the souffle pancake though).  The burger was GOOD!  Probably one of the better ones I've had in the city.  We also shared a delicious coffee cake, some French pressed coffee and each had a mimosa.  I was a little more adventurous and got their signature one which was seemed lighter in flavor.  

Our sever was nice but not overly attentive even when patrons starting pouring in right after they opened.  

Overall, a delicious meal but unfortunately we probably would not be coming back until the neighborhood cleaned itself up a bit.  We're not holding our breaths ....
author: Rosalind S.

description: Bought a gilt deal for brunch, which included French press coffee, coffee cake, two cocktails, and two entrees. I got the eggs royale and Bloody Mary, both were scrumptious. The service was also amazing. We had to leave in 50 minutes and our waiter made it happen. Besides the fact that it is located in the middle of the tenderloin, everything from the decor to the food and drinks are to die for here.
author: Peggy L.

description: Fun setting at the Phoenix hotel. Pretentious waiter. Definitely in the deep tenderloin but just take a cab and you'll be fine. Steak cooked perfectly. Chicken liver app was standard but tasty. Amazing asparagus app!! Kobe beef on a hot rock was so cool and delicious.
author: Christina S.

description:
We went there for a laid-back brunch, and felt like things were taken very, very seriously over there. This didn't make us as comfortable as we were expecting our brunch to be...

The girl at the door was very helpful, but not friendly at all. The food looked great and imaginative, and tasted alright (way not as good as it looked! but decent anyway...)

The waitress (young blond gal, whose name I forgot) was really, really awesome, a ray of energy in an otherwise pretty grim and "serious" ambiance.

We probably won't go back, but I understand how people who like hip places without caring too much about the food itself will like it a lot.
author: Rudy R.

description: 2nd visit to Chambers.  1st visit for brunch maybe 12 months ago...fantastic vibe and food.  2nd time for dinner and drinks.  Great service at the bar, average service at the table.  Food...halibut...very disappointing.  Would return for drinks or brunch but will probably stay from dinner menu in the future.
author: Doug B.

description:
You know you're disappointed with your meal on some level when you look at a $95 check and think, "That wasn't worth the money." 

Chambers Eat + Drink has been on my long list of must-tries for a while now. Understandably, my expectations were high, especially given that everyone I talked to really enjoyed their experience here. The food was good...just not $50 per person good. The drinks were good...just not GREAT and in an area where there are GREAT cocktails (Rye, Tradition, Wilson & Wilson, Bourbon & Branch, Jaspers, etc.), you have to really step up your game.

We sat inside, which was nice but apparently all the fun happens out by the pool. Maybe I'll check that out next time if I'm feeling generous with second chances.
author: Julia N.

description:
We came here with a Gilt coupon for brunch ($35 for two to enjoy French press coffee, coffee cake, drinks, and an entrée each) and were not expecting to be blown away - but we were! 

First of all, the atmosphere is awesome - had kind of an LA / Ace Hotel vibe. It's very 60s rock n roll nostalgic, with records lining the walls and a great sound track throughout. Just hip enough to be fun but did not cross the line into over designed douche-bag territory. It was cozy.

Sometimes with a place like this the staff can be "too cool", but everyone was so nice, we felt right at home. Our server Maria was a ray of sunshine! 

But we came for the food, and Chambers did not disappoint. The coffee cake was good, but the entrees were amazing. We shared the tofu hash and the soft scrambled eggs. The tofu hash was deliciously savory with  a generous heap of veggies and the best faro I've had anywhere. I would eat this for lunch or dinner any day of the week. The eggs were soft and delicate with some veggies and a cheese crisp. Really good. It was just enough food to fill you up without feeling gross and overstuffed. The cocktails were also good. 

I just wish they offered vegetarian options for dinner so we could come back at night. Happy to have a new brunch spot regardless!
author: Christine B.

description:
I'd passed by Chambers a handful of times and caught wind of the music bumping above the low buzz of the dinner crowd and had been ACHING to step inside for a while now.

Last night, I finally got my chance.

I was invited to grab some birthday drinks and dinner by one of my good friends Brian B. and in my excitement ended up at the restaurant a good fifteen minutes ahead of everybody else which gave me the opportunity to scope the place out.

Much of the light from the dimly lit interior comes from the ample shelving of the restaurant which holds, upon closer inspection, LOADS of classic records. Add to that, the eclectic mix of sofas and seat styles and the place definitely oozes the cool of James Bond with the tongue in cheek of Austin Powers.

Although the food menu itself may be a little brief for some diners, the cocktail and wine offerings are imaginative and solid.

While Chambers definitely has the Swag to rock the vintage vinyl and mismatched sofas, for me the final word is always about the food and for that I have to give it three stars. 

The polenta was over seasoned and the Tombo Tuna from the Small Bites selection fell flat with it's pairing of smoked tuna and saffron cracker. The Quail which I had for my entree consisted of two pitifully small pieces of fowl served on top of an overwhelming portion of butternut squash and lentils.

Overall, an enjoyable experience but if I were to come back it would be for the cocktails not the food.
author: Kevin T.

description:
Good cocktails, but a bit pricey.

Food is decent, but also pricey for what it is and how much of it is there.

Vibe is great, stay for late hours for a decent scene. 

Had good service while I was there.

My friend tried to pick a fight with a nerdy guy wearing a stanford sweatshirt. That was kind of funny. "What was your SAT score? Tell me! Tell me!!!!" I need new friends.
author: Stephen H.

description:
We were a large group that went there for brunch on new years day. We were seated at an patio table. The place was not super crowded (for brunch in SF). My friend ordered family style for the table. 

The problems started after we got seated. We asked for water and some coffees and they did not show up. We had to go back multiple times and ask before the waiter started paying attention. After that we realized that they were no coffee cups around or in some cases the cutlery. 

After about 40 minutes, we got a little antsy and finally pushed them to get the food out. The food itself was very delicious. They did mention that were having some issue with the kitchen but it would have helped to know that much earlier. n the end, we realized that we had some issues with the check as well which had to be sorted out. Overall, given the number of options for brunch, I hope they can fix the service issues since their food is pretty solid.
author: Rahul H.

description:
Brunch review only. Came with three friends on a Saturday. Made a reservation, but it was pretty quiet when we got there around 11a.

FOOD: I wanted to eat everything on the menu, but settled for the Chambers burger (no pork belly or avocado). It was huge, juicy, full of flavor - and the challah bun was perfectly soft but not soggy. The boyfriend got the pork belly - which was a bit disappointing with only a couple bites of pork belly and the grits being in these weird fried balls. Still delicious, just not the kind of dish I was expecting.  Lucky lemonade was pretty strong (thumbs up) but the bloody mary was pretty boring.

ENVIRONMENT: What a cool looking place, despite how it looks from the outside. Dividers were shelves of records, with cool lighting, booths and a good amount of space. It feels so rockstar and vintage but not in an overbearing sort of way.

SERVICE: It took a weirdly long time for the hostess to appear after we walked in. But after that, our waiter was great - definitely gave us enough time for deciding and chatting. The timing of bringing out food was a bit strange, as it felt like we were waiting for the fourth dish for a while after the first three.
author: Kailyn G.

description:
DO NOT sleep on this place! I went for the first time in Feb 2013 and have been back several other times!! 

First off do not judge the place just because it is in the Tenderloin. The moment you step in, it will blow your mind away. The front room is the restaurant. This place has style. It's a place you can take someone on a take to, or just hang out with some friends a grab a good solid drink. 

As a bar, it is a great place to drink. They have a variety of drinks to choose from, and the drinks are strong. The bar tenders really know what they're doing. I'm always looking for a cocktail that Ive never tried before and if they're strong and made right, it will definitely bring me back. 

As a restaurant, the food is pretty damn great! The idea of pork belly being brought out to you in on its own little smoker should be reason enough for you to come in try it! Not to mention the KOBE TRI-TIP they serve you. Truffle ricotta, zabuton steak, lamb shank, and yellowtail ceviche WILL NOT disappoint you! 

Then, there's the outside area/patio. I think this is where it separates itself from the pack. During a nice day or even a nice night, you can just hang out back there. There's a pool in the back, some cabanas, chairs, and even a fire pit that makes you feel like you're no where in the tenderloin or even SF for that matter. Sorta like and bar oasis in the middle of a big city.

And the reason that it gets the 5 stars ...well the staff has never let me down. Nice, attentive, and overall great. Even the bar tenders try to smile or help you out if when the bar is jam packed.

I don't know what you're doing still reading this, you should go try the food, and grab a drink already. LOL
author: Leonel B.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE. Came here for dinner and drinks last Saturday night with a group of friends and we all agreed we had a better time here than at any of the other bars we visited afterwards. The decor is warm and sensual, the burgers look delicious (will have to try those next time) and the salad, while small, was tasty as can be. The drinks were also superbly mixed -- I'm pretty picky about my gin martinis and Chambers made each and every one top-notch. A few of the reviews on here raved about the waffle "fries" and truffle dip, but honestly, I wouldn't recommend it. The fries were essentially oily potato chips, and the dip was a creamy rich mess.

After we had finished eating, we headed over to the back bar/dance room. The crowd was fun and diverse -- I only wish we could've stayed longer! My biggest mistake that evening was leaving Chambers too early.
author: Tiffany W.

description: How can a place be both trendy and timeless? I don't know, but Chambers pulls it off. The ambience here is what keeps me coming back. This place pays attention to the details, which work together to make a beautiful whole. With a dining area, back bar and seating, and a large outside area, Chamber's feels intimate even on a busier night. I like to grab a cocktail at the "Be Amazing" back bar and take it outside to the water/fire fixture and enjoy an SF night with the conversation of good friends. My only complaint is that I feel its a little overpriced, though not bad enough to keep me away.
author: Rachel H.

description: I may become a regular in the tenderloin now that I've been to Chambers for a friend's birthday.  The atmosphere of the lounge was great! We had a group of around 40 people for the event, and everyone was able to get in (some fashionably late people had to wait in line for ~20 minutes) and hang out together while enjoying delicious drinks.  I lovedddddd the #12 (I have no idea what it was other than that it had Stoli hot in it and was spicy and amazinggggggg).  I was sad when they stopped making specialty drinks partway through the night.  The bartender accidentally spilled a drink on me, but was really apologetic (and said something again when I ran into her in the bathroom later) and comped my drink, which was nice!  Hotel bar prices, so be prepared for that and come ready to have a good time!
author: Raina D.

description:
I don't think Chambers lived up their motto quite like I thought they would.  
Drinks were stiff and nothing impressed me.
Food was Ok... overpriced and small portions. And they forgot to bring out an item. 
Sketchy neighborhood!
Only thing I liked about the place was the"Be Amazing" sign.
author: Nia Q.

description: I've been here quite a few times in my 4+ years living in SF and it never disappoints. Great cocktails, neat space (who doesn't love a neon "Be Amazing" sign behind the bar?) and good crowd.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
One of my favorite bars in SF. In a sketchy neighborhood, but once you enter, the interior is beautiful and i just love the overall vibe of this place. it's warm, lively, and not overly pretentious. 

Have been for dinner which was fine, but this place is also great to just drop by for a drink. Was here last weekend and the bartender made me a "special" which was a berry mojito of some sort. delicious. 

And yes, i did take a photo of the be amazing sign. and yes, i did make it my facebook cover photo. I couldn't resist.
author: Susan C.

description:
I give it 1 star for the food portion, quality and price combination. Let's just say this place charges and portions like it's a michelin star restaurant does, but does not provide the quality. Here are the things this place is bad at:

1. plates for sharing. We were there for a bday party, we were hoping we could share some small plates like the sizzling tri tip or grit fries; there's only 3 grit fries and like 6 THIN slices of tri tip. The flavors were fine but $8 for 3 fries and $16 for 6 thin tri tip slices? Uh.
2. Getting full on anything less than 100pp. We spend 40$ pp and were still pretty hungry when we left. The french onion soup was kind of like french onion sauce, the burger was somewhere between a slider and a burger, and swordfish could hardly be found on the plate.

Even the drinks, we thought they were yummy, but it was way small for a $11 drink. I think we could have a pretty good time here if we didn't care about how much we were paying but be prepared with your $50's if you want to dine here for dinner.
author: Tracy W.

description:
As most others may have done, my afternoon leisure lunch date and I had anticipated going to Brenda's for lunch but with our starving tummy's we couldn't wait for the long line so we strolled around the corner and found Chambers. And I'm glad we did!

I ordered the eggs royale- sous vide eggs, crispy hash browns, cold smoked salmon, mandarin hollandaise, & caviar. I really enjoyed the way the hash browns were prepared. It tasted more like a block of lightly mashed potatoes with a crisp outside. Delish!

My companion had the Tamago (Japanese Omelette) w/ house smoked chorizo. He enjoyed the meal, though the portion was a tad on the small side and he said the smoked chorizo was quite dry. I've never had chorizo smoked, so I'm not sure if it was supposed to be that way. 

We also ordered drinks, he had the bloody mary and I the cucumber mimosa. I thought the mimosa was quite refreshing and tasty. I'm not a fan of bloody mary drinks but I tasted his and I thought it was quite tasty as well. Different from your normal bloody mary. 

Chambers has retro meets modern and hipster-like decor all rolled up into one. I liked all the old records and comfy lounge chairs, as well as the option of sitting outdoors. My favorite part of Chambers has to be the music though! A place where I'd like to sit around, lounge, drink and enjoy the music all day.

This place is a little pricey for an afternoon bite though. For the two of us the bill came out to be $55. But I would still definitely want come back and check out the rest of the menu, or just to chill there.
author: Tu M.

description:
Actually, I'd give this place a solid 3.5.
