I've been here at night and it's a completely different feel during the day for brunch.  The service was very prompt, and they have a mean bloody mary.  The waitress was super generous, as I didn't order unlimited mimosas but she filled mine up without even asking.

I like to try corned beef hash where ever I go for brunch.  Chamber's corned beef hash was super unique!  The corned beef is actually separate from the hash.  It was fun grabbing a bit of both, mixing it with the sauces, then grabbing the delicious bite.

I would definitely recommend coming here.  The food is good, the service is good.  The atmosphere is also very nice.  When you look outside the window, it looks like you're in some random motel in LA.
author: Andrew H.

description: saturday nine:thirty pm arrival...past dinner tables and back bar...manageable crowds...no wait for bartender and taking a "whiskey drink" $eleven...whiskey cocktail sweet with slightly orange bitter notes...decent sip before past ten pm and crowds arriving by eleven pm...quickly becoming a sardine can bar...longer wait for drinks...taking chance at the front bar and returning to the back bar...an old fashion next...sweet whiskey drink for sipping and mingling...interesting mix of crowds...good bar and lounge to socialize...not overly loud...crowded in the late night, but large space to escape...
author: Hen A.

description:
Would have completely missed this place if it weren't for yelp!

The first thing you'll see is that the place has a massive record collection. 

The ambiance once walking inside is very intimate and trendy. There are vinyl records from classic bands throughout inside. We chose to sit poolside in the patio where we could enjoy the weather.

We had the pancake souffle and the eggs Benedict. Both were great, and were executed with a modern touch. For example, the pancakes had nice herbal syrup that was just sweet enough but not too sweet.
author: Arjuna S.

description:
Beautiful aesthetics, mediocre food and drinks.

Located in the TL in the Phoenix Hotel. Intimate, dimly lit space which includes two full bars and an outdoor patio area. Tres chic! Would be a perfect date spot for the ambiance alone. Check out the main bar where they have their "BE AMAZING" lighted sign. Service was friendly but extremely slow.

I tried the following:
- Truffle Dip/   Wild mushroom and black truffle with waffle chips. Very creamy. I enjoyed this dish.
- Sizzling Kobe Tri-Tip/   Small portion of kobe that comes on a sizzling rock for you to cook. Good, but not extraordinary.
- Pancetta Wrapped Chicken Roulade/   I did not like this dish, the flavors were definitely lacking.

Cocktail selection is standard, I did not have anything that was memorable. If I come back it will be for drinks only.
author: Ashley K.

description:
Food was good. Had pork belly, Egg royale, and spiced french toast. 

Negative... tenderloin leaves a lot to be desired. Parking isn't great. Bathroom had bad public bathroom smell
author: Lisa C.

description:
Cozy, swanky, & chic - barely escaping from the grunge of the TL but just quite right for a night of dimly-lit boozing and shmoozing. This is the kind of place that has lighting that can't possibly make you NOT look good (a double-edged sword...).  Knowing the neighborhood that lies right outside Chambers' doors adds to the kind of "this could be a nighttime poolside porn set" feel that I couldn't quite shake. The cabana area also has a bit of a seventies motel feel what with the pool lighting and hotel rooms overlooking the patio.

I hosted a going-away party here last month in June and reserved an outdoor poolside cabana. There are 2 cabanas available for rental. Each one can fit about 8-10 people seated comfortably. If your group is bigger then that, then they'll have to stand. 


[ [ RESERVATION TERMS ] ]
*$150 cabana rental fee
*$300 food/beverage minimum, met on one tab (tab can be split at the end on a maximum of 5 credit cards, or with cash).
Note: Since drinks are $10/each, it's not too hard to meet the minimum. 30 friends at one drink each, 15 friends at 2 drinks each... fewer friends = they'd better be generously channeling their inner alcoholics.


[ [ WHAT I LIKED ] ]
+ Drinks with tequila & cayenne (e.g. drink #12). I like a little fire in my liquor. 
+ Pisco!
+ Drink list is manageable and varied enough to suit most palates. I appreciate that the drinks were well-crafted but weren't too fancy pants. Good for pleasing groups.
+ Cabanas have heat lamps
+ I worked with Isabel Manchester to book my reservation. She was responsive, accommodating, and easy to work with via email communication


[ [ THE MEH ] ]
- Service was super slow as our cabana was served by one single cocktail waitress who seemed to be running around serving other areas of the lounge. It's hard to meet the $300 F+B minimum if your waitress comes by only once every 15-20 minutes. She was nice enough and got all of our orders correct throughout the night, but the slow service was unacceptable. 

- To meet your minimum, you have to order with your specific cocktail waitress so she can put it on your tab. You can't simply order at the bar and tell them to put it on your reservation tab. This was not made clear to my guests at the beginning, and several of them ordered drinks at the bar (since service was so slow) thinking their purchases would be transferred to my tab.

- Chambers is not equipped for cash+carry purchases - meaning your guests must place their orders on the same tab and keep track of how much they personally owe so they can pay up at the end. If you don't have a designated sober-enough person at the end to figure out how to split the tab, well, you're going to end up drunkenly confused and likely overpay/compensate for your equally dazed friends. 

- Whoever designed the cabanas must have never thought of the consequences of letting inebriated stiletto-clad girls traipse around ditches with loose rocks. The cabanas are styled with a decorative "moat" of small rocks that one must traverse before making your way to a cabana seat. I can't remember how many times I myself or one of my guests tripped on this poorly designed rock moat. 

- The cabana area closes at midnight, so if you've got a cabana reservation, your guests will be asked to move inside. God forbid you haven't settled your tab yet at that point. 


[ [ OVERALL ] ]
I'd come back for drinks with a small group of friends. I do like their drinks and the ambience. I'd have to think twice about hosting a party here again though, unless they loosened their reservation terms, changed their system to allow for cash+carry purchases, and fixed the sloowww service.
author: Megan L.

description:
This restaurant isn't in the best neighbor hood. When you see the colorful Phoenix hotel, you are in the right place. The door doesn't have a sign.. it's just two black doors. If I had to find this place myself, I would be lost. 

I didn't particularly enjoy the decor as much as I thought I would. We sat in a booth in  the hallway leading to the back bar/lounge area. The candles added a nice touch but it was pretty dark in there. Luckily, we went when the sun was still out for an early dinner (well, 7pm). 

The restaurant was pretty empty when we got there. Towards the middle of our meal, it started to fill up fast. Our server was great. We ordered sizzling kobe tri-tip, sizzling pork belly, tator tots, and butter lettuce salad. 

The sizzling kobe tri-tip was AMAZING. The meat is brought out rare on a sizzling stone and you let it cook to your liking. Kind of like korean bbq but kind of not. It came with pickled veggies in slaw form and mushroom brandy reduction. I took a piece of meat, dabbed some mush-bran reduction on there, topped it off with some pickled veggies... perfection in a bite. 

The sizzling pork belly was just as good but not as sizzling hot as the kobe tri-tip. It came with kimchi-like side that was just super fantastic. It tasted like white kimchi. 

The tator tots are not the traditional tator tots. They kind of look like fat mozzarella sticks but also look like blocks of hash browns. Super crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. It came with pork remoulade and bacon dust (you have to mix it together yourself)..I didn't know what I was tasting... regular ketchup would have been just fine. 

The butter lettuce salad was just ok. It's just a salad with champagne vinaigrette. The spiced walnuts tasted like candy.. they were made very well. 

I also had a sugar cane coke for $6..... seemed a little pricey but it was nice to have bubbles with sizzling meat. 

We were still not totally full after all that. We ordered the Chambers burger. A bit disappointed. It wasn't a burger burger with lettuce, tomato, cheese, onion like we expected (we should have read the description before ordering...) . The smoke onion marmalade (looked like bbq sauce with onion chunks) was too much.. it was spilling out of the burger and created a mess. The fries were just ok. I thought the meat was a bit dry. The burger was probably my least favorite part of the meal. 

After my meal, I walked back to the second bar to take a picture of the "be amazing" sign. The back bar looks completely different (modern and contemporary) than the front dining area. 

I'd def come back here for the sizzling kobe tri-tip and pork belly. Delish!
author: Esther C.

description:
Fantastic service. Excellent food.

We had a late dinner reservations and were catered to perfectly. A small wait for our table was compensated for by a free drink, several apologies and rewarded with heavenly food.

+ The sizzling Kobe trip-tip appetizer served on a hot stone
+ Perfectly cooked burger 
+ Good drinks and great ambiance
author: Janett R.

description:
Amazing place 
Burgers with pork belly was insane !
Hangover hash f great dish 
So many tastes in one plate
author: Erez E.

description: Really good place for drinks and hang out. Haven't tried food yet , but the environment is really cool. Liked it ....
author: Mr B.

description:
Love love LOVE it here. It's a hidden gem in TL. 

Great vibe - perfect spot for brunch. Amazing part is that there are no lines and the cocktails are fantastic. Sit out by the pool on a warm, sunny day and you'll feel like you stepped into 70's miami.
author: Nadine H.

description:
Sketch neighborhood. But then you walk in and it's like...being transported. Dark, sexy, cool. There's a backroom bar that has a more open feel if you're not in the market for a full sit-down dinner. 

I only had drinks, the spicy cucumber something. But as I was walking out I saw other people's food, and it looked really fancy-tasty-cool.

I'd come back here for a small group thing - maybe a cool birthday party spot in the back room. Or, just a change from the normal mission or financial district after work thing.
author: Shanee B.

description:
Truly, this place is a-ok. Main points:

-Pretty good food: jerusalem artichoke soup was intriguing and apparently I'm a sucker for squid ink. Truffle ricotta was dependable, even though the bread was perfunctory. A lot of people were getting the burger so if I ever came back here, I'd try that. 

-Meh cocktails: drinks are so-so and a bit imbalanced. The Gin Drink sounded promising but needed a lot more cava to balance the overwhelming flavor of cynar. (Don't know what that is? Neither did I until I googled it in front of the waitress. Education + technology ftw.)

-Atmosphere: cute, hidden away vibe. 

Unfortunately this was more of a cubic zirconia in the rough than a diamond in the rough experience.
author: Nora M.

description: Delicious brunch, with a fun atmosphere.  Walls are covered with shelves of old records, and I wouldn't be surprised to see Ron Burgundy at the bar or Greg and Marcia Brady by the pool.  Dark interior, but nice outdoor seating if you can get a table.  Parking is non-existent, so be prepared to circle the neighborhood if you're driving.  Had a reservation and didn't need to wait for a table.
author: Sancho T.

description:
Overall, I think Chambers was spot on.  The reason I would come back to Chambers is for the ambiance.  We came here to test out the restaurant for an upcoming 40th birthday party.  We made a reservation and we were promptly seated:

Ambiance - Super Cool on the inside.  You really do forget you are in the heart of the tenderloin and saw some of the most interesting people you've seen all week only seconds before stepping in.

Food - Basically a hit or miss.
*Loved : Spiced Bar Nuts, both Steaks we tried and the Burger.  Probably one of the best burgers I have had in the city.  Very juicy. Lyonnaise salad was also very tasty.
*Okay : Chicken Liver Pate, Truffle dip with waffle chips which were a little too greasy.
The major miss for us was the Tombo Tuna which came out totally unseasoned.  When we sent it back the chef acknowledged it had not been seasoned but, we still paid for it and did not receive a replacement.

Service - I wish I knew our server's name because he was AMAZING (no pun intended).  He went above and beyond and really helped us through the menu by offering some great suggestions with both food and drinks.

Updated after discussing with friend since our service deserved 10 stars!
author: Denise G.

description:
Overall, it was a solid place.

I liked the vibe and decor. It was not overcrowded and I think before midnight the outside is open to lounge. 

Had to wait in line for awhile; seems they try to keep the place from getting overly crowded and/or just to create a line.
author: Matthew T.

description: Really great food and great atmosphere! Brought my husband here for brunch (he is extremely picky) and he raved about how good it is!
author: Randi B.

description:
Delicious!!! Pork belly w soft boiled eggs, shared a piece of coffee cake, and a cucumber mimosa. Coffee is in your own French press, and presentation is beautiful!
 Service a little slow
author: Laura M.

description: So the neighborhood is a little sketchy and the outside definitely seems a little questionable.  The food is 5 stars the service is more than adequate and inside Is very well appointed and pretty damn classy.  The manager Patrick turned a good experience to a great one and his kindness and conversation was the highlight of the evening!
author: Levi T.

description:
Well, it is in a sketchy area, and we were admiring the I *heart* TL T-shirts in the shop across the street while waiting for doors to open. Once you get past that and go inside you feel like you just stepped into the 1960's. This is mid-century modern done exquisitely. But, on to the food. Went here for brunch on a Sunday. We had reservations and were seated in the heated patio area overlooking the funky motel/hotel Phoenix pool area.  The food from top to bottom was delcious. A little slow with drinks and food, but our reservation was at 10:30 right when it opens and staff was still filtering in. And they warn you on menu their kitchen is small, I'll give them that. 

Overall, we definitely will go back. Food was very good, bloody mary's, mimosas (esp cucumber one), were yummy.  Next time we wanted to check out dinner/drinks at night.
author: Chrissy M.

description: I loved Chambers! My friend and I ventured through the Tenderloin for brunch; she got the Chambers burger, and I had the egg in a hole with a chicken apple sausage substitution (thank you, waiter, for being so sneaky and kind!). Both items were delicious, and we spent a good 10 minutes after we finished taking pictures of the cute "BE AMAZING" sign. Knocking off a star because the area around the Phoenix smells like straight up piss.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Threw my wife a dinner party here for her birthday. We were a group of 12 and were situated in the bar/lounge area adjacent to the "Be Amazing" sign. Isabel was my event planner and I had been coordinating with her for some weeks to help organize the evening. Isabel was extremely courteous and always responded promptly to any inquires I had and she was instrumental in planning the dinner to even its most minute details. 

We settled on a 3 course prix fixe menu consisting of a couple options for each course. I wish I could say the food came out in a timely manner but there were long periods of waiting between courses. Not a big deal for me since I was just soaking up the atmosphere and good company and pounding the Jack n' Cokes, but I can see myself getting annoyed under different circumstances. The food itself didn't knock my socks off but it was good. I would rate it 3.5 stars. 

Service was solid and amiable. I have been to Chambers a couple times in the past and will continue to do so even more now considering my dining experience here. I just love the hip, trendy, and chic decor and the clientele here is more my crowd.
author: Derrek O.

description:
Drinks: The cocktails are really good, especially the vodka jalapeno drink.  The wines are good as well, though they are pretty pricey by the glass.

Food:  Good, but not the kind that will make you yell from the rooftops.  I had the steak and my friend had the snapper (I think it was snapper).  We both liked it, the portions were moderate, and my steak was cooked to the right degree (medium rare).  The appetizers, especially the truffle dip, left a little bit to be desired.

Atmosphere:  Great.  It is fancy without being pretentious.  There is a lounge in the back that is great and can be used without doing dinner.  The restaurant itself has a small bar near the host desk that you can grab a drink while waiting for a table.  

Extra tips:  1. Make a reservation if possible. 2.  The neighborhood is not the nicest (Tenderloin-ish), but the building is very secure and there is an employee posted at the front door.  Once you are inside, you forget the neighborhood outside and can enjoy the decor inside and the view of the hotel pool.

This space would be great for birthdays, a date, etc. but I wouldn't come with a group of more than 6.
author: Kellan M.

description: Fantastic ambiance! If you love mid-century interior design, this place does it right. The food was pretty good too - loved the pate and pork belly, but the burger was a little lackluster.
author: Carly B.

description:
Came here on New Years Day and it was surprisingly packed, with a mimosa in almost everybody's hand (or not surprisingly packed? Hair of the dog, as they say). We arrived at around 1:50 pm, not knowing that the kitchen closed at 2:30, but the hostess was nice enough to let us know she wasn't sure if we'd get seats, but she'd try. We ended up getting seated shortly after and I'm glad we did. I enjoyed my pork belly plate and the flavors of the kale and gochujang, but I do wish the pork belly had been crisper to offset the fat... I love fat probably more than the average person, but some balance would have been nice. My bf got the spanish omelet which was delicious. It wasn't like a typical omelet but more tamago style. The mimosa had a unique flavor, since it had chartreuse and cucumber in it along with orange juice. 
I also enjoyed this place due to the ambiance. Love how it looks like an old school warm, velvety library with hundreds of old vinyls. This would be a good place to come back and indulge in a bottomless mimosa brunch.
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday party on a Saturday night. I had a good time once I got over the inequality between the bar's patrons and its neighbors.

Ambiance is good, drinks were tasty, crowd seemed classy.

Not sure I would go back on my own, but if a friend is having an event I would. I prefer dancing at clubs over these types of bars.
author: Max H.

description:
BE AMAZING!!!!!

Let's keep this short and sweet.

Food: Best burger with pork belly!

Awesome drinks: Love their spicy cucumber drink! (forgot the name)

Ambiance: BE AMAZING enough said.....
author: Bevo T.

description:
Came here for brunch with my husband on the recommendation of a good friend. Unlike most reviewers the area didn't bother us and we got a great parking spot right outside. We also had no problems finding the restaurant and got sat right away. All which sounds like the start of a great review... 

We both got bloody's, his with vodka mine with gin, both we not spicy enough and for $9 a pop they were a rip off. 

My husband got the burger which was good. Salty, sweet combination due to perfectly caramelized onion marmalade, and   It was perfectly cooked - but $15 for a burger. Not quite worth it.

I got the eggs royale which on the menu sounded delicious: 'two sous vide eggs, crispy hash browns, cold smoked trout, mandarin hollandaise, caviar, chive, dill, creme fraiche'. The hash browns where not crispy at all though the menu clearly said 'crispy hash browns'. It came with smoked salmon not smoked trout like stated on the menu and the dish basically tasted the color it was... Beige. To say the dish needed salt is an understatement. 

Overall this place is over priced and super mediocre, we ended up spending $50 on food that wasn't worth the hype. Thankfully the service was friendly and good, but that doesn't save a food establishment.
author: Rachel C.

description: Chambers is a hidden gem in the tenderloin. Loved the vintage decor and dim lighting which gives this restaurant a romantic vibe. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Drinks were delicious as well as the food, I would definitely recommend the smoked grit fries and the hanger steak.
author: Silvia A.

description:
I like this place...the food, ambiance, decor.  But their bathrooms are the MOST disgusting bathrooms I have ever been in.  The smell like the have be bathed in urine and the lights are do dim you can't even see anything.  I would expect bathrooms like like at Vertigo....but NOT somewhere I plan on EATING AT.

DISGUSTING.
author: Megan H.

description:
Chambers is my FAVORITE restaurant in the city. The food is to die for and the ambiance is inspiring. How can you not feel like a rock star while drinking champagne under the "Be Amazing" sign?

Must-haves include: Sizzling Kobe Beef, Tombo Tuna and the Snapper.

Love, love, love.
author: Karen G.

description:
I can't stop thinking about their Bloody Marys. 

They don't taste like any other Bloody Mary I've ever had (and bloodys are my favorite). Maybe it's a little bit more bisque-y? Creamy? Maybe it's the nearly whole peppercorns? They can't be using standard hot sauce...

Whatever it is, I'm hooked. Their brunch menu is also pretty much to die for, with something for everyone. Portions are perfect for curing your hangover without making you too full. The omelette I had was perfectly cooked. And I broke vegetarianism (that's been happening a lot lately...), and partook in a biscuit with gravy, which was everything I'd been dreaming of and more. 

It's random in the Tenderloin, but entirely welcome. 

Reservations are definitely recommended for the evenings (a friend and I tried to go and were turned back by a 45-minute wait), but so far, you should be ok without one in the mornings. That might not last though, as brunch is a recent new-offering.
author: Allison S.

description:
I like this spot, its cool inside, and it has an awesome pool area outside.
Decent looking people and ok drinks. 
The location kinda suck, though. But I still like it, and go once in a while with my friends.
author: Paula C.

description:
Pricey but the food is actually good. I had the polenta, salad, and the burger, all savory dishes. I also love the ambiance of this place. It is classy, fun, and lively. 

They also have a bar in the back. Also very classy and fun. 

The entrance is also kind of secretive, and hard to find. Look for the giant KEY on wall, the door is right next to it. 

I came back here several times!
author: Jamie T.

description:
Cool, cool. This place is #1 for ambiance IMO. Set in the rock-n-roll themed Phoenix Hotel, this place is definately rocks, and is arguably one of the top five lounges in the city. The 'Be Fabulous' section  of the lounge was being used for a private party 
( great idea!) & the place was jumping at 6:30 on a Saturday! The wait staff was nice enough to let us use a table that was reserved at 7:30, so we could have some cocktails before dinner. The decor & lighting great, the cocktails are reasonable for this town ( $10-$11) and well made. If you are going with friends, call ahead & book one of the booths in the lounge or the swank couch by the fireplace in the entry bar.
author: Jen S.

description: If you want an just OK drink in a somewhat nice design, hipster atmosphere than Chambers is the place to be. Chambers has a very limited menu and what they do have, when ordered you will receive it COLD and not great tasting. How can you serve COLD fries? I can overlook a lot but when you are also dealing with an INEPT server it is just too much, there are a lot of great restaurant choices in SF and this is not one. Too bad because the interior designer did a great job. To top it all off for the 6 of us we got charged a mandatory 20% tip that was not deserved. If the server was great I have no problem being generous. Chambers food and service is barely a 1-Star.
author: K E.

description:
Maybe you've heard this one before: 6 people are standing at a bar on a Friday afternoon, a 7th shows up. How long before the bartender takes his order? If you guessed 7 minutes, you are correct. Then he made some other people's drinks, and it took another 4 to get mine. 11 minutes total. 

The bartender knew this was weird and thanked me for my "patience," which helps, but doesn't really fix it. It wasn't busy. I was getting texts from my table asking if I left. 

Also, no beers on tap. Bottles of local brews were $6. Not surprising in a hotel bar, but this is the TL. You can walk about a block and get a beer and a shot for $5. 

Meh.
author: Rob R.

description:
The restaurant is located in THE shadiest part of SF- deep in the 'loin. 

What you want to do if you're walking there is really to just walk briskly, hold your breath (coz the sidewalks reek of urine and other nastiness), locate the main entrance and propel yourself in ASAP. 

If you're taking a cab, have them drop you off right in front of the non-descript door and barrel your way in. 
Don't linger outside. 
It really is Shades McGades (and i live a mile away on Nob Hill). 

I've been here for brunch and for Happy Hour

Happy Hour: awesome food. My fave there was the kobe beef over small charcoal grill. the meat was tender, buttery and perfect; i had 1.5 servings All to myself. 
The burger that everyone raves about was good but not memorable. 

Brunch: good but not remarkable. It is, however, The place for 20 something hipsters and marina chicks to hang out on Sunday mornings; you've been warned. 

If you're here for a drink and don't want to stay for dinner, venture to Lers Ros Thai across the street- cheap and best Thai food in the city
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
I would give this place a zero if I could

We got here with a reservation for saturday brunch. We did saturday because of the botomless mimosa's. When we arrived there was nobody at the front of the house, she was off serving customers or taking care of something (not 100% sure). When she did arrive she took our reservation and we were seated

Right when we sat down the waitress told us they were already running out of orange juice so if we got mimosa's we would basically just be drinking champagne with a tiny tiny bit of orange juice. So right off the bat we were disappointed, and we were no where near the end of brunch service, its not like we walked in 30 minutes before closing. So we just ordered some other drinks (i got water, everyone else got other mixed drinks), we looked over the menu and as we ordered the waitress then told us that 2 of the 3 items we ordered had been 86'd. At this point I had enough. 

They only do bottomless mimosa's 1 day a week. So the food and beverage manager should be more then prepared for something like that. You know almost everyone is going to order them, so why not just prepare a ton of orange juice. If it was their first few weeks open I would understand, maybe they don't know how many people would actually show up for something like that. But this far into being open you should know to stock up on orange juice. Unless this is a tactic by the owners to draw people in and when they get there just have enough to last you for maybe an hour and then run out.

Also the Executive Chef is also responsible for ordering food and food prep in the mornings. So if anything does run out its on him/her.

After all this I was upset and asked for the check, it took a while. When it finally did come I expected it to only have 3 drinks on it. But of course when I look down, they rang us up for BOTTOMLESS MIMOSA's!!!!! so i totaled up the drinks we had, paid in cash and told the waitress she charged us for mimosa'. She explained it must have been left over from someone elses order and instead of waiting for her to fix the mistake i just put the money on the table and left. 

I guess the moral of the story is, if you want bottomless mimosa's or something that is popular on the menu, come right in the morning when they open, an hour and a half after that and its all 50/50 whether you are going to get it or not
author: Joseph Y.

description:
We came here for dinner. The space is really cute and I've heard that the outdoor space is even nicer for brunch. 

The truffle dip is really rich and I wasn't sure I liked it, then found myself craving it all week. The rest of the food was nice, too. Everything was fairly light, not huge portions, which was nice.
author: Nina M.

description: These guys are in an obscure location on The Tenderloin, but their food, their ambience, their workers are first class. On the grounds of the Hotel Phoenix...owned back on the day by a famous female rock star...the place is compfy still with fun and odd folk. Crystal cold Schramsberg Rose by the glass, fun molecular cuisine apps that work, killer ingredients....and a bar lined with all the record albums you owned, loved, and walked away from back in the day.
author: Michael J.

description: I went here with my husband because the reviews were good and we were heading to a concert nearby. Completely underwhelmed by the food. Interior is cool and drinks seemed fine, but the food is lackluster so drink your dinner!
author: K C.

description:
Appetizers you must try: 

Sizzling tri tip: Thinking about this appetizer is making my mouth watery. Pieces of small, rare tri tip is placed on a sizzling stone and bought to your table while it's still cooking. Just flip each piece over once and you get a rare to medium piece that's still bursting with flavor. Meat lovers orgasm in every bite.

Truffle chips:  The chips tasted like ones you'd get off a bag of Lay's, but it actually went really well with the truffle dip. There are chunks of mushroom in there, so don't be surprised when you taste something chunky.

Chicken pate: I didn't think I'd like this dish because I normally like other kinds of pate, but it was VERY tasty. The pate was almost like butter and you spread it over a buttered, garlic crostini. Simply deliciousness.
author: Rosie W.

description: A great hidden oasis in the tenderloin. Arguably the best bar in the area. They also have Allagash on tap...good times
author: Mister T.

description:
Ambiance is great here.....Arguably top 5 lounge in san francisco. A little hard to find since there is no sign but once your inside it's quite a scene.
I recommend a pomegranate spice for ginger cocktail lovers
For ladies the Cusco cocktail if they have it....get you where you wanna be.
author: Devin S.

description:
Come for drinks, NOT FOR FOOD. The environment of this place and ambience are on par with some of my favorite places in the city. The vinyls, the music, the mood lighting. The cocktails are ok point and great bartenders. 

The food... confit duck breast with seasonal vegetables? Texture of baloney and void of flavor. Vegetables varying in texture and preparation, but all unfortunately off. Burger would seem easy, but for $16 you expect some kind of mastery. Unfortunately even the sautéed onions lacked inspiration (my dead grandmother could sauté a better scallion and she's dead, bless her). Why, why does a chef have his name on the menu when he lacks recognition?

Come for cocktails and sexy date. Go else where for food.
author: James L.

description: We enjoyed such a great evening at Chambers last night "BE AMAZING" is spot on as the service, food and cocktails were truly just that. AMAZING.  I will be flying back into the city in 2 weeks and have already booked another dinner reservation. Can not wait to taste whatever Joel is mixing up at the bar!
author: Jaime L.

description:
2 days later.....I still can't stop raving about how good the food is here!!!  5 stars are hard to come by for me in the Tenderloin but here is one of the few that have met my list and one that I will have to come back to despite the shady neighborhood!

I went here this past Saturday night for a friends birthday dinner.  My friends partner had all the appetizers and sides pre-ordered and picked out and boy were they really really good choices!!!!  Let me go down the list:

appetizers:
truffle dip - might be a bit overpowering for some but it was just right for me!
spinach salad - not your ordinary spinach salad ;)
smoking hamachi - great smoky flavor and then hamachi, ooowee it was fresh!!!
sizzling kobe tri-tip - yes......sizzling kobe tri-tip, need I say more??
foie gras torchon - first time i had foie gras....not bad and the flavor was def rich! 

sides:
trumpet royale mushrooms - yuuuuuummmmy!!!
crisp polenta - i wasn't so much of a fan, it was a bit too dry for my taste
asparagus - perfect!

Yes, we had all of those!!!!  We were a party of 13 I believe and boy did we devour all of it!!  For my BIG bite, I had escolar which was a white fish.  I devoured it like I hadn't ate all those appetizers.  There was something on my plate called forbidden rice....it's the first I've heard of it but hmm...it was really interesting.  It had a subtle flavor and nothing distict, it really was just like rice although I should say it looked like a burnt brownie on my plate LOL.  

As far as drinks go, they have a full bar.  I loved the "BE AMAZING" sign, it reminded me of Vegas!  Very classy looking bar, nice seating with leather couches.  The restaurant had an over all contemporary feel to it which I really liked.  Ohhhh I should say, don't leave this bar without Juicy Pussy ;) first time I had it and I loved it! LOL  

I can't wait to come back here :D trust me..........you will NOT be disappointed.
author: Mary-Anne C.

description: Love the place. Apparently they had a remodel and let me tell you. It is AMAZING. You'll know what I mean when you go in the back room. Food looked and smelled good but unfortunately I did not indulge. Definitely going for brunch though.  More to come after a brunch.
author: Anthony H.

description:
So random.

Tenderloin? You have to expect and, er, eclectic crowd and just to put it bluntly, some people who really shouldn't be in swimwear,....ever. If the sight of a hood rat  turned whale squeezed into a ziploc bag doesn't bother you, then you will adore Chambers. 

Wonderful pool and lounge type feel, cut off from the dangerous neighborhood surrounding it. It literally feels like an urban oasis. A group of friends and I spent our Sunday poolside in a cabana, which was perfect as it was a hot, hot day in the city. The bartender was super sweet and made me a wonderful cocktail based off of simply my interests. Great place for groups.

*Avoid the pool, it's warm and feels like one of those piss infested kiddie pools.
author: Meredith M.

description: Love this place. The atmosphere is awesome, mellow & swanky. The food is always good & I love that they have sparkling rose by the glass. Happy girl whenever I leave here.
author: S. M.

description: Came w/ my friend to grab a drink. We were immediately seated at the bar. There are 2 bars, but one of them is only open during dinner time (the one w/ the super pretty "be amazing" sign). The bartender told us that if we didn't want to sit at the bar, we could ask the host if we can sit in this private area right before the other bar area. This private area is right next to the walkway towards the other bar & bathroom. It's so cute w/ 2 big chairs and a table. The host gave us the okay so we migrated over. It was like no one else was there but us! So cool. We stayed for a bit and drank. Their bourbon/lemonade is delish!
author: Justine O.

description:
Well hey there sexy.

This place has come a LONG way since the old Bambuddha Lounge.  You would never think it was the same space.  The classy sexy interior and very good classic cocktails are enough to turn me into an alcoholic.  Again. Three times over.  #7 and #9 are my usuals.

I want to crawl around naked on the old-school leather couches in the lounge like I'm in a white snake video.  But I didn't.  But I should.  And maybe I did.

The sizzling kobe is addictive!  Granted it comes to you pretty rare so I cook mine a little longer on that hot stone, but once it's medium, I'm all over it with my side of parmesan polenta.

Chambers has quickly become a regular in my rotation of places to imbibe in liquid sin.  I mean, they play great classic rock for gods sake.  But I will say that I never usually stay past 10:30/11:00 on a Friday or Saturday night.  It gets quite clubby in here around then, which is my que to split and mosy on over to my other watering hole.

Don't be afraid to walk past the bums and addicts, skipping over a few needles and knives.  (i kid...maybe..) Chambers is a perfect little gem in the middle of our colorful TL that you should definitely experience.
author: Juv C.

description: One of my favorite restaurants in the city! While the food is always tasty and creative, Chambers is all about ambience. I order the sizzling Kobe almost every time I go. Last time I dined here, I reluctantly tried the all veggie entree and that was amazing, too. The Happy hour is also great!
author: Nadine M.

description: Went here before Book of Mormon and was convenient for its location.  Staff was slow but they were busy getting everyone taken care of who needed to leave in time for the same show.  Would come back here again.
author: Nicholas K.

description: Nice looking bar, friendly staff, reasonably priced drinks and I love that the outside patio is open until 11. Not many places in SF have an outdoor area so I'm very appreciative of that.
author: Lina M.

description:
We had an incredibly disappointing brunch here today.

I made a reservation weeks ago to celebrate my friend's birthday. There were 4 of us in our group, and the restaurant was nearly empty. And yet...the service was TERRIBLE. It took over an hour for our "starter" (coffee cake) to come out - and it was burned. The rest of our food showed up 20 minutes later. We did not understand the delay and asked several times, as the few other occupied tables seemed to get theirs very quickly. We also had to ask 3 different people to turn on our space heater on the patio. 

The icing on the cake was that we wanted to split the (...way overpriced...$160) bill on 3 cards, and I even wrote out instructions since I was trying to pay for my friend's meal (i.e. "person A - $40, person B - $85") AND explained it to our waitress (after having to hunt her down inside for us to pay). She still mixed it up and charged all of us the wrong amounts. We were just so over it (since it had been 2 hours since we sat down!) so we just paid the wrong amounts and left, and I found an ATM to pay back my friends. It was super frustrating.
author: Kelly B.

description:
I had Sunday brunch here with a group of 11. The restaurant was able to take a large reservation on a Sunday which was part of the reason why we chose this place.

I had the smoke salmon, egg, and hash brown. It was just OK in my opinion, everything besides the salmon tasted a bit bland. My friend got the french toast and that was very good.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Great place for drinks and dinner, we did both.

If you want to impress a date or feel hip this is definitely a place to go.  I am endlessly searching for places in SF that feel a little swanky and getting dressed up for will be fun.  Chambers definitely hits home with both of those aspects. 

Their food is quite delicious as well! We ordered a bunch and although I was on a date, I wanted to SHOVE ALL THE FOOD IN MY MOUTH like the little piglet that I am,  but I had to restrain myself.  However, what I was able to taste, was wonderful :)

I think its also important to know that although the place has a very drink/lounge centered vibe, their service doesn't get neglected for people going for dinner. They are just as attentive as a restaurant that focuses solely on dining.  Our waiter was great and never once rushed us, in fact we were there for hours just talking and eating at a really comfy pace.  Given we were still drinking and ordering food as we went along, most other places usually start asking when you want dessert or "are you done with that?" ... neither of those annoying questions happened here.

As a side note, they played awesome music all night.  Several times during our convo we both had to stop and ask each other if the other person knew the song that was playing, needless to say we had lots of fun with shazam :)

Put it on the list.
author: Sunny D.

description: Cool lounge/bar with a good selection of handcrafted cocktails. We tried the burger, tots, and fries. All of which were really good. If you're going to eat there have a reservation. Or go chill outside on the cool throwback pool/hotel area.
author: Chad C.

description:
I recently helped plan a birthday in the lounge area on a Friday evening. The hostesses at Chambers were extremely helpful and responsive in helping me with my reservation. I initially wanted to reserve the U-shaped sofa area in the lounge, but it was already booked. I ended up reserving the side section with one long side of banquette seating, 3 small tables, and a few chairs. This area easily accomodated my group of about 15 friends. 

When I arrived for my 9pm reservation, there were a few patrons sitting in my reserved area. Chrissie helped clear the tables for me and the night was off to a great start!

My friends and I had a great time here! My out-of-town friends really liked Chambers. A DJ spun loungey music, and the lounge area was busy, but not crowded. There were pockets of dancing here and there. A waitress came by often to take our drink orders. Whenever the hostess wasn't around, it was easy to get a drink at the bar. 

I highly recommend Chambers if your group is looking for a hip, central place to grab drinks, but still have a place to sit and chat without yelling over the music. I did have to put down my credit card to reserve the area, but Chambers assured me that they would only charge my card if we did not show up. There was no minimum tab and we were able to order appetizers and snacks.
author: Monelle A.

description:
I had my birthday dinner here and the place exceeded my expectations. I had a party of 10 and we got to sit in a cozy corner surrounded by old records and perfectly dimmed lighting. Our food tasted amazing and the drinks were tasty-each of my friends found a new favorite cocktail! My only complaint was the slow service. I only noticed because we had somewhere to be after dinner, but otherwise it would not have been an issue. My friends loved the place too.

Super sexy vibe at the bar and at the pool outside.
author: Amy G.

description:
Absolutely AMAZING!! My gf and I went here and ordered the pancake soufflé and the french toast.  It was out of this world!  the french toast I was nervous about because it says it is spiced and has bourbon, but they said it is still sweet and I wouldn't tate the bourbon, but it would contribute to the taste. The waiter was absolutely right, the french toast was incredible. The pancake soufflé was amazing... we were both quiet from beginning to end because the breakfast was so delicious. 

We are looking forward to visiting san francisco to go to chambers again.
author: Dianna C.

description: my husband and i really love this place for brunch.  everything is done to perfection.  coffee is great, service is great, and atmosphere is fun.  highly recommend it for brunch.
author: Yasi N.

description:
SUCH a fan. So much character! 

Front room "BE AMAZING" bar. Good DJ music and dancing. Continue in through a hallway into an old-school vinyl room with just stacks and stacks and stacks of vinyl and tables to just straight chill with a draank. Then the last bar room with space to stand and chill to the music. 

Overall fun vibes, and LOVED the decor. Drinks were strong, and there was a pool area outside as well! #SCORE
author: Monalisa M.

description:
This place looks so different from its previous Bambuddah Lounge name. 
Really love the sleek and trendy decor and the outside looks nice too.

Just came for drinks, and luckily they have a fun drink menu.

def. coming back!
author: Yas G.

description: Wow, this place is impressive. Wait and host are really friendly. The menu selection was great. The pork belly is a mustt. Came here for a birthday dinner. The vibe is hip and kinda takes you back to the time of record players. I love the"Be Amazing" lighted up sign by the bar in the back. It's connected to a motel with a pool.
author: Holla F.

description: Super fun experience! Great place to take people from out of town. Trendy, delicious, and great ambiance.
author: Anna K.

description:
Giving 3 stars to this place might be a bit cold hearted, because overall I do thinks it's worth checking it out and I didn't have any major problems...it's just not making it to my top 10 list. 

I went here for a birthday, and was very impressed by the inside decor, the drinks were quite good too, and the service was pretty fast. 

BUT: you can't smoke outside in the patio around the pool, which at least to me it seemed silly, because it's outside - I know a lot of people will try to throw stones at me right now, believe me, I'm not your obnoxious smoker, I will step aside and not blow smoke in your face. Also, being in the Tenderloin, you will have not just your usual homeless people and beggars, but quite a few very mad and yelling individuals, crackheads when you have to smoke on the sidewalk etc...

At the end of the day, the Phoenix hotel that is the home for Chambers used to be this huge SF celebrity spot in the 80s, and it's good to relive that a bit :-) We didn't have any food, but the dishes looked great, the crowd was OK, so it's worth checking it out.

HOT OFF THE PRESS: I got a very nice message from Sean M. from Chambers (very nice touch Sean!), explaining that they are just obeying the San Francisco's Department of Health regulations which prevent smoking just about anywhere in San Francisco now. He also mentioned that the celebrities are still there every now and then, so keep your eyes open! With this said, I can be easily influenced by good customer service, and this was part of it for me, so I'm raising my stars to 4.
author: Timea B.

description:
I don't typically swear in my writing, but this place is fucking cool!

After a dinner at Jardiniere, we wandered over to Chambers to Drink + Drink, if you know what I mean!  It's an awesome spot - walking up, it looks like an old motel, in fact, that's what it is.  Except that as you enter Chambers, you realize that it oozes ambiance in such a way as to know it's cool, but without being too cool about being cool.  It's a sexy mix of filthy rockstar and high fashion world traveler, with a touch more emphasis on the fashionista perhaps.

There is a bar right at the entrance, serving up $10 specialty cocktails - we tried the Aviation and Vodka Drink, both of which were awesome.  I also noticed that they were selling the "Blood and Sand" like it was going out of style, so it might be a good one to try.

We wandered off to check out the rest of the bar and found ourselves outside on the patio which melds into the courtyard of the motel, which also has a pool that is lit bright blue and has a few [motel, I think] guests taking a dip.  There's also some table arrangements and an eclectic mix of people hanging out, conversing, drinking, smoking, and what not.  I told it was cool.

When we finished our drinks, we headed back inside and to the back bar, where we were reminded to "BE AMAZING!"  We ordered a couple drinks and chatted with a few people.  It was funny, because they were shocked that some out of towners knew to find our way to this place.  In any case, when they caught wind of our recent engagement, they bought us a few rounds of beers and shots - so, thanks to those guys and girls!

After a bit more fun, we called it a night, and jumped into a cab back to our hotel.  Chambers was a killer spot for a night cap and the perfect place for us to end a great night!
author: Nathan B.

description: I only went for Drinks, but I think my whole group really enjoyed it. Two big bars, plenty of space for carousing, some dancing - no requirement for it though.
author: Greg F.

description:
I came here recently for GNO and of course birthday of a good friend of mine. The drinks here are pretty good! I liked the "Vodka Drink". Mind you, it's not as lethal as it sounds. It's a mixture of stoli, elderflower liquor, basil and lime. It was really refreshing! My boyfriend eventually rolled around after dinner and had a drink that was mixed of rum and ginger beer. I actually really liked that drink too and for me to say that is rare since I don't like rum at all.

The food on the other hand though was MEH. I really wouldn't come back for the food. I had the duck breast. The texture was good but the flavor was unimpressive. We had an appetizer of chips w/ their truffled dip. The truffled dip was good, but I wasn't a big fan of the chips. They were a bit stale?

Overall, I may come back for drinks, but not so much on the food.
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Solid food, but a great bar.  Bar and restaurant staff are always super helpful and friendly.  

I'm a fan of their steak, burgers and the always yummy truffle dip.

Always full of interesting people and whilst a bit hipster, the place still has a refined atmosphere.  Considering the location, that's no mean feat.
author: Ali B.

description:
Wow. 

My husband and I have been coming to Chambers about twice a month since it opened. We live nearby and we were really excited when something opened in our neighborhood that we could actually take friends and clients to. 

The staff have always been generally good and some even great over the last few months. 

However, on our last visit, the cold, unwelcoming service we received really topped it off for us. 

I wouldn't consider myself a regular, but I recognize most of the staff so I figure that sometimes they remember me. And some of them do and are very nice. 

We saddled up to the bar and tried to order a couple of cocktails. I said "hello, how are you?". The bartender, eastern European woman, I think, looked at us, turned around and helped someone else. No problem, maybe we weren't next, maybe she was in the middle of something. 15 minutes go by, and she's on the other side of the bar, talking to co workers. Finally, she makes it over to us, and said, "what are you having?". I'm thinking, ok, everyone has a bad day, it happens. 

We ordered some food, a few staples, and a couple more drinks and wine. I asked her how this one glass of red wine was and to describe it, she said, "it's good" and kept staring at me. She made what we both thought was rude comments as if we were inconveniencing her. 

It started to pick up and get busier, and people were ordering around us, and she was getting more and more annoyed with everyone around her, customers and coworkers! She was mumbling things under her breath and giving annoyed looks to people. 

I swear I thought we were on an episode of Punk'd. It was like watching a cartoon. 

I asked one of the staff that was walking by, a server maybe, about what was wrong with her, is she ok, like maybe her cat died?  

She said, "oh she's always like that! We all just ignore her". 

Anyway. We left with a very bad taste in our mouth. Some people just shouldn't be in the SERVICE industry.

I should mention, on the flip side, her co worker seemed very nice and accommodating. We chose the wrong side of the bar to sit. :(
author: Jenny M.

description:
Ate brunch here today and had the pork belly. It was not delicious.

I had a Bloody Mary. Also not delicious. Fun bar, but I don't know that I'd eat brunch there again.
author: Earl M.

description: Great food. Good drinks. Cool space. -3 stars because male bartender is hostile to Asian girls and makes them wait the longest for drinks. Others have noticed this too. When he finally gets to an Asian girl he very rude. Not sure what's up with that.
author: h h.

description: My wife and I went here around midnight for her Birthday after a night on the town.  We had an incredible experience here.  There was an awesome crowd of people having a great time all around.  The bartenders were great and interactive, and most importantly, they made us great cocktails! Don't let the location being close to the tenderloin scare you off, this place is awesome and well worth being near the tenderloin.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Bourbon for breakfast.

Syrup that is. Vanilla whip cream too. Poolside.

Part of Chambers' new brunch. With a pool. Reservations encouraged.

Aforementioned challah bread french toast topped was topped with macerated cherries. It was very good. Also very expensive. Twenty bucks including a shared French press.

Server was nice but there was a long lag between being handed a menu and having our order taken. Food was prompt.

Loved the scene. Loved the meal. Did not love the price.
author: Jason B.

description:
We had Pork belly and Egg in hole.
Egg in hole: the egg in the toasted brioche were a very good combination. The egg was soft and well-cooked. The brioche is crispy.
author: Rouise L.

description: Ate here on a Friday night in March 2016.  The ambience was lovely and with very cool decor.  While the food was very good and really tasty, we ordered a bottle of wine from their very expensive wine list - we were so disappointed with it, it was so bad we couldn't finish it. It's unbelievable that a restaurant that charges like this would even have something on their menu that was so un-drinkable.  Our server was inattentive and not very friendly. A disappointing experience and we won't be back.
author: D F.

description:
Came here for a birthday brunch and was treated right! 
 Lucky Lemonade(whiskey and lemonade) and Eggs Royale = happy belly.
Our server, Amos, was stellar.  Friendly, attentive and service with a genuine smile. 
The hostess accommodated our request to sit facing the records.  Great food, service, atmosphere, service and drinks!  Looking forward to coming back.
author: Angelica G.

description: Tasty, tasty drinks. Chic interior from the moment you walk through the door. Walk towards the back and you'll find reserved tables but a welcoming bar with the words, "BE AMAZING" written out in electric lights serving as a background. I ordered drink #7 (several times over) and instantly knew it was going to be a good night. Drink #7, or Cusco, has aged brugal rum, lime, ginger beer, and cinnamon bitters. I cannot emphasize how much i love this place and will be bringing friends here for HH often in the near future.
author: Samantha L.

description:
"Sexy Ambiance, Cool Vinyl Record Vibe, Delicious Food"

I'll start with the one and only CON of this restaurant. It's in the hood. From the outside, it looks like a shack. As our uber driver parked to drop us off, I thought he had seriously made a wrong turn. But, once you walk inside, you will not be disappointed.

PROS:
1. Delicious food and cocktails. I had the pre-fix menu, and loved everything. I added the wine pairing but probably would not next time - the wines were all great, but the pours were a bit skimpy. My husband had the hanger steak entree and it was fantastic. The cous cous was a bit too salty for us but everything else was top notch, including the salads and dessert.
2. Service was fun and professional. We had made a reservation ahead of time and our table was all set for us upon arrival. It was our anniversary and they treated us to two glasses of sparkling rose on the house which was a nice touch.
3. The ambiance is dark, sexy, intimate and unique. The place is decked out with vinyl records, interesting lighting fixtures, and two beautiful bars. 
4. It is definitely not touristy. After being in the Union Square and Fisherman Wharf areas for 4 days, this was a refreshing, local change of pace.
5. The attached old school motel is funky - a great place to grab drinks before or after dinner, sit around the pool and people watch.

Note: this place is best for a more liberal crowd. A conservative southern traditionalist probably would not appreciate the quirkiness as much as I do. But I loved it and would definitely go back.
author: Nikki V.

description:
If you can find the door you're in for a treat.

A small group dropped in for a quick bite before a show.  We glanced around looking for clear signage.  We almost walked past it before someone in our group spotted the door.  The reception area is kind of dim, it may take a second to get your bearings if there's even the slightest bit of daylight left outside.

It was 6 o'clock, there was a decent happy hour crowd hovering around the bar areas. But most of the tables were empty.  We were seated as soon as our group was assembled.

I chose the Chambers Burger with crispy pork belly.  Nothing else really stood out to me.  Two other friends got the burger too.  One of them ordered the burger without the pork belly.  He regretted that later.  My burger was juicy inside with a nice caramelized sear on the outer surface.  The crisp slice of pork belly added a layer of fat and texture that capped this burger off nicely.  The two of us that added the pork belly were very satisfied.  Our friend without was a little disappointed, our "yums and OMGs" as we ate probably didn't help.  My friends found the burger patty to be too smokey.  I actually enjoyed the smokey flavor and smell of the meat.  The fries were nothing special.  I dipped a few in the truffle dip another friend ordered.  The dip was ok, it kicked up the fries a bit.  

Overall service was good we never felt ignored. Our food came out quickly and we were back on the street with enough time to walk to the next venue.
author: Jo H.

description:
I can see Portlandia doing a sketch on this place, it was just that nonsensical and pretentious. "Hmm, yes, miniature piece of tri tip on a tiny hot rock, to die for!" Whenever I'm in San Francisco I look forward to an amazing meal and I was more than disappointed in Chambers.

It seemed like every dish started out featuring something yummy, only to have something less than yummy happen to it. Hamachi?  Delicious!  Hamachi with a smokey flavor?  Not so much.  Chocolate fudge? Sure. Chocolate fudge with curry ice cream on top?  Why?  Blue Cheese ice cream.... no comment.

The prices are too much for what you get, as well. Case in point: 16 dollars for the hamachi. It's not that much in the best of sushi places!  I feel like you're paying for presentation that the food just does not need. After $200 for four of us I was still hungry walking out of there.

Otherwise, the venue is beautiful. I love the records, they played my favorite artists all night, and it looks like a great place to go for drinks. Sitting out by the pool on a nice, warm January night with good friends was wonderful. Just don't bother to eat there first. Go somewhere where they don't over salt and deep fry everything. When the crab croquette and deep fried grits taste exactly the same, something's not right. I'm all for experimentation, but not at the expense of flavor. 

Maybe with time they'll work out the kinks and return to the basics that have worked for 1000's of years and stop putting a bird on everything. (Portlandia reference -- yes, I like that show)  Until then, wine and cocktails is all I'll be indulging in over there.
author: Matthew W.

description:
Located in the Tenderloin, Chambers Eat + Drink is totally a diamond in the rough. If you have a difficult time locating the place, it's situated right inside/by the Phoenix Hotel, which is easier to spot. 

This place is pretty swaggy. The decor and atmosphere is candy for the eyes. You can't miss their famous, "Be Amazing" sign behind the main bar. It's pretty awesome, and you won't be able to help yourself but to take a picture of it. 

The service here is pretty good, prices are very reasonable. They have a extensive menu which seem to change pretty frequently. The food is kinda hit and miss. The portions are a bit small for my fatass, so if you are starving, you may need to order a couple plates, or three.
author: Joon Y.

description:
Sunday morning for breakfast. 
Coffee was ok, we asked for warm milk to have our coffee, the waiter was wondering how to warm it up since they did not have an espresso machine, we suggested, microwave?
When the coffee arrived we were told the kitchen was too busy to warm up milk, so instead they brought cold half and half. 
I ordered "eggs in a hole" eggs were over cooked, so they had to be re-done. 
The greens that came with the eggs were extremely salty, could no eat them. 
Second salad that came with the batch of new eggs was just as bad.
My friend ordered two eggs with Challah toast, eggs were fine, the Challah bread was dense and heavy. 
We ordered a fruit bowl without any melon, instead they brought a bowl of fruits with yogurt and nuts, we told them that we wanted Only fruits, but no melon, we got a fruit bowl With melon!!!
Needless to say, I do not recommend this place if you are looking forward to a good meal.
author: Adela K.

description:
First impression: Hipster central. Why? Because of the neatly stacked vinyl record covers on the walls, low lighting, old fashioned leather sofas, and that woman eating by herself while using her iPad.

Came here to celebrate a birthday with some girlfriends on a Saturday night around 8pm. We could have made reservations online, but we didn't. They didn't have any available tables for another hour, but said that we could be seated right away if we ate outside on their heated patio area which we didn't mind and turned out to be pretty toasty. It's right next to the Phoenix hotel so super convenient if you want to grab a bite or drink or hang around the pool if you're staying there.

Our server (don't know name) was really nice and accommodating. All of the cocktails on their menu are $11. My friends ordered some drink with whisky and pineapple juice and they all thought it was a bit strong (because whisky is gross duh) so our server came out to add more pineapple juice to sweeten their drinks upon their request! I ordered a bramble which I really enjoyed.

-Bread: Tiny bread with interesting butter. Tip: Bread is only served upon request.

-Truffle dip: Waffle chips (reminds me of Ruffles) with a wild mushroom/black truffle creamy dip. Really creamy mmm. We used some of this dip for the bread since the butter was this weird butter/peppery concoction.

-Little gem salad: Romaine lettuce salad with egg. Dressing was really good.

-Smoking pork belly: About 6 little pieces served on top of a little wooden smoking grill. Normally I don't really like pork or excessive fat on my meat, but this was pretty tasty and went well with the kimchee side dish.

-Chambers' burger: It was good, but nothing special.

-Boar chop: Came with broccoli and cauliflower. 

I would recommend it if you want a nice, trendy place to dine. You can dress up or down and it wouldn't really matter. Some dudes sitting next to us were just wearing hoodies (remember- hipsters). Food was pretty good, but personally it was nothing life-changing, though my friends loved it. Semi-expensive for the portion sizes, but you pay for the ambience.
author: Stella M.

description:
After doing the Bay to Breakers this year a friend found this place via YELP! so we decided to head there for refueling. Luckily my friend called and got the low down, when we arrived 20 minutes later the hostess tried to brush us off and say that they were booked entirely and weren't seating on the patio poolside (though the restaurant was entirely empty and that the pool had seating for 3 parties) so we made out with a shaded pool table. 

Service was ok, our waitress didn't understand that we had a 2 yr old with us and to bring the fruit bowl and emergency fries stat - they came after the meals did 25 mins later...luckily we had snacks in a bag. The food was delicious (spiced french toast with strawberries & bourbon syrup is recommended for breakfast/brunch) but the beer selection was allegedly sold out. When we selected one variety we were told it was out, then the next selection only had 2 left over so after we ordered them it was gone, selection 3 was out, FINALLY selection 4 was in stock. Pitiful.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Considering that this place is in the Tenderloin, the snazzy decor is a welcome surprise. I love the look and lighting of this place. It also has a lounge feel which makes it inviting. 

Unfortunately, the food doesn't quite live up to the decor. I went here for dinner with my girlfriends a few weeks ago excited to discover such a gem in the Tenderloin.  I ordered the escolar. With a description including forbidden rice, charred avocado, maitake mushrooms and wild arugula, it sounded right up my alley. The food was pretty bland though. It wasn't bad, but nothing exciting that will leave me craving it weeks later.  Two of my friends had the burgers and were pleased with their choices.  My other friend had the polenta and royale mushrooms and was not impressed. Again, the food was pretty bland. 

For dinner time, the place was also pretty empty but the happy hour bar area was crowded so maybe there are a good happy hour deals.
author: Diana C.

description: Okay so I think they really are 4 stars, the food was not bad.  The pork belly was great. Loved the soft boiled eggs.  The burger was not bad.  The drinks were fabulous, the coffee cake quite sweet.  Service is amazing.  However price/performance this place doesn't add up for me.  Plus what is up with the healthy SF FEE + service FEE.  This ended up being another 10% almost.  Seriously what is with the price gouging.. ...
author: Tiffany C.

description: Everything was better than when it used to be Bambuddha. urgh except the service.    we had several main dishes but chamber burger w pork belly & sizzling kobe meat were the only dishes I liked.
author: Jee C.

description: The interior is very hip and the cocktails should come with autographs because they are so popular.  Patio dining is wonderful overlooking the Phoenix Hotel pool and you literally feel as if you are dropped in the middle of Palm Springs instead of one of the sketchier areas of the tenderloin.  Service is fantastic and the servers are very knowledgeable in regards to the menu.
author: April M.

description:
I've been to Chambers multiple times for friends' birthday drinks, and I finally went for a large birthday dinner there.

I ordered the escolar and a side of the asparagus, but had a chance to try the lamb dish, brussel sprouts, and polenta too.  Everything was really tasty.  Nothing was over or undercooked, the seasoning was spot on for every item, and everything was served hot/fresh.  

The escolar dish came with this amazing forbidden rice side that I could have eaten all night long.  I can't even describe the flavor of this thing, but they formed the rice into a patty and crisped it up in the pan.  The textural contrast was awesome and it tasted really darn good.  The charred avocado added a nice creamy, smoky touch to this dish, and while I've always been skeptical of "cooked" avocado (grilled, charred, fried, etc.), this was exceptional.  If you like fish and appreciate good food, you should really order this dish!

The asparagus dish came with a deep fried farm egg, and, wow, this was awesome.  Asparagus was cooked well, the dressing was nice, and the egg was great.

Every other dish (brussel sprouts, polenta, and lamb dish) were all prepared well, great seasoning, and just delicious.  

We had a huge group (about 16? maybe more?) but the service was pretty spot on.  A few drink orders were forgotten but eventually brought out, and the food took quite some time to come out.  That being said, the servers were very good about keeping us updated, and honestly, keeping food/drink orders for that many people for that long of a period of time is pretty hard.  They really did a great job keeping food and drinks on our table.  

I've always loved the cocktails and vibe at Chambers, but now I can confidently say that the food here is great, and you should really check this place out.
author: Naoko M.

description: Love this place.  No cover charge, lots of couches to sit, friendly bartenders, great music , nice mix of crowd. Our bartender, Chez, was very nice to us and gave us great service.  Parking was not even that difficult but area was a little sketchy.  Would definitely come back here again.
author: Claudine V.

description:
Was surprised to discover Chambers for a networking event one Thursday night. Really enjoyed the ambiance, service, and food. Definitely plan to return! 

Decor/Ambiance: Awesome. 

Service: Bartenders are cool ladies whom I wouldn't describe as warm, but definitely fast and attentive. Servers are super nice! 

Food: Had appetizers and amazing lemon meringue cupcakes. Lamb meatballs and bruschetta with melted brie and portobella were rich and yummy. Cupcakes were delicious. 

Price: can't say, since it was a hosted event.

Events: Talked to host about it, and it didn't cost any extra to have a custom little sign with special cocktails for the party, so I'm considering it for a friend's birthday party. They just have food/beverage minimum.
author: Andrea B.

description: This place sucks. Attitude from both the hostess and bartender. When my girlfriend ordered a glass a wine the bartender poured what was left in the bottle, about a third of the wine glass, and didn't bother to open another bottle. My girlfriend looked at me then asked the bartender, "is this your normal pour for a glass of wine?" Yes came back the response. She must of felt bad, and poured her a little more ten minutes later (hence the one star) My pseudo Manhattan was lame. No cherry, no zing. 13 dollars. If you're a local I probably don't need to tell you not to waste your time and money. If you're a tourist don't fall for all rock star hype.
author: SCOTT L.

description:
This place is swanky and a lovely spot in the TL.  It's a little uphill and a couple blocks away from the real crackhead action (but still close).  Nice dim lighting, bartenders are awesome (especially Scotty!), and there are 2 bars.  I wish the music were a little better so I could actually dance or recognize the songs, but meh, I'm not complaining...this place is free.

Oh, and clean bathrooms - very important!
author: Dee H.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday party and we had a reserved table.  The area is pretty big and there are two different bars, however it can get crowded.  The location is smack in the tenderloin but there is parking in front.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Came here the other night for a friend's birthday dinner. The experience was very mixed. We were a large party and some wanted the prix fix ($40) while some wanted individual courses, we were told this wasn't allowed because after 1 person orders the 3 course prix fixed the whole table has to get prix fixed. This seemed absurd to us as I and a few others were not particularly hungry and didn't want to order a 3 course meal. After some arguing we were allowed to order individual courses. I got the black cod which was absolutely delicious!! Melt in your mouth amazing. BUT it took 1.5 hours after ordering to get our food.....in addition the people who got the prix fix got their food an hour after ordering while the a la carte orders had to wait and watch them eat for another 30 mins before apps were brought out....not pleased. I also ordered a margarita which took another 35 mins...ridiculous. The three stars are for the food. The service was horrendous. So it's a gamble, it's suggest coming not that hungry and expecting a wait.
author: Sami F.

description: Great spot for drinks!  If you ever want to feel like you're getting out of the city this is the perfect Palm Springs vibe.  Probably one of the few establishments in the city with a pool too.  Great retro decor paired with fun cocktails, perfect for daytime or nighttime gatherings.
author: Nicci C.

description: Came from Yelp reviews.  Next to hotel, unmarked door. Fun looking place as soon as you open the door. Service was wonderful and super yummy food. Would recommend for sure.
author: Pamela B.

description:
Chambers is the best restaurant that I never experienced. I did sit in a seat at the restaurant for two hours but like a high class strip club, I touched some stuff, got drunk, but never put anything in my mouth.

The ambiance is unique. If a hipster let you eat snacks in their attic, you'd swear you were here. I saw an old record on the wall with a picture on the cover that looked like our friend's cat but then I was sad because my first cocktail tasted like dust. The second cocktail tasted like a sorority ate strawberries then urinated in an empty tequila bottle. We received some appetizers that were (actually) really good. Go to this place to eat appetizers. However, I wasn't aware this was a psych out prix fix French Laundry style menu because when we didn't get our main course within 45 minutes of eating our appetizers, the manager of the restaurant (I know it was her because she used words instead if body odors to communicate) told us that, "NORMALLY, their patrons like to enjoy a six course meal and like a (I swear to goodness) hot minute between servings." Not quite sure where to start with this because I've been lied to before but never have I been attacked in the eardrums with something like the words, "hot minute," in a normal setting where people exist and communicate. First, their menu style can't be described with French words when one section is called "small bites" and another one is called "big bites." Secondly, a (cringe and throw up) "hot minute" between appetizers and main courses is not equal to 40 regular non-sociopath minutes. We ordered our appetizers and entrees at the same time, were served and consumed the appetizers, then waited 40 minutes to not be served our entrees. This can be explained very simply....

I knew a dog that would roll in its own poo when it was scared. This dog found its poo to be a comforting blanket of safety when the world threatened him with confrontation. I'm not suggesting that human cowards do such things but since our waiter looked like he smelled rancid and was so terrified to serve us that whenever he showed his face in the dining area he acted like he got caught shoplifting and if I did suggest that, it would be totally accurate. I'm also not saying that our waiter was a coward who absolutely rolls in his own poo instead of speaking with his customers ESPECIALLY when he crystal clearly forgot to submit their dinner order but if I did that would also be totally accurate. We requested two hamburgers and some vegetables. Because I'm guessing, I know that it takes 10 minutes to make a good hamburger. It's possible yellow-bellied cowards can't do math because our waiter failed to inform us that we couldn't make an 8pm musical (10 minute walk) if we ordered our food at 6:45pm. Important note: I don't know a dog that rolls in its own poo because dogs are angels and our waiter was awkward. Another important note: our waiter is probably a nice guy who just forgot to submit our order to the kitchen or he isn't.

But, it's close to Thanksgiving so, I'm thankful? We drank alcohol for two hours and ate zero food so by the time we reached the Book of Mormon (you need to see it) we were so drunk that it seemed even funnier than it probably was (extremely funny so probably not). Granted, we were handed our food in a grocery bag as we sprinted out the door to make an even longer sprint to the theater but I didn't taste it because I threw it as hard as I could against a wall. So, thank you Chambers for being incompetent because we laughed harder than we would have had we had consumed solid calories. You are not good at service or food.
author: Nick R.

description: The food here is great! It's attached to the hotel, and open real late. My friend and I showed up in our jammies thinking it was a diner-type deal. IT WAS NOT. It's a high end restaurant, with only a limited late-night menu. I think there were 3 things on the menu? haha. So sad. Anyway, San Francisco has a "health care" tax which we didn't know about, and we were automatically charged for. This was the only eatery that charged us for it, which was strange.
author: Christine H.

description: I held an event at Chambers this past weekend for my client who is a non-profit organization.  Chrisse and Stacy, the venue coordinator and manager, were both very accommodating, responsive, helpful, and easy to work with.  They both worked with me weeks in advance to create the perfect menu and bar package for my event.  Not only is Chambers a beautiful venue (with a L.A./Santa Monica vibe) but they also serve delicious food!
author: Gloria M.

description: Amazing food! Waiter kindly diverted from the fries and directed me towards some tater tots. Great advice! The tots and accompanying bacon dust cheese concoction was truly something magical! The atmosphere was awesome.  Some of the meat dishes come to the table on a cooking plate or little mini-square fire pit looking contraption. Smells like a campfire in fall!  I would highly recommend this place for a night out with friends. Works out nicely if you are catching a show of over at the Orpheum.
author: Kevin J.

description:
"be amazing." already am, thankyouverymuch!! any place that reassures me that i'm amazing as i walk through their doors has my attention. but you, you're amazing too!

i really like this place. it's dark and looks like it's pretentious, but then you realize that right outside the window is a pool with a funky hotel attached to it. then your server greets you and she's chill. i like that. plus it's in the tenderloin, so really how pretentious could it be?

the food is pretty good, though i would skip the truffle dip. not really sure what that's meant to be, but it was pretty much truffle flavored butter. a bit too rich for my taste, and i have rich taste. the escolar was perfect. cooked medium rare and paired with charred avocado, maitake mushrooms (my fav), and a forbidden rice patty. loved this dish!

photos and full recap here: http://alwaysremainawesome.blogspot.com/2012/08/chambers-eat-drink-muka.html
author: Regina C.

description:
