As you continue toward the back ....bookshelves, lounge music, and  mixologists await! Much more my style with a group of friends.  I thought the place was great .....with a mix of the old and the new in both decor and style. Next time I can choose which side I want to go.... lounge or party!!   I can decide while I pass by the skinny crack heads wandering the streets like zombies.
author: Shane S.

description: Subdued lighting, good looking people, great happy hour ( $5 wine and $5 bar bites), and relatively friendly staff (I can only speak for the bar tender who didn't really do any thing wrong, but she just wasn't exceptionally friendly.) I ordered the tater tots, which I would probably rename tater teenagers since they were the size of a small gold brick (and there was 6 of these things!) However, they were accompanied by this creamy, porky, bacon dip sprinkled with bacon 'dust'. De.licious! Even better, I can stagger across the courtyard (being careful to avoid the heated pool) to get back to my hotel room! (Phoenix Hotel...updated, quirky motel). So, why are you still reading? Go and get some tater tots!
author: Catherine H.

description: Great atmosphere, good drinks, and even better food! We all got the burger with pork belly inside, and oh mai jesus, I don't know why it took us so long to try this place out. We sat outside on the patio, it was in the evening time, so they had heat lamps up and running, it was perfect.
author: Angela C.

description:
Chambers Eat + Drink feels like it was transplanted from Austin. And that is one of the highest compliments I can give.

Good food, good drinks (cocktails and wine!), good music, good company, good times.
author: Emily C.

description:
i like this place bc there's no cover and the drinks are delicious although a little pricey at 11 bucks a pop!

The ambiance is nice. The crowd is very hipster-ish. I brought my co-workers here and they loved it so its solid in my book!

I want to come back for dinner!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I really like Chambers just as a classier drinking spot, and also as a place to eat. The decor is awesome inside the restaurant portion with the walls of vinyl . I've had great full on dinners here , as well as some snacks while friends and I cocktail. It never lets you down . This past weekend I munched on the smoked grit fries , and smoking pork belly which were both tasty.They have great drinks, my favorite is the "Daylight Savings". I just wish I could enjoy my Daylight Savings outdoor by the pool/ firepit after a certain hour without the Phoenix Hotel staff getting a little aggro.
author: Lauren V.

description:
Vinyl records everywhere!!!! Woa...

Thats right! they have tons of records filed away in their trendy bookshelf. During our dinner, we decided to see if these LP's were fake covers or actual vinyl, and lo and behold!!! they are real legit vinyl records.. pretty cool in my opinion. The whole place gives of a sorta 60's hipsters den feel... This place looks likes what i would image Frank Sinatra's den would look like..

Anyways, back to the main reason to go here: food and booze!

The menu selection is extremely limited. 90% of our party ordered the burger with pork belly... They liked it, but were not so hyped that they needed to fight the urge to twitter their encounter with this beef patty incarnation.  I had the chicken roulade and sorta impressed... It was moist and had a decent flavor. I think it was served on top of a bed of what i thought was wheat bulger, but was in fact beluga lentils! they were flavorful enough, which is tough for what it is...  Just wished my food was hotter but that might have been because our group was so big.

My foodie friend ordered the steak and was unimpressed because of the price.. he expected more or something more magical..

However, out dining experience wasn't a total exercise in drab cuisine! Others in my party ordered clam chowder and loved it. I didn't taste but they passed the bowls around and everyone savored it. For me i ordered smoked grits fries.. I was amazed... AMAZED! The "sticks" of grits were breaded with some sort of smoky crumbs and fried/baked into perfection. The grits themselves were creamy and hot and the outside was like ... DAMN!!! THATS SMOKY GOODNESS... 

We ordered some mixed drinks and everyone liked their custom concoctions. We were shocked to see that we were charged $1 extra for ordering Jameson on the rocks. We were about to make some snide comments about subtle gouging when our wonderful waitress explained that the charge wasnt for the ice, but for the extra booze in the glass... OOOOhhhhhh

Anyways, lesson of this adventure: Go to Chambers to for drinks and their appetizers, but skipped them if you want to have a full meal.... i would have given this place 3 stars but the cool motif, great waitress, and smokey goodness made me be more generous.

Provecho!
author: ariel r.

description:
Summary: Chic enough to be celebration-worthy, authentic enough to return for a fun night out!

WHAT'S TO LOVE?

Great atmosphere!  The crowd's young, eclectic, creative and beautiful--but much more real than the Marina/Pac Heights crowd, and much friendlier than the self-righteous, self-conscious grit of the Mission.  

Good food.  The dishes are flavorful, fresh and well put-together.  We ordered a lot of small plates and skipped the big plates altogether.  The pork belly lettuce & tomato roll is a lovely balance, the kobe tri-tip is delicately marinated, and the marble potatoes are surprisingly delightful.  And I do love the desserts--the carrot caraway cake is moist, and the chocolate ganache is sinfully scrumptious. What is missing is a bit more care in the details and execution.  The pork belly would be better if it were weren't tepid, but cooked to that perfect "melt in your mouth" temperature, and the carrot cake would taste that much more heavenly if it was a bit warmed up.

Friendly service.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  They don't quite have the thoughtfulness of the real pros, but they're nice and make an effort.

Best part of the experience: perfect balance of everything!  My palate was satisfied with the smorgasbord of flavors, yet I did not feel bloated or stuffed.  The food, the ambiance, the people--everything came together so well for a great evening.  I want to come back not because of any one thing, but for the whole package.
author: Izzy C.

description:
I love what they've done to this space. The first time I came to this building, long ago, they had a sweet jerked chicken, live Caribbean music and I think the floor was exposed concrete. Later Backflip & Bambudda... this spot has consistently kept a fun vibe, and every iteration so creative. Chambers raises the bar again with a smooth ambiance and good food.

The kobe tri-tip with the hot stone isn't just good looks, it's tasty meat. And the burrata in the heirloom tomato salad is amazing - though the accompanying bread seems too salty, and I didn't care for the tempura.

Everything I've gotten here has been on par or excellent, and I leave in a good mood. Thank you!
author: Susan W.

description: Super sexy spot! Make a RESERVATION!!! Brunch is on Saturday and Sunday. Staff is cool. Try the chambers burger! Deeeelish! Enjoy
author: Yaya L.

description:
Chic and stylish. You feel like your out on the town, not just another restaurant bar.

When I sat down I felt like the staff were going to be snotty, but surprisingly they are mostly nice and give rather good service for such a trendy spot. They do seem a bit absent minded as it can be hard to get their attention even when their not busy.

The food is very good, however I wish there was more options on the menu. There isn't much to choose from especially if your hungry or a Vega. Not a good place to go for dinner but a great to have drinks and small bites. A great place to start your night or chill with some friends.

The music was not particularly exciting but at least it's not just the same old DotCom House that I hear everywhere.
author: Anthony M.

description: Food left me wanting, but I have to mention that I am a vegetarian so I think possibly the meat selection may be better. Mixed drinks are definitely the way to go at this bar..more bang for the buck. To explain, I'm just not down with paying six dollars for a pacifico. Find that kind of ridiculous. I realize drinks in general are overpriced in SF..but pacifico? Come on--see the mission. Hah. Overall the bar is nice, but wouldn't make it a routine spot. Definitely wouldn't go back for food either.
author: Brighid F.

description:
This place is awesome. Heard that it just opened. Showed up for an impromptu surprise dinner party.

Pros: Food is excellent. Drinks are pricey, but unique. Beer is average price, so that rules. People are definitely great to look at here. There's lots of things to stare at if you're lucky enough to sit near the wall of records. I even left $20 in the ATM for about 10 minutes by mistake and it was still there. Talk about nice...

Cons: The carrot cake sucked. I've had better trail mix. The speakers were WAY too loud so we had to shout at each other all night. The awesome tasty drinks were a little low on the alcohol.

But really, this place is awesome. The servers are cool. I think 10 of us went out, each had 2 drinks and a meal and it was only like $400.

GO HERE NOW. Get a burger!
author: Rich_kids_of_yelp Z.

description:
Chip does so much so well and this is another one!

Chambers bar located in the Phoenix Hotel is swank.  Most bars that get design down as well as Chambers often make too strong drinks and rely on basic "in" bar food, not Chambers.  The drinks are quality combos clearly a result of some thinking and they are not too strong hence you dont have to clear your schedule the next day after a few hours there.
The food is actually good.  I am often the one that stares at her pals eating bar food in dismay however here, I eat with pleasure.
The staff sheds the usual "I work at a cool place hence you are a loser because I am so cool" attitude which is so refreshing.
All in all, if you want to lose a few hours engaging in drinking and eating in a cool space with unassuming folk who are actually cool folk, check out Chambers.
author: Kate S.

description: Lovely dinner experience with my girls.  Dressed in our cutesy skirts & tops.  Super hipster ambiance where you def don't want to get that ratchet & be called "that girl"  I enjoyed the nuts appetizer with shots of jameson.  Lovely service by the down-to-earth servers.
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
This place is alright.

When I went it was one of the newer places and everyone definitely dresses to impress.

The food was alright and the place was PACKED, packed to the point where it started to get humid and everyone was bumping into everyone. We had a table and people still were knocking into us. Plus its in a run-down area, so be careful.
author: Jesse G.

description: Chambers has a cool vibe that you wouldn't expect from the outside of it. The entrees are limited and are fairly expensive ($30+). The least expensive entree on the menu was the hamburger($16) which was quite good if you don't want to spend too much.
author: Stephen C.

description: I had gone here about a year ago and forgot to leave a review for this place... During that time I was very unimpressed by the food and dessert selection that they had.
author: A M.

description:
Not that impressive, overy expensive food (touristy), but I do have to say they have a great selection of beers.

Would recommend for a late night spot, where nowhere else seems to be open.
author: Ava A.

description: Food is yum.  I had the pork belly that came with soft boiled eggs, sautéed onions and potatoes in chili oil.  Very inventive dish, I must say.  Strong, bold flavors.  Perfect portions. Plus, the hotel is as adorable as can be. We will be back.
author: Maya S.

description: I like Chambers for the set up and the huge outdoor area. The menu is small but everything I've had was good. My favorites are: quinoa salad, the burger and the pancake they serve at brunch.
author: Mimi S.

description: If you are a hungry human eat before you go out eating to Chambers. The food is delicious but very slim pickings. It is the epidemy of San Francisco's trendy up and coming fine dining which I enjoy but made sure I came with my cashed paycheck in hand. We ordered appetizers of sweet pea salad and tri tip between two people. The tri tip came served on a heated stone where it sizzled in front of us for us to fight over. The sizing was less than a deck of cards portions and the cave man in us came out as we battled for the 6 slices of tri tip at $14. Game on!  I won and the meat was divine. My poor table mate had to watch me slowly eat each bite while drooling in envy. It is a place to check out for the ambiance, the look and and 3 bites of meat. Eat before or eat after but fun to check out. With wine, tri tip, and sweat pea salad the bill came to $70. Enjoy
author: Courtney B.

description: The location (TL) is not the issue, as some reviewers suggest. The issue is that the service is mediocre and the food is not good: pretentious menu, poor execution. Decent ambiance and decor, but the fact that this place clears out after one seating is telling.
author: Peter C.

description: I think I've found my new favorite brunch spot in the city. The atmosphere is awesome - think James Bond in the 60s. The food is good, service is attentive, and prices are decent. Will definitely be back!
author: Lee R.

description:
nice find while staying at The Phoenix.  
see more at FullandTipsy.com
author: Full And T.

description:
I like this place and love the atmosphere and decor.  I've been a few times and have tried a few different things from the menu.  Most everything is pretty good.

Our last trip we had the burger and the tri-tip appetizer.  The burger came with very thick bacon that was undercooked to my taste.  What's with places that serve non crispy bacon by default?  I'm inclined to believe that the large majority of people prefer crispy bacon.  Soft bacon is gross.

The tri-tip appetizer was good but could've been better.  It was a little bit too fatty for my taste but others may prefer that.

Everything else about the experience and restaurant I like.  It's pretty easy to get in and the staff is mostly nice and accommodating.
author: Scott W.

description:
Just wanted to say how much fun I had at the Phoenix Hotel and
Chambers.  My steak dinner was excellent and the champagne delightful.  And the pool so wonderfully warm.
author: Kiersten L.

description: fast  and great service. The cocktails are pretty good the food It's just ok. Great ambiance and a nice place to hang with your girlfriends or a group.
author: Lupe A.

description: So accommodating, so friendly, AMAZING SERVICE! I went here with a large group (about 10 of us) for my fiances birthday (bites and drinks). I was running a little late for my reservation and my friends who got their first did not check with the host and thankfully they were so understanding about it. Our server Becky was one of the sweetest, most genuine people ever. I let them know ahead of time and when they brought out the desserts we all (including staff) sang happy birthday. Such an amazing time we will never forget. The birthday boy literally hugged the waitress at the end of the night because she was such a huge part of what made our night so special. Seriously go here, its amazing. We can't wait to go back for dinner next time.
author: Deja B.

description:
Brunch is next level. This was my first foray to Chambers and while I wouldn't recommend walking from the St. Regis (the surrounding area is dicey) It was worth the super sketchy walk because once inside, I  died and gone to bfast heaven. Make sure to order the pork belly and a skeleton key to drink... You won't be mad if you order a side of challa and preserves. 
Nom.
author: Anjuli M.

description: Smack dab in the trendyloin, this place really is quite cool. I give the food an A-, the drinks an A,  and the atmosphere a A+.
author: Sandra S.

description:
We showed up on a Saturday night for some cocktails. I was very impressed by both the interior decor and the service at this venue.  

The place was perfectly crowded; our bartender took orders for rather complex cocktails on a busy night and was very friendly.  Maybe I've become too accustomed to busy clubs where anything other than a vodka soda earns a scowl?

The setup is a mix of standing area and seats mixed with some very unique furnishings and decor; either of the two bars at both ends of the building were relatively accessible and well staffed.

I'm curious to try some of the food here on my next visit.  For a good mix of people and interesting cocktails I'll definitely come back here.
author: Jeff M.

description: Mid-Century Modern decor with great ambient lighting and records strewn across the walls. It's hip, but not pretentious and the food is decadent. With friends, I've shared the yellowtail ceviche, truffle ricotta, summer vegetable soup, california halibut, sprouting kale and the yukon gold potato gratin. The soup was incredibly tasty with fresh vegetables, herbs and spices and they pour the broth over the soup table side. In addition to the delicious starters and entrees, we tried two of their desserts. Not only is the presentation of each menu item beautifully displayed, each bite is delish! We tried the peach cobbler and the coffee cake and both had several flavors on the plate in addition to the main item. Peach cobbler had a warm cake with touches of smoked peaches and caramelized jalapenos. The Coffee Cake had a creme fraiche frosting and tasty pecans. Can't wait to try another dish!
author: Skye H.

description:
Outside looks sketch and honestly when the cab drove away I was wondering if he had dropped us off in the wrong place but sure enough there were a few door guys who got us right inside and this place was really cool. Fun atmosphere indoors and they have a back patio area that has a pool and outdoor bar scene (which kinda looks like it belongs in a 60's Vegas hotel but it's still cool to see in The City).

Had a DJ on a Saturday night and the place started to get busy around 10. Good drinks and the food (while we didn't eat any) looked really good.

Worth checking out if you're looking for something out of the usual for a drink.
author: Greg V.

description: I loved the atmosphere of this place. I got the eggs royale and it was perfect! Service was also attentive and great. I wouldn't recommend walking there during the night because on my stroll there during the day there was poop smeared all over the sidewalk in the tenderloin district!
author: Helena R.

description: Fantastic energy! I stumbled upon this place while looking for a Sunday brunch spot. We got lucky and were able to sit at the bar within 15 minutes. The variety on the breakfast menu was fantastic with almost to many things to choose from. I ordered the Egg Sandwich and was blown away by how wonderful it was. Overall this is definitely a lovely breakfast/brunch spot while in San Francisco.
author: Elisabeth M.

description:
It was going to be my boyfriend's birthday so I went onto the trusty Yelp and looked for a good place that's good for large groups, a full bar, and a great vibe. I stumbled to Chambers and it looked like a good place for the celebration. Since they open til 2am. I called around 11 something at night and tried to make a reservation. The guy I spoke to said since this is a large party, I had to talk to someone else who could help me make a dinner reservation and he will have that person call me back the next day. Next day, I received no call so I called back myself. They said they can accommodate us if we arrive at 6 and leave by 8pm, seating us in a private lounge area. I figured that since it is around the holidays, this is the best as it can get so I took the offer. Then later that day, I received another call from them, telling me that the party that was scheduled at 8 is coming in early and they don't want to rush us out early so they wanted to eat us outside to the outside common dining area, but had to break our party of 14 into group tables. I declined the new changes and decided to try the restaurant with just me and my boyfriend instead of the large party.

We made a reservation for a Saturday night for 7pm. A party of 2 is definitely a lot more easier to make a reservation for. We decided to arrive early to see if we can dine early. The entrance of the place was a little bit hard to find because there's no translucent window where you can look into the restaurant and there were no restaurant name at the door. We had to ask the front desk of their motel neighbor to find out the large wooden doors on Eddy St. leads you into Chambers. Once you get in, you're greeted by the host and the place looked empty with a few guests at the front bar. But the best bar is located at the inner part of the restaurant where a large "BE AMAZING" sign on the wall lights up in your face. We got seated next to the windows where you can look out to the courtyard that's shared with the motel next door, which includes their swimming pool (I wonder if Chamber guests can get access if they happen to wear swim suits), a fire pit, and a cabana. Our server was really nice and she constantly checked on us to see if we're having a good time. She also mention that since they have a full bar, they can customize any drink we want, we don't need to follow their drink menu.

I ordered the braised oxtail ravioli and my boyfriend ordered the Chamber burger along with the truffle dip chips to share. The truffle dip was good, I liked their chips and the dip was really flavorful. The ravioli was good too, but I'm having mix feelings about it because the ravioli was stuffed with the meat and it just seems like it's missing something. I can't really pin point what is wrong with the dish, but I'm placing my taste buds along the line of texture, it's missing some sort of textural palette to the dish. My boyfriend really enjoyed the fries that came with the burger, it reminded him of McDonald fries. The meat was cooked exactly how he wanted it and it has an intense charbroiled flavor to it.

The place definitely has more of a lounge vibe than a restaurant. It's dimly lighted and the whole place is filled with shelves of old record covers. Kind of an old hollywood feel with some modern touches around the place. The seats are covered with mismatch textiles with mainly wooden furniture. It's a long narrow space that stretches probably about half a block with compartmentlized spaces so there's a sense of separation between group dining/small party dining/bar. I liked the set up of the restaurant, but I think this place is better for drinks and small eats rather than a full dining experience. My suggestion is to have dinner somewhere else and then come here for a few drinks with some friends.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Great social spot!

Must Order:
Kobe Beef
Pork Croquet
author: Tina N.

description: great  atmosphere! fantastic burgers! and service was awesome! surprisingly fantastic!
author: T M.

description: Wait time is too long. They said is about 30 to 45 mins but we've been wait for an hr. The food is alright,  good environment,  and nice drink. The services is alright depends on who.
author: Sally C.

description:
I can't really find anything bad about this place.  Except for one thing.  I'll get to that later.

I seriously walked by the phoenix hotel millions of times not knowing this was here.  Its pretty easy to miss, but once you're in, its no tenderloin.  I could sit in there for days listening to music.

The food was great, we pretty much had one of everything.  The steak on a stone was pretty amazing as was the burger.  For dessert we had the grilled nectarine.  The cookie it was on was freakin amazing.

So on to the bad part.  When we arrived we were still waiting for the 4th in our party (we were 2 minutes early btw).  The hostess said "well I hope they're here soon, we have another reservation at 9:30."  it was 7:30.  Really?  Rude.

But luckily everything else outweighed her attitude.  I'll be back!
author: jessica b.

description: Are you kidding me........16 dollars for a cook your own 2oz. Piece of meat....12 dollar 3 bite freaking salad hahaha haha now we know why no locals knew of this restaurant. ...... what time is breakfast? ???????
author: Gary H.

description:
After seeing a concert at the BGCA (Sara Bareilles by the way- AMAZING!) my girlfriends and I decided to get an after-show drink. When Sugar in Hayes Valley was shut down for the night, my friend suggested we walk to Chambers in the TL. Dude- talk about a diamond in the rough!

Chambers is swanky and cool- without catering to the typical crowd that typically goes with this vibe. (Yes Marina-ites, I do mean you!) I didn't really enjoy waiting at the bar for what seemed like forever...especially in a place that wasn't crowded! Regardless, they make a great vodka soda (how can you screw this up anyway?) at $6 a pop. Not bad Chambers, not bad. 

The atmosphere was neat with all the old records lying about on the shelves. I really wanted to peruse, but felt that wouldn't be appropriate. It was a great place for an after show drink. Definitely felt it was a place where people start their night- not end it. 

I liked Chambers. I just may be back!
author: Annalise F.

description: The ambiance is great, and the food delivered (lots of small plates for a large crowd).  The bartender curates cocktails.  And it's fun to pull out album covers and guess at the artists.
author: Laurel B.

description: The food here is worth the trip into the tenderloin for, the service is great and the Phoenix Hotel rocks!
author: Jill T.

description:
ok this is a pretty cool place. chambers eat + drink is totally nondescript from the outside but just look for something that resembles a sex motel in the tenderloin. once you enter the establishment, voila- it's like you just entered the twilight zone- you will forget that you are even in the tenderloin! who knew something so cool would exist amongst the filthy, dangerous, drugged up, homeless infested part of sf?! o.O

the place is super chic and hip on the inside. during the day, you can order food and drinks and chill out by the motel pool. when i was there, i didn't try the food- i just had drinks but every one of them were fantastic and inebriating-  just as good as the cocktails from my favorite bar, bourbon and branch. i found another awesome place to bring my friends to! until next time, chambers!
author: The Hangry Chef O.

description: Relax  atmosphere, food is great and price is decent.  If in SF and looking for a brunch spot without lines, this is a good spot. Downside being seated and food delivery takes awhile - so patience is necessary. Overall great spot.
author: Irene E.

description:
Chambers is definitely a popular place, it's a great spot if you're looking for a place for birthday celebrations. Like its name Eat + Drink, Chambers is split up into a sit down restaurant area and a lounging bar like area. I absolutely love the ambiance of the "Eat" side. Chamber gives a very unique vibe, especially when it's located next to a motel. They have vinyl records lined up on the shelf  and booth chairs mixed with modern chairs and tables. 

The menu is a blend of tastes from Japan, Mediterranean and France. What we ordered:

:::Artichoke Soup:::: - It has PORK BELLY in it! Creamy and warms my tummy.
:::Truffle dip::::- Absolutely addicting and if you love truffle, it's a must order item on the menu.
:::Chicken Liver pate:::- Nicely done
:::Smoking Hamachi::: - I love the idea of pairing it with a fried shiso leave.
:::Sizzling Kobe Tri Tip::: - On a sizzling rock; soft tri tips however don't over cook it by leaving it on the rock too long. 
:::Oxtail Ravioli:::- Taste good but it reminded  me a little like pot stickers.
:::Chambers Burger::: - (Med Rare) Had better. It came with thyme fries.

Someone at the table suggested: "This would be a great place for New Years Eve!" I guess I'm not the only one who's thinking about returning to Chambers.
author: Christina W.

description: The place is legit!!!  Tatar tots, duck breast, filet, chicken nuggets, Brussels sprouts. The vodka drink was my favorite
author: Jared G.

description: We had low expectations when we saw the neighborhood but what a gem! Great service, cool vibe while also welcoming and a decor that was matched by the food and the incredible cocktails.  Go there and feel that you have discovered a secret that must be shared.
author: James C.

description: Had brunch today and loved it. We had the champagne service which was nice and then to start shared the challah toast and compote, sooo good. We all ordered our own food with the intention to taste all of the entrees. I had the breakfast sandwich that had mushrooms it was good, but a little on the small side. I also tried the tofu scramble and a smoked trout dish that were equally good. The smoked trout had Delicious creme fraiche and caviar  on top of a thin hash brown. My brother had the hangover hash that looked really good,but it's not really my thing. We decided to really go for it and order dessert which was a soufflé, it was so worth the 20 min wait. Over all super good. We drove and parked in the hotel parking, which seems like if you're eating at the restaurant you should be able to park there, but we found out you can't, and had to pay 22 dollars, which isn't so bad.
author: ashley m.

description: This place is AMAZING, similar to the brightly lit "AMAZING" letters that hangs over the bar. I came here for my company holiday party and was impressed. I drank 'Moscow Mules' all night and thought the environment was perfect for chatting from one person to the next and socializing. It's a dimly lit lounge that reminds me of the 70's in a brilliant way. There are small tables and also big leather sofa/booths that were cozy and one-of-a-kind. The food was incredible, which reminds me of the unforgettable truffle and cheese dip with homemade criss-cross potatoe chips I enjoyed--genius, indeed! Whether for a party of for a couple of guests, I definitely recommend this place!
author: Mariel C.

description: From the style, ambiance, decor, vibe and music I love this sexy spot! Vintage records, candles lit and tasty food packed with flavors!!!! It was an awesome night! I was hoping to go by the bar and check out the "Be Amazing" sign but unfortunately it was closed down for a private event. Good Service and def good for GNO's or groups!!!
author: Jasmine V.

description: Good atmosphere, good service and food for the most part, kobe beef and the polenta were great.  The tots were weird - they were like McDonalds hashbrowns with a bacon-flavored sauce.   The "bacon dust" on top of the sauce was weird - I felt like it was pushed just for the novelty of it, in my opinion it didn't add anything to the dish.  Also not a fan of the brussels sprouts.  However, our waitress was great - even brought us a new bottle of wine when the table next to us drank some of ours on accident.  Neighborhood isn't the best, but what do you expect in that area.  All in all, I'd go back if I was in the area.
author: Rachel D.

description: The restaurant itself is really attractive and fun. The hostesses were really nice and accommodating to our party of 8...and that's about all I can say. The service was insanely slow! Multiple times throughout dinner we all had empty cocktail glasses for more than an acceptable amount of time. I hate that. The appetizers and entrees were ok...more visually attractive than tasty. The desserts were awful, no one in our group liked them. I would Go back for drinks at the bar and maybe some tator tots (the best thing we ate) but definitely not for dinner,  mostly due to the super slow service.
author: A.c. D.

description: Brunch and Dinner are great at Chambers. I took my mom to Chambers for brunch and it was relaxed, easy and delicious. The french toast wasn't my favorite so I would get the pork belly and coffee cake with a french press to share. Great atmosphere in their back patio and inside but take a cab there because the surrounding area is a little dicey.
author: Lauren O.

description:
Fantastic space with tons of potential. The TL is and will always be a bit sketchy, but at least Chambers provides a nice oasis in the middle of all that madness.

Whoever designed the place knew what they were doing. It's sexy in a manly, retro Seventies, library/study sort of way with the amber-tinted lights and wood decor, all the while making you feel completely at ease. The cocktails weren't anything to write home about, but this is the type of place where you can hang out, catch up with friends, and sip on Scotch for hours.
author: Cristofer P.

description: This place is so much fun! My first time here was a couple years ago at night and it was a great spot to hangout and drink with friends. My second time here was for brunch yesterday. Their food and drinks are great. Plus the staff is super nice & they play actual vinyl records.
author: heather m.

description: Amazing brunch location. Sit outside by the pool. Chambers is located inside the Phoenix hotel which I've heard is great as well. My new favorite place near Civic/Tenderloin to sip mimosas by the pool!! Rub the giant eclectic frog for good luck!
author: Ericka A.

description: Visit chambers via gilt city voucher and it was an awesome experience! We had a a large piece of delicious coffee cake, a french press to share, one cocktail each, and a brunch entree for $35 total. The burger and fires were amazing, not greasy, super flavorful. The place itself is dark inside, with marquee lights, kind of like 19030's Hollywood lounge. I'd love to come here at night one time or sit outside by the pool for brunch!
author: Sonya S.

description:
I first came here to hang out and have a couple of drinks.  This place definitely surprised me.  The interior is dark with a very cool vibe.  From the records lining the bookshelves, to the unique sofas and fireplace in the dining room, to the BE AMAZING sign illuminated above the back bar, this place definitely rocks.

I then came again for dinner, and the food was not bad.  The small plates were better than the entrees.  We all loved the pate (they give you a lot of bread) and chips and truffle dip (so good).

Reservations aren't hard to get and the place doesn't seem to get overly crowded.  There are two large booths in the back which are good for larger parties.

Definitely a cool place to check out, even though it's in the Tenderloin.
author: K V.

description: I've been here twice now and have been thoroughly impressed both times. I think it may become our go-to place before theater outings. The seasonal greens were beautifully presented with unusual and pleasing flavor combinations. The jerusalem artichoke soup and zabuton steak were exceptional and artfully presented as well. The burger is one of the best in SF in my opinion. The drinks were also delicious--my favorites were the copper bones and the "gin drink." Service has been excellent both times and the vibe is dark and hipster cool. And there's a pool right outside. What's not to like? Overall a wonderful find in a neighborhood in which you might not expect it.
author: Moses G.

description:
food is supper yummy but it gets packed so hard for service to get there

The appts are amazing. steak amazing, 

sea bass way too small.

the drinks are pretty good
author: Justin I.

description: Watch out for the female short change artist. If they think you've had too much to drink, they'll try to short change you. Fortunately I wasn't drunk enough to fall for it. Knowledge is power, beware...
author: J. P.

description:
I wasn't that impressed by the food here, but fell in love with the stylish 70's theme here, therefore I give Chambers 4 stars.

We ordered some starters that were really good (smoked salmon, beet salad, and marble potatoes), but the entrees weren't that great. The burger was overcooked and burnt on the outside. The Ahi Tuna was good, but the sauce/puree overpowered the fish.  
The staff was young and friendly.

After eating we met up with friends in the bar/back room, which was full of good looking and well-dressed people. We had such a good time inside so we didn't really check out the pool area.

I will definitely come back again... probably just for drinks and meeting up with friends, but if I decide to eat there I will stick to starters.
author: Anna S.

description: Wasn't impressed with the food considering it is tapas style and they don't give you much of anything, but the drinks were excellent and they are not stingy on the alcohol. The décor was great,  we went on a Wednesday so we missed the DJ and it was somewhat of a sausage fest (a lot of dudes). With that being said if you ever stop in you might want to go Thursday thru Saturday when they have a DJ spinning. Next time I'm in SF I would defiantly like to give this place another shot.
author: C. C.

description: Who's our waitress? I forget because it's been so long. We ordered our food an hour ago. Wait I take it back everybody here is super nice and the food is awesome. And it is New Year's Day.
author: California B.

description: I went for a bachelorette weekend in SF last August. Food was good- I split a burger and tater tots with my cousin, and both were delish! The ambience was cool too, with vinyls stacked on shelves around the whole place. The neighborhood it was located in wasn't that great, though.
author: Cat G.

description: Just had a great evening. Although the ambiance is fabulous and the food is great, the real outstanding quality was the waiter, Ryan W. Having grown up and eaten all over this city he really knew his stuff and had a perfect presence. Crazily knowledgable without being pretentious, friendly without being intrusive, focused on a satisfying experience without being too compliant. A true master of his food and beverage service craft
author: Julian R.

description: Don't be fooled by it's Tender location. Love this place. Been for brunch & dinner and would reocmmend for both. Burger and fries are to die for! Very cool/hipster ambiance. Randomly had wedding happening out near the pool at Phoenix hotel while we were there too. Interesting spot to get married.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Nice design.  Given the location, might want to consider a happy hour offering ($10 for drinks in the Tenderloin?).  Appetizer was tasty enough, though a bit small for the price.

Edit: Went back this past Friday (7/22) to find a new happy hour!
author: Chris N.

description:
4 Stars for Drinks
Had a Cube Libre with Flor de Cana! Killer
Wine list is ok, but only a handful of by the glass options so plan on buying a bottle

2 Stars fro Food...there is plenty of room for improvement. Chambers has a ton of potential, but the menu doesnt seem to make much sense..its part gastropub, part classic American, part Japanese, part I dont know wtf

Saturday night...Arrived and was seated and greeted with a cool table near the window to the pool. The atmosphere is great and I loved the decor, but unfortunatley the food wasnt so hot..

Started with truffle dip and chips which was ok, but the chips seemed like bagged Ruffles so nothing special

Next was the Smoking Hamachi, which was a cool concept but didnt pack much smoke flavor and the dipping sauce added nothing at all. The fish itself was mediocre quality at best.

We split two entrees

1.Oxtail Ravioli - ok so this one really confused both of us...while it says Ravioli, its really more like a pot sticker on top of Asian style veggies cooked in soy sauce..I guess if that was the expectation from the get go I wouldnt have been so thrown off. The soy marinade made the whole dish really salty.

2. Salmon - normally I would go for something more exotic than salmon, but due to Chambers limited entree choices (5 or 6 total) The salmon was small in portion (size of a deck of cards) and garnished with a cauliflower mash that made the plate even more bland..overall this is well below par for SF.

I really want to like this place but the menu/food has a long ways to go - I'll be back, but i think drinks only will be the choice...also have fun parking!
author: Ryan P.

description: The food was decent but service was pretty bad. It started off fine, but then my friend asked for iced coffee, and got a pot of hot coffee and a cup of ice. That was a little weird, but not a huge deal. Then my coffee came and the milk was spoiled, to the point where it smelled noticeably bad. The busboy who replaced it was apologetic but my waitress seemed not to care. When the bill came, my coffee was still on it. I didn't want to take it out of the tip (because the milk was the kitchen's fault, not my waitress's) so I asked her to take it off the bill, and she was rude about it. Overall strange experience! The food was alright but not good enough to make up for the service.
author: Maya E.

description: Every dish we had was mouth-watering. I love Tapas because I hate making decisions, but this place had no bad decisions :)
author: Steve B.

description: This was a great place for brunch! They have multiple vegan options, the people are very friendly, the decor is interesting and incredibly trendy, and it's part of a really unique hipster hotel. The good was pretty salty, but seemed to have high quality ingredients and everything was very fresh. I definitely want to go back.
author: Bibby L.

description: Look for the gold key. Awesome atmosphere and great food. My drinks were strong and the vibe was great. This place is worth stopping for even if you just want a quick drink.
author: Englands E.

description: Food, service and atmosphere are amazing here.   Brunch is fantastic.
author: Audra C.

description: The cocktails are really tasty. I like the ambiance. I got the burger and it had a really over powering, weird sauce. The tater tots with bacon dust were really good. This place is alright. I'd probably head back for drinks & appetizers but not a full meal. Plus the neighborhood is SUPER sketch. I don't recommend walking to this place from the mall. Bad idea.
author: Desa F.

description:
Chambers burger (with pork belly) was delicious - def one of the tastiest burgers I have had in San Francisco if not the best!  

Drinks list was really cool - I had the seasonal negroni which was really nice  - will def go back again - I guess the location is edgy, but service and food really good - I was here with 3 other guests and everyone enjoyed the ambiance and meal itself
author: Gray D.

description: This place is pretty versatile.  From a poolside brunch, to proper dinner with friends, to late night in the lounge.  Food is very good, great ambiance, and a nice selection of drinks.
author: jeremy d.

description: Came here about a month ago on Saturday and the initial greeting was from an outgoing hostess and bartender who was very polite. then the place got slammed with young professionals; which is nice. Everything was great, a group of eight of us were enjoying the venue when I offered to get a round of beers for my table. I slowly made my way to the bar being very patient and finally get to rest my hands on the bar after 20 something minutes waiting to get through the crowd. There's a tall guy serving everyone who seems too busy.  The polite bar tender (shorter guy) is taking table orders so he's doing his thing. So I just keep waiting... Eventually there are people asking me if I'm getting something and I just nod "of course" and yet he keeps serving people around me. It kept happening until my friends came to find me telling me they were ready to leave. Was it my t-shirt or something?? I probably wasted an hour of my life watching a bean pole serve people behind me amongst the young girls and suits. I get that, you want to serve the scene, I didn't fit. This place is now my representation of the epitome of all I hate about the new San Francisco.
author: Ky F.

description: Great European Modern/Pop dance place! High Class stylish on the insides, the Bar was great. The staff are pleasant. The dance floor was kept clean and uptone. Look outside of the window look in the pool area was beautiful and the glass on the edges makes it look grand, very nice taste.
author: Carlo K.

description: I made a reservation and it was confirmed via email and via text.  They then called me less than 20 minutes to the reservation and told me they had a private party and wouldn't honor the twice confirmed reservation.  I have never experienced anything like this.  The worst business exchange a restaurant could possibly have.  DONT BOTHER.  It is now a Friday night and I have no dinner options for elderly people who are traveling to the city to see me.  Thanks a lot Chambers.
author: Adam S.

description: Just get the pork belly 13 and enjoy the pork candy. If you don't like this place. You should move to another country and slap your inards.
author: Gary X.

description: Here's the truth, this joint has it's pros & cons. Let's start off w/ the goods: This place screams trendy, & for the hipsters who want a good drink to socialize, also food is above average with lots of creativity. Atmosphere & music is great also! Now for the cons: The Kobi tri-tip is tasty, but didn't taste genuine, portion sucked and could have been a bit more generous, but all in all I would of gave 5-stars if they offered more portion for the price...
author: Mitch A.

description: Came here with my coworker a few weeks ago to celebrate her last day working with us (she was just switching over to a different department but still! It was a good way to end it).  We grabbed a few drinks and ordered the Chicken Liver Pâté which is amazing to me because Pâté is something we love putting in vietnamese sandwiches but I also love.  The taste was up to par and I think my friend asked for the chips to dip it with and man, it was just bomb.com, for sure!  And we were lucky because my friend's knew someone who work here so we had the kobe sizzling tri-tip and oh my god.  It was an orgasm in the mouth.  The idea that you could cook it yourself to how well done/rare you'd want it is already awesome but the sauce you dipped it in was even better.  Not to mention, the drinks taste delicious and strong enough to keep you buzzing but still asking for more because you can barely taste the alcohol in it.  I definitely wouldn't mind coming back here again for another night!
author: Lisa L.

description: A cool restaurant with good food and drinks. The drink menu was really diverse and had some very interesting drinks - I had the one with bergamot vodak and it was a pleasant surprise. The food was good but the portions were modest for the price. Overall I had a nice time and will be back in summer when they host outdoor pool parties.
author: Brooke G.

description: "Be Amazing."  That is the brightly lit slogan at the main bar area here.  This location, the former Bambuddha Lounge, has gone through a major overhaul and renovation for the better, much better (they made it look pretty amazing).  Swanky and trendy interior with one area more dedicated to the bar/lounge and the other, following the ramp heading down, more so dedicated to eating and food service but still just as lively.  Located adjacent to the Phoenix Hotel, Chambers also shares their outdoor area with the Phoenix Hotel's pool.  Fancy a dip?  It's way too cold to get into a pool in SF!  We really only get a few beach days a year that will prompt us to dip our toes in the unfailingly cold ocean water, and as such the pool is pretty much just to add to the ambiance.  A nice addition to the changing scene and perception of the Tenderloin, kind of assisting with the gentrification efforts in the neighborhood, and great spot to Ingest, Inebriate, and Indulge (http://www.thesfbay.com/).
author: Erich D.

description: Located in the tenderloin... I laughed as i read several reviews of people saying not to walk here because it's terrifying. Haha. True, the neighborhood is sketchy-  there's homeless people wandering around and trash on the ground and gutters is a normal thing. If you're not used to the city life at night, then yeah I see people being put off by walking around here - it's not like its Beverly Hills or anything... Location aside, Chambers is your typical hipster joint located in a slummy part of town. The interior design is really nice. The whole vibe was music inspired as you see tons of vinyl on the shelving along the walls. You get hipsters mixed in with travelers, as the restaurant is located in the Phoenix hotel. The place wasn't empty when we got there so we expected our food to arrive promptly. We ordered the EGGS ROYALE, which was really good. Poached eggs that sit on top of a really crispy hash topped with dill and smoked salmon. We also ordered the PANCAKE SOUFFLE,which we were told would take 15 minutes because of the preparation for the dish. Which was fine, but it actually took about 30 minutes. The texture and presentation was on point - until we bit into it. The thing was bland. Lastly we got the French Toast, which ended up being soggy. We figured they let the dish sit while waiting for the Pancake soufflé to finish. Service was NONEXISTENT. The server visited once during our stay to tell us the soufflé would take longer than expected. Trying to flag her down was a mission - I guess we weren't in her peripheral as she was more busy greeting and chumming it up with the regulars / or people she knew as they walked in. The expediter who brought us the food was great though, big ups to him for getting us extra plates and water. To sum it all up - waiting 30 minutes for a breakfast meal was simply off putting. They could've at least served the other dishes before prior to the dish that took the longest to be made. We should've gone and tried DOLCE AMORE instead.
author: Fred O.

description: I enjoyed the drinks and ambiance.  I don't recommended the food.  The customer service definitely left something to be desired.   Sub-par until the 2nd bartender showed up.  The blonde lacked personality and pretty much ignored our entire side of the bar.  It's a good thing the cute brunette showed up and saved the day.
author: Michelle H.

description: Great place for brunch. Very cool atmosphere and delicious drinks. We had the lemonade and the bloody mary both were tasy but I was partial to my bloody. For our meals we had the Burger, very tasty, and the pork belly dish which was also very good. Very quick staff and very friendly I will  be back.
author: Nicole S.

description: Bouncers are dicks and the place is not even nice. Don't bother.
author: Gustavo A.

description:
I had been wanting to try this place for awhile, after my coworker majorly hyped it up to me. The pictures also made it look like my kind of place...records, art, cool decor in general. Also hearing the Joseph Gorden Levitz had a party there, made it even more appealing in my eyes (considering he's smokin' hot and always has cool roles in good movies). So I decided it was going to happen on my birthday, since my friends automatically have to go to a place of MY choice. We walked in w/ a group of 10 and were seated within 20 min. My first drink was the Vodka Drink. Sooo good. I probably could've enjoyed more, but since it was my special day, I thought Champagne would be a better choice. I tried everyone else's drinks too and they were super tasty, not to mention potent. 
For food, we started out with the Wild Mushroom Truffle Dip, which was intense but super good. Although I wish it came with more mushrooms and more chips! The chips went in a second, and there was still tons of dip left. We asked if we could have more, and they said we'd have to pay form them, which is odd considering the Truffle Dip probably costed wayyyy more. Anyways, next my friend and I shared the Slow Roasted NY Strip. Wow...I could really eat that dish every day. The veggies underneath the steak were especially good. 
The food and drinks were delicious, but the atmosphere was the best part for me.
author: Sonya D.

description:
i went to the orpheum on fri night and came here for drinks and food beforehand.  i found it on yelp and didn't realize it was the old bambuddha lounge.  when i walked in, i was shocked at how good the place looks compared to before.  

drinks are pretty tasty, and the food is not bad if not a tad expensive for what it is.  the salmon dish was good, as was the smoking hamachi app.  we also got brussel leaves, the oxtail ravioli, and the fall salad.  i didn't try the ravioli, but the greens and mushrooms beside it was really good.

this is a nice haven amidst the tenderloin grit.
author: Helen T.

description:
A 70's Tenderloin motel with a trendy bar and restaurant?  Holy hipster heaven, Batman! 

Yup, the atmosphere is pretty cool and I dig the style - the pool courtyard, records, music selection, all that.  Cuz I'm such a hipster, yo!  But dammit if the food doesn't miss the mark, and at the prices they're charging, it just left me feeling unsatisfied and cheated.  It started off fine, the cocktails weren't too shabby, and our starter of chicken liver pate hit the spot.  But our other starter, the smoked grit "fries," grits cut into long rectangles and fried, were really overpowered by that liquid smoke flavor. 

For the main course there weren't too many options, we decided to split the tortellini and a salad. Ah, how naive we were to think that would be enough .  Three, yes that's right, three tortellini.  Nothing too amazing taste-wise, served with some half-hearted vegetable matter tossed on top to disguise their paltry numbers and a base of lukewarm orange mystery sauce to add another confusing and unneccessary flavor dimension. Three.  The salad was fine, spinach, orange, nothing too amazing or too weird, except for the bacon.  Now, I was glad to be with my friend that doesn't eat pork, because that means the bacon is ALL MINE (oink, oink!). But I'm pretty sure that this was the pre-cooked bacon because it tasted like thinly shaved cardboard.  Not to be one of those ChowHound, locally-sourced, Alice Waters-lovin "foodies," but pre-cooked bacon is just not tasty.  And there is really no excuse for serving that at a greasy spoon, let alone at a restaurant that is hitting your wallet this hard. 

On a positive note, we did finish with the manchego ice cream with blood orange and that was solid, expecially if you don't like your dessert too sweet.  All in all, I might come back for drinks.  If I was in the area.  And if someone else was paying.
author: Ania L.

description: One of my Favorites Bars in the city. Classy ambiance and fun. Great place to host an event or a BD party.
author: Aly I.

description: Loved this spot. While there's no lack of "speakeasy" cocktail bars in the Tenderloin, I found this place's location to be especially cool. It is attached to a sketch looking motel (Phoenix motel). The spicy cucumber cocktail was delicious and not too sweet (jalapeno infused vodka, agave, cucumber, and lime).  The smoked grit fries were delicious and rich, but the portion was really small. I liked that the staff wasn't pretentious at all. I'm definitely returning!
author: Pria P.

description: Omg Poppy totally adores this see and be seen LA type bar/restaurant.  Tables of tech millionaires and wannabes, douchebag financiers and faker bakers, misguided tourists, awkward match.com dates, girls in cheap dresses and cheaper shoes with huge Louis Vuitton bags, hair, makeup and lip gloss everywhere looking for men!  It's a total scene so not a great place to have a chill meal and a drink (although the food is totally decent). Def take a car or cab there bc the neighborhood is scary.
author: Poppy C.

description: The spot is sexy but there is nothing sexy about running the fireplace when it is already 90 degrees up in this mofo.
author: Dru P.

description: I liked chambers, but my experience was pretty bland. I feel too young to hang out with the mid-30's crowd who just stand around the bar, not letting patrons order. The Pimm's Cup was very good, and I appreciated the relaxed, chill ambience of the place. In a few years (after a kid or two), I think I'll love this place.
author: Laura W.

description: I took my friend here last night for her birthday, and I must admit I was a little nervous about the place giving the neighborhood, but I'm excited to say it was  great. There were four of us so we ordered almost everything on the menu, and everything we received was very delicious. The only thing they need to work on is their desert, it was kind of a let down. Good thing the food was awesome .
author: M C.

description: This is one of the best new trendy spots in San Francisco. A great place to come with a date or also to come with friends for some drinks and to mingle. As long as you don't mind wandering through the ghetto-est part of SF as they are in the heart of the Tenderloin, where crackheads and public defecation are a common sight (not joking). So walk fast, and carefully, on your way to Chambers!
author: Andrew M.

description: Fantastic everything. Try the chips, they make other chips seem like a half-realized idea.
author: Shaun P.

description: Gonna go here again. They offer a really good small bites menu, along with an interesting array of mixed drinks. I had the Kobe Tri-tip. It was served rare on a hot stone. Really good & tender beef. The shrimp bisque was a good addition as well. I also had the Pisco Punch mixed drink. It was good & had honey whiskey & pineapple juice in it!
author: Ed P.

description: I finally went back for dinner. The place is cozy with great atmosphere. The wait staff are friendly with lots of Info. I ordered the hamburger once again.  This time it was really tasty and not salty.  I had the happy hour red wine, which was pleasing!. My friend had the vegetarian plate, which you have to ask the waitress for the info.  I will go back, the lounge looks great for drinks after work. Please try it out you will like it.
author: Susie S.

description: I booked a reservation for through their website for a bachelorette party brunch. I had lengthy email correspondence and confirmation of our reservation. When we got there first thing at 10:30 with no other patrons in the restaurant, they couldn't find our reservation. They asked who I spoke to and I showed them the actual email. The hotness was rude and unapologetic, asking me questions about who I specifically spoke to as if I was making it up. Finally she came back and said shed seat us outside ... Though the place was empty and it was freezing outside (even when we turned on the heaters). Unfriendly, unapologetic waitstaff that made us never want to go back.
author: Jenny B.

description: Über chic. Was just there for my birthday this last week: champagne, steak, cocktails - all amazing, with a fantastic server! This is a must in SF.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The food was only ok, but had to wait 45 minutes for it! The drinks weren't bad, either. I might try it again but I don't know if I'd wait around for the food.
author: Andrew D.

description: Came here on a Saturday for a girlfriend's birthday. Originally, our reservation was at 8:30, but they called us that night to push it back to 8:45. We arrived then and still had to wait about 20 minutes for our table. So be it, not necessarily their fault if a party is sitting around after dinner. We also wanted to go into the lounge, but that was closed for a private party. Once we finally got seated, we took a minute to look over the drink and food menu. Our server was great and really helpful. The drinks were tasty, the food, not so much. The tater tots were bland, and the Brussel sprouts were just OK. The ambiance is great, fun place, loved the vibe. I just wouldn't go back for the food.
author: Aimee C.

description: a dope spot in the city. a great place to go on thursday nights always pretty busy but not too packed. love the decor too. and the people that work there are really friendly too. not to mention the drinks are worth the price you pay for them.
author: Zo M.

description:
Well worth it once I found it!  Had a great brunch here yesterday.  Cool laid back hipster vibe.  Food was FABULOUS, as were the prices!  My only criticism would be the cocktail prices.  I have a difficult time paying the same price for my mimosa as for my entree especially when it is some no name label.  I would highly recommend this place for brunch.  We were all very pleased with our food.  

We had the (1) egg in a hole ~ two eggs in brioche toast, house smoked bacon, seasonal greens, champagne vinaigrette; (2) eggs royale ~ Two sous vide eggs, crispy hash browns, cold smoked salmon, mandarin hollandaise, caviar, chive, dill; and (3) japanese omelet "tam ago"~ house-smoked chorizo, tempura squash blossoms, cana de oveja, scallions
author: Maureen R.

description: Foodie Duty represent! This was our first location, and so far the best. The Roasted Red Pepper Soup with a poached egg and PB&LTs are amazing. Service was incredible and everything was tasty. There's also a lounge-y place to have drinks when your meal is over.
author: Jenny K.

description: This place is great! From the decor, to the service, to the FOOD! Diana, our sever, did an awesome job. The burger with the pork belly is something you have to try. The chicken liver pâté is "melt in your mouth" delicious.
author: Catherine G.

description: Ok drinks, appetizers and ambiance not so good
author: Romita J.

description: Love this place! The decor is fabulous. It's modern without being over the top. The music is not too loud where you can't carry on a conversation and is pretty good. The drinks are priced like any other bar in SF but very tasty. Additionally everyone who worked there was friendly! I can't wait to go back.
author: Crystal M.

description: My review is based solely on coming here for drinks. However, I do plan on coming here to eat at some point in the near future. This bar/restaurant is located in the Phoenix Hotel-- not in the best of areas. Smack dab in the middle of the sketchy tenderloin to be perfectly honest. However, when you walk inside, you'd have no clue you were in a rather unpleasant area. Everything here is so modern and sleek. There's TONS of seating in the bar area, and there's even a patio outside next to the pool where you can sit by a fireplace and enjoy your glass of vino. I've always had a great time here. I find myself here on "dead" nights most of the time, so it's fun to get to know the bartenders and enjoy being silly with your friends without having to make a fool of yourself in front of a bunch of people you don't know. I really like this place and can't wait to try the restaurant!
author: Ashley D.

description: This is one of my favorite lounges in the City. I'd definitely bring my friends here. The atmosphere, the service and the drinks were all stellar. I'll go back here to try the food.
author: Mika D.

description:
I went here after dinner, so I didn't eat...but I was pleasantly surprised to find a jewel like this smack dab in the middle of the Tenderloin/Civic Center area. 

It's connected to some flourescent-lit motel, but it adds to it, honestly, with a lit up pool and an outdoor courtyard area to the venue.

Drinks were good, bartenders were friendly and attractive, and everyone was having a good time.
author: Lina L.

description: It was surprisingly easy to get a table here on a Saturday night. Approaching the restaurant I was a bit skeptical, as the place doesn't have much curb appeal and it looked like a seedy offshoot of the Phoenix Hotel. Walking in, however, my opinion completely changed. The decor was nothing like I'd ever seen in a restaurant before, in a really good way. It basically felt like someone had transformed their living room into a restaurant. Stacks of records lining the walls, dimmed lighting, and a view of the pool and the fire pit. To start I ordered the Severance Pay to drink, which was awesome. I'm not a bourbon drinker, but the sweetness of the fruit made it easy to gulp down. My boyfriend and I then shared the tater tots, the rib eye steak, and the quinoa salad. All were good, although I wasn't crazy about the pancetta in the quinoa salad. The service was a little bit slow, but that might have been because we were sitting on the patio. Overall I enjoyed my dining experience here and I will definitely return.
author: Victoria G.

description: This place is rad.  The food was fab.  Small plates with a funky twist.  I enjoyed hanging by the pool and with wine bottle prices like theirs, I'm likely to jump in one eve.  Rooms at The Phoenix are fairly cheap too.  Make a night of it!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Great place, very cool vibe - service is alittle bit slow. But overall very interesting cool place! We had burgers and they were excellent. If you have time after dinner you can always hang out in the lounge as well. The area outside is not very nice:) But once you are inside - it is a total change of scene.
author: elena a.

description:
It seems with the down turn in the economy, the opening of quality, hip, new hot spots in San Francisco has slowed down quite a bit and when one does open up, it follows a similar recipe of artsy, modern, dim lit, slightly industrial space, with a touch of smug. Well Chambers is a fresh change to this formula. Located in the Phoenix Hotel (former Bambuddha), the owners have remodeled the entire place. Walking in you get this warm and welcoming feeling, it's almost like rocker 70's vibe meets DJ. The interesting light fixtures, thousands of records lining the walls, beautiful bars and wooden floors really set the place off. If Lenny Kravitz were to build a Lounge/Restaurant, Chambers would be it, but maybe with shag carpeting over the hardwood floors. There is nothing in San Francisco I have found in my 6 years of going out in the city that has this combination of hip and cool, yet warm and welcoming. The warmth just begs for you to stay to last call. 

The Food: 

My friend and I shared a few things which included their burger, that had these amazing smoke onions (think almost bacon flavored sweet onions) and crispy skinny fries, we also shared the Pork Belly App, which is a must have, this dish carries a similar theme to many of the dishes we ate, which could be best described as hearty, yet fresh. We also had the artichoke hearts which had a great combination of flavors and textures and the last entree we shared was the pork tenderloin. The pork itself was cooked to perfection, but we felt the beans and bread that accompanied the dish made it feel a bit dry, I think some type of sauce would make this dish perfect. We finished off our meal with the Creme Brulee, which was actually disappointing, but the attentive staff knew right away that we were not happy and replaced it with the goat cheese cheese cake, which was both beautiful and tasty, but be sure to share this dish, as you could easily split this with 3 people due to its richness.Overall considering this was a soft opening for Chambers we were both very impressed with the food offerings, ambiance and service.

I am excited to have a new hang out that is truly unique in San Francisco, that is casual yet sexy and not pretentious, a rare combination.
author: Joseph C.

description: This may be a bit of an unfair review...  Came in for a quick drink after being at Olive.  I'd rather go back to Olive.  I only tried one drink, the one with absinthe in it, and it was meh.  Just tasted like lime Gatorade...  I'm intrigued by their food menu though, so I may be back and will update this review.
author: Christopher L.

description: Just grabbed cocktails here (an earl grey coupe, and some cocktail with gin, creme yvette, and grapefruit juice) with a few friends. They were fine. Nothing really to write home about though.
author: Kristen I.

description: Do I love Chamber or do I hate Chambers?  I'm so confused.  The space is really nice, great design and fun, but always so darn crowded.  The front lounge is awesome if you arrive early and claim your territory, but as the night goes on it almost impossible to walk through it.  Some relive comes in the form of the smaller back lounge, but its far less exciting there.  As much as I love to hate the crowds it is very fun place and the food is pretty darn good too, but a touch on the pricey side.  Worth checking out for sure.
author: Marcolm A.

description: Environment, food and bartender were good. Our Server had a "too cool" attitude. She never looked us in the eye, she never said "hi how are you?" "how is everything?" or "thank you" When I asked her for recommendations for a vegan dish, or what dishes could be made vegan, she huffed like she was annoyed I asked her a question. Then she ran through the items so quickly that I had to ask her to slow down twice. Hopefully management reads this and reminds the servers that without us, the customers; they would be out of a job. So please, be nice to us!
author: New C.

description:
Update:  Chambers reached out to me and alerted me to the fact that they had some new systems they were working with.  That can be frustrating and I am sure I was right in the middle of a learning curve. The extra effort to communicate post-experience is pretty special.  

****
I wouldn't classify this place A-OK as Yelp's 3 Stars implies.  I'd say, inconsistent. This place deserves 2 stars based on the customer service.

My gf and I sit down to have a drink and surfer boy bartender is nice and prompt enough.  That's great.  No problem.  Not ten minutes afterwards, the check is dropped at our table.  Odd but no big deal.  The server/bartender with the tattoos (or piercings, extremely low cut top and caked on makeup) comes by ages after that (after we had finished our first round and had been waiting) and picks up the check asking if we wanted to close out (the only other time she came to the table was to ask if she could close out the check). We decline and say, "actually we want another round."  She is cool and says sure (but in a weird insecure way) and gets us one.  She comes back with our drinks and places the check on our table again.  The gothy/Brittany/hipster looking bartender mentions to us, again, that we can close out whenever we want.  We thank her.  

Now, two more times after that she comes back, picks up the check holder and asks if she can close out the tab.  My friend and I are no longer puzzled at the fact that she has come back numerous times to "close out the check" and each time interrupting us, we are annoyed. We note that it feels like she is afraid we're going walk out on the bill.  We laugh at the incompetence of her behavior and find it strange.  Especially since we both look like we came from the office.  We continue to drink our drinks and finally, when she comes AGAIN to ask to close the check, I say, "look, you're obviously nervous about someting, here, why don't you take my credit card and hopefully that will make you feel better."  She sighs a big sigh of relief as if that's what she had been wanting all along (I'm not kidding guys) and says "That'd be great! That's really just all that I need, we just need a card to keep the tab open." 

She leaves and my friend and I start laughing at her because if she was so incredibly nervous that we were going to "walk out" or that she "just needed a card to hold the tab open" Why did she not just Say so? Instead, she decided to continually aggravate us by consistently asking us to pay.  This is not normal.  We chuckled at the lack of communication, causing an awkward situation, about how it is really the bartender's responsibility to ask for a tab, not ours as customers but more importantly, no matter what, a bartender shouldn't be nagging customers to "pay the check" like the way she did.  It's unprofessional, unwelcoming and just plain poor judgement.  

We were just busy catching up.  We had no idea why sufferin' sally was wringing her hands about such a silly issue. All she had to do was Ask for a credit card :T   Weird.

Drinks were decent (not like kool aid but not stiff either) and the ambience is why this review is not a 1 or 2 stars.  Great seating areas.

Like I pretty much say, and know from experience, a place is not going to last if you do not have your customer service DOWN. Period. 
All of those customers who think your staff is incompetent or pushy or unfriendly or whatever!, will not return, recommend or even worese, spread negative reviews to others which is like a reverse cascading effect of bad "press." 

I am not even going to into the closing of the tab screw up.
Meh~
author: Katherine P.

description:
3.5 stars

We went to Chambers eat and drink because this place won Reader's Choice Awards in 7x7 magazine for best newcomer.  It is a restaurant lounge in the tenderloin that is attached to the rock n roll hotel, the Phoenix.

From the outside, this place is really hidden because there are two wooden doors, but once you step inside, there's a nice glow and vibe inside the restaurant with a comfortable relaxed setting.  

We had the burger with porkloin which was delicious and shared fries with truffles sauce.  The pisco punch drinks were absolutely delicious and we topped it off with dessert.  It's a nice hang out to meet up with friends for a couple of drinks, small bites, and japanese/Mediterannean/French inspired meals.  All in all, I'm glad I checked it out, but I wish there were more food options.

Other than that the place has a nice decor, and I'm glad we checked it out.  They were nice enough to give us extra truffle sauce for our fries too.
author: C L.

description: Beautiful interior, fun bar -great wine and food. Love the bar and dj space in the back...good for an up-beat date or hang out with friends. Not a good place for business.
author: L D.

description: Newly renovated from Bambuddha Lounge, this place has got it goin' on now!! Shoulda worn my flapper dress tonight. Stylin' and Profilin'!
author: Karen L.

description:
Maybe it was just a magical day, a perfect weekend in SF, or maybe it was just that I was having a cheat day after weeks on a 1200-calorie-a-day diet consisting mostly of egg whites, protein shakes, cottage cheese and salad...but this place rocked my world!!

My husband, cousin, and I proceeded to walk from China Town to the Tenderloin, very hung over on a Saturday morning, to Chambers.  The walk was long and the Tenderloin was...well, the Tenderloin, but in a good way. How, do you ask?  Well, let's just say that my cousin and I felt fantastic by the time we got to the restaurant because it seemed that every man on the street had a flattering comment to contribute about how pretty our maxi dresses were or how lovely we looked.  Of course, the relative sobriety of the men in question was, well, questionable, and many of them seemed to have slept even less than we had the night before but who were we to judge? We were still perhaps a bit tipsy from the night before and heading to Chambers for bottomless mimosas - the hair of the dog, so to speak. 

When we got there, it seemed that the doors of heaven had parted to receive us.  It was like a swanky Las Vegas restaurant oasis in the middle of the Tenderloin desert.  The mimosas were pretty good and the waiter (who was loving our crazy hungover/drunken conversations) kept 'em coming.  WE LOVED OUR WAITER!!! So much! He had a very unusual name that I can't quite remember right now, but he was awesome. We shared the biscuits and gravy to start...can I just say AMAZEBALLS?!!!! Hands down the best biscuits and gravy ever...crisp and flaky and golden brown on the the outside, soft and tender and flaky on the inside, and the gravy smelled and tasted like sausage heaven.  That's all I can possibly say, you just have to try them for yourself. We also had the pastrami eggs benedict-type thing (I'm not looking at the menu right now so you'll have to compare the review to the menu), the pork belly with soft boiled eggs and spicy potatoes, and the chambers burger with pork belly.  Holy crap! Everything was the best thing I'd ever had. I'm picky with poached eggs because I don't like runny raw eggs...they made them perfectly over-medium-hard for me. I can't even explain the level of perfection. The pastrami was far from deli-sliced, it was fresh and marbled and delicious, my cousin's pork belly plate was awesome, and my husband's burger was jealousy-inspiring.  I'm not a huge burger person; I mean, I get junk food cravings like everyone else, but burgers are not usually my go-to at a restaurant.  But I DREAM ABOUT THIS BURGER and I only had one tiny bite. I can't wait to go back and get this burger, and, of course, those bisuits and gravy...and anything else I can fit in my belly.  YUM YUM, you must come! Eat here at least once, it's divine! Fancy restaurant style creativity and flavor but more or less average prices. I was completely floored by this place!
author: Carrie V.

description:
3.5 

I couldn't help but be charmed on the decor inside, surrounded by old records and "BE AMAZING" across the bar! Though the neighborhood is a bit sketch, and the motel like scenery in the courtyard with the cheesy shallow pool, this place definitely has charm. The booth we got was quite spacious and comfortable. Overall, it's dimly lit and full of candles. There are different areas for drinking, or dining. 

The waitresses are pretty knowledgeable about the food and how it's made and were able to offer up several recommendations.

For the tri-tip, it comes out red and sizzling on a hot stone. You should separate the pieces and let it cook both sides (press on your fork/knife). It tasted much better upon browning up a little rather than eating it pretty rare. The ponzu sauce was good. The ricotta persimmon salad was also really nice -- mild and not too "cheesy" but very flavorful. The burger was highly recommended by the waitress and it's only $14. ($3 extra if you add pork belly). It definitely tasted better than the ox tail ravioli, which was $23, and not that great. It comes with a lot of supplemental veggies, but at that point I was so full I barely had any.

I liked the ambiance. People are able to down out on the patio outside and there's heat lamps. All in all, pretty good experience.
author: Jeanne C.

description: A few friends and I went to Chambers on a Sunday night.  The drink menu is small but adequate.  I ordered a drink called cusco.  It was very crisp and refreshing.  One of the ingredients was ginger beer/soda.  I loved the drink and stuck with it the rest of the night.  The staff was very friendly but still had somewhat of a sophistication to them.  We didn't eat there but a couple plates that came out to others smelled delicious!!!  The decor is classy and fun at the same time.  I kind of felt like I was in the regal beagle from threes company.  There are old records all over the walls.  The music varied a lot but over all was entertaining.  The only thing that needs immediate improvement is the bathroom.  There are two co-ed bathrooms that are horribly lit and needed to be cleaned.  They reeked of potent urine.  I would hate to see how bad  the bathrooms get on a busy Saturday night.
author: Marlene G.
