description: Didn't have any food. The drinks were great. A little pricey, but not bad. Great freaking ambiance. Heated tents outside? Yes. Awesome.
author: Chris B.

description:
ugh so we thought we could come here and do something chill for my birthday but they made us wait outside for one hour!  they said that the patio was closing at 12 so they had to make sure there was enough capacity inside for all the people out on the patio.  while i understand the reasoning, it sucked to be stuck outside for one hour!  

when we got inside it wasnt even the crowded.  please remind me not to come here on a weekend night ever again
author: claudia y.

description: Love the drinks, the style, the people and the outside pool area with a modern fireplace is awesome.  Only reason I am not giving this 5 stars is the neighborhood is sketchy.  But once you are inside all of that melts away and you are in a lovely, contemporary oasis.  A great place to have a few fun cocktails!
author: Laura P.

description:
wow, what a trendy retro hip place.
Lots of different cozy textures.
They have shelves with real records aka LP's or albums, like the Doors, Prince, David Bowie. It's perfectly dim lit yet bright enough to appreciate  the well presented dishes. My small plate: Tritip looked like a little Japanese Zen garden-The beef arrived on a plate, sizzling on a hot rock on top of it.
It was up to me to take the meat off when it had reached my prefered medium rare state.
I tried the dipping sauce it came with but only dipped once because the Tritip qualty was so tender and flavorful by itself.
The shredded sauted veggetables were also delicious. If veggies had tasted this good when they were served to me as a child, I would have wanted to eat them.
Our table also gad the Hamachi Serviche, which had a slight sweet tint to it and delicious. The top dish was the chicken sausage which was called:
pancetta wrapped chicken roulade.
Cooked in a broth, best chicken I have ever had, served on a bed of peas and some rice like grain. Our female server Anda did a fantastic job explaining the menue to us leaving us wanting to order EVERYTHING, she was that good.
Because we were too full ordering dessert we literly forbid her explaining any of them to us, as we could have not resisted and probably would have suffered food koma as a result. Since we had plans to go dancing we had to skip dessert.
Overall fantastic experience with lots of atmosphere. Loved it!
author: Silke M.

description:
The interior is really nice and upscale!
Good food.  The dishes are flavorful, fresh and well put-together.  

Great atmosphere!
author: Elena K.

description:
Chambers is definitely a rose that grew out from a garbage can.  Situated in Tenderloin, this place offers a nice mix of trendy/hip with good food and drinks.  The modern look and feel of the bar along with the retro decor of it's lounge chairs and sleek decor makes this place the ultra lounge to beat in SF.  It also has a huge indoor patio with pool that is shared with the Phoenix hotel.  The patio comes  complete with outdoor seating, tables, heat lamps, additional bar and stone fire place. The design is amazing and incredibly uber cool.      

The mixed drink cocktails menu was really good, too.  The cuba libra cocktail was delicious. In addition, the food is amazing.  We ordered the truffle dip which was savory and a must have bar bite.  In addition, I had the sizzling kobe tri-tip that is another must have.  Tender and perfectly seasoned kobe beef served on a hot stone, which allows you to cook it to your liking.  This is done intentionally if you are sharing with someone, you can cook it well done, rare or anything in between.

The only draw back to this experience was the staff.  The female bartender was pretty rude and insulting when providing drinks.  I don't know if it was an off night for her, but snide remarks was given when handing off our drinks.  I still tipped and thought it was just random.  Until, I stepped outside and experienced the security guard who also was pretty rude.  He stated that he was closing down the area and asked us to finish up our cigarette.  No big deal.  Except, he came back two minutes later saying, 'I thought I told you to leave for smoking.'  We merely responded, 'You stated you were closing down and for us to FINISH up smoking'.  I've been around enough places to know where you can't smoke.  However, if I'm outside where there are a couple of people smoking, one of which was a bartender, I figured it would be acceptable.  This totally brought down the vibe and should be fixed.
author: James M.

description:
I stepped into the new Chamber Eat + Drink with my boyfriend which is part of the Phoenix Hotel a few weeks ago.  The new restaurant and lounge used to be the old Bambuddha, for those of you who recall the pool parties...I do!!!  Chambers did a COMPLETE overhaul.  The restaurant decor transports you back to the rockin' 70's with the walls lined with classic records, a cozy fireplace, and a killer bar.  The restaurant space is not large so I would definitely recommend a reservation.  As for the edibles, we tried the kobe beef appetizer served rare as it sizzles on a Japanese hot stone and the warm farro salad.  We loved the food so much we went back again last night and this time tried the white bean salad, potatoes with bitty carrots, both were excellent, and then sunk our teeth into the steak loin...cooked to perfection and served with a delicious horseradish sauce and squash...can I say yum!!

If you are looking for a little action after satisfying your palette, head to the LOUNGE.  The old Bambuddha had a circular bar that took up most of the area.  Chambers tore that out and created an "amazing" spacious lounge area with it's own bar.  The bartenders served delectable drinks...I suggest Drink #11, vodka, elderflower, and basil (I may be lacking an ingredient)l, but be careful...they go down fast.  A DJ is there to help you shake your tail feather or enjoy stimulating conversation with your ____ (fill in the blank).
author: Kylie S.

description: Not what you would expect pulling into the parking lot of the hotel, but maybe that's half the excitement! This place is a gem from the shelves of records to the  false lashes on the image encompassing the fireplace. The vibe in this place was awesome for some cocktails and food with friends. We shared a few appetizers including the truffle dip, pork belly and Kobe tri-tips; I would recommend them all! The strip loin was perfectly cooked to MR as requested, and the beet and goat cheesecake was decadent. Chambers was a great start to our Saturday night!
author: Christianna K.

description: Great place... great food .. great waiters .. its a must visit spot in SF .. I say try the duck breast .. and chamber's bur
author: Sulaiman B.

description:
Celebrated a special dinner here with friends.  The food here is AMAZING, I mean, really unexpectedly delish.  Can't wait to try brunch.  Worth a trip to the 'Loin - yes, it's that good LOL
Service was also very good, from the friendly host to our awesome waitress.
author: Cynthia S.

description: This is a really nice place!  The inside decor is awesome.  It's dim, there are pop images on the walls, displays of fake vinyl CD shelves, trendyish vibe.  Food and drink is offered here, though I have to warn you that the food portions are tiny.  Had the rib eye which was delicious, but it was not enough for one hungry person.  The service here is friendly and attentive as well.  Overall, a nice place for a night out, but difficult for having conversations as the music plays pretty loud.
author: Patty O.

description: Expensive. Small portions. They lied and said it was a lot of food. Very disappointed. ...and left hungry.
author: Sarah Q.

description: WOW! the new owners did a really nice job on revamping this space.  staff nice and friendly too.
author: Pickle R.

description: Chambers was beautiful! I took my boyfriend here for our first night in SF. We ordered a lot of the small bites. I highly recommend the kobe beef tri tip and medjool dates.
author: Amanda T.

description: Ambiance was spectacular! Such a hidden gem in the TL. Came here for the roomie's birthday. She raved about her steak. I ordered the sea bass which was also delicious. DJ spinning great music!
author: Chauanh D.

description: Great cocktails and one of the best hamburgers in the city. A great cool room for drinks, food and a pool right out the door.  As hip as this place is, the people who run and work it are awesome with no pretentiousness.
author: N M.

description: Very cool interior, bar, drink menu, and ambiance. However, for a place this cool and hyped, the food was subpar. It was ok, but I expected so much more from all the coolness surrounding me while drinking good cocktails and feeling like I was in a high-end rap video.
author: Marc M.

description: I headed over here for some drinks and light bites after seeing Spamalot at the Orpheum. I love the decor and the furniture. The sizzling kobe tri tip melted in my mouth and I will definitely go back for more. The cocktails were well balanced and they had a nice selection to choose from. I want to head back for a full dinner, soon.
author: Christy Z.

description: I've been wanting to try this place since the new name, finally make it for some drinks. We wanted to sit at a table, we were told we could not unless we were eating.....hmmm 20 empty tables on a  Tuesday...okey....small bar  area very uncomfortable seats to try to enjoy a drink....very disappointing experience....
author: Dee D.

description: I seem to be focusing on reviews in the Tenderloin lately, but there are some hidden gems here! Chambers, connected to the Joie de Vivre hotel, has excellent cocktails and a solid wine list, and the atmosphere is chic without being pretentious. Food is pricey, though. Great happy hour spots, but reserve a table if you want to eat anywhere other than the bar.
author: Sarah B.

description: The atmosphere is great, but the food could use improvement. I know they are brand new and still need to work out the kinks. Overall, the food tasted good, but the portions are REALLY small for the prices! None of the food, except the burger, wowed me. I'll be back for drinks, but probably not the food.
author: Erin O.

description: I chose Chambers for my husband's 50th birthday. I cannot say enough great things about it. It was absolutely excellent in all ways. From the service, to the ambiance, to the food , to the luck we had with the SF weather, I highly highly recommend this place for brunch. We had about 45 people and the food was SO GREAT.  Love love love it here.  Yay- five stars.
author: Kristin B.

description: Love this place. Only bummer its in the Tenderloin..but overall great ambience and beautiful people watching. Especially the staff...
author: Ti C.

description: Really a hidden gem. Looks sketchy from outside but absolutely beautiful inside. Lots of old records lining walls. The bartender was the best part of the night. My best friend and I went for just a drink and to catch up. It was a slow night and the bartender gave us the best recommendations along with the unknown histories behind some of our fav drinks as well as the classics!! Def a must go for anyone in the city
author: Shilpa G.

description: I went here with my friend the week after they opened their doors.  We arrived around 7:00 pm to a mostly empty restaurant.  You are immediately immersed into a trendy lounge with a relaxed ambiance.  The interior design is on point and very unique as well as comfortable.  I had the Kobe burger cooked medium and enjoyed every last bite.  The little crunchy string fries were a nice touch on the side too.  The drinks, while not cheap, were carefully hand crafted and didn't disappoint.  The bartenders came by a couple times to make sure the food and drinks were up to our expectations.  The service was excellent.  The only down side to the place is, of course, the rough neighborhood.  Take a cab and don't give it another thought.  I'll definitely be back to this gem!
author: Todd S.

description: super tasty small plates (best enjoyed family style) and delicious beverages.
author: adam h.

description: Chambers is spot-on with their vibe and cocktail list. The bar staff is generally quick to fill your order.  They have great indie-electro-pop dance music in a 70s Palm Springs atmosphere. Their outdoor area is also very inspired with a lot of sculptural elements like grass orbs hanging over the pool. A great firepit to lounge by can be found. The only reason they lack a star is for the bathrooms...don't quite compare to everything else.
author: Eric B.

description:
I had dinner here with a group of 10 last week and it was a home run.  I was blown away with the new look of the space.  The layout works a lot better than the old back flip and Bambuddah lounge (no more circular bar).  The decor is warm and intimate and the vinyl collection is a nice touch.  

All of the food was delicious but highlights were definitely the Kobe Beef app, the Pork Chop and the Burger.
author: murphstar ..

description:
I held a surprise party for my friend at Chambers.  We had dinner with him and then a large group of friends met us in the back lounge to surprise the birthday boy.  Isabel was incredibly helpful, friendly and accommodating, she made the whole party work seamlessly.

The food was yummy and the adorable hostess, our waitress and bartenders were great.  It couldn't have been better!!  With great atmosphere, wonderful people, delicious food and drinks, you can't go wrong!
author: Stephanie H.

description: Chambers is decent. I think a lot of people hype it up because it does look a lot nicer inside than outside. It's fairly typical as a lounge with a bit of dancing. Crowd is mixed. Odd door policy going on. I understand door people will use their judgement as to how close to capacity is reached and how many people leave and how many they want standing in line outside to make the place look poppin'. Still, no need to make a line of 7 people wait for 40 mins with continuous ins and outs and people leaving (and it's not that packed). If you wanted a certain look inside, I'd understand. But didn't seem like that was the case, either.
author: Bern H.

description: You get to decide for yourself how well to cook your Kobe steak.  it is cooked over a stone on your table so you serve yourself when it is still ready and hot.  The pate is nice too.  The atmosphere is slightly loud, but you can still hear each other talk.  You would never have imagined a gem like this from the way the place looks from the outside.  The location is shady also.
author: Byron L.

description:
third stop on our "adult prom" night.

our SUV limo (holla) dropped us off around 11pm.

the lighting in this place makes everyone look good. or maybe it was the drinks. or the sign behind the bar telling everyone to "be amazing." i don't know.

would be nice to lounge around the pool area on a hot day. 

delicious drinks with stylish people in a stylish bar. in the tenderloin!
author: Shawn C.

description: above average food, cool ambiance, except the douchey college crowd in the other room.
author: Gabriel C.

description: I came here on a weeknight for dinner with a bunch of friends and the food was amazing! The restaurant is part of the Phoenix Hotel, which has a retro hipster fee. Each of the dishes we ordered were tasty and the ingredients for the dishes were carefully selected to go well together. My two favorites were the Medjool dates wrapped in lamb pancetta and the smoking pork belly. The Medjool dates had a melt in your mouth flavor and the pork belly was perfectly cooked and not too fatty. The seating and the ambiance were great too, which made the dining experience even more enjoyable.
author: Amisha P.

description:
Last Saturday we had dinner at Chambers,  which is a hot restaurant in the design and decor area, but with wonderful service and an innovative and delicious menu. The small plates are super, including a piece of Kobe beef sizzling to cook on a hot stone, and served with a wonderful Asian style dipping sauce. Another outstanding dish were peas in their pods, served with the tendrils which was like heaven. The fish entree was super, and one of the other members of our party pronounced the steak divine. My husband had what he called "the best carrot cake of my life", I had the Manchego creme brulee which was unusual, but delicious. 
The crowd at the bar is very hip, attractive and having a great time. There is a pool outside that belongs to the Phoenix Motel and a DJ spins tunes as well. There is a very "rock n roll" atmosphere in the decor and the motel is known for housing various rock bands when they perform in SF. 
I would recommend this as a fun, and innovative way to spend an evening. Great food, good cocktails and attractive clientele. What more do you want?
author: Beverly m.

description:
First time to visit this new SF restaurant and we had a really good time. We ordered eight of the ten small plates between three of us and shared, great way to get a good sample of Chambers' fare.

Tthe standout was the Kobe Tri Tips plate served on a sizzle rock. Also, the warm faro salad and the miniature red potato medley were super yummy.

Our hostess was very welcoming, taking time to find out where we were from and giving us some nice tips on ordering.

Our server was on his third day and also did a great job of explaining the dishes.

We'll be back!
author: Charles D.

description: I came here for a birthday and it's a hidden gem.  I'm taking 1 star off because of location, but other then that, this is a nice and hip place to hang out with friends.  I would love to come here again.
author: Sara C.

description: A very cool spot to check out - good cocktail menu and a variety of menu options as well.  The ambiance and decor are cool - basically there's a ton of records throughout the front area with seating for patrons.  There's also a second bar in the back of the restaurant that opens when it's a busy night.  I've been here on more than a few occasions - birthday, dinner, drinks, etc.  I like the atmosphere and vibe, which is very laid back, relaxed, and chill.  Burger is a staple, brussel sprouts are good as well.  Enjoy and have a good time.
author: Eli R.

description:
The food was super tasty. The service was incredible, I came for my birthday and they were extremely accommodating. Only negative was that the portion sizes were a bit small,  my friends that came to dinner all complained of still being hungry after eating dinner (I, myself included was still hungry). We had a party of 9 and were sat at 2 different tables. My table  ordered two appetizers to start to share for 5 people, and then each person had their own entree. The odd thing was that the appetizers came at the same time as the entrees. The pasta was good but literally looked like it was  3-5 bites. The slow roasted new york strip loin for $25 was only 3 strips of meat.. I felt so bad for my guy cousins that ordered it... they ended up eating a lot of the fries off my plate to try and supplement their meal. They both said they had expected a decent sized steak . the sizzling kobe tri-tip - was so tasty, I was sad I only had one slice (and the smallest one at that). The truffle dip  was really really good. I ended up dipping my fries in the dip also. I got the burger, and they were nice enough to leave off the bun and give me extra lettuce instead. YAY! 

I also reserved a space in the bar section for my birthday celebration after dinner. The staff was very helpful in setting up that area as soon as my guests arrived and we had finished dinner. Christie (hostess?) was extremely helpful in setting up my bday celebration. Thanks!
author: Bon N.

description: I love this place! I made a reservation at the last minute this past Friday for a group of 5 including a 7 month old. They answered my excessive questions patiently and gave us a great booth that accommodated us perfectly. Eclectically decorated, inside and out. The food was fantastic (I had the burger and potatoes), excellently presented with fresh tasting ingredients and good portion sizes. Our friends went with the salmon (which was brought out smoking on a beautiful grate with some awesome looking aoli-ish sauce of some kind) and the tri-tip (also great looking). The service was great, my water glass didn't go left unfilled once, the recommendations were spot-on, the table and seats were in a great location, the owner was very friendly, and the bartender was the best!! I will definitely be coming back here :)
author: Loren M.

description: this place is truly amazing. last night, a group of friends and I had the pleasure of eating dinner here and it blew our minds. the food and libations were real good, and the service even better. our server kyle, the manager Patrick, and the host, were the best part of the night. super nice guys. everything was on point. we will definitely be back!!
author: M M.

description: Definitely a popular place.  Great decor, music, and the food is pretty delicious.  A little overpriced, but what isn't in SF? Noise level is pretty high up, I like to be able to hear my friends talk and not lose my voice by the end of a meal. BUT still a fun place!
author: Azita R.

description: What I love about Chambers, great food, great service and great ambiance.
author: Melinda E.

description: Thank you B&T for ruining another great lounge in the city! Chambers Raise the drink Prices It might help.
author: Michael T.

description:
what a gem this place is.  i would have never found it on my own.  inside had kind of a weird vibe - i'm guessing most of the people were foreign.  however the females were extremely attractive.  i mean really attractive - maybe that's where the strippers frequent before they go to work for the night?

the staff was really great though.  

ps if the bartender is reading this, please go out with me
author: Hammer Time H.

description:
This review is for their dinner service only.  
Very cool place.  I love the decor of this restaurant.  The service was not as good though.  We waited probably 10-15 minutes before a server even acknowledged us, so we were able to place our entire order at the first greeting.  The four of us decided to order multiple small plates and share, but they decided to bring out every dish at the exact same time, which left us very little room for eating.  The food was good, not great.  Throughout the meal the service didn't get any better.  We had to flag down the girl many times, ask other servers for things, and didn't get things we had either been promised (like breaking down the small plate meals into 4 servings for easier sharing, which the server offered, we didn't ask) or that we had asked for (silverware and a glass for bottle beer).  I can't say we'll be back anytime soon.  We might come to just check out the bar scene someday...
author: Rise G.

description: A downsized version of the Redwood Room, equipped with the identical annoying trustfunders in suits, this place does however offer up a cool low lit club atmosphere in the middle of the hellhole known as the Tenderloin.  To quote a philosopher, it's "a stay against confusion.".  Jump or skip around your local bum as you approach.  The good news is that the prices are fair inside so you can hurl silver dollars at the beggars before or after a cocktail.  Yup, it's a good spot for a date actually.  And the food is tasty too.
author: Patrick B.

description: Don't let the sketchy exterior of the building or neighborhood fool you. Once inside this place is of class awesomeness and such. I went here for my 21st birthday and had so much fun. My favorite things were this meet dish which they brought to you raw and you cooked on a rock and a drink that tasted really refreshing with mint leaves in it. The chef was also incredibly sweet because I stupidly forgot one of my friends was vegan so they made her a burger with grilled veggies on it, can we say awesome
author: Ja l.

description: I came here Saturday evening and had a decent time.  It used to be another establishment in which I've been too (Bambuddha Lounge) and that was way better since there was a full on dance floor on one side and bar on the other (best of both worlds!).  The crowd was kinda douchy, but that's to be expected in SF.  Overall, the ambiance was nice and the food was good.  Drinks were strong too!  My main complaint is that the area is super ghetto and you'll have to weave your way through crackheads and other "interesting" folks while walking up to the place.  I'm from the city and I'm used to this, but that doesn't mean I like it.   Bambuddha would have got 4 stars, but this place is still okay.
author: Jeff M.

description: Came here a few months ago with a guy and girl friend for dinner. Decor was lovely and the waitstaff was great, but some of our dishes were really quite strange... One dish (wish I could remember the name) had this really strong, fishy-tasting paste on the inside, and all 3 of us commented on how weird it tasted. Can't even begin to describe it, it was just all wrong. Everything else was decent-ish, but definitely not worth what we paid. I hope they improve, because I'd love to give them another try - just not anytime soon.
author: Lola D.

description: Frankly shocked by how well the food was prepared and tasted in a really cool atmosphere (LA vibe without the pretentiousness).  If you have the chance, meet the owners who are simply awesome.  Don't miss the brussel sprouts and tri-tip, but everything is tasty.
author: Terence F.

description: Try telling your friends you want to have dinner in a restaurant adjacent to a decades old motel in the Tenderloin and I bet you won't get many takers. However, if you tell them that you will be taking them on a hip and tasty explosion of the senses (and if they trust you) then you should have many takers. Simply put it is hip, fun and tasty. From the bar atmosphere to the wide cocktail menu to the simply well played menu you will not be dissappointed. Obviously, heads up in the neighboorhood but this is a hidden gem. Trust.
author: C K.

description: Reunited with some Boston friends at this amazing restaurant. No one had any idea what this place was like, so we took a chance on an unknown destination and struck pure gold. Service was extremely polite, drinks were amazing (nothing like we have on the east coast) - especially the 'spicy cucumber', decor was super hip, and the atmosphere itself was perfect to catch up over some food + drinks!
author: Johnny C.

description: Came here on a fluke for brunch since Brenda's was ridiculously packed... Saw the Yelp reviews and figured why not try it out?  I ordered the burger and my sister ordered the coffee cake, eggs, turkey sausage, and biscuits and gravy; instead she got potatoes instead of the sausage. So they got the order wrong, strike 1.  My burger came and it was disappointing... The buns were toasted but cold, the grilled onions had a super smoked flavor that did not compliment the other ingredients on the burger, the fries were cold too! Strike 2 on a cold burger and fries. As far as service goes... There weren't very many people at all in the resturant so why did it take us forever to get our food and then our check? Strike 3 on the slow ass service.  I wouldn't reccommend this place to anyone for brunch... Maybe that's why it wasn't so busy because brunch may not be their thing but regardless, it doesn't matter what a dining establishment serves and when it should always be good and on point!  I feel like I wasted my money :(
author: Tinder B.

description: Love this place! Great drinks, yummy food, cool and funky decor, and nice staff.
author: Terry L.

description: I love the bohemian and high energy vibe of the restaurant. The service and food are always excellent.  A great place for girls night out
author: Navdeep B.

description: Great bar, very cool outdoor space, yummy food.  I'd say it's closer to a three dollar sign bar, expensive.  Unfortunately the bar staff here were obnoxious, unhelpful and stuck-up.  They seemed like it was far too much effort to serve you.
author: Amy F.

description: Oh man, this place is such a scene, but I love it!!!  The bartenders are talented and friendly, and the drinks menu is really unique and creative. It can be kind of nuts during the wee hours, but here early and you shouldn't have to wait to long.
author: M G.

description: I didn't eat but the drinks were strong and tasty and it's a great room to sit in soak up a classy but boozy atmosphere.
author: Odette L.

description: I met up with a friend here last week for brunch and boy was it an experience. I am a San Francisco native born and raised so I am familiar with the area. I passed up the venue twice because I couldnt see the sign. I finally saw the little Phoenix motel and parked in that lot. I went in to have the receptionist tell me I couldnt park in the lot but to go up the street to another motel and park then walk back to their hotel. I was already exhausted by her instructions but got in my car and found the other parking lot she mentioned. I walked back in my 4 inch heels to the Phoenix hotel for the receptionist to instruct me to go back out and walk to the restaurant entrance next door. Sigh she was killing me at this point. I went in and stood at the front desk awhile before I was greeted and seated. The ambiance was quite cute. I really liked the records and old motown playing as I sat and waited for my friend to arrive. I ordered what I thought was a peach mimosa which I tasted absolutely no juice. I then ordered french toast which was extremely dry so I had to ask the server for some regular maple syrup which I think she was offended that I'd dare even ask as she hestiated and asked me if the maple already on the plate was not enough. My friend ordered the grit balls and said it was quite bland as well however he enjoyed his bloody mary. The server came back again and was almost grilling me as to why I didnt like the french toast. Total turn off. Will not be going back ever based off her service alone. I did like the "Be Amazing" decor in the bar area and I think it wise if the server who helped us would look at that sign every hour she's on the clock to be reminded of how to give amazing customer service.
author: Jenn S.

description: Excellent food and drinks, ideal for leisurely late night dining. The environment is dark and sultry, perfect for date night. After dinner, grab another drink and head to the pool for people watching and more fun. Enjoy!
author: Brigid W.

description: this place is great for brunch, we came here a few weeks ago and besides being in the TL its a great gem. The service was very friendly and professional. The food was really delicious and the bloody mary's were not my favorite but still very good!
author: joe r.

description: The coffee is awesome. The bloody marys are awesome. The music makes for a great atmosphere. The food looks fancy but doesn't taste fancy. But its all worth it on a sunny poolside day. This is a gem tucked away in gritty area. Minus a star for the hostess who I made a reservation with, and called to confirm that we could sit outside, however she really tested us - telling us we'd have to wait who-knows-how-long, and tried to get us to sit inside instead. That was annoying.
author: Katie R.

description: While the ambiance of the place is good, the food is terrible. We had a birthday party there last night and ordered from their appetizer menu. Portions were tiny and quality was bad. We ended up paying over $600 for very poor quality platters. If you are reading this review, don't ever order their party platters - they are essentially a rip off.
author: Sabeer B.

description: Looks like the Tenderloin is the new Mission because hipsters are crowding around and forming lines outside Farm:Table, Jones, and the Shooting Gallery. Bored of the same consistently-good restaurants--Bar Jules, Mission Beach Café, and La Mar--I can finally ecstatically recommend a newcomer to the Tenderloin scene. In the aptly-named Phoenix Hotel, the adjacent lounge has re-incarnated itself from Backflip to Bambuddha and now to Chambers. It is sick, or slick, or whatever the lingo is today. It's like entering Bourbon and Branch's library, but better. Like the Ace Hotel, but better. You can actually see your date as the lighting, a refreshing golden hue, has been strategically placed. Even the food is worth the guarded walk from your locked car to the entrance. As for the impeccable food, the PBLT, pork belly lettuce and tomatoes, is stand-out. A big coup for the neighborhood, this new hot spot won't be reinventing itself for quite a while.
author: catherine g.

description: No one mentioned this is a joint for men looking for men. Or maybe I just hit the wrong night. With that said, I bought my own drinks.
author: Alice S.

description: Wow...were looking for a restaurant to go to for a light dinner before going to the Orpheum Theater to see Bring It On...I googled restaurants in the area and came upon Chambers, and what a find!  It was definitely the highlight of our evening (the musical was absolutely horrible)!!!  Chambers is about a 10 minute walk from the theater, and through not such a great part of town, but I cannot say that we felt unsafe walking there.  The restaurant definitely has to get a sign to indicate where exactly it is, because the first thing you come to is the parking lot for the Phoenix Hotel and there is no indication whatsoever as to where the restaurant is located (it's the first wooden door around the corner from the hotel lobby).  However, once you enter the restaurant it is just lovely.  We were warmly welcomed and brought to our table by Sheila, who was just great.  She explained how the food was prepared and anything else we had questions about.  We ordered the sizzling kobe tri-tip and the smoking hamachi, and both were so delicious we went for another round!  Overall, this dining experience completely made our night, and I would highly recommend this restaurant as a perfect place to start off a night at the theater!
author: JB A.

description: Fun updated retro decor.  Food is inventive, fresh, and tasty.  Was there for brunch and had the coffee cake, soft scramble, and hash.  All quite nice.  But the service is definitely an issue.  Took 45 minutes just to order.  Asked for decaf coffee and got caf.  Waited for a long time for check and change.
author: Cynthia K.

description: I spent my birthday at Chambers and I have to say I wish I had decided on another venue instead.  We had dinner there and the food was nothing to write home about...okay maybe a postcard with bold letters: OVERPRICED and OVERRATED.  Since I told all my friends to meet me at chambers, I expected all of them to come inside with no problem.  Nope, I got calls from friends waiting in line telling that the bouncers told them the lounge was overcapacity.  I know that they do that to make it seem like its popping but it wasn't at all.  I thought since we had bottle service, I could ask the manager to let a couple of my friends who had been waiting in line for half an hour to come in but I was greeted with a frown and a no. =(  A bunch of a my friends end up leaving because the line was ridiculous.  The staff was alright...did their job but didn't go out of their way to accommodate us. The decor deserves my two stars.
author: Lisa Z.

description: Wish you could give a "zero stars."  Decor was amazing, so had high hopes.  Food was good, but HORRIBLY overpriced.  Service was, well, an oxymoron.  Apparently our group was deemed not trendy enough for the rest of the crowd, because we were seated outside and ignored.  Had to flag someone down for our drinks, our food was very slow to be delivered, our tab was incorrect, and we had to take our payment inside because we got tired of waiting on our server.  Too many other great places in SF to put up with that.
author: H H.

description: We tried this newly opened restaurant/bar after years of going to this spot for the previous iterations (Miss Pearl's, Backflip, Bambuddha) and found it to be approachable, welcoming and downright fabulous.  From the gracious service (non-pretentious, welcoming staff) to the great food and drinks, we certainly recommend it and will be back again.  It's worth the drive from the Peninsula up to Chambers and we look forward to some warmer nights on the patio around the pool once/if the management decides to highlight this attribute (great fire/water feature, by the way).  Prices are reasonable and the detail of the food presentation is outstanding.  The kobe beef and beet/artichoke appetizers were exceptional and the the beef shortribs and the burger entrees stood out.  Beyond the restaurant, it's just a great place to hang out for comfortable lounging as the vibe is inviting with great furniture, music and patrons.
author: Eric M.

description: Old Bambuddha Lounge or Backflip! It's Chambers now and very well put together. Find it's more of a professional good looking crowd and the decor is great. Outdoor patio with pool and firepit with bar was my first eyeopener (no smoking though - take it to the front area) The back bar with plenty of sofa space was accomodating for my large group and noise level was low so you can actually hear each other. Happy Hour prices were fair and strength of drinks matched. Very roomy and Highly recommend for an after work or weekend drink amongst friends or dinner with the significant other! Only advice - It is in the Tenderloin so be cautious where you park and walk. Do  keep an eye on your purse ladies when venturing outside the venue....
author: Edward B.

description: Totally took a mason jar home. Fucking awesome.
author: hannah B.

description: As a recommendation by our hotel concierge we weren't sure what to expect!  Amazing food, strong drinks, great music and loved the decor!  Must go, I will definitely be back when I'm in the City by the Bay next!
author: Sarah G.

description: nice interior but out of place exterior.  phoenix motel?  also the pool in the back -- um just looks like a "set," and is cheapened by the surrounding the motel room enclosure.  otherwise, probably people who like Jones will like this bar setup as well.  no cover, lounge-y, mild music, couches in the back bar tight setup.  does get stuffy
author: Rob C.

description: Fantastic design, great attention to detail.  It's like hanging out in a cozy yet hot music library.  The bartenders are really friendly, and the tequila gimlet rocks.  The food is fantastic.  We had the beet and artichoke salad and farro salad, both of which were delicious, and the Prather Ranch hamburger is to die for.  Going to try the lamb next time.  It's a bit of a different crowd than I usually like, but a great spot for dinner.
author: Grace R.

description: how this place has 4 stars i dont know. I would give it 4 stars for ambiance/decor, but there is a reason they dont have the menu up on their website. The food is just plain bad, and very over priced.
author: laury g.

description: I went to Chambers with friends for drinks on a Saturday night and absolutely loved it. We got there around 10pm so there wasn't a line at the door, but about an hour and a half later there was so getting there early can help you avoid waiting outside for too long. I loved the ambiance at Chambers and the DJ that night was also really good. The bartenders also mix really good drinks, one of the people I was with said they made the best Tom Collins in SF. Beware though, with the huge "be amazing" sign above the bar you will probably receive a number of pick up lines involving you being "amazing". I definitely plan to go back there soon though.
author: Wintha K.

description: this place has great potential. the decor is its best attribute, cleverly designed and just trendy enough without being cliche'. the service was top notch, too, but the food... the food needs improvement. not to say it was bad, it just wasn't great. though the lamb shank was impeccably prepared, its sides were strange and seemed a misfit. the carrot cake was weird, too. i'm not giving up on chambers, though. i think it will age gracefully.
author: Marie A.

description: It's been almost two years since I popped into Chambers, and by pop in I mean scurry down the admittedly sketchy Tenderloin stretch it's on, which only ends up adding to its uber hip status (I guess). But I am tempted to say, perhaps controversially, that it might be worth getting mugged just to experience its unique setting... and try their hamburger with the awesomely-skinny thyme fries and a side -- or two, or three -- of Matilda Belgian (of course) ale. But seriously. It's also uber hip, or at least was when I visited, what with its David Lynch mise-en-scene 70s retro decor. You know there's something special about a place that transports you elsewhere the minute you step inside (and perhaps even on the walk over!), and keeps you there for the entire duration of the meal. The only reasons why it's short of a star might be the price-quantity ratio, the awkward location and the fairly nonchalant service, although none of those deterred my enjoyment and ultimate satisfaction. Chambers is definitely one of my top eateries to revisit if I return to slash ever move back to San Francisco.
author: G. J.

description: Great, funky ambiance.  But the food is eh, and the hostess seated us right near the door to the back patio, despite us having communicated with the restaurant a week in advance that we were celebrating a special milestone and would appreciate prime seating.  The entire evening we had dozens of people opening and closing the door (or just plain leaving it open), making for an incredibly chilly and uncomfortable dining experience.
author: Yasmin F.

description: the ambiance at this place gets 5 stars.  the people, music, decor, vibe were all excellent.  we had an 8:45p friday reservation at unfortunately weren't seated until 9:40p due to overbooking.  however, the host comped our group of four with a free appetizer and a round of drinks.  we stayed at the bar for both and it wasn't very crowded --- though the restaurant was busy.  the food was good...nothing spectacular, but i'd go back for the burger, which was about $14.  they also served schramsberg brut rose (bottle) for only $60, which was (a) impressive that it was on their menu and (b) was a reasonable price.  i look forward to heading back to Chambers soon.  my friends all loved this place as well!
author: Joel F.

description: I ordered the heirloom tomato salad - and there were about 10 little 1 cm cubes of tomatoes (that I seriously doubt were even heirloom) and 10 1/2 cm cubes of cucumber.  It was served on top of a white patty of cheese, which was far more expansive than the tomatoes.  So if you're expecting tomatoes in your tomato salad, this is NOT the place for you.  Tomatoes had no flavor, and not even any seasoning.  Food is not all that - overpriced and expensive.    The atmosphere is great though - nice fixtures and finishes.  Great outdoor courtyard!  Retro.  Drinks were good & strong!
author: Bird o.

description: fun-ish. a place to stop by at, before the fun begins or after the excitement is over to let the rest of the night take its course.
author: Fzarond K.
